fields.author: Mark
fields.title: Welcome
fields.content:
Let me be the first to welcome everyone to the Mario Kart Wii Players' Page! I would like to start out by thanking Alex for his hard work on getting this page design and database done in such a short amount of time. Also, I would like to extend a warm welcome to the main updater for this site, William "Susan" "Peach" Lacey. It is my understanding that Lacey has graciously volunteered his time to keep the news and times for this site up to date. I'm sure his wit, all around gaming talent and girlish charm will make for an enjoyable experience for everyone involved. I would also like to thank everyone who has volunteered to help out, whether it be with translations, proof moderation or time updating. Withouth all of your help this would not be possible.

The game has only been released in Europe, Asia and South America for a few weeks and is due out in North America in about 10 days so there may be a bit of a slow start. Regardless, when you get your times submit them to the yahoo group and we'll take care of the rest.

With that said, I wish everyone happy karting.

-Mark

P.S. Alex will be out of town for a little while so development of new features or fixing of bugs may have to wait until he gets back.

fields.author: Shadow
fields.title: And so it begins!
fields.content:
Hi everyone!
It's great to be here at the start of a new site. I want to reiterate how awesome it was for Alex to get this all up and running so quickly before he left, and thanks to Mark for his welcome. I shall be your hostess with the mostest for the next while, until it sinks in how much work I've taken on and decide to run off and catch a plane to hawaii instead. :)

The site is still in it's infancy, so there are bound to be a few bugs which crop up here and there. Let us know on the message board, and hopefully we can fix them up quickly. Alex will be gone for a few weeks, but I'll do what I can in the meantime to make sure things don't go too crazy. All new submissions should be updated by tonight, and then regularly from there on in.

So, first off, congratulations to Fabien Da Silva, who becomes our first official site champ by virtue of being the first to send us in a full set of times. Hopefully everyone else can get theirs in soon (although I realise how annoying finding out best lap times can be)
Fabien also broke the long standing LC record of X'XX"XXX. He brought it down to 1'11"294. :laugh:

I'm sure there will be daily record breaking from here on out, so have fun, and let us completely dominate the Nintendo top10 lists!

William/Suzie

fields.author: Shadow
fields.title: The calm before the storm
fields.content:
Week one news, and it has been fiercely competitive so far! :O
With records tumbling every day, it's anyone's guess how far times will fall, and how far players will rise!

So without further ado, congratulations to new Site Champ David Schiering. His opening set of times were very impressive and dislodged Fabien Da Silva from the top spot. Guilio Centrone jumped straight into 3rd spot and surely has his eye on David's crown with updater Kristopher Will just behind him. Stacy Needham rounds out the top 5 with an impressive 6 Site Records.
How long can David keep his title with such intense activity? Stay tuned folks!

Honorable mention to Lewis Benny who hit double digits with 10 Site records, currently leading the way on that count. He should be a strong contender for the title in these early days when his remaining times come in.

52 players have joined this week so far, 20 of whom have a full set of 64 times, which is to be expected at this stage due to the time required to actually sit and pull out a full set. With the US release of the game in just 4 days, we should quickly surpass the 100 player mark.

Hopefully we can begin to dominate the Nintendo top10 leaderboards. Currently we hold 6 World records and have a 15.62% rating. The number at the top of this mainpage will keep track of how we're doing.

And finally, many congratulations go to Kalle Videkull for beating Nobou to sub 1'10 on LC. At 1'09"933 this is easily the most impressive WR currently. Good job!

Keep up the great work! :)

fields.author: Shadow
fields.title: Quest for the Crown
fields.content:
Seriously, google that online game. It's old, but fun.

Award
Now, down to business. Our first POW award goes to *drumroll* Guilio Centrone! His impressive times just pipped David Schiering to the top spot at the end of this week. Only 0.0781 separate the two, which converts to just 5 places. Guilio has been a consistently strong presence since joining the site this week. Can anyone beat him to April's Player of the Month?

Strangeness

The game is now officially out in the USA under a slightly different title: "Funny Moustached Italian Racer", so expect a lot of new players. Apparently Nintendo decided to change quite a lot of the names of the courses and karts/bikes for the US release, because they're great like that, and which will undoubtedly cause no end of pain and suffering for our updaters.

Other news

The biggest mover over the last few days has been Emmanuel Debenest. He has powered into the top 4, and looks like a serious threat. Himself and Kristopher Will lead the chasing pack right now.
Rene Bauer, Prashant Bhoja and Markus Hobelsberger are all on the rise, whilst everyone else is dropping like a stone. With many players still only sending in half-sets of times, there's a lot of background activity going on which affects the lists.

And King of the background has to be Lewis Benny, who increases his Site Record total to 11 at the end of this week, followed closely on 9 by Stacy Needham. Lewis also gives us our strongest showing on the Nintendo top10 pages.

That's your 4-day round-up!

fields.author: Shadow
fields.title: The Borne Supremacy
fields.content:
Hello, and welcome to our first news update of May.

Movement

The news of the week has to be about our new Site Champion Kevin Borne. He passed the top 4 players including ex-champions David and Giulio, and now holds an almost 2 point avg finish lead over 2nd place man Emmanuel Debenest. He also stormed into the Site Records chart, holding 12 in total now and surpassing long time leader Lewis Benny

Although Emmanuel dropped in average finish points slightly this week, he played enough to move into 2nd spot behind Kevin. The French have definitely seized control of the top of the lists this week.

Alvin van Asselt put in a hugely impressive week, and is representing the first real Dutch threat to the #1 spot. His cuts move him up into 4th, and I'm sure Emmanuel and Kevin must be wary of this challenge to their dominance right now.

If you can hold your ground, you can move up in the lists, and that's exactly what Martin Rudmarker did this week, by keeping his average finish stable. He breaks into the top 10 at #8.

Another new entry into the top 10 is Paul Tanney. Not content with keeping his average finish respectible, he cut over 4 points off it to leapfrog into 9th position.

Cole Gilbert represents Canada's best hope in these early days making an equally impressive cut of 5 points, to move him within striking distance of the top 10, at #12.

And finally, the single biggest cut comes from Kevin McAteer who shows that the USA is going to be a force to be reckoned with, even if they did get the game a few weeks later. He has been consistently climbing all week, whilst those around him fall away. 10 points cut lands him in #14. Another with his sights set on a top 10 spot soon.

Other news

Our mission to be the most dominant force of Mariokart:Wii times on the net is progressing well. This week we broke the 20% mark for our domination of the top 10 lists. Lewis "still some missing times" Benny still represents our strongest influence, but may soon be dethroned by Kevin Borne.

Weather
Light drizzle coming in from the east will clear later this afternoon with highs of 59F(15C). There's a slight chance of frost on the roads tonight, so you night-owls be careful if you're out for a late-night stroll.

And finally
Keep an eye on the Forum for the latest strat discussion, vids, Lakitu SC glitches, outrageous mountain hops, half-day champs, and polls about karts, bikes and controllers.

I'll be back on Wednesday with more news, and the first POW award for May.

fields.author: Shadow
fields.title: Late Nights and Early Mornings
fields.content:
Cereal - Check
Toast - Check
OJ - Check
News entry for MKW - In progress

So I'm a little late this week because when I decided to do the update yesterday, my body also decided that it wanted to go to sleep. So let's all just pretend it's still Wednesday *readies delorean*

Movers and Shakers
Quite a bit has happened in the 3 days since the last update, so let's get straight to it.
The biggest news, is that Alvin van Asselt has become the new Site Champion. We're all used to Dutch dominance in other mariokart games, so it's great to see Alvin leading the way here too. So far no Site Champion has remained between news updates, so let's see how long he can maintain his lead.

The top 10 remained completely unchanged apart from that one move although Martin Rudmarker made some good progress in closing the gap between 8th and 7th. Jonathan Wheatley also closed the gap from 15th to 14th. Meanwhile Adrien Edet made the only proper move in the top 20, moving from 20th to 18th.

The real action over the last 3 days has been happening from 20-30, with several players making sizable cuts. Primarily the movement all comes from North America.
Dave Phaneuf climbs from 25th to 20th, cutting 7 points.
Erik Reynolds with the best move of the update, climbs from 29th to 21st, cutting 9 points.
Armdano Cobian climbs from 30th to 22nd, cutting 7 points.
All three will be looking to battle their way past each other into the top 20 by the time the next update comes.

Meanwhile myself and Robin Usher have been battling to stay within touching distance of the best cutting 4 points each this update.

Other News

Although Kevin Borne was a bit overshadowed by Alvin this update, he still managed to set some great times, and still holds the most amount of Site Records, along with our best showing on the Top10 lists. Kalle Videkull is our next strongest, with some great times in the official Top10s.
Our membership numbers are greatly up and we passed the 100 mark recently. Currently we're up to 134 players, 54 of whom have a full timeset. For those that don't, try to get at least crappy ones submitted. I generally don't mention movement from people who have just appeared on the Average Finish list.

Awards
There were alot of decisions to be made about when the awards would be done, and who would get them. The sites tend to work on a "4 week" per month system, so I had to reshuffle a few things to make everything in line with that. Also, a precedent was made with the MKDS site, which gave out a POM award for their first month, even though only two weeks had passed. So I decided to go with that too. :)

fields.author: Shadow
fields.title: Alvin vs Kevin
fields.content:
Hey guys, girls, the gender confused, robots, the robotically confused, and Christian Shephard.

Movement
What an amazing few days we've had, and especially so today, where the #1 spot changed hands no less than 27 times! Well, maybe a little less than that, but it has been intense at the top. In my last news update I mentioned that no player had managed to be Site champion for 2 news updates in a row, and it didn't look like it was going to happen, with Kevin Borne setting some really great times early on, only for Alvin van Asselt to pull some great times out of the bag himself to inch in front. Kevin hit back. Alvin hit back. And these two have been trading the top spot all day. So congratulations to Alvin for having his nose in front at the moment this news is being written, and holding onto that Site Champion spot, and congratulations too to Kevin for this awesome battle we're witnessing.
These two are pushing each other to new heights, which can only be good for this site as a whole! :)

Whilst the battle up top is the main headline, there have been a few impressive movers elsewhere.
In the top10, Kristopher Will takes back a place and moves up to #3. David Schiering makes a small improvement and passes Giulio for 5th.
The most impressive move near the top has to be from Tim Shelbourne who passed quite a few players, moving from 12th to 7th, and becoming the best player from the UK in the process.

Cole Gilbert leads the North American charge, and currently sits on the cusp of the top 10, in 11th. I predict that Europe's dominance of the site top 10 will come to an end by the time the next update is written. Armando Cobian continues his rise from early this week, jumping ahead of his continental neighbors this update, up 3 places to 19. Markus Hobelsberger has been hitting some good times these last few days too, and moves up 4 places to 22nd. And Chuck Foster breaks into the top 30 for the first time, passing me so fast that all I can make out is a vague blur on the horizon and a possible green shell coming back to hit me.

Finally, move of the update goes to Joe Sebeny. #43 just 4 days ago. He now sits 10 places higher at #33.

Other News
Ooh! I bought some nice new shoes today. They're completely awesome! :D

Other other news
Our domination percentage is a little down over the last few days, but I'm hopeful that we can start pushing towards 30% by the end of this month. Our site can only get better, and I have every faith that we'll win out in the end like we always do, so keep up the great work people. :) 28 different people currently hold at least 1 site record which proves the potential we have, and our strength in depth.

Until next time,
Peace!
- Suz

fields.author: Shadow
fields.title: Wheeling and Dealing
fields.content:
I'm walkin' on sunshinnne...woaaaaaaaaaah...

Movement
The top 2 this week decided to calm down their rivalry a bit, and each took a break from the PR-frenzy that was last week. Alvin leads the way, whilst Kevin secretly hopes someone fires a blue shell.
Behind those 2, Kristopher Will successfully defended his 3rd place spot from Emmanuel Debenest. There is quite a large gap between these two and the top two, so we'll see over the next while if anyone can bridge that gap.

The person who seems most likely, with almost Obama-like momentum, is Tim Shelbourne. He has kept climbing impressively over the last few weeks, and passes David and Giulio to slot in at #5 . Can he continue his impressive run?

The next 5 players who have been impressing over the last few days are all from the North American continent, 3 from Canada and 2 from the USA. Cole Gilbert breaks into the top 10, moving up 3 places from 11th to 8th. Armando Cobian and Dave Phaneuf both move up two places. 19->17 and 21->19 respectively. Erik Reynolds gains 3 places to move from #25 to #22, and lastly Benoit Boudreau passes a couple of players to move up to #32. Behind the scenes Michael Fried is making a strong showing in the North American rivalry, and should be ranked pretty high when he sends in his last remaining times.

Finally, Manuel Schmitz climbs 4 places and cuts over 6 avg finish points to reach #37.

Everyone else pretty much sucked. :D

Other news
Ok people. Go search in your garbage cans for wherever you threw your wii wheel, because this week's Nintendo challenge requires you to have to use it. *goes off to try it before writing more* Oh dear. That was awful. Try to beat my first try time of 1'31"331! :D
This challenge will be a time attack to see how quickly you can drive through 10 rings. You can only use the wii wheel. Several item boxes are strewn across the map, and these seem to all contain a single mushroom. Good luck! In the last challenge, the top 6 places were all impressively filled by Japanese karters. Let's see if we can do better with this challenge. Good luck! :)

...and don't it feel good!

fields.author: Shadow
fields.title: Lots of Activity
fields.content:
Over 60 players were active over the last few days, so let's get to the main action.

Movement at the top
The top 2 remain the same this week, although Kevin has been moving slowly towards Alvin. They are only seperated by a whisker, and other results could have an impact soon. Kristopher Will and Tim Shelbourne both made gains on the top 2, but remain for the moment in 3rd and 4th. Lewis Benny materialises into existence and finishes the week in 5th spot just behind Tim. The only person who actually gained a place in the top 10 this week is Cole Gilbert who rose from 8th to 7th even though Lewis's appearance dropped everyone down a place.

Movement (10-20)
On the brink of the top10, and Jonathan Wheatley is threatening a breakthrough, currently sitting in 11th. He would have broken into the top10 if it wasn't for Martin Rudmarker continuing to hold his ground.
Easily the two most impressive movers in the upper echelons this week are Dave Phaneuf (who is no stranger to appearing in the news) and Kevin McAteer. Both of these players matched each other stride for stride climbing from 19th/20th to 15th/16th, both with cuts of 6 and 6.5 respectively.

Movement 20-30
At the moment, if you stop playing for a day, you can be sure that you're dropping places on the list, and this week there have been a core of players making sure to punish anyone who takes their foot off the gas.
Markus Hobelsberger cuts 3.3 to move from 24th to 23rd
Richard Karlsson cuts 6.4 to move from 25th to 24th
Leo Bigorgne cuts 5.7 to move from 27th to 25th
Matt Tanzer cuts 6.4 to move from 28th to 26th and
Benoit Boudreau cuts 5.7 to move from 32nd to 28th.

Movement 30+
Everyone bar one from 29th to 42nd was active over the last 4 days, making it the most active section, but only 4 of those 12 moved up the list.

Eric Baumgartnerwith a 5.1, gains 3 places to finish 31st.
Joe Sebeny with a 4.0, gains 3 places too to finish 33rd.
Manuel Schmitz with a 4.1, gains (because it's the new cool thing to do) 3 places to finish 34th, and
Andreas Rudmarker not wanting to be left out, gains 3 places to finish in 36th place.

And the final, and most impressive move of the week goes to Mark Jones. He made an average finish cut of 16.5, and passed 11 players to move him within striking distance of the main bunch. He finishes the week in 44th.

Other News
We had 9 new players submit their full 64 times to us which brings us up to 77 on the Average finish list. Hopefully over the next few weeks we can pass the 100 mark.
There's been plenty of movement with Site Records. Lewis Benny takes 3 and loses 1, moving him back to the top of the list. Tim Shelbourne and Cole Gilbert both add 2 to their totals.
Stacy Needham, Fernando Moritz dos Santos, Emmanuel Debenest and Mark Schmidt all claim another Record. 6 people lose their only Site Record, and Kevin Borne loses 2 to drop him back into 2nd place with 9.

That's all folks!

fields.author: Shadow
fields.title: The oldest strategy
fields.content:
3 days go by too quickly

Movement at the top
Kevin Borne impressed on Tuesday with a plan fiendishly clever in its intricacies. He didn't PR at all, and somehow managed to move into 1st place by the end of the day. Having the higher number of Site Records might have accounted for the average finish shift as Alvin's times were the more likely to be beaten. Alvin van Asselt struck back straight away, to regain his title, but Kevin decided to change his strategy and actually play. He passed Alvin again by the end of Wednesday.

The rest of the top 10
Lewis Benny has his eyes on the prize, jumping up to 3rd from 5th, and crucially bringing the 6 point avg finish gap down to 3 between himself and the leading pair. Kristopher and Tim both drop down a place despite also moving closer to the leaders, whilst Emmanuel and Cole remain where they are. Martin Rudmarker gets tired of living on the edge of the top10, and moves up into 8th, whilst Dave Phaneuf continues his relentless rise, breaking into the top 10 for the first time and passing 5 players in the process.

Teenage kicks
Kevin McAteer leads the way for the USA, climbing 3 places this update to #13 and with sights set firmly on the top 10 positions.
Richard Karlsson has been one of the most impressive movers recently, and shows no signs of rest, cutting almost 5 avg finish points to move from 24th to 19th. James Leare breaks back into the top 20, after dropping out for a few days with some nice cuts.

The Roaring 20s
Possibly roaring because everyone appears to be falling down the list. Markus Hobelsberger and Andreas Rudmarker were the only two players to gain any positions here. The former moving up one place to 22nd, and the latter climbing an impressive 6 places to come from 36th all the way to 30th. Whilst most others in this section played, it was all they could do to just hold ground.

Best of the rest
Robert Ziegler made some headway, climbing 2 spots from #40 to #38 despite the appearance of 2 players ahead on the avg finish list, and Mark Jones continues his rise into the intensely active section of the list, climbing 4 places to break into the top 40.

Site Records and other news
Whilst Tim Shelbourne was passed this week by Lewis he's been doing some real damage on the site records chart. Winning 4, and losing 1, he joins Lewis at the top of the list. Both now on 9 Site Records each. Kevin Borne takes the biggest hit, losing 3 of his records this week. Alvin van Asselt wins another 2, and Michael Fried enters the equation with 3 Site Records. James Leare, Benjamin Lorthioir, Mark Schmidt, Omer Dogan and Joe Sebeny all pick up 1.
Behind the scenes, Michael Fried continues to climb the ladder unseen. His current PRs place him somewhere between 10th and 20th, but with a full timeset he may well break into the top 10 soon.

New players
Welcome to: Ashley O'Hara, Gosia Buza, Louis de Bourqueney, Biagio Macula, Nicola Rsun, Gary Ryan, Milan Pacino, Jochem Oorschot

Happy International Biological Diversity Day!

fields.author: Shadow
fields.content:
Mmmm, pie...

We had some good movement in the last few days, and here is roughly what that activity looked like:



At the top
Alvin van Asselt continues to battle to defend his top spot wrestling it back from Kevin Borne earlier in the week. Over the last few days the main challenge came from Lewis Benny who cut 3 points off his average finish score with ease, and briefly hit the top spot before Alvin hit back. Alvin is easily our best Site Champion so far, holding the title for more than twice the length of time of anyone else so far. How much longer can he defend it for?

Everyone in the top 10 played over the last 4 days, and they needed to to defend their own positions. Kristopher and Tim did just enough to hold off the challenge of Cole Gilbert, who moves up another place to #6 and who bags another 2 Site Records in the process. He sits within a point of Kristopher and Tim ahead.
Fellow Canadian Dave Phaneuf continues his climb, picking off another 3 players to move himself into a comfortable #7
Rounding out the top 10, Louis de Bourqueney who only joined the site this week, storms impressively into the top 10 at #10. It's anyone's guess what order the top 10 will be this time next week with so many good players currently active.

10+
Richard Karlsson is after that Swedish top spot and he halves the distance between himself and Martin this update, passing 5 people and closing in on that top 10.
James Leare and Markus Hobelsberger both improve by less than 2 average finish points, but pass 4 players each in the process, making important progress towards the top-end of the charts. James moves from 20th to 16th and Markus moves from 22nd to 18th.

36,34,33,37
Those were the positions the next 4 players started from on Thursday morning.
Joe Sebeny bullet bills past 8 players
William Lacey stars past 5 players
Manuel Schmitz shrooms past 3 players and
Omer Dogan lightnings 6 players
These four finish 28,29,30,31

Mid-table madness
Whilst quite a few players are falling away, Mitchell Flaherty has been making his hard work pay off. He gained 7 places 45 -> 38. Prashant Bhoja gets leap-frogged by Mitchell, but gains 4 places of his own rising from 44th to 40th
Cut of the update goes to Jon "Bread" Ho. With a cut of 30, and passing a full 23 players in the process to move up to 47th, the player's ahead better hide their toasters.
The last two players with significant movement, are two players working their way into the active section of the list. Both getting rid of some of their poorer times. Arnaud Guepey climbs 9 places to 54th whilst Darius Austin climbs 9 places too to finish 60th at the end of Sunday.

Site Record Movement
Cole Gilbert and Fernando Moritz dos Santos are the big winners over the last few days, each gaining 2 records to the expense of those around them. 7 other players each gain 1 site record: Joe Sebeny, Benoit Boudreau, Daniel Boettcher, Dave Phaneuf, Mitchell Flaherty, Matt Ellis and Tristan Eyma.
Hopefully we can keep pushing these records to their limits and really challenge for overall World Records.

Tip of the day
Don't play with matches. When setting fire to things, make sure to do it very seriously.

fields.author: Shadow
fields.title: You can use facts to prove anything that's even remotely true!
fields.content:
So I was walking through town today. I can't quite remember now why I was there. I think it had something to do with someone's birthday, and I was looking for a present, but the problem with that is that it's hard to buy a present for someone when you've forgotten exactly why you're shopping, and if it's for a birthday at all. So suffice it to say, I ended up buying nothing. Then I realised that I hadn't written a mid-week news update, so I ran straight home to do it.*

No pie this week unfortunately. I ate it all last week, and now I'm trying to exercise it off, hence the running home part. Instead, here's some colouredly text:

63 active players.
11 new players.
16 site records changing hands
3 days
1 news update.

v=x72GXEgAnGA
Tim "My nickname is worth more points in scrabble than yours" Shelbourne moved ever closer to the top 3, and is now within striking distance. The top 2 played slightly, matching each other stride for stride, but were mostly quiet, and slid a little backwards towards Tim.
Martin "Forever 8th" Rudmarker slipped up a little this week by improving too much and finishing nicely in 7th. I may need to rename him if he can keep this up!
Meanwhile James "I'm on the North American Domination top 10 list page by magic" Leare passed a tightly bunched group of players, moving up from 16th to 11th. He would have finished 10th were it not for the appearance of...
Lastly, and at last, Michael "Sleepless" Fried materialises into 10th place, and then refuses to sleep for the next few days.

Friday to Sutherland
Paul "If you think I'm doing this for everyone I mention, then you're having a laugh" Tanney found some time to play over the last 3 days, and made good on his potential moving impressively from 24th to 16th. This would have been good enough to be battling for the top10 had nobody else played.
Mark Schmidt made further progress to push himself into the top20 from 23rd spot. Mark is part of an impressive German group of players rising to the top.
One such player is Omer Dogan. Up 9 places from 31 to 22, he shows no signs of slowing up. Watch for him next update!

As I was present shopping, or whatever I was doing earlier, I happened to stumble across some birthday cards. I noticed that on the cards for guys as they reached 30/40 there were jokes about being old and senile, whereas on the cards for girls of the same age were "Life begins at 40", "You're still looking great!". Anyway, this applies vaguely (very vaguely) to the af ranks too. For most people in the 30s and 40s, you have nowhere to go but down. But for some few, karting life really begins here, and the skies the limit!

Life begins here
So whilst everyone around him was dropping (Everyone from 23rd to 47th), Mitchell Flaherty decided to buck the trend and climb 4 places. He's up to 34th from 38th, and hoping to escape the void.
Two players who finish Wednesday side by side are Mickael Hondarrague and Darius Austin. Mickael made light work of 18 players as he improved most of his times. Darius continues his recent strategy of not sucking, and moves past a further 11 players this update.

Finally Jean-Sebastien Dubois starts his campaign well, making an 11% cut and moving up 6 places to 64th.

Site Records
Guillaume Bertrand bursts onto the scene and takes 3 Site Records straight away for himself. Omer Dogan and Kevin Borne both pick up an extra 2 this week. Michael Fried adds another to his collection, whilst Emmanuel Debenest, Ashley O'Hara and Louis Koepke join the list with 1 each. Congrats to all for pushing these boundaries ever further. Tim now leads the way with 7 records to his name.

New Players
Welcome to: Shaun Tanney, Louis Koepke, Brendan Payne, Kevin Breit, Ricardo Cymbalista, Kameron Chastain, James Pierrepont, Guillaume Bertrand, Fabio Sacco, Pierre-Emmanuel Medus

*Ok, so I may have hopped on a bus

fields.author: Shadow
fields.title: Grumble Rock
fields.content:
Suzie 1 Matt Ellis 0 :laugh:

So! What a few days it's been. I'll get to all that in a little while, but first a look at the movement at the top of the charts.

74 active players. 11 new players. 18 site records changing hands.

Top 10

[news deleted by Nintendo because these players are too good]

11-20
Kevin McAteer and Jonathan Wheatley have both been pushing hard for the top 10 in recent days, which is a place that's getting harder and harder to get into. It doesn't help when everyone there is also playing. Kevin passed James and Louis to move to 12th, whilst Jonathan passed those two and Richard to reach 13th.
Marijn Jongbloed was the real mover in this section though, leaving everyone else looking on, up 8 places 26 -> 18.

Mid-table Mediocrity
These are the people teetering on the edge of the event horizon of a black hole that could easily suck them out of the top 100 in a month or so if they're not careful. A few of those attempting to escape it are Manuel Schmitz and William Lacey. Starting 33rd and 32nd respectively, they end up positions reversed and a bit further up at 28 and 29. Meanwhile Darius Austin continues his epic journey from the land of nowhere, and passes 11 people and an Usher to finish the week in 37th spot.

40+
Chuck Foster and Shaun Tanney refuse to be counted out just yet, making some good improvements to finish 45th and 46th.
Jean-Sebastien Dubois crosses 12 people off his hitlist. Up from 64 -> 52. At the same time, Tom Norton performs some voodoo, making an AF cut of 0.0 and managing to pass 4 people in the process.
Lastly Jerrol "My surname is almost as long as my middle name" Hoppenbrouwers gets off the mark finishing the week in 77th place.

Sometimes there isn't a lot extra going on, and I have to talk about designer bags. This week is markedly different.

Don't do what Donny Nintendon't does
So yesterday we discovered a nice Shortcut on Grumble Volcano. This improved the quality of this Time Trial track by about 700%. Mostly because the annoying jump over the lava whilst bouncing on the rock part was now completely unnecessary, and it also removed the need to perform any Lakitu glitches. This was all well and good until Nintendo decided to delete times. Now this in itself is fine. If you want to have a policy for what times are allowed, and what times aren't, then you're entitled to enforce it.
The problem of course, is that Nintendo seemed to have no idea what they were doing, and 24 hours later, they still don't know. They randomly deleted a few times yesterday, but not all. They picked one or two people to remove at random, whilst leaving other people's times perfectly intact. If you're going to have a policy, then enforce it. If you're not going to enforce it properly, or if you can't, then leave it alone. It's that simple. Until they decide what to do, feel free to keep sending in SC times to the site. If you have the option to use a different licence, that might be a good idea too, so that you can keep track of both old and new times (if we need to switch back to the old). Perhaps they deleted our times yesterday because our site was clearly dominating the track. We'll see if it makes any difference now that there are 5 Japanese karters in the top 10.

Going for a Kruise in the Desert
With all the grumbling going on yesterday, you'd be forgiven for forgetting that we had yet another breakthrough stratwise with another course this week on Dry Dry Ruins. Using the path to the right of the start/finish straight, you can now set much faster flap times by using 1 of 2 methods. The first involves the bowser bike and doubleshrooming around the bend in between the water and the pyramid. The second involves the Magikruiser and singleshrooming to the right of the water. Both strats are faster than the previous methods, and both need to be explored more fully in the coming weeks. And hopefully Nintendo won't decide that we're simply going too fast for their liking. (But since they don't care about Flap times anyway, I wouldn't worry too much).

Site Records
Big winners this week were Mickael Smolen, Cole Gilbert and Alvin van Asselt. The first two picked up 2 extra site records, whilst Alvin picked up 4. Omer Dogan,Mark Schmidt,William Lacey, Paul Tanney, Brendan Payne and Jonathan Finn all added 1.

If at first you don't succeed...
If Nintendo is going to be half-assed at deleting things, we might as well keep pushing forward. With that in mind, let me sneakily resubmit our earlier news entry:
Top 10
Everyone was active over the last 4 days, making it the longest unbroken spell of activity at the top since the site began. Alvin van Asselt pushed the gap out between himself and Lewis Benny to just over a point, helped by the 4 Site Records he grabbed this week. Michael Fried furthered his cause by knocking off Martin,Dave, and Emmanuel to finish 8th.
Finally, the move of the update, and the week taken as a whole goes to Omer Dogan. From Thursday -> Sunday, Omer cut 63% off his AF, moved past 17 players and finishes in a strong 5th position. Omer came from nowhere this week, and proved that if you've got the talent and the time, you can still compete with the best, no matter where you're ranked.

New Players
Welcome to:Alvin Le, Jamie Thompson, Marilyn Frappier, Mitch Arinze, Wayne Cragg, Marc Matthias, Thomas Dhali, Mickael Smolen, Jonathan Finn, Sasha Cross, Josh Husky, Matthew Elvin, Austin Becker

That's all we have time for this week. Our apologies to Matt Damon.
Next week: Is there really bread on MMM? What designer bags are *in* this summer?

fields.author: Shadow
fields.title: Moo Moo Breadows
fields.content:
Hey!
There's been quite a lot of conspiracy talk recently about toasters and bread-related items. Always loving a good mystery, I set out with my trusty video camera and paid a visit to our local Moo Moo Meadows to see what I could find. What I found there was shocking, and the images I'm about to show you may blow your mind, or make you want some toast.




So there we have it folks. Proof, that bigfoot and bread exist.
(You can see bigfoot in the first picture riding some sort of motorcyle. It really freaked me out)

Non bread-related News
Alvin and Lewis continue their battle at the top of the charts, each taking turns at being #1. At the moment Alvin has the edge and will attempt to hold onto the top spot for as long as he can.
Omer Dogan slows his incredible pace but continues his upward trend passing Tim for 4th spot. Kristopher Will returns to action and passes both Tim and Cole to move into 5th position.
Emmanuel Debenest has had a quiet time recently, but after being knocked out of the top 10 last week, he played and impressed again with some strong times, moving up 2 places 11->9. And just outside the top 10, but closing fast, Louis de Bourqueney makes the best cut this update of the top players, putting himself right into contention moving from 15 to 12.

Official Grumble Volcano Decision
There's been a lot of discussion about this on the message boards with some people for it and some against it. Nintendo have stopped deleting these times from their charts, so it looks as though they're going to allow it. Since it would make sense for our Domination page to match up with Nintendo's charts, and since the alternative is to revert to a strategy that already had a shortcut element (a much harder to hit one), we're going to allow the new shortcut to be ranked as the official route on this track. A separate chart for Non-sc/Mini-Sc/Hopping-over-the-lava-using-a-rock-isn't-really-a-Sc may be created in the future, but that will be decided at another time.
Good work to Shaun Tanney, Matt Ellis, and Mark Schmidt for representing us well and pushing this new shortcut to its limits.

The Norton Six
There were a number of players these last few days who made absolutely 0 cut to their AF. In fact their AF got a bit worse. Nevertheless, a brief mention to these players who gained places by moving backwards: Paul Tanney, Mark Schmidt, Markus Hobelsberger, William Lacey, Joe Sebeny and Prashant Bhoja
(Congratulations to them for also not using any time travel whatsoever to achieve this)

Up, up, up
Armando Cobian returns to the news and passes 5 people, bringing him into the top 30. Ted Kim passes more people than anyone else this week and moves himself up from 60th to 48th. And finally Michele Magnaterra starts his move back up the chart, passing 6 people and finishing at #51 at the end of Wednesday.

I was going to talk about designer bags this week, but I realised I don't really have the money to shop, so talking about it would just depress me. So instead, here's a poem:

The meadow dreams of shadows,
and a young bird dreams of air.
Where I am warmed by dreams of you,
The spring snow holds my stare.


Site Records
Michael Fried gains another 3 records to move to joint first place with 6, along with Lewis, Alvin and Omer. Paul Collins joins the site with 2 records. Lewis Benny, Omer Dogan, Mickael Smolen, Prashant Bhoja, Shaun Tanney and Alexandre Lorsery all pick up 1.

New players
Welcome to: Paco Lozano, Dennis Wegner, Lucas Porcu, Alexandre Lorsery, Thomas Coyle, Paul Collins, Paco Gaita, Erik Washburn, Matthew Collinson, Oliver Drews and Joshua Leutz.

Happy World Environment Day
(this entry is completely recyclable)

fields.author: Shadow
fields.title: Searching for a news update.
fields.content:
So I've left you without for news the last couple of days, so to make up for it, here's a wordsearch featuring all the players who made AF cuts this week!



Brief Highlights
Tim Shelbourne makes a big move this week and may soon be the one to challenge Alvin for the top spot. Kevin McAteer breaks into the top 10 and has his eye on that USA #1 crown.
Richard Karlsson and Thomas Dassaud were very impressive at the end of the week and passed quite a number of players between them. Richard is now close to breaking into the top 10, and Thomas is nearing the top 20. Both players to watch in the next few weeks.
Robert Ziegler makes passing players look easy, by passing 13 and finishing the week within the top 40, whilst Stefano Bragagia makes passing players look even easier still, dispatching 15 on his charge up the charts. Joe Sebeny was beating my PRs all week and making my own progress look like a snail's. I doubt I'll be keeping up with him this week. Michele Magnaterra continued his impressive PRing and passed a further 6 people, while Jon Ho was clearly inspired by the bread revelations and finished the week in 55th.

Silicone
A faster strategy for Daisy Circuit lap was found this week. It involves carefully pushing the cones that are placed around the track, off the racing line so that you can have a clear path when you're attempting to beat your fastest lap. It's quite a time-consuming new method and one I'm sure we're all going to dislike. :crazy:

Site Records
Tim Shelbourne steals the limelight here too this week beating 3 SRs and being the first on the site to sub 2'13 on DKM. Alex Penev picks up another 2, winning the race on Dry Dry Ruins flap. Michael Fried moves away from the pack on 6, by picking up N64's Bowser's Castle flap record and moves now into an untied #1 spot on 7.
Kevin Borne became the first to sub-22 on Luigi Circuit flap with a time of 21"997, whilst Mickael Smolen broke his own record to break into the 1'17s on MMM with 1'17"968. Shaun Tanney continues to lead the battle on Grumble Volcano's Bumpy Rock
Paco Gaita, Aubrey Clissold, Ryan Stevens and Marco van Turner all pick up one record.

New Members
Welcome to: Austin Wiggins, Aubrey Clissold, Ryan Stevens, Marcel Schubert, Marco van Turner, Liz Linebaugh, Sebastien Romero, Derrick Ihnen, Jason Foss, Kim Lang

Laters!
-Suzie

fields.author: Shadow
fields.title: 7 days
fields.content:
I've been away for the last 4 days so the usual mid-week update will be squashed into this one. I've developed an extra special squashing machine for the purpose. It doesn't really do anything except make juice, but that helps me with the staying awake.

Monday
15 active players, 6 new Site records
Kevin Borne snatched 2 records today. One on TF and beating the 1'46 mark on MG with a time of 1'45"990. Michael Fried added both Ghost Valley records to his collection, whilst Stacy Needham added the Koopa Cape ones to his.
Martin Rudmarker passed back Karlsson to reclaim the Swedish crown once more. Robert Ziegler, Stefano Bragagia and Ted Kim all moved up a couple of spots. Alvin van Asselt pushed a little more into the lead.
POD: Michael Fried

Tuesday
36 active players, 9 new Site records, 6 new players
This was a much busier day than Monday, possibly due to some sort of updating backlog from Monday or just that karters like Tuesday!
Tim Shelbourne submitted some decent PRs to propel himself past Lewis into second spot. Alvin van Asselt grabbed both DKJP records including a great sub of 43"993
Reinier de Jonge, Javier Argote and Dan Lindblad all joined with a Site Record to their name.
Martin Rudmarker and Dave Phaneuf moved up to 11th and 12th respectively. Joe Sebeny passed 3 for 23rd whilst Shaun Tanney passed 6 to move to 47th.
Other movers: Robert Ziegler,Cameron Tangen, Oliver Sreeves, Pete Crawford and Liz Linebaugh
Other records: Kevin Borne, Alex Penev, Ryan Stevens
Notable Subs: Omer Dogan on DKS lap of 37"850
Welcome to: Javier Argote, Emmanuel Claire, Daniel St-Laurent, Bernard Leclerc Jr., Dan Lindblad, Reinier de Jonge
POD: Tim Shelbourne

Wednesday
15 active players, 0 new Site records, 0 new players
Wednesday was a day for sleeping, and most people decided to take it off. Kevin McAteer however too this chance to move up another place, dispatching Emmanuel to move into 9th. Mark Schmidt passed both Paul Tanney and Marijn Jongbloed who were tied for 17th spot.
Lucas Porcu, Ashley O'Hara and Justin Best also moved up a few spots.
POD: Kevin McAteer

Thursday
26 active players, 3 new Site records, 2 new players
A big move from Michael Friedtoday, moving up 3 places from 8th to 5th becoming the highest ranked Non-European. The biggest move today came from Sebastien Servouze who unhoarded quite a lot of times to move himself up from 34th to 25th. Tom Norton also made a big move, lifting himself up from 65th to 51st.
James Leare, Robert Ziegler, Shaun Tanney and Justin Best all moved up a little.
Alvin van Asselt took the Maple Tree lap
record, whilst Lewis Benny improved both of his Snes Mario Circuit 3 ones.
Welcome to:Pat Bertovich , Nicola Gatti
POD: Michael Fried

Friday
25 active players, 4 new Site records, 1 new player
Lewis Benny hits back, and retakes his #2 spot back from Tim. Cole Gilbert passes Kristopher Will for 7th whlist Louis de Bourqueney climbs 2 spots to end up at #12
The big news today was that Mickael Smolen finally decloaked. He's been doing some strong work in the background and finally appears on the list all the way up at #14, moving everyone else down a spot. Lucas Porcu continues his steady rise today, now at #34.
Stacy Needham picks up 2 SRs today, whilst Alvin and Mickael both take 1.
Welcome to: Steven Reyes
POD: Stacy Needham

Saturday
17 active players, 3 new Site records, 0 new players
A day for revenge here as Tim Shelbourne passes Lewis straight back for 2nd and Kristopher Will gets his 7th spot back.
Robert Ziegler has had a great week and keeps going, passing 3 players today to reach 32nd. Shaun Tanney is doing similar things this week, and passes a further 5 players, finishing up in 41st.
Alvin Van Asselt, Stacy Needham, and Tim Shelbourne all bag a Site Record today.
POD: Tim Shelbourne

Sunday
29 active players, 2 new Site records, 3 new players
Re-revenge today, as Lewis Benny snatches back his #2 spot from Tim. The top 3 have been playing very consistently this week.
Louis de Bourqueney climbs another spot to finish the week just outside the top 10 in 11th place.
Matt Tanzer and Andreas Rudmarker both picked today to make some big moves. Matt passes 6 people to finish the week at 30, whilst Andreas climbs a full 11 places to finish in 35th
Michele Magnaterra and Justin Best also make some decent progress today.
The only person setting Records today was Emmanuel Debenest, who took both Bowser's Castle 3 records and made them his own.
Welcome to: Jose Karica , Kim-Erling Bolstad-Larssen and Jaap Nieuwenhuizen
POD: Lewis Benny

Overall
67 active players, 17 new Site records, 12 new players
A great week for activity with the top 3 really battling it out. Michael moves up into 5th, and Kevin McAteer moves to 9th. Mickael Smolen appears in a very strong position and ends up 14th. Some excellent movement from other players, so let's hope next week lives up to this one in terms of the quality of competition.

Toodles!
-S

fields.author: Shadow
fields.title: Towering above the competition
fields.content:
Instead of my usual goings on about movement and cuts, I thought I'd draw a picture instead for the last 3 days. It shows the people who made the biggest cuts. (The white extensions to the buildings show the improvement made). You can click on it to see it more clearly.





Site Records
Alvin van Asselt took both N64 Bowser Castle records, with the best lap time now sitting at 50"042. Who will be the first to break 50 seconds here? Meanwhile Michele Magnaterra beat Alvin's BC lap record and brought it down to 48"116. Jochem Oorschot, Kevin Borne and Michael Fried all added 1 to their collection. The biggest Site Record cut goes to Javier Argote , who demolished the old Bowser Castle 3 record, taking it down from 2'09"150 -> 2'07"798.

Other Stuff
Making the picture drained my chattiness from me I think, so you'll notice this news update is a little short on actual words. :) An update on our numbers though. We currently have a total of 243 players on the site, 116 of whom have sent in a full timeset, which is awesome. Keep them coming!

New players
Welcome to: Mario Palazzolo, Davide De Santis

Suzie sleep now

fields.author: Shadow
fields.title: Mushroom Mountain
fields.content:
Well, it looks like we have another shortcut to learn! More news on that later.

*Meep meep*
Alvin "Roadrunner"van Asselt continues to move further out of sight this week, widening the gap between himself and Lewis "Wile E. Coyote" Benny. The gap is now out to over 1.5 in AF.
Michael Fried pushed on and moved passed Kevin Borne to take 4th place overall and close the gap with the 3 remaining players ahead of him. Cole Gilbert also moved up a spot by dispatching Omer Dogan. The best move of the week however, has to go to Mickael Smolen. He started 17th but passed 10 players in one go to finish the week in 7th. Mickael is really looking like a serious threat now.

Staying in contention
4 players just outside top ranks have been steadily moving in the right direction.
James Leare passes Phaneuf and Karlsson to reach 15th
Stacy Needham and Joe Sebeny both pass Marijn and Wheatley to finish 19th and 20th
Matt Tanzer makes a move towards James and Stacy by passing 3 players to move up to 22nd

A is for Apple..
Alexandre Lorsery makes the biggest mid-table movement this week, impressively passing 14 players to move from 44->30
Armando Cobian and Ashley O'Hara both threaten to push me down yet another few places, finishing the week in 32nd and 33rd

Other movers
Shaun Tanney makes a move to rise out of the "other movers" column, putting in an impressive week this week, to rise 7 places to finish 36th
Justin Best continues his steady rise from last week, picking off players one by one and finishing 45th. Meanwhile Marco van Turner is taking good chunks off his weaker times and passes 19 people like they were statues. He breaks into the top 50 this week.

More Mountain Madness
This week another shortcut was found. This time it was on Mushroom Gorge, and is a similar style of shortcut to the Grumble Volcano one, except much harder to actually do. It involves driving for a few seconds past the line, turning around, and shrooming onto one of two mushrooms, hitting the mountain, and sliding around it to finish near the cave exit. The mushroom closest to the finish line is the quicker of the two, and also arguably the harder of the two to do correctly. Check out the message board to read about the best ways to do it, and what seems to trigger the Shortcut each lap. Good luck with it!

Site Records
8 new records were achieved over the last few days. Alvin van Asselt bettered both his Peach Gardens and N64 Bowser's Castle course times. Alexandre Lorsery improves his own Shy Guy Beach time, whilst leading the opening days attack on Mushroom Gorge. The time at the end of the day (which has since been beaten) was 51"715. Alex Penev leads the charge to bring that lap time down to an insane level. It currently stands at 14"611.
Michael Fried achieves a nice sub on Toad's Factory lap with a 35"846. And finally, Kevin Borne takes the DKS course time by 0"006, whilst Mickael Smolen improves his own time on MMM course.

New Players
Welcome to: Lockie Mclean, Lee Harrold, Sam Cheshire, Reiner de Jonge and Santiago Munoz

Tip of the day: Driving whilst on shrooms into the side of mountains may be hazardous to your health.

fields.author: Shadow
fields.title: Contesting
fields.content:
Movement
The only person in the top 10 who moved up any places over the last few days was the returning Kristopher Will. He's been away for a while and is now eager to gain back the places he lost. He passed fellow German Omer Dogan and new contender Mickael Smolen to reach 7th overall. Michael Fried continues where he left off last week and closes in on 3rd place Tim. CBS news projects that this race is "too close to call".

Hopefuls
Outside the magic 10, Paul Tanney has been making up some ground again. He passes out Louis de Bourqueney and Martin Rudmarker to move into 12th place, and is now quite close to 10th place Kevin McAteer. A cluster of players near the high-end of the teens are quite active and are all moving up whilst others fall like heavy statues (I know light ones would fall at the same rate, but the heavy ones really make a satisfying *thunk* when they hit the ground)
Mark Schmidt goes from 18th to 16th
Stacy Needham climbs a place to 18th, and
Matt Tanzer breaks into the top 20, finishing 19th from 22nd spot.

Limbo
In between hopefuls and the best of the rest lies the Limbo region where you could be going up or going down and nobody is really sure or paying much attention. In this section this week are William Lacey and Shaun Tanney. William does nothing but play MG and passes 4 people to finish 27th, and Shaun also passes 4 people, moving up to 32nd.

Best of the rest
Justin Best lives up to his name, and *is* best of the rest this week. He continues his climb from previous weeks and moves up 3 places. 45th->42nd.

Karter Contest 2K8
With all the recent contest hype, you might be forgiven for thinking that there was no actual karting going on this week. For anyone who isn't aware, 140 members of our community are facing off in a battle of wit/strength/cunning and guile to win the hearts and minds of the voting public, and whilst I'm not entirely sure what guile is, it's bound to make some fascinating viewing over the next month or so. Here's the link to the Message Board that has been set up for it: LINK!

Site Records
Alvin van Asselt stakes a firm claim to be the King of Peach Gardens this week, taking both records and making them his own. Meanwhile, Alex Penev continues to press home his advantage on Mushroom Gorge pushing the times down to 47"980 and 13"331 respectively. Reinier de Jonge claims the last Site Record taking the Daisy Circuit record down to an impressive 1'31"806

New Players
Welcome to: Matt Krall and Leslie Wolf

-Suz (Twirling, twirling towards freedom)

fields.author: Shadow
fields.title: Beginnings
fields.content:
Monday
Michael Fried made a vitally important move on Monday, cutting a full 18% off his AF, and moving past Lewis and Tim into 2nd place. Now the only person standing in his way is Alvin. Alvin has successfully defended his #1 spot against everyone who has tried to take it so far. Will Michael be the one to dethrone him?

Mickael Smolen also made a move today, and passed Cole and Kristopher to secure 6th place. Paul Tanney breaks back into the top 10 after over a month in the wilderness, displacing Kevin McAteer in the process. Mark Schmidt stays right on his tail and moves comfortably into 11th. James Leare silently moved up from 16th to 14th, whilst Justin Best broke into the top 40.

Stacy Needham neither moves up or down today, but improves on 3 site records. He takes Koopa Cape below 2'24 and also improves the lap and to wrap it off he swoops in to take Alvin's Maple Treeway lap away from him. Tim Shelbourne had 2 of his records snatched away from him. Michael Fried took his MH lap, and Mickael Smolen took his GCN MC lap. Daisuke Oota rounded off an impressive day for records, by lowering his own N64 BC course time.

Other movers today included Marco van Turner, Dennis Deede, Lee Harrold, Liz Linebaugh and Pete Crawford. Behind the scenes Milan Pacino is stealthing his way to the top 50.

Tuesday
Tuesday was a much quieter day by far. Mark Schmidt broke into the top 10 for the first time with a few nice PRs. Shaun Tanney made the most impressive cut of the day going from 33rd straight into 25th spot to lead the mid-table hopefuls. There's quite a gap to traverse to make any upward moves from here though.
Alexandre Lorsery moves up a spot to 22nd. Sam Hoar passes 3 for 76th and Nathan Stinson takes out 7 on his way to 80th.
There was only one record beaten today, and that was by Alvin van Asselt who broke Lewis's N64 BC lap.

Wednesday
Wednesday was the quietest day of all, with no upward movements by anyone in the top 40. Marco van Turner did manage to break into the top 40 though today, slotting neatly into #39, whilst Justin Best maintained his 40th spot by passing another player.
Michael Fried beat his own Snes GV2 course record today, joined by Jochem Oorschot who lowered his own MC course time.

New Players
Welcome to:
Roger Bisbe, Ivo van Oord, Karina Villa, Joe Loose, Nic Nash, PJ Ferguson, Justin Baldwin, Tanner LeBlanc, Corey Bryant

fields.author: Shadow
fields.title: Karting Times
fields.content:
Monday, July 7th 2008

The Karting Times
Still only 90c


Gender Conspiracy Rocks
Karting World




N
ews broke late last night which has shaken the very foundations of the karting world to its core. A number of high-ranking mariokart players were discovered to have faked their identities in order to blend in with honest, hard-working karters here on the site.

Suspicions arose at a recent karter meet, when a bracelet with a floral pattern and hearts on it was found on the ground shortly after everyone had gone home. The bracelet was bagged and sent to the forensic department who managed to lift fingerprints and trace it back to a house in the city. A raid of the house took place shortly after 7pm last night, and it was there that the shocking discovery was made.

Twenty seven girls were found having a secret meeting, all wearing name tags with the karter they've been impersonating on them. The mastermind behind all this, one Karina Alexandra Villa, was wearing several nametags, and had been instructing the girls on how best to stay
undercover.

Although twenty seven girls were at the meeting, it is thought that only a fraction of the total females involved were in attendance that night. However, so far the girls have refused to release any other names.

Statements from the girls were taken on the scene. Michelle Fried, the highest ranked known member of the group was quoted as saying, "The guys will often treat girls differently on the site. We just wanted to be taken seriously for once."

Karina was arrested and will appear in court later next week on multiple charges of defrauding the community. Karina has taken on many male personalities, including MK64 rising star John Falls Marshall and Julio Cesar Morales. Details of the extent of the deception may never reach the public, as judge Liem has ordered the press out of the courtroom for the duration of the trial.

The news shocked regular-Joe, meat-eating, male karters, everywhere. One karter commented "Girls, good at Kart? What next? Male hairdressers?".

Not everyone viewed the situation the same way though. One prominent mkds star commented "If Karen Borne wants to be known as Kevin Borne, then who are we to argue with her, him, er...you know what I mean. Why are you still writing? Give me that p.."

Whatever the outcome of the trial, it is clear that the world of kart won't be the same. The 27 girls discovered at the meeting may be just the tip of the iceberg. Some have postulated that as many as 50% of all karters may indeed be secretly female. The consequences could be potentially disastrous. What if you're playfully flirting with some guy on the Message Board? If it was a guy, he'd know you were joking, but what if it was secretly a girl? In some states that sort of thing means you're technically married. It's a scary world we're entering, and this reporter feels that the only karters you can trust are those you've met personally. And even then, have you noticed those guys who never seem to grow a beard, and have
suspiciously high voices, and when you ask them "Who is your favorite character from Sex and the City?" they tell you that they can't decide rather than telling you they'e never seen it?

Be on the lookout. Pretending to be the gender you aren't is serious business and should be stamped out of this community.

~Susan Amy Lacey

fields.author: Shadow
fields.title: Back to normal
fields.content:
As the media circus of the last while dissipated to background noise, the main karting action continued this week with renewed vigor

What goes up..
What goes up, tends to stay there. At least for a while. To avoid dropping AF points, everyone in the 30-50 range should aim to improve 0.500 per day to break even and counteract those passing you. That increases to nearly 1 full point per day when you drop down near the 100 mark, but only around 0.300 near the top. The general message is that the higher up you go, the slower you fall back down. It's also why those who focus on getting really fast times on certain tracks tend to fall slower than those who try to improve only their worst times.
Anyway, all this rambling on doesn't help anyone, and I have a hot date tonight.

1-16
Alvin and Michael declared a truce this week. Alvin, because he's internetless for 3 weeks, and Michael because he's busy studying for his bar exam. The end result is that both fell towards 3rd place Tim. He's cut the gap in half between himself and Michael.
3 German players have been secretly moving up other lists (the PRSR one), Omer Dogan, Mark Schmidt, and Kristopher Will. They're now 4th,5th and 6th on that chart, and Omer moves from 9th to 6th in AF.
The real action of the week though, and of the entire month so far is that of Shaun Tanney. Starting the month at 33rd, and the week at 24th, Shaun has improved hugely to finish the week just behind his brother Paul, who has been the dominant force so far. This rivalry could be just about to begin in ernest.
Joe Sebeny closes out the top 16, climbing two places from 18th this week, and continuing his upward momentum.

People who aren't totally horrible at the game
In the mid-section this week, we have Alexandre Lorsery and Marijn Jongbloed, who both move up a place to 21st and 24th respectively. The real movement comes from Marco van Turner and Brendan Payne. Michael passes 7 players to move from 34th to 27th, whilst Brendan inflicts trademark payne on 14 players, finishing just behind Michael in 28th spot. Both push me down a spot each, and are off my christmas card list.
Rounding out the top 50 is Sam Hoar who cuts his AF from 71 to 61, and passes 7 to finish exactly 50th.

People who would rather be under a different heading
Quite a lot of movement in the 2nd half of the top 100.
Dennis Deede moves from #69 to #57
Daniel Pascua moves from #77 to #58
Brian Fergus moves from #65 to #59 and
Lenny Andreev moves from #80 to #60
These 4 players finish the week side by side, and all hoping to break into the top 50 soon.

Leslie Wolf remains in the hunt, passing 13 players this week and up to #65. The biggest move of the rest goes to Jared Guemmer. He started the week outside the top 100 at #107, but finishes it well inside. He now sits at #89.

Site Records
Too many records were broken this week. 14 of them to be precise.
Jochem Oorschot took back his MC crs record after Alvin broke Nobou's WR here. Go team us! That time is now 1'22"517
Kevin Borne took down both DKS crs and DKJP crs records.
Marco van Turner not only beat his WGM Site Record but also beat the World Record in the process. The time sits at 1'54"363. Another point for the player's page!
Reinier de Jonge improves his own SR on Daisy Circuit, and gets top spot on the World Rankings too. 1'31"261 is the mark, and point number 3 to us!
Meanwhile Guillaume Bertrand takes the lap away from Reiner and is the first to reach sub 29 here with a 28"996.
Vincent Schuttevaar is new to the site and takes the Peach Beach crs SR from Prashant. Omer Dogan takes Tim's YF lap from him, whilst Tim takes Mickael's GCN MC lap and Alvin's Peach Gardens crs record. We're now 1-2 on the Worldwide list here. Point 4 for us.
Emmanuel Debenest takes Shaun's BC3 lap record. Daisuke Oota beats his own N64 BC crs time, and gets #1 Worldwide. The time is 2'34"712 Point 5 for us!
Lastly, Joe Sebeny takes down both Sherbet Land records.
A great week for Site and World records from us. Keep up the excellent work!

New Players
Welcome to: Mick Whitcomb, Vincent Schuttevaar, Denat Aymeric, Adam Dahlke, Daniel Pena, Tyler Layton, Erik Daxberger, Andrey Mengliev, James Wilson, Andy Lundeen, Dennis Hennersdorf, Oskar Lindby, Joscha Behrens, Olivier Aeby, Daniel Both

Laters!
-S
