Feeling ambitious, #25 Fabien Jacques makes the first placement hop of the update, going from 26th to 25th to join this paragraph of updates, cutting roughly .2 AF with 2 new times. Less than 1 AF separates him from #24 and beyond as of now.

Coming to #26 to #50, a very good number of 8 people played, with some rather big movements. Staring us off, #29 Oliver Martin successfully leaps from #30 to #29 to really get into the "feel" of the Top 30. He cut just about 2 AF with 4 new times to finish off this week. Two places back, #31 Kevin Mason made 6 new times for a big 4 AF cut and made a 2 place jump, very very close to the Top 30 now. #33 Zane Royal got pushed back in the process losing about half an AF point but still made 2 new times to not lose as much ground. Irish Champion #35 Daniel Raftery made 7 new times, one of which is a new SR on RR 1lap, and cut about 2 AF and jumped a place. Coming to a very big cut, #37 Paul-Philipp Baehr, aka the person I always typo when I update, submits PRs from November until now, cutting over 27 AF with 34 PRs and cut exactly 30 places, #67 -> #37. Right behind him, #38 Thomas van Deerse had a good week too, cutting 4 places with 12 PRs to cut about 4 AF and moved up 4 places to join the Top 40 crowd. Completing the trio, #39 Liam Ashcroft joined the Top 40 himself, #43 -> #39 with a batch of 6 new times good for a little over 2 AF cut. Closing us out on this area, #44 Zack McNell found himself knocked back one place because of the people passing him but he still played this week and made one new time to prepare him for next week.

Top 100 territory gives us the most activity this week with 11 players improving their times. Starting almost at #50, Japanese Champion #51 Harp Valentine started to play again with two new times, but got knocked back one place from the people who passed him up during the past few days. The next three people also got kicked back a place, but in the end still cut AF rather than losing it. #58 Yannick Wiesner was the first one pushed back, but made 6 new PRs good to cut himself well over an AF point to have an ~4 place gap to get back to 57th. Behind him, #59 Tim van Ham was the second one who still cut AF despite being pushed back, driving in 3 new times for close to an AF point cut. #60 Kyle R had an identical week as well, with 3 PRs and roughly the same AF cut, trying to shorten the gap between him and Tim + Yannick. Two places back, #62 Agustin Berrios changed it up and jumped one placement instead of being pushed back, with a good batch of 14 new times and a 3.2 AF cut. Only 3 AF separates him from the Top 60 now. #70 John Brunn continues nicely with 3 new times and cut over an AF cut, he didn't gain any places, but he made a good dent in the gap between him and getting deep into the Top 60. Keeping up with John, #71 Sofie Wimmer didn't really cut all that much AF because of the players active around Sofie, but still managed to make 3 new times to start decreasing the lead John has over her. Making consistent progress the past weeks, #77 Marvin Donjes keeps it up with a 2+ AF cut, moved up 3 placements in the process and drove 12 new times. With an intense week, #95 Danny Gallenberger PRd one third of his times sheet, jumping 3 places good for a 11 AF cut. Despite being passed, #97 Martin Prigent still kept his place since he cut over 1 AF with 5 new PRs to not lose ground. Finishing up here, #98 Andre Hoelscher had a good week, gaining one more place with a 4 AF cut and 7 new times.

Keeping around the same level of activity, "The Field" as Zack would say, had 7 people active to close this news update. Starting us off, #106 Christian Nemetz continues to make progress to the Top 100 with a solid 1 AF improvement with 4 new times and stays at his 106th spot. With only two new times this week, #114 Noah Gordon jumped two places with each PR to get him closer to joining the Top 100 group as well. Not far behind, #120 Dexter Howe made a 3 placement jump into the Top 120 with a little over 1 AF cut and 4 new PRs. #138 Tomas Pallaruelo made a good 2 AF cut with 3 new times to set him up for next week. #140 Christian Wild found some time to play this game instead of SMK this week and jumped 3 places with 3 new times, cutting 2 AF like Tomas. 7 places back, #147 Tom Norton fell back 2 places this week, but only made one new time, which is a new rSGB 3lap WR. The last player active of this update was #227 Tony Fan. He made an impressive 15+ AF cut with PRing one third of his times sheet and jumped 14 places, good work.

Site Records

Very large amount of Site Records accumulated this past week and even more today for next week.

Salvatore Bellusci beat the old Mushroom Gorge crs time of 0'37"921 with a time of: 0'36"845
Lee Duggan beat the old Dry Dry Ruins lap time of 0'33"371 with a time of: 0'33"176
Jak Russo beat the old Rainbow Road crs time of 2'27"884 with a time of: 2'27"599
Daniel Raftery beat the old Rainbow Road lap time of 0'47"993 with a time of: 0'47"931
Shaun Tanney beat the old SNES Ghost Valley 2 lap time of 0'15"019 with a time of: 0'14"983
Tom Norton beat the old GBA Shy Guy Beach crs time of 1'22"238 with a time of: 1'22"167

As this update comes to a close, interesting news awaits next weeks update, so stay tuned. Until next time...

fields.author: Webinator
fields.title: Times Two
fields.content:
For all you news-desiring karters, your wishes are finally fulfilled. Because of personal issues, I couldnt write the news last week, but this week you get twice the fun, and so do I!

This update covers news from 2/20/11 to 3/5/11. Meade will pick up the weekly updates again on Sunday. Good news about this is I finally got an active week. Anyway, enough intro text you dont care about, and on to the important stuff.

The New Players
Five new guys this week, which is a little more than twice the usual. I guess it makes sense, but why I put this sentence in the news update really doesnt.

Andre Riviere had 50 times sent in to the site. Hes about 319th now, but the other times will surely help him cut AF points. (and join the main chart as well, but nobody ever does that).
Victor Zanchi slots in at about 200th, but only has 32 times as opposed to Andre. With a full timeset he could probably get close, if not into the Top 100, so I would recommend keeping up the progress on submissions!
Mohsen Mazza defied all odds and actually entered the full AF chart in his first week, moving in at 241st. Technically, defying the odds is entering after not submitting a full timeset (its either first week or never), but Mohsen deserves some credit for actually writing down his flaps.
Logan Fournier had 7 times, which really doesnt show that much about his skill, except for the fact that hes sitting at 344th (if every one of his other times was dead last ranked), also meaning hes beating about 30 people on the main AF chart with 7 times, which I guess is an achievement within itself.
Finally, Remy Faure had the most impressive entry out of anyone, submitting 32 times but showing up as a ghost hovering over 191st. With flaps, he should easily be able to get near the Top 100 like Victor.

Movement
Thats the longest the New Players section has been in a while, but now its time for the real fun, as the last 14 days brought 80 active players to the MKW page. Who said MKW was slowing down?

A welcome to the AF chart other than Mohsen entering in his first week goes out to #17 Jak Russo, who had some very nice DDR times on entry and now enters at a very good chart position. Lets see if he starts to drop, or can maintain or improve. Also, #29 Alexandre Gilet, who submitted 10 new PRs and jumped in at an impressively high position. Im not sure if hes been lurking in the non-complete zone for a while or if hes new, but the Top 30, no matter how you enter it, is impressive. Also, #292 Julian Stephens moved in at a slightly lower position, however Im sure we havent heard the last of him yet.

~~1-10~~
Starting at the Top, the Elite 10 MKW members have been quite active recently, and this week(s) was no different. #2 Nick Meade is pretty much always active, and he kept up the PRs this week. He grabbed 6 overall, but it wasnt enough to stop from the natural weekly AF gain. #3 Shaun Tanney has been on fire recently, and is quickly becoming a force in the rankings again. He hit 17 PRs in this two-week span, and cut 1.5 AF, trying to bridge the huge 7 point gap to Meade. #4 Marc Bas hit 5 PRs to hold his ground, and distance himself slightly from Bubbles. #6 Jimmy Benson knocked out 6 PRs, and is now about 10 AF away from Bubbles, or more depressingly, 640 place improvements. Anyone think #7 Jay Batten would slow down? I sure hope not, because as usual, he made a massive move. 26 PRs allowed him to make a move from #10 to #7. Jay is running out of chart positions, so Im really not sure how he can top this recent progress. Finally, #8 Mark Schmidt hit 13 PRs, passing Tyler McNell (who had a really bad week, #7 - #9) and putting a nice 3 AF buffer on his German title from #10 Dustin Enders. Glad to have this group nice and active again.

~~11-25~~
#11 Jamie Disley jumped from #16 with his current comeback, displacing both #12 Ben Hart and #13 Alex Shoal, frequent members in the Top 10. #15 Tony Ruiz and #16 Eric Hacksell both were active with 4 and 1 PRs respectively, however due to Jamies huge move both dropped down a spot overall. After Jaks entry at #17, we find #20 Salvatore Bellusci, who several (including yours truly) projected in the Top 20 positions. With his 10 PRs he made a massive 6 place jump, showing to the MKW world he belongs in this elite group. Finally, #23 Alvin Le hit 3 PRs, but even with a .4 AF cut lost a place due to Jak entering so highly on the charts.

~~26-50~~
#28 Oliver Martin hit 2 PRs, but sadly dropped one spot again due to Jak. He narrowly avoided dropping two however, as Alexandre popped in at #29. Next up in the 30s we reach a huge group of activity. #32 Lucas Acek, #33 Kevin Mason, and #34 Zane Royal looked at each other for a rivalry this last fortnight, and played 3, 2, and 3 PRs respectively. The first two of this threesome lost two spots, and Zane lost one (or gained one technically and then lost two from newcomers), so they all have spots to fight back for next update. #36 Thomas van Deerse and #37 Liam Ashcroft played together as well. However unlike the last group, each moved up two spots instead of losing ground. The two opposite trains may collide if the trends continue, for one long train that could probably screw over your times on a game like MK64. (+3 update points if you get the reference). #39 Daniel Raftery was too busy working on RR to cut that much ground, and hit 2 PRs for a net loss of 5 places, which is mainly because of newcomers and annoying trains. #41 Alberto Fiorese dropped 2.6 AF points, yet still lost a spot, showing the harsh reality of AF gaps and active MK sites. The third train of this group involved #43 Franco Gubser, #44 Zack McNell, and #45 Matthieu Mayer. This train was a little confused, because last update Matthieu was in 43rd, Franco in 44th, and Zack in 45th, but they decided to make a car switch and Matthieu was left on the back. Franco made a .98 AF cut with 8 PRs, so nice week for him. Finally, #48 Kyle R, who might work for some secret agency due to the fact that his last name is classified hit 5 PRs to vault into the Top 50 from 54th and perform more stealth and espionage operations on the upper workings of the MKW players. All I can say is, were on to you Kyle.

~~51-100~~
#52 Agustin Berrios hit his first SR on DC 3lap this update, notching up another achievement on his resume. Before long he should move into the Top 50, and hopefully can continue his success on DC and MMM. #56 Clement Rouchon and #57 Hendrik Boss were active right near each other, Clement with 26 PRs and a 10 place gain, and Hendrik with 8 PRs and a one place loss. They both cut AF however, and maybe Hendrik will play in order to stay with his new rival. #60 Tim van Ham ate his way to 4 PRs, but wasnt hungry enough to eat away some of his AF points. Maybe next week, as Clement and Hendrik are right around the corner. #67 Stacy Needham hit 1 PR and dropped 3 spots, while #69 John Brunn hit 10, and moved up one spot. Technically he passed three players, but the charts dont say it so I cant write it. A 4-person group of activity jumped in next, with #73-76 Emmanuel Amador, Sofie Wimmer, Marvin Donjes, and Nate Paternost all playing. Donjes was active as usual, he could be named Jay Batten Jr., with 17 PRs, but stayed stagnant due to an AF gap. Next up is #80 Jon Coppernoll. J-Cop hit 20 PRs, probably a hoarding group and brought himself up 8 spots. #86 Carlos Eduardo hit 10 PRs and escaped from the verge of Top 100 elimination, moving from #97. #88 Thibaud Bourdeau hit 9 PRs but dropped 2 spots. Carlos made some quality times and thats what was the difference. Finally I couldnt go a news update without mentioning #91 Danny Gallenberger, who has risen high above the Top 100 expectations, coming from #94 this week. Although the tables are ever-changing, Danny has to be feeling the cushion behind him growing larger and larger every week. Lastly, #94 Andre Hoelscher had his own battle to win, and that was avoiding the 101 and beyond group. He moved from #99 and tried to grab on to Dannys cushion to no avail.

~~101-373~~
A lot of activity down here, but Ill just throw in some honorable mentions since the update has been long, and my head is hurting from looking at this word document. #101 Yorick Meeker forged ahead towards Top 100 fame by hitting 28 PRs and moving from #122. About a point separates him from the elite group. #121 Jamal Fluellen hit (hoarded) 36 PRs to jump from #137 to a lower spot. And finally #123 Loris Bagnasco made a move up 6 places to try and track down Jamal.

I promise I wont be as lazy with this section next time, but I figure you want news more than you want every player mentioned.

Site Records
A bunch of records were broken from new strats and such, but only the DC 3lap WR changed hands. A huge congratulations goes out to Agustin Berrios, for his first SR. I cant believe we were actually in the same rivalry at the same time, and I wish him the best luck in the future with moving higher and higher, while I stay in the 150s or something.

Salvatore Bellusci beat the old Mushroom Gorge crs time of 0'36"845 with a time of: 0'33"626
Marc Bas beat the old Toad's Factory lap time of 0'35"252 with a time of: 0'35"163
Tom Norton beat the old Mario Circuit crs time of 1'21"854 with a time of: 1'21"764
Daniel Both beat the old Wario's Gold Mine lap time of 0'09"443 with a time of: 0'09"393
Agustin Berrios beat the old Daisy Circuit crs time of 1'29"819 with a time of: 1'29"775
Lee Duggan beat the old Dry Dry Ruins crs time of 1'48"418 with a time of: 1'48"359
Jak Russo beat the old Rainbow Road crs time of 2'27"599 with a time of: 2'27"420
Cole Gilbert beat the old GCN Peach Beach crs time of 1'13"124 with a time of: 1'13"114
Tony Ruiz beat the old GCN Waluigi Stadium crs time of 1'51"070 with a time of: 1'50"470

Awards
Im still getting caught up on these since Ive been busy for the past week. Ill work on them in the next few days and maybe get in a PM to Meade for a little excerpt in his next weeks update.

Im sure there are typos but Ill leave them unless theyre really drastic. Sorry for the lack of news last week, but everything is back to normal now. See everyone in two weeks!
-Web

fields.author: NMeade
fields.title: Back On Track
fields.content:
Hey everyone, another week of news to report.

The New Players
Only one new player this week... welcome to Johan Svensson.

Movement
This week yielded pretty quiet activity with only 32 playing, as well as no new Site Record activity.

The Top 10 was still very alive this week, with 5 out of the 10 playing. Starting us off, French Champion #4 Marc Bas did a small amount of PRs but managed to cut well over 1 AF to have a 1.1 AF distance to reclaim it from Shaun. Two places back, the guy who never stops improving, you guessed right, #6 Jay Batten passed up Jimmy Benson this week to become the new Australian Champion. (I understand it shows UK on the PP but I'm pretty sure he is Australian). Anyway, he cut almost an AF with 6 new times this week. Behind him, #7 Jimmy Benson didn't lose a lot of ground with the improvements of everyone else, contributing one new time. Let's see if he strikes back next week. Behind Jimmy, #8 Tyler McNell makes a nice return and starts to gain lost territory from not playing for a while, jumping from 9th to 8th with a 1.2 AF cut. Finishing us off, German Champion #9 Mark Schmidt lost points with people passing him but he still improved 4 times to almost even out what he had already lost.

Not so much activity into Top 25 but still had 4 people playing this week. Knocking on the door of the Top 10 comes a new challenger, #11 Jamie Disley. Upon Jamie's return some weeks ago, he has made a bunch of progress from around Top 30 to #11, this week he contributes 3 new times to put himself 2.5 AF from #10, will he finally get into the Top 10? Some placements back, #17 Jak Russo lost some ground but still improved 2 times to set himself up for next week. Making a big jump, #18 Salvatore Bellsuci finally breaks into the Top 20, making 10 new PRs and cutting close to 2 AF. Closing this area out, #22 Alvin Le gets a little closer to Top 20 with jumping 1 spot to 22nd, making 3 new times and decreases the gap from him and 20th to less than 2 AF.

It is interesting to look at the stats program at this point for the #26-#50 area. 6 people were active with only 2 people improving 2 times and the rest improving one course, and each person fell back a tiny bit in AF. Anyway, first to be reported in this area is #29 Alexandre Gilet, who was one of the only 2 people who improved twice, staying in the same spot as last week. #33 Kevin Mason and #34 Zane Royal both improved once, and lost about the same AF, so these guys didn't swap spots at all. 3 places behind Zane, #37 Liam Ashcroft was the other person with Alexandre who PRed twice, and keeping his original place from last week. Ending off here, #44 Zack McNell and #45 Matthieu Mayer were the last two people who PRed once and kept their original position. Some weeks this area decides to cut a load of places and other weeks they decide to lay off the kart for a while, so I guess this week was just "one of those weeks" for this area.

Instantly, my mind was blown away as I was scrolling down the stats program - scrolling slowly, I saw that #51 to #69 held no activity at all, so I thought that the most active group (generally) of the week had no players at all playing... well this clearly wasn't the case. A good number of 7 people still played in this area this week, from the #70 to #100 area. #70 John Brunn lost some ground this week but not that much, as he still managed to improve 2 times this week. Cutting close to 2 AF, #73 Emmanuel Amador didn't move any place, but he made a big dent into the gap between him and 72nd down to only 2 from an original 4 AF. #75 Sofie Wimmer almost broke even this week with not losing ground but still lost a little bit, but ended up PRing twice this week to have good momentum for next time. Coming along well, #76 Marvin Donjes made 4 PRs and continues his consistent progress up the ranks this week. Into the 80s now, #83 Carlos Eduardo made a nice 3 place cut this week, making a nice round of 7 PRs and cut close to 3 AF. #89 Danny Gallenberger continued the trend as well, making his own jump of 2 places into the Top 90 and cut a little over 2 AF with 5 new times. The last improvement here, making a leap of faith into the Top 100 comes #93 Yorick Meeker. Yorick went from 101th to 93rd this week with an impressive 7+ AF cut with 8 new times, congrats.

Quieter than usual, 6 people still picked up their controller this week in "The Field". Inching closer and closer to the Top 100, #112 Noah Gordon starts us off with close to a 2 AF cut with 6 new times, bumping himself up 2 places. 4 places back, we have #116 Viktor Silivanov who jumped 4 places this week to get closer to the Top 100 like Noah. He improved 6 new times and cut over 3 AF to finish off this week. Coming to the biggest cut of this week with an insane cut, #121 Simon Uldry improved way over half his times sheet, cutting 37 places and 46+ AF, great job. #124 Dexter Howe did some magic this week with a 1+ AF cut with only 1 PR, jumping 3 places from last week. Affected by the jump of the Mighty Simon, #135 Sam Smith got bumped back a spot this week but still gained positive AF points for 2 new times this week. Finishing this weeks update, #153 Nicholas Harvey makes a pleasant return to MKW this week and starts his come back well with 4 new times and a 1+ AF cut.

Site Records

No new Site Records this week...

That's it for me. See you guys around.

fields.author: Webinator
fields.title: The First Quarter Draws to a Close
fields.content:
Dont worry everyone, I was really tired last night from my workout so I couldnt get the news up. Its up today though, and thats better than skipping a whole week, right? Anyway, heres the news from 3/13 - 3/19.

The New Players
One newbie, which has become the norm. At least the good news is everyone keeps up the activity.

Jonny Sapper sent in 22 of his times, although I have no idea which 22 they were. Hes 277th if the rest of his times are dead last, so its hard to judge how far hell move up when (or if) he fills out the rest of his timeset.

Movement
36 players picked up MKW this week. The huge surge of WRs in the past few weeks has slowed a bit, however many still wanted to advance in the charts. Were nearing 400 players, so a spot in the Top 200 which once was laughable is becoming more and more impressive. Keep up the work guys!

The only Welcome to the AF chart goes out to #251 Sean Wilson, who hit 12 PRs (not sure how many were new or old) to jump in at a decent starting ground. Now is the real challenge, as every time submitted can change his score. Will Sean work to gain ground, or go inactive and slowly drop? Only time will tell.

~~1-10~~
Proportionately, the Top 10 was the most active group this week, with a nice 70% turnout from the elite MKW karters. #2 Nick Meade is still on the great quest to reclaim his title, and each week that Jorge stays dormant it seems like a glaring possibility. We do know JG has some hoarded times, but with his 2 PRs and small .6% cut this week, Meade is about half a point of AF away from retaking the site crown, or 32 place improvements. #3 Shaun Tanney has found out that he had a lot more left in the tank, as this week he sends in 3 PRs, trying to fight off #4 Marc Bas. Both have battled back and forth but Tanney is holding on strong to his position. Marc sent in a PR to stay active and show STanney hes not giving up the fight yet. Passing Ex-Champ Bubbles who remains retired, we find a karter who seems that theyll never retire. #6 Jay Batten had a quiet week, only hitting 7 PRs for a 1AF cut, or a 3.5% improvement. 8 huge AF points lie between Jay and the Top 5. If he keeps up his progress, he should be there in a few months. Jay distanced himself from #7 Jimmy Benson, who PRed 4 times this week. Due to Jays PRs he ended up gaining AF, but much less than the inactives around him. Lastly is #9 Mark Schmidt. Mark hit 1 PR to try and widen the gap for the German crown from Dustin Enders (now at 4 AF). Dustin seems to submit in hoarding spurts however, so Mark may need to keep working.

~~11-25~~
#11 Jamie Disley continued his progress in a comeback, dropping 2 AF points and now sitting only a tenth away from the fabled Top 10. I cant ever remember Jamie being in this illustrious group despite his wide range of great PRs, so this should be a great accomplishment in his already impressive MKW career. #12 Alex Shoal has fallen out of the Top 10 but is never forgotten as a great karter, holding that spot for years. He dropped by to send in 3 PRs this week, one on Mario Circuit where hes been working on his strategy, which helped him to drop 1.1 AF points and fend of the other attackers to his position. Next up is newcomer to the full AF chart (as of a month ago) #14 Jak Russo. Jak jumped up three spots with 5 PRs, cutting off 2 AF points, and now sits ready to strike on #13 Ben Hart, and Shoal if they arent careful. #18 Salvatore Bellusci has been making strides in the charts recently, but had a quiet week. He had a nice 3 PRs, but it wasnt enough to stop the inevitable AF gain from more active players. #22 Alvin Le, Swiss MKW champion had a decent week, PRing twice but still gaining a bit of AF. Finally, a new entry to this group comes with #24 Alexandre Gilet, who jumped all the way from #29 to just barely squeak in. He had 8 PRs which cut 6 AF, so they must have been amazing PRs in order to provoke such a jump. On the short end of the stick this week is Marvin Rekovsky, who falls back to #26 and will need to fight to be mentioned in this paragraph. Wait a minute, nevermind.

~~26-50~~
#29 Oliver Martin always seems to start out this section, and this week was no different. He had a 1 PR week, and the jump from Alexandre pushed him back a spot. The lack of anyone really active around him helps though, and the Top 25 beckons. #36 Liam Ashcroft and #37 Thomas van Deerse decided to kart together this week. They swapped spots however, Liams 7 PRs ousting Thomass 3, and each cut a little AF. Liam seems to have the edge now, and Thomas will have to play catch up to reclaim his spot. Ending off this quiet group is #44 Zack McNell, who had 1 PR but fell back due to the more active players. Will he catch Tyler near the top? It seems far off, but a Jay Batten-esque move could do it.

~~51-100~~
#51 Agustin Berrios is inches away from moving into the Top 50. He jumped up two spots from #53 due to other activity, and now stands 1.3 AF points away from passing Ex-Champ Tim Shelbourne for a Top 50 position. With his recent SR progress, hopefully Nick can write about it next week. Farther down is #67 John Brunn, who made a nice move from #70 up three spots. Hes always been hovering around this spot, and with a few good weeks (due to a lack of activity here), he could see himself moving up quite a bit. #73 Emmanuel Amador held his ground with 4 PRs, cutting a few tenths off, while #75 Marvin Donjes continued his constant surge up the charts. 9 PRs this week helped him cut 3 AF points and continue to bridge a 5 point AF gap. Next week with the same result he should latch on to another group of karters. #89 Danny Gallenberger has risen above the 90s and now secured himself a spot in the Top 100 MKW players. He hit 6 PRs to drop .7 AF, but again this group is very quiet, and merely cutting AF causes you to jump places. Finally, #92 Yorick Meeker banged out 13 PRs, causing him to cut 6 AF, but due to huge gaps only move up one place.

~~101-Wherever~~
For once the 101 and after group was very active this week. #105 Frederick Hutchington hit 17 PRs, bumping him up all the way from #113 up 8 spots. Hes 10 AF away from the Top 100, so continued progress is very important for him to reach that goal. Also active were #110 Simon Uldry and #114 Noah Gordon. Simon moved from #121 up 11 spots, while Noah cut .87 AF but lost two spots due to Frederick and Simon. #122 Dexter Howe had two impressive PRs that moved him up two spots. #135 Brett Edwards hit 5 PRs to cut 3.5 AF and move up a spot, but still needs to continue progress if he wants the Top 100. Other active names included Christian Wild and Nicholas Harvey, but no one really had any form of cut otherwise.

Site Records
Only 2 records this week, but one holds extra significance.
Shaun Tanney beat the old Coconut Mall crs time of 1'57"480 with a time of: 1'57"374
Alex Shoal beat the old DS Delfino Square lap time of 0'38"997 with a time of: 0'38"990

With Alexs improvement, the first true king of MKW, Alvin van Asselt is bumped off the records table. Sword loses a SR and returns to 3 from 4, however both Shoal and Tanney go from a solo record to having two under the belt. The top of the chart remains unchanged, with ROM at 8, JG at 7, and Meade at 6.

Awards
Sorry I couldnt finish with awards, I did about a months worth of them, however I figured youd want the whole news up rather than the awards. Ill finish them in a few days and send a supplement to be added into Meades update. I think youd want all the awards as opposed to a few in the news at once, and some have already been updated, so just check the Awards page.

Also, before I forget the POQ is quickly coming up, and as you guys have stated youre interested in voting for the POQs, Ill have a poll put up a few days after this news update. Ill let you know all of the stats so youre not in the dark.

Peace and keep on Karting!
-Web

fields.author: NMeade
fields.title: Starting Off Q2
fields.content:
I guess you can consider this the start of the 2nd quarter of 2011, so let's see how the first week rolled out.

The New Players
Three new people joined the site this week... welcome to Yann Deptia, Hato Mugi, Thomas Petraud.

Movement
We finally broke the 40 player/week active barrier again as opposed to recent weeks with 41 players playing with some pretty nice jumps.

A very good deal of activity was in the Top 10 this week with 8 out of 10 players active (not really typical to see). At the top, #1 Nick Meade took advantage of the very slim gap at the end of the week to play a bit and made 5 PRs, gaining the Site Champion status from #2 Jorge Hernandez who hasn't played for some weeks. Keeping really consistent activity since his come back at the turn of the new year, UK Champion #3 Shaun Tanney improved 17 of his times for a huge cut of over 2 AF, effectively gapping himself from Marco for now. The French Champion #4 Marc Bas didn't let that affect him though, as he too made a very big cut with 8 new PRs and cut 1.5 AF to keep the distance ~1 AF from Shaun. This very interesting rivalry between Shaun and Marco in recent weeks has been very fun to see, it's almost like a tug of war game really. Anyway, now we arrive to #6 Jay Batten who is (confirmed) as a British player (sorry about my last update Jay). He capitalized big this week when he improved 12 times on his times sheet to cut off another chunk of the gap from him and #5 David McPartland. Trying to gain some ground back to regain 6th, Australian Champion #7 Jimmy Benson lost more than half an AF due to heavy activity in the Top but still had time to make 2 new times to have the distance to Jay just barely above 2 AF now. Now that I see it, along with Jimmy, #8 Tyler McNell, German Champion #9 Mark Schmidt, and #10 Jamie Disley all lost a little more than half an AF this week due to heavy activity from the Top and from lower placements, but they all contributed 4, 2, and 3 new times, respectively.

A nice amount of activity came from the Top 25 too, with 6 people trying to advance into the Top 10/20. Having really quick progress (reminds me of Jay in past weeks), #12 Jak Russo made a big cut of his own, with cutting close to 3 AF with 8 new times and jumped from 15th to 12th, very close to the Top 10 now. Behind him, Canadian Champion #13 Alex Shoal was unfortunate with the heavy activity losing a little over an AF worth of points, but he still made one time, so maybe he will play next week. The Spanish Champion #14 Tony Ruiz had a similiar week to Alex as well, with losing a little more than half an AF but still improved 3 times to set himself up for next week. #18 Salvatore Bellusci made 4 new times but was still set back close to an AF point. Eager to join the Top 20 again, #21 Alvin Le lost some AF like the majority of people but still ended up making 3 new times to be only .5 AF from passing Cole to rejoin the Top 20 group. Finishing this area up, #23 Alexandre Gilet seemed to break the chain by making 3 PRs and lost around .1 AF, he didn't break the chain with that, he broke the chain with actually gaining a spot to #23 from #24 even though he lost AF, if that makes any sense.

Maybe the most active group this week was the Top 50 territory with 10 people active, with some pretty nice jumps involved too. #26 Fabien Jacques lost less than .1 AF this week (might even be 1 or 2 places actually), but he still made 2 new PRs and is roughly .2 AF from passing #25 Daniel Anderson to join the Top 25 group again. Not too far behind Fabien, #29 Oliver Martin made 2 PRs too and lost close to the same amount of ground, but both still have a lot left they can do in coming weeks. A little farther back, both #34 Zane Royal and #35 Liam Ashcroft lost over 1 AF but still made 1 and 2 new times, respectively. Two places back, #37 Thomas van Deerse made 3 new times and kept his place for the most part without much placement lost. Coming up very fast is #38 Matthieu Mayer behind Thomas, who improved 15 times this week good to jump himself 4 placements and almost 6 AF, nice going. Making a mighty leap himself behind Matthieu, #39 Paul-Philipp Baehr made 15 PRs as well, jumping 4 places like Matthieu, and cut over 3 AF, good work to you as well. Several places back, #44 Kyle R, the person whom we don't know his surname, improved 2 times this week to edge a little closer to the Top 40. Behind Kyle, #45 Andrew Tran submitted a majority of hoarded times as well as several new times that pushed him up 60 places, cutting around 72 AF and improving close to 75% of his times sheet, definitely a new force to be reckoned with in coming weeks. Closing out, #47 Zack McNell lose a placement to Andy but still improved 2 times this week.

Man what happened to my Top 100 area this week? Normally this brings the most amount of activity next to "The Field"; only 4 people played this week. Not wasting this opportunity, #62 John Brunn does some very good work this week jumping 4 places with 7 new times and cut a little over 2 AF, coming near the Top 60 now. 6 places back, the persistent tank #68 Marvin Donjes continues very high improvements with PRing almost half his times sheet, jumping 7 places and almost 10 AF. #75 Emmanuel Amador lost 2 places due to activity from John and Marvin most likely but he still improved 2 times to make it a little less. Finishing up, #89 Danny Gallenberger made a dent at the gap from the beginning of the Top 90, making 7 new PRs with a little over 1 AF cut to finish off this area.

To "The Field", this held the last 6 people who played this week. #105 Simon Uldry cut a little over 3 AF himself with 7 new times and edged closer towards the Top 100 this past week. Getting close to Simon this week was both #109 Dave Tandy and #110 Noah Gordon, where Dave made 5 new PRs to stretch a little closer to the Top 100 but Noah wanted in on the action as well so he answered with 4 new PRs, jumping him right behind Dave from #114 with a near 2 AF cut, future rivalry? Into the 200 and beyond, #209 Tony Fan recently changed from Kart to Bike and quickly began piling on PR after PR and managed to cut 18 placements with about 40% of his sheet improved cutting 28 AF, great job. To conclude the news, both #291 Julian Stephens and #292 Andre Riviere were both active with 4 and 13 new times, respectively.


Site Records

A good amount of Site Record activity with 3 new SRs:

Thomas Petraud beat the old GCN Waluigi Stadium crs time of 1'50"470 with a time of: 1'50"446
Hato Mugi beat the old GCN Mario Circuit lap time of 0'28"817 with a time of: 0'28"742
Brett Edwards beat the old DS Peach Gardens lap time of 0'38"573 with a time of: 0'38"558

Keep watching to see new rivalries begin and continue during this quarter...

fields.author: NMeade
fields.title: Status Update
fields.content:
Hello everyone, just wanted to inform you on the current situation with news.

The news after my last one was supposed to be by Zack but he never had the chance to post it (he hasn't been around for more than a week) so he is probably busy/something happened, so I decided to write both his and the one after that for the past week. When I tried to do both, when looking at the stats program, I cannot look at the stats even though I correctly put in what is needed to look at the page (weird but yeah).

That's pretty much the deal now, I've been around to do the news but since I can't look at stats I can't do it for now. I'll have them up when I'm able to look at them again.

fields.author: Webinator
fields.title: Reclaiming the Crown
fields.content:
Welcome back to the newsroom MKW community, its been a while but with random technical difficulties and such the news has been delayed. Im back to inform you on what should have been April 3rd, however its 14 days later. So place your mind back two weeks ago at a time when, well whatever happened in the past two weeks didnt happen, and enjoy this delayed news update. This update covers from March 28 to April 2, 2011.

The New Players
Two new players this week, which is a little better than the usual one.
Munim Peerally shocked the world by actually completing a full timesheet and popping in the AF charts at #249 on his first submission, something that rarely happens. With a decent starting spot, only improvement can come from here.
Riley King submitted the 32 times that I think most players get confused as a full timesheet, which would put him at 244th if the rest were dead last, which hopefully they wont be. A nice starting set which isnt actually a full timeset.

Movement
44 Players were active this week, two of which youve already heard about, and a majority of which youll hear about now. I just dont worry about those non-full timesheeters, since nobody can really see their overall standing anyway.
The Welcome to the AF chart section is blank this week, since no one but Munim completed their timesheet. Everyone in incomplete timesheet land wanted to stay there, but with several very impressive karters only several submissions away from a Top 100 placing, maybe a sudden moment of action will shake up the standings. Both Sebastian Kovats and Sean Owens submitted more times to fill out their timesheet and get closer to the fabled 64 near the top of the list, but neither finished it off. Hopefully next week someone will break the trend.

~~1-10~~
After a four day reign with the crown, Nick Meade succumbed to the pressure of #1 Jorge Hernandez, who returns with a bunch of hoarded times to reclaim some SRs, and more importantly the #1 overall spot. Jorge sent in 8 PRs to cut a full point of AF, propelling him to a .9 AF point lead over Meade. Nick wasnt active this week so that added to the gap, but right below him #3 Shaun Tanney was still playing to close the large gap between #2 and #3. Tanney hit 5 PRs to drop .2 points off his AF, and now has (only?) 3.7 AF to go before he catches Meade for #2 to reclaim his old peak position on the charts. #4 Marc Bas cut exactly the same amount of AF that Tanney did with .2344, submitting 4 PRs of his own. The gap here is still about 1.3 AF points, so Marc will need to work overtime since Tanney is so active. Passing over the retired bubbles, we come to #6 Jay Batten. Active as always, Jay sent in 12 PRs to drop 1.2 AF points, which is ridiculous at this level. Hes now only 5.1 AF away from Bubbles, and I say only because it should take him a few weeks if he keeps up the activity level. #7 Jimmy Benson sent in 1 PR but it wasnt enough to keep him even, and he lost a few tenths. #8 Tyler McNell sent in two PRs and cut one place, or .0156 AF points. #9 Mark Schmidt could make a run for this position if he has a nice week, as he is only .8 AF away. This week however he only sent in one PR and it didnt cut him any AF points. At the bottom of this very active group, newcomer to the Top 10 Jamie Disley stayed quiet, but with the increasing activity below he might want to pick up the controller soon.

~~11-25~~
#11 Jak Russo, who was just entering the charts a month or so ago is now fighting for the Top 10. After this week, he passed Dustin Enders, the King of Hoarding, to lie in wait within .4 points of the Top 10. Jamies comeback has brought him into the fabled group, but if Jak continues at his pace and Jamie stays quiet, the switch will surely happen. A little lower, #14 Tony Ruiz hit 6 PRs to drop half of and AF point, but currently is wandering around in an AF graveyard, so hell have to keep playing to escape. #18 Salvatore Bellusci and #19 Alvin Le were both active as always, hitting 4 and 2 PRs respectively. Alvin however had a massive 1.4 AF cut passing James Richards, and is now .4 AF away from passing Salvatore, who only cut .28 AF this week. #22 Alexandre Gilet passed Mick this week with 6 PRs. His 1.4 AF cut puts him at the gate of a small AF graveyard of about 2 points. Finally, #25 Fabien Jacques, aka MT Flap King, sent in 2 PRs (maybe MT 3lap and flap?) to cut .07AF and hold his ground from the coming attackers.

~~26-50~~
As always, this group didnt have a massive range of activity, but the people that did play had massive improvements. #28 Matthieu Mayer continued his rise to the top of the charts, jumping four places from #32 with a 3.56AF cut. One of the victims was #30 Andrew Tran, who lost a spot but did send in one PR to lessen the damage. #31 Kevin Mason and #33 Liam Ashcroft moved together to finish one place apart. No thats not a typo, Kevins 5 PRs and 2.8 AF cut were enough to tie him exactly with #31 Oliver Martin. Lash had a much better week with 9 PRs and a 3.7AF cut, hes sitting .3 away from the #31 duo. A little lower down, #37 Zane Royal hit 3 PRs but none were of huge significance, as he still lost .2AF. #38 Thomas van Deerse was on the move, with a 2.1 AF cut and 4 PRs he jumped over Joe Sebeny to sit behind Zane in wait. To close out the group, #46 Zack McNell continues his quest to catch his brother with 2 PRs and a one spot gain over Franco Gubser.

~~51-100~~
This group can only be described as few and far between, as almost no one played as usual. It has to be that feeling of only having two numbers in your position that gets you on a lazy streak. #56 John Brunn takes advantage of the laziness, and moves up all the way from #61 with only 5 PRs. Thats efficiency. #59 Tim van Ham makes a similar move, rising from #63 to #59 with only 6 PRs. Take an example from these two, MK community. Once you make it through the golden gates to the Top 100, everything becomes a little easier. #68 Marvin Donjes had a slow week, hitting only 5 PRs. Hes stuck in a huge gap of AF, so hell need to summon his past self to grab one of those 35 PR weeks again. #71 Yann Deptiamade his sophomore week a good one, cutting about 1 point of AF with 3 PRs, and advancing a spot from #72. Much farther down we come to #83 Danny Gallenberger, who Im happy to report has secured himself in the Top 100 for a while. He jumped from #87 with 12 PRs, and with a few more tenths can jump past a couple more karters. #92 Emmanuel Debenest saw the gates nearing his vision and the 101-110 group looking for blood, so he accelerated away from his 96th position to feel a little safer. He had a massive 8 point AF cut with 9 PRs. Finally, #100 Frederick Hutchington has his long journey pay off, as he moves the final four spots to the fabled group, displacing Bernando de Jans (or that guy who made that massive 64/64 hoarding submission and cut 100AF last summer). Hes in a very unsafe position right now, so only time will tell if he can hold his ground.

~~101-Fin ~~
#105 Simon Uldry cuts almost 2 AF and moves up a place, spurred on by 5 PRs. Close behind are #108 Noah Gordon and #109 Dave Tandy, who both are looking at Frederick with fire in their eyes. Noah cut a point of AF with 1 PR, and Dave jumped Michael Schneider with 9 PRs and a 3.5AF cut. Both are so close to that Top 100 goal, but so far away. While youre wrapping your mind around that last sentence, check out #113 Viktor Silvanov, who jumped 6 spots from #119 with 9PRs and a 5.3AF cut. He passed #116 Christian Nemetz, who was once in the Top 100 (how harsh the times have been). Christian played for one PR but it lost him AF due to great activity above. #119 Loris Bagnasco filled Viktors empty void with a move from #127. 16 PRs came along for the ride, and due to their weight 6.1 AF points had to be left for other travellers to pick up. #124 Dexter Howe hit a PR that didnt gain him ground but kept him from losing as much. #141 Tomas Pallaruelo had a similar story, 2 PRs not putting him above even. #202 Tony Fan karted his way to one PR, and #286 Andre Riviere and #288 Julian Stephens both began long climbs to the top near the bottom of the charts to close out the activity for this week.

Site Records
A very nice amount of records this week, several spurred on by Jorges hoarding submission/return. Jorge now has 9 SRs, which propel him past ROM on the leaderboard, and send Meade back to 4 and a tie with Marc for 3rd. Agustin Berrios and Andrew Grieve both drop off the chart this week.
Aziz Abdullah beat the old Moo Moo Meadows crs time of 1'16"189 with a time of: 1'15"996
Jorge Hernandez beat the old Coconut Mall crs time of 1'57"374 with a time of: 1'57"296
Marc Bas beat the old Coconut Mall lap time of 0'37"846 with a time of: 0'37"753
Jorge Hernandez beat the old Daisy Circuit crs time of 1'29"775 with a time of: 1'29"356
Fabien Jacques beat the old Maple Treeway lap time of 0'44"062 with a time of: 0'43"907
Tyler McNell beat the old GBA Bowser's Castle 3 lap time of 0'38"276 with a time of: 0'38"085

Awards
Check my more recent update tomorrow or Wednesday to see a full catchup of all the awards. Now, Ill turn it over to Meade who should submit next weeks news today.

See you in two days!
-Web

fields.author: NMeade
fields.title: Stretching Away
fields.content:
Getting back on track with updates, here is the week of 3 April -> 10 April. Yeah it is a full week because of some difficulty with the stats program for the 9th, so this includes an extra day, making the next news update 1 day shorter. After that it will be the same Sunday to Saturday content in news.

The New Players
Four new people to add to the AF roster this week, welcome to... Jason Collis, Stephen De Winter, Eric Shore, Aziz Abdullah.

Movement

41 people were active in this (7) day news update.

8 of the 10 players of the Top 10 were active this week with some pretty interesting activity, including a new AF player that slotted some people down a spot. Directly at the top, improving times to no avail, reigning champ #1 Jorge Hernandez improved 11 more of his times, and reached new limits by cutting nearly 1 whole AF, which made him the first player since Alvin way long ago to be under the 5 AF mark. With these new times also, he became the first Myth player of MKW, quite the accomplishment. United States Champion #2 Nick Meade couldn't really do much to stop Jorge, only making 2 small PRs and lost some AF. Becoming a serious contender for #2 or even #1, UK Champion #3 Shaun Tanney continues his monstrous activity with 11 new times, cutting almost an AF and settling at mid 9 AF. If he continues weeks progress like this, for sure he could be the Site Champion soon. The French Champion #4 Marc Bas shouldn't be counted out though, he cut close to half an AF with 4 new times and is still making steady progress behind Shaun, showing he is still around and fighting. Behind him, new AF player but long time member of the players' page #5 Aziz Abdullah slotted 5th, finally submitting all his flaps, albeit if a lot of them are 1 shroomers. He made 7 new times this week (generally the flaps) and rests at almost the 20 AF mark. Two places behind him we have #7 Jay Batten who lost some ground from the high activity around this area but still improved 9 of his times to nearly even off what he lost. Even though he was pushed back a spot, #9 Tyler McNell still cut positive AF with 2 new times trying to catch Jimmy for #8. Finishing off comes #10 Jak Russo, who made an impressive 2+ AF cut with only 5 PRs, coming really close to the small gap between him, Tyler, and Jimmy.

Top 25 wasn't really all that active with only 4 people playing. German Champ #11 Mark Schmidt was an unfortunate victim who got slotted back 2 spots and lost some ground but still made a single new time. A few places back, the Spanish Champ #15 Tony Ruiz cut close to half an AF with 3 new PRs. Around maybe 20 places or so separate him from getting to #13, if he makes an extra push, he will most likely get that and more. Both #18 Alvin Le and #19 Salvatore Bellusci made 1 new time as well, but they both lost some ground. Apart from that, this area was quiet.

People began playing again as we hit Top 50 here. 8 people picked up their controllers and tried to move up the charts. Making great progress deeper into the 20s, #28 Thomas van Deerse made 12 new PRs and cut nearly 4 AF and put himself a place better than last week. If he improves by just 1.5 AF or so, he could jump 3-5 spots too, so keep playing! Very close to Thomas, a new comer to the Top 30 is #30 Lucas Acek, who jumped a mighty 7 places from #37 to join the ranks of the Top 30, cutting over 6 AF with 10 new times. #33 Kevin Mason cut close to half an AF with 1 PR to keep some activity alive as well. #35 Liam Ashcroft was an unfortunate victim like some others, improving 1 time but still losing some ground. #44 Kyle R had a similar week as well, doing 1 better with 2 new times but still losing ground and a placement. 4 places back, #48 Zack McNell was like Kyle and Liam, with a new time but still losing ground. We finish with positive numbers though, as #49 John Brunn digs a deeper dent in the Top 50 with nearly a 3 AF cut with 5 new times, and #50 Matthias Sempels joins the ranks of the Top 50 by jumping up a spot with 11 new times and over a 2 AF cut.

The Top 100 was virtually dead this week with only 5 people playing, this could only mean "The Field" had the most people active. Anyways, starting us off, #54 Tim van Ham cut almost 2 AF with 3 new times and only a few AF separate him from the Top 50 now. 11 places back, #65 Marvin Donjes continues consistent progress through the weeks with close to 2 AF cut this week and 6 new times, jumping up 1 placement. Both #72 Stacy Needham and #83 Danny Gallenberger lost around the same ground but still submitted 1 new time to finish off the week. The last player was a new face to the Top 100, completing a goal he set for this year in only the first 4 months of the year. #98 Noah Gordon cut over 8 AF with 14 new times and jumped 9 placements to join the Top 100, congrats Noah.

"The Field" had 9 people playing this week (thought it was more before I counted the actual people who made cuts) but is still the most active group of this week nonetheless. #103 Simon Uldry is very close to the Top 100 now, cutting 2 spots and making 4 new times, just that extra push will propel him there I am sure. #111 Viktor Silivanov cut a nice 3 placements with almost 3 AF cut and 6 new PRs to boot. An interesting situation, #114 Christian Nemetz got a good slice of luck this week with losing AF but still submitted 1 time, but still ended up finishing a spot higher this week. If only it was that higher in the top ranks. Anyway, #119 Jamal Fluellen comes for more this week with almost 2 AF cut with 3 new times, jumping 2 spots. #123 Dexter Howe almost mirrored Jamal, with 2 PRs and the same cuts as he did. Coming back from well over a year of inactivity, we see brother of Shaun #132 Paul Tanney make a nice 2 place advancement with 6 new times and almost 3 AF cut, nice to see you again Paul. #136 Brett Edwards pitched in on activity with 1 new time, but lost a place. Finishing off, both #272 Julian Stephens and #286 Andre Riviere made respectable cuts of 8-14 PRs and nice placement jumps.

Site Records

Not much Site Record activity to note compared to other weeks, only two were broken:

Jorge Hernandez beat the old Daisy Circuit lap time of 0'28"448 with a time of: 0'28"374
Marc Bas beat the old SNES Ghost Valley 2 crs time of 0'53"145 with a time of: 0'52"674

Zack should have "last" weeks news up tomorrow, then I will be back at the end of this week for this weeks news (man that confused me). Sorry for the delays of news, but everything should be all good now. See you around.

fields.author: Webinator
fields.title: Spoiler Alert
fields.content:
Before you start reading this entry, read the two below. That is, if you wanted to see the old news you missed out on. Instead of lumping everything together we decided to split it up into 3 one-week entries, and this one covers April 11th through the 16th. Yeah yeah I know thats only 6 days, but because of server problems Meades was through the 10th since the 9th was corrupted. You probably should have read that before complaining hmm? Just kidding, anyway lets get on to the important stuff.

The New Players
One new player this week.

Bryan Straatman submitted two times. Not really sure what they were and why he decided to start out with so little, but he did. His position is somewhere in the 300s, but that doesnt really matter since the other 62 times will drastically change his standing.

Movement
31 Players were active this week, a lot less than my last update and a little less than Nicks. Im really bored for some reason, so today Im going to switch it up and go from bottom to top. Not really sure if Shadow ever did this in his old updates, but oh well, if he did maybe you guys were just aching to have a second version.

But wait! The Welcome to the AF chart needs to be recognized! Actually, nobody new joined the AF charts this week either from joining straight with 64 times or slowly fighting their way on to the ranks. Now its on to the news.

~~381-101 ~~
Starting at the very bottom, its hard to tell who actually improved by just looking at AF count, since there was a player deletion who had 13 times, causing a bunch of people to gain AF. However, looking at the number of PRs column, it becomes obvious. #271 Julian Stephens was the lowest ranked player to PR this week, sending in two of his improvements to hurdle Moritz with a 2.5 point AF cut. A little further up, we reach recent newcomer #233 Munim Peerally, who was quick to start his upward battle. Munim sent in 6 PRs this week for a 8.1 point AF cut and a 9 place move. If this keeps up, the Top 200 will be within his sights in no time. Next up is #206 Dimitri Coueffe, submitting 11 PRs giving him a 4.7 AF loss. The nice cut was only enough to move him up one spot, however Im sure he can improve in the future. Next we reach #148 Tom Norton, who really shouldnt be ranked this low but is due to not having a full timesheet. Sword submitted 7 PRs, three of which were site records, to cut 2.5 AF points and move up three spots back into the Top 150. Cant wait until we see what Swords true potential is. Just barely above him is secret agent #146 Polar King too important to the mission to disclose his real name. King cut 2 AF points but due to low activity around him stayed exactly in position at #146. #135 1:59.945 aka Brett Edwards sent in one PR which cut him .6 AF compared to his inactive surroundings, however couldnt move up a spot. The entire Tanney household is getting back into the MKW scene, with #122 Paul Tanney submitting 11 PRs to attempt to catch his younger brother. He did vault 10 spots up with an 8.7 AF cut, however the road is long and dangerous to #3. #118 Dexter Howe has fought his way back in to the 110s for which he was known months ago this week. Moving from #122, Dexter Owned 5 PRs and cut 1.98 AF points, not that Much but maybe in future weeks he can improve more. To close out this highly active group, #103 Simon Uldry sent in one PR that made up the difference of his loss this week, keeping exactly the same AF as 7 days ago.

~~100-51~~
Two weeks ago (okay, three days but meh) I mentioned #99 Frederick Hutchington cruising into the top 100 in style from #104. He slowed down a little bit due to celebrating and fell out again. However this week he fought back in, coming from #102 with with a 2 point AF cut and 2 solid PRs. Ahead of him is #98 Noah Gordon, fresh into the two-digit crowd. Cutz only had one PR this time around and didnt cut any more AF, but he held of Frederick so thats a plus for this week. Then follows a huge group of people who are either dead, asleep, or just not karting (Im going to guess its the third one). We have to move all the way up to #65 Marvin Donjes in order to find the next active karter. With 2 PRs this week, Donjes cut about .15AF points or 10 spots in order to slowly move up against the silent crowd. Slightly above is #51 Tim van Ham, within reaching distance of the Top 50. He moved up three spots with three PRs, in total losing 1.2 AF points, and is about 2.2 from catching #50 Matthias Sempels to earn his ticket to move up a class.

~~50-26~~
The activity here was scattered as usual in this group, however several had decent cuts. #49 Zack McNell fought valiantly to keep his spot, but with only one PR fell victim to #48 John Brunn. John hit 4 PRs to cut about 1AF points, and has a very nice set of four players less than 1AF away from him to look at with hunger in his eyes. #39 Zane Royal had a 2 PR effort that earned him .3AF points which is about half of a percent. #35 Liam Ashcroft is another one of those guys that is steadily gaining every week without really being seen, so I will expose him this week. He hit 2 PRs and moved up a spot in order to secure my suspicions. #33 Kevin Mason did the same, 2PRs for a one spot gain. Im keeping watch to see if Kevin and Liam are working together to sabotage other players positions. Finally, #26 Fabien Jacques sent in one improvement, but it wasnt enough to help him lose AF points.

~~25-11~~
Only three karters active here, as everyone else is apparently fine with their current standing. #25 Thomas van Deerse had a 2 PR effort that pushed him up three spots, displacing Fabien and stamping his seal on the Top 25. #20 Salvatore Bellusci sent in one PR to shave off a bit of AF, but not enough to move him around anywhere. Finally, #18 Alvin Le moved up one spot from #19 with 3 PRs, cutting him 1.8AF points. With newcomers popping in here and above, karters who once thought they were in safe positions are now dropping like rocks. (See #15 Alex Shoal, in the Top 10 only months ago, etc.)

~~10-1~~
Four karters were playing in this elite section, as newcomers strove to displace veterans. #9 Jak Russo sent in 5 PRs and cut .76AF, but he was knocked back a spot by a huge spurt of PRs from #8 Jimmy Benson. Jimmy had 9 PRs for 3.76AF, fighting back against both Jak and Jay who have been fighting in place. #7 Jay Batten however, has passed Jimmy by several points and is now marching towards ex-champ #6 David McPartland. This week, he had 9 PRs, for a 1.85 AF cut, and is now within 2 points of passing Bubbles and setting Doom on his radar. To end off the week, #3 Shaun Tanney had three PRs, for a tenth of a point cut, and continues to close the gap between NMeade and his kart.

Site Records
Sword shook up the SR table this week, gaining three. He jumped up to a tie for third place with Marc Bas (5SRs), after Marc grabbed one SR of his own. Both ROM and JG suffered hits to their impressive tallies, and now have only 9 and 7 respectively. Newcomer Jak Russo also took a hit, dropping from 2 to 1 SRs.

Tom Norton beat the old Coconut Mall crs time of 1'57"296 with a time of: 1'57"251
Marc Bas beat the old SNES Ghost Valley 2 crs time of 0'52"674 with a time of: 0'52"518
Tom Norton beat the old GBA Shy Guy Beach crs time of 1'22"167 with a time of: 1'22"074
Tom Norton beat the old GBA Shy Guy Beach lap time of 0'25"274 with a time of: 0'25"247

Awards
1st POQ, 2011 - Shaun Tanney, for his massive comeback and race up the Top 10 ranking.
1st April POW - Shaun Tanney , for 11 PRs while already being ranked third, and almost a full point of AF cut.
2nd April POW - Jimmy Benson, for fighting off some newcomers to the Top 10 while hitting 9 PRs and 4.2 points off his AF.

POM for March will have to be covered in a later update due to the stats already being archived. Expect to see that announcement in two weeks along with the April POM.

See you guys in about a week and a half for my normal schedule again!
-Web

fields.author: Webinator
fields.title: Spring Karting
fields.content:
Sup guys, two important things you need to know. Meade needed me to cover for him this week, and this update is a day longer due to the stats not reporting on Sunday, so it covers April 17th through the 24th. Thats about all you need to know. You can literally turn off your computer now. Unless you want to read the news, which is a little further down. You do? Fine, Ill keep typing then.

The New Players
Two new players this week.

Sebastian Giraud joined with 38 times, all of which were raced on a legitimate Nintendo Wii console, I think. Other than that, I dont know much about them, and hopefully hell finish up the timeset in the coming weeks.

Tonny Su sent in 35 times, and even though thats three less than Sebastian, he still is higher up on the charts. This means those 35 were better; however the other 29 could be absolutely atrocious, and knock him below Sebastian. Only time will tell.

Movement
Not sure if it was the extra day that Im adding into this update, or everyone just had an urge to play kart, but 57 players were active in the 8 days of this update. Due to the vast amount of players, this section will be condensed since the movement will be longer. Its over now.

Welcome to the AF chart goes out to #80 Sebastian Kovats, popping into the top 100 in style and annoying a bunch of players below him. Also #237 Eric Shore joined the AF charts completely, in a position where theres nowhere to go but up. The Top 200 waits for him, and maybe in the coming weeks he can achieve it. #333 Stephen de Winter appears near the bottom of the charts, but that means that he has great potential and the happiness of watching inactive players fall behind him left and right. Lets return to the non-inverted standings and check out this weeks activity.

~~1-10~~
Jorge went back into hiding to hoard some more PRs or just play other games, and his sub 5-AF took about a tenth of a point hit, still far and away from the other competitors. #2 Nick Meade was not despondent in the least, putting in his share of the PRing action. Meade hit two PRs, not saving him from a gain of AF, however he did cut his losses. #3 Shaun Tanney was not slowing down, as usual with 8 PRs. He lost a tenth of AF, and is 1.5 AF away from Marc and gaining on Meade. #4 Marc Bas was also playing, trying to desperately fight back the points he lost, and had a nice first step. 5 PRs amounted to a loss of .6 AF points. #5 Doom stayed quiet, and this allowed for #6 Jay Batten to sneak up on him. Jay made a landmark move this week, passing ex-site champion and longtime holder of the crown David McPartland, with 6 PRs and a 1.12 AF cut. At this rate, he should be passing Aziz for #5 in a few weeks. Just below, #8 Jak Russo returned fire on Jimmy Benson who attempted to defend the 8 spot last week. With 5 PRs and a 1.5 AF cut, Jak not only passed Jimmy but surged out to a 1 AF lead on him. Bubbles is now 3 AF away from Jak, and at his rate the pass isnt far off. #9 Jimmy Benson hit 2 PRs, but they werent significant enough to allow Jimmy to hold with Jak, and he gained .6 AF points. To close out the Top 10, #10 Dustin Enders had his usual hoarding spree, coming back with a massive 30 PRs and reclaiming not only his Top 10 spot but the German crown from Mark Schmidt, who he relegated to the paragraph below. The AF cut was monstrous, 8.62 AF off of his score, however hes still 3 AF away from Jimmy.

~~11-25~~
#11 Mark Schmidt had an impressive effort of 7 PRs this week, but Dustins hoard overshadowed him. He moved past Tyler McNell, however due to Dustins move, kept his position. He still cut 1.7 AF points, and is now another 1.7 AF points away from catching Dustin. This is one of the most intriguing country title battles on the site, and as Mark continuously submits while Dustin sits back and hoards, the outcome each week is unpredictable#12 Tyler McNell, once a top 10 commoner, sent in 3 PRs of minor significance, but they werent enough to stop him from gaining AF on top of the sad fact he got passed by both Mark and Dustin. Jamie Disley was quiet for once, and #14 Tony Ruiz had two PRs as well, but he gained AF and was passed by Dustin. #16 Eric Hacksell had a nice submission of his own, with a three place jump and a 3 point AF cut. 3 + 3 = 6, and thats the PR count for Hacksell this week as he displaced Ex-Top 10er. #17 Ben Hart, who had 2 PRs and an AF cut, but still lost on the position front. #18 Alvin Le would have gained a spot, but due to Eric he stayed put. He still jumped over Artur Bauer, famous for his over 100 point AF cut into the Top 10 a few months ago, but hes been dead ever since. Back to Alvin, 3 PRs kept his AF exactly where it was last week, without one place gained or lost. #20 Cole Gilbert had a nice three spot move with several PRs he probably achieved in the span of 5 minutes combined. He cut 2.9 AF, and never really seems to retire, but never really is active either. #21 Salvatore Bellusci was shuffled out of the Top 20 with Coles move, and he gained AF even with 4 new PRs. Right below, #22 Matthieu Mayer jumped from #27 with a five place move and 19 PRs, and now sits .4 AF away from Salvatore poised to overtake him barring a strong showing next week. The result will be interesting, so stay tuned here. #23 Alexandre Gilet dropped back two spots, but still played even with this misfortune. His 4 PRs almost allowed him to break even on the AF losses, however he can recover in the coming weeks. Finally, #25 Thomas van Deerse continues in this group hovering on the fringe with 3 PRs and a .3 AF cut. Mickael Smolen was notably displaced from the Top 25 this week, adding another karter to the list of drop-outs with all of these rising stars taking their place.

~~26-50~~
Heres where the drop off in activity began, where karting was scattered and those who moved moved well. #30 Kevin Mason had three PRs that moved him up three spots, cutting 1.5 AF in a close pack. The next karter is about 3 AF away, so more work awaits. #34 Liam Ashcroft moved up a spot with 6 PRs and a .6 AF cut, and five players are within the next 3 AF points, so with a good week the places could fly. #37 Oliver Martin gained some AF with only 2 PRs, but did manage to gain about .4 less than his counterparts due to playing. #39 Zane Royal had a solid week of 1 AF point cut and 3 PRs raced, however #40 Daniel Raftery had a massive spree of PRs, not only on RR flap where he took the SR, but on 23 other PRs. He had a 10 point AF cut and jumped three spots to settle right behind Zane. Finally, #48 Zack McNell did one of those weird things on the rankings that should never happen. He submitted three PRs, moved up a spot, but lost AF. Weird as it is, Zack doesnt care since it puts him further and further away from dropping out of the Top 50.

~~51-100~~
Speaking of dropping out of the Top 50, #51 Tim van Ham might cause someone to do that if he keeps his pace. This week he sent in 4 PRs to gain a minor amount of AF, but drew closer to his inactive compatriots. #60 Marvin Donjes had a five place improvement with 13 PRs, also cutting 2.8 AF. Another 5 or so karters are within the next 3 AF points, so another charge from Donjes could be imminent if he keeps up his pace. #68 Yann Deptia had 16 PRs to jump from #73. With a 7.4 AF cut, he had some graveyards to fight over, however hes in the middle of a pack now, so place movement should become much easier. #83 Jon Coppernoll and #84 Danny Gallenberger moved together. Danny hit 3 PRs, cut one point of AF, but dropped a spot on his ranking. Thats because Jon hit 6 PRs, cut 2.8 AF, and passed Ashley OHara. Danny passed Degausser too, however the joining of Sebastian Kovats combined with the pass from Jon has two losses plus one gain to average out to a one spot loss. Near the back, everyone was active. #92 Thibaud Bordeau notched 13 PRs to move up two places with a 5.3 AF cut. #94 Emmanuel Debenest had an inverse effect. 1 PR let him cut a point of AF, but he lost two spots in his ranking overall. #99 Noah Gordon still fighting on the edge of the Top 100 sent in one PR, but the AF cut wasnt enough to stop him from dropping back a place. Finally, #100 Simon Uldry made a push from #103 with a 3 PR week to cut 2.3 AF. The 100-108 places are separated by 3 AF, so out of this group a bunch of people could rise to the occasion, even Frederick Hutchington, displaced again from this group this week.

~~101-381 ~~
Down here, nobody really plays unless they are fighting for the Top 100. Most have already given up hope. #109 Dave Tandy hasnt, as he moved up two spots with a 16 PR week and a 6.4 AF cut. If Dave can move up three more AF hes in the middle of a pack, where moving into the Top 100 will be much easier due to seeing his progress. #111 Martin Prigent had a PR, but gained AF and Sebastian and Dave made him lose two spots in his ranking. #113 Paul Tanney is making a short comeback like his brother, and I assume fighting to rejoin the Top 100. 11 PRs came from the older Tanney, as well as a 7.43 AF cut and a move from #122. Keep up the progress Paul, and show the world that older brothers are on top! (Well there is MKDD, but regardless). #116 Christian Nemetz and #117 Loris Bagnasco both played, both with 3 and 14 PRs respectively. Christian stayed even and dropped two spots, and Loris cut 5.3 AF and moved from #123. Thats the difference. #121 Dexter Howe had a very unfortunate week, with 4 PRs sent in for a .8 AF cut, but a drop all the way from #118 from two passing him and one joining. #136 Brett Edwards and #146 Zack Weber both had one PR and gained AF. Brett dropped one spot and Zack dropped two. However activity here came from #142 Tomas Pallaruelo, with three PRs and a 1.1 AF cut, and #145 Polar King, moving from #146 with a 3.4 AF cut and 6 PRs. #197 Tony Fan had 5 PRs for a 2.4 AF cut, but this is so spread out that he didnt move up or down a single spot. He would have moved up one, however Sebastian spoiled it for him. #222 Sean Wilson is in the early stages where a 45 PR week might not actually be a hoarding spree, and he cut 39.4 AF points to move all the way from #255. Very nice week from him and hopefully more to come. #240 Dave Johnston had 14 PRs for a 9+ AF cut and a movement from #249. Finally, #269 Julian Stephens is still truly fighting from the bottom, waiting for someone to make a movie out of his remarkable story, as this week he hit 5 PRs for a jump from #271 with a 2.5 AF cut.

Site Records
Only one SR changed hands this week, and only two were achieved overall. ROM reclaimed his rPG flap from Brett, continuing the battle between auto and manual on the flap, and inched closer to JG on the quest to recapture his SR title, second with 8 to JGs 9. Brett dropped from three SRs to two, still a very impressive count for such a course-specialist based game. Dan of course continued his kart rampage on RR, improving the flap even further.
Daniel Raftery beat the old Rainbow Road lap time of 0'47"931 with a time of: 0'47"840
Romain Smadja beat the old DS Peach Gardens lap time of 0'38"558 with a time of: 0'38"548

Awards
Only one award this week, a day off from 4th April POW being in there however it will have to wait.

3rd April POW - Jak Russo , for jumping past Jimmy with a 10% AF cut, as well as moving through the Top 10 when the rest of the group made small cuts, if any.

Thanks for tuning in to this news update, a little unexpected and a little late, but hope you enjoyed it nonetheless. See you guys in two weeks!
-Web

fields.author: Webinator
fields.title: I Call TAS.
fields.content:
Web here back for my third update in a row. Since I covered for Nick last week, thats why youve been seeing a lot of Yoshi avatars lately. But hell be back on May 7th for his update while Im having fun at the SATs. (Although I think NMeades doing them too, so nevermind). Anyway, lets get to the action. This update covers April 25th to April 30th, due to the one-day longer update last time.

The New Players
Two new players this week. This seems to be a new common practice, as one just isnt enough.

Will Eudy had 17 times in his first set of submissions, but with the rest to come his final positioning is uncertain.
Jacob Shive submitted 32 times, presumably all the courses, and will most likely stop there (as is with most new joiners). Alternatively, if Jacob reads this then he can get motivated to submit the flaps. Hopefully that happens.

Movement
An average amount of activity this week, as 43 players sent in PRs. As the overall SR time creeps towards sub 69 minutes, hopefully the toppies will keep playing to lower it.

Welcome to the AF chart goes out to nobody, as everyone who joined this week didnt have a full timesheet, and the people that were in the green section of no-return (everyone who doesnt have 64/64), didnt feel like being bold and finishing up. The good news is that two of the top five players in the non-full timesheet zone are getting closer to having full timesheets. Lee Duggan went from 55 to 56 times, and Victor Pavao went from 61 to 63. Lee is ranked 46th if all of the other 8 unsubmitted times were dead last on the chart, so when he submits them a challenger near the top will surely emerge. On to the movement.

~~1-10~~
The top 10 decided to play dead relative to their activity the past few weeks. #3 Shaun Tanney is the constant force that drives the top however, this week with 2 PRs that brought his AF down to a solid 9.5. Hes less than two points away from catching Meade for his old chart peak at #2, maybe with this constant work it can happen. Right behind #4 Marc Bas sent in 2 PRs as well, however ended up gaining almost a tenth of AF, the times not strong enough to keep him even. He fared better than Aziz Abdullah, who elected not to submit. Down to #6 Jay Batten, the constantly submitting karter was quiet this week. He only cut .07AF points with 2 PRs. Regardless, everyone inactive gained about a tenth of AF, and Jay is still only 1.7 AF away from catching Aziz for the Top 5. #8 Jak Russo and #9 Jimmy Benson both played, both hit 2 PRs, and both gained AF. Jak gained about .2 and Jimmy .1, but Jaks lead is almost a point on Jimmy now, so hes still safe with his #8 spot. The good news for both of them is how they are slowly catching up to Bubbles. I also just noticed that everyone active hit 2 PRs this week in the Top 10, maybe thats the secret to advancing this high in the ranks. Hurry everyone, go and PR, but stop after you hit 2!

~~11-25~~
Only five players active here, and it seems that the German battle has been forgotten, at least for one week. #15 Alex Shoal sent in one PR, but still gained AF. At least he proved he has more MKW in him. #16 Cole Gilbert submitted two weeks in a row, which is a little shocking however the results were nice. 9 PRs, a 6.1 AF cut, and a move from #20 to #16. Is Cole making a serious comeback to this game? Will he join the top 10 soon? Stay tuned to find out. #21 Salvatore Bellusci had 6 PRs this week, also grabbing one SR by lowering his own MG 3lap. He did have a second SR on MG flap that he got throughout the week, but it was beaten again leaving him with only one. He did end up gaining AF, and the Top 20 is still 2.15 AF away, however Salvatore can work harder and grab this distinction. #23 Alexandre Gilet had three PRs which cut .3 AF, however hes stuck in an AF graveyard, trying hard to fight his way out. Finally, #25 Thomas van Deerse had 1 PR to show for this week, gaining a little less AF than the rest of his inactive karters and hopefully further securing his Top 25 spot.

~~26-50~~
#30 Kevin Mason continued work on his times, submitting two PRs this week, however still gaining .2 AF. #34 Liam Ashcroft had a similar situation, with 1 PR and a loss of about .3 AF. Continuing this trend, #37 Oliver Martin had 1 PR for a loss of about .3 AF. All of this repetition probably annoyed a few karters, especially #39 Paul-Phillip Baehr, who really hates things that repeat themselves for no apparent reason. Ignoring this probably wrong statement, Paul had 15 PRs that brought him from #43, netting an SR at MG flap. #40 Zane Royal had 2 PRs, which cut .1 AF off of his score, but due to Paul-Phillips great movement, lost a position. #41 Daniel Raftery was too busy playing with a kart on RR to worry about losing positions. Due to this, he dropped one spot from #40 to #41, although did hit 2 PRs, only gaining a little AF. #43 John Brunn lost a ranking position, but had 4 PRs and a .95 AF cut. To close things off, #50 Tim van Ham works his way up through the ranks to finally reach the top 50, from 51st place. He had 3 PRs that cut 1.6 AF together, some great cuts from him at such a high stage.

~~51-100~~
The constantly moving #55 Marvin Donjes moved up five places this week, helped along by 9 PRs. Its been a nice time seeing his rise to the top of the charts week after week from outside the Top 150, and with more weeks like this (2.65AF cut), he has much more to climb. Farther down is the only karter to be Top 100 in all six games, #71 Stacy Needham. Stacy moved up two spots from #73 with 3 PRs and a .9 AF cut. Hes trailed slightly by #75 Nate Paternost, who joined in the upward current of a 4 place jump of his own. 8 PRs and a 5.7AF cut were the catalysts of this reaction. #79 Sebastian Kovats moved from #80 with 8 PRs and a 4.3 AF cut. #82 Danny Gallenberger is far and away from dropping out of the Top 100 now, this week jumping up from #84 with 9 PRs and a 1.9AF surge. Taking the vacancy is #84 Jon Coppernoll. J-Cop didnt really want this vacancy, as its a one place demotion from #83 last week, however he did cut .6250 AF with 2 PRs. The new joiner in the Top 100 this week (as there always seems to be at least one) was #89 Andre Hoelscher. Andre moved from #102 this week with a massive 22 PRs, which provoked a 16.2 AF cut to sit very comfortably in this elite group. #95 Emmanuel Debenest had a .12 AF cut with 1 PR, trying to hold his ground among the forever-entering karters. Simon Uldry dropped out this week.

~~101-End ~~
Well this was a little delayed in its arrival, however these players deserve a mention because of the fact that they played against the odds below the Top 100 and fought their way upwards. Starting things off, #101 Simon Uldry hit one PR. He ended up gaining .26 AF points and dropping out of the Top 100 down a place, but his continued activity is positive news for the future. #112 Paul Tanney has had a surge in the past weeks of returning to several MK games. This week he hit 10 PRs on MKW, and cut 3.4 AF points. He also jumped up a place from #113 over a large AF gap. #121 Dexter Howe was active as always, and had a decent 1 PR effort to cut about as much AF as he lost and finish with a nearly even week. Slightly lower is #140 Tomas Pallaruelo, moving up two spots from last week. His 4 PRs allowed him to cut over 2.5 AF points, meaning those PRs had to be very significant. With work like that the Top 100 isnt that far out of reach. #146 Christian Wild had a 2 PR effort prompting a 1.23 AF cut. He hurdled me, and even with his apparent retirement he should continue progress in the future. #148 Evan Simmons was also active, hitting 16 PRs for a 21 point AF cut.
