He jumped all the way from #164 up to #148, continued weeks like that (if even humanely possible) could result in the Top 10 in a few months. Good luck Evan! Above the Top 200 cusp, #196 Tony Fan, the kart only user moved his way up a place with 1 PR and an AF cut of exactly one place, or .0156. A surprise awaits your resident news update in the 220s. #220 Sean Wilson had a 17 PR week that jumped him up two spots with a 6 point AF cut. #223 Munim Peerally had an 8 PR week that sent him up from #235 jumping up the standings. And #227 Eric Shore had a massive 23 PR week that sent him from #237 up to his current position. Closing out the group is the KartFather himself, #346 Sami Cetin sent in two PRs that had him cutting a tenth of AF and moving up one spot. Finally, a shock at the bottom of the charts. #378 Jeremy Lee realized how truly pathetic it was sitting at dead last at #384 on the charts, and decided to do something about it. He sent in a full timesheet of improvements, 64 PRs in total, cutting 21 AF points and moving above 6 karters. His move leaves Peter Ferguson sitting in the worst position of all on MKWPP.

Site Records
A bunch of SRs happened this week, with three in total switching hands. The resulting activity saw a shakeup in the SR table. Lee Duggan and Daniel Raftery both moved from 2 SRs to 3, and a T-6th on the page. Alex Shoal dropped from 2SRs to 1, and tied for 12th with all the other course specialist guys. Paul-Philipp Baehr made his debut on the table by grabbing a SR, and both Marvin Donjes and Jak Russo lost their only SRs this week and were knocked out of this group.

Salvatore Bellusci beat the old Mushroom Gorge crs time of 0'32"861 with a time of: 0'32"425
Paul-Philipp Baehr beat the old Mushroom Gorge lap time of 0'09"397 with a time of: 0'09"379
Daniel Raftery beat the old Rainbow Road crs time of 2'27"420 with a time of: 2'26"939
Lee Duggan beat the old DS Delfino Square lap time of 0'38"990 with a time of: 0'38"954

Due to the fact that I'm finishing this unfinished update now, the awards that I missed will just be covered then. Thanks for reading! I could say see you in two weeks although I'm typing the new update now, so that would be lying. See you in two weeks!

~Web :cool:

fields.author: NMeade
fields.title: May Fever
fields.content:
Back for another news update, this time the first week of May is the subject at hand. Simply put, the activity from 1 May to 7 May.

The New Players
No new players this week...

Movement

The first week of May doesn't disappoint, with 47 strong and actively karting this week

A little change with this news update you will notice is that this paragraph won't be nearly as long as it generally is. That is because only two people played this week in the Top 10, which is dramatically lower than of recent weeks passed. Still having complete and utter domination, Site Champion #1 Jorge Hernandez didn't cut as much AF as he would have, but still submitted 3 new times to officially make a 3 AF gap from the United States Champ. The only other person who played in this area this week was non other than the guy that never stops PRing, #6 Jay Batten. Jay lost barely a place or two in AF overall but still sent in 3 new times like Jorge to chop the gap to almost 1 AF from Aziz.

Picking up pace, the Top 25 gives us plenty to talk about with 6 players karting here. Up first, making the first positive AF cut of the update, former German Champion #11 Mark Schmidt cut almost half an AF with 4 new times to send in. This creates a slim gap of only .5 AF between him and Dustin for both the German Champion status and the Top 10 slot. This battle has been pretty interesting the first half of the year thus far, and it doesn't seem like either one of them are done yet, that's for sure. Spanish Champion #14 Tony Ruiz is still inching up little by little each time with 3 more PRs this week to become very close to taking over Jamie for the #13 spot. Apparently at a standstill in his furious progress, #16 Cole Gilbert only submitted one new PR this week (I am pretty sure it was not a new World Record this time) and is almost 1 AF away from taking back (?) the Canadian Champion status. #19 Artur Bauer makes the same move, with one new time as well, but actually jumps from 20th to 19th to be "in" the section of the Top 20, so to say. Behind him comes the new Netherlands Champ #21 Alvin van Asselt. I am pretty sure this isn't a come back, as practically all of these times (16 of them) were made randomly over the course of around a year or so. Either way, they cut him over 8 AF and pushed him back from 28th to 21st. Last comes #25 Thomas van Deerse who lost his title to Alvin but made 3 new times to keep himself set at the 25th spot.

Positive activity still shows from the Top 25, as the Top 50 did two better this week with 8 people active. Starting us off, #27 Mickael Smolen shows some activity again, even if it was with only 1 PR. Sadly he fell back a place because of other improvements but he still has a lot left to cut if he put more time in. Chopping away at a once pretty large gap, #30 Kevin Mason cut well over 1 AF this week with 5 new times. To move up 3 spots he only has to cut that same amount again, so keep pushing Kevin. #34 Liam Ashcroft stayed in the same place like Kevin did, with 2 new times. Only a 2 AF gap or so separates him from practically the Top 30, so a good group of new times could make it possible. Like Alvin, #38 Brendan Payne most likely isn't making a come back, it was just one time that was updated of his from months and months ago (probably TF). #40 Zane Royal had the same this week with one new time to contribute, and rests right at the 40th spot at the moment. A few places back, #43 John Brunn still makes consistent progress, with cutting more AF with 3 new times this week. It only seems like a month ago that he was back near 100th place and now he is here already, nice progress John. Near 50th, #48 Zack McNell was pushed back with negative AF like a lot of others in this update but still submitted one new time to set himself up for next week. Finishing this area out, #50 Matthieu Sempels jumps one place to finish 50th this week with 7 new times and almost 2 AF cut.

Approaching Top 100, 7 people played here, so pretty much the average number has been ~7 for most sections so far, a pretty nice number. Both #55 Marvin Donjes and #56 Tim Shelbourne made one new time this week. Both are only a few AF from joining the Top 50 as well. Several places back, #73 Simone Bertini makes a good move this week with over 2 AF cut with 6 new times and jumped an overall placement to boot. Behind him, #74 Lewis Benny, long time retired player, sent in one new time (albeit it was probably one of the mass times that were updated). Either way, even with the time, he lost a placement to Simone. #77 Sebastian Kovats cut almost half an AF this week with only one new time, which jumped him a place too. A few spots behind him, #82 Danny Gallenberger makes a good effort at chopping the fairly large gap between him and the pack of the beginning of the Top 80 with 3 new times that cut almost 1 AF. The last person to report about here is #100 Noah Gordon, who cut exactly half an AF with only 1 PR, how about that.

I am guessing 7 is the lucky number as it is the number of people who played in "The Field" as well. Nearly tasting the Top 100, #103 Pierre Doffine cut over 3 AF with only 2 PRs which cut him 5 overall placements, quite the radical cut there. If only it was that simple in the higher ranks. Continuing positive cuts, #111 Viktor Silivanov 1 ups 2 people this week with 8 new PRs to rest at 111th, cutting almost 4 AF, well done. A little farther back, #134 Dylan Scullini cut one overall place with 3 new times to 134th. 5 places back we arrive to #139 Polar King, who made an impressive 12 PRs this week to cut 6 placements, and almost 13 AF. #141 Tomas Pallaruelo got pushed back in negative AF but still made one new PR this week to take some of it away. #163 Aubrey Clissold was another person who had only 1 time updated since it was a relatively old one. Lastly, honorable mention goes to #263 Julian Stephens for cutting 6 places, 7 AF and making 11 new times.

Site Records

A nice amount with 6 of our Site Records chopped down farther.

Bapt Johnson beat the old Moo Moo Meadows lap time of 0'23"958 with a time of: 0'23"934
Andrew Grieve beat the old Toad's Factory crs time of 1'51"122 with a time of: 1'51"070
Andrew Grieve beat the old Coconut Mall crs time of 1'57"251 with a time of: 1'56"895
Clement Blizzard beat the old DS Yoshi Falls crs time of 0'59"308 with a time of: 0'59"207
Andrew Grieve beat the old GBA Bowser's Castle 3 crs time of 1'59"038 with a time of: 1'58"856
Romain Smadja beat the old DS Peach Gardens lap time of 0'38"548 with a time of: 0'38"544

And that's all I have to say about that. To close out this update, I'd like to bid you a goodbye. This is my last news update as I am resigning from writing the news. It was fun the half a year I did it, but now I am passing the baton on to someone else who will take my place alongside Zack for the news. That person should be decided on and announced most likely this week. For all who have read and/or enjoyed my news updates, I thank you, and best of luck with future karting.

fields.author: Webinator
fields.title: Flying Solo
fields.content:
While I'm typing up this news update, take some time to look down two updates and admire the 101-End section of my last written update. There was a huge amount of activity I missed, including people moving in the 200's, and a change in the dead last position on the chart of MKWPP.

First of all, I'd like to take a moment to thank Nick Meade for the help he gave me with news updates for these past months. As you all probably know, last summer when I first became a news updater the news was occasional at best, and his joining on the news team got me rededicated to the news and helped get it out every week. Now that he's retired, we are in the process of deciding on the next news updater. If you want to help out, shoot Nick or me a PM on the forums and we'll put you in consideration. Next week the new updater will probably make their debut, and if not they'll join two weeks from now since we have to get them settled. Enough rant, let's get on to the karting.

This fine May week of MKW brought few karters to the controller, as many were probably enjoying the warm weather for the first time in a while. However those dedicated players that did play had a great surprise as they made nice cuts with little opposition. Let's get on to the news and find out the facts.

The New Players
The norm in the new players column this week, even with the decreased activity. Two players joined us, and both with full timesheets. No I'm not lying.

The first player is #141 Cyril Fulag, who sent in all 64 times for a very solid intro ranking on the site. With such a high joining position, more is expected to come in the near future.
#327 Jordan Haack showed great courage by sending in his first set of times. Many karters send in PRs one by one until they improve, and wait to join the full AF charts until they are guaranteed a good position. Knowing he had nowhere to go but up, Jordan sent them all in. I commend you Jordan, all new karters should take example from you.

Movement
Only 27 karters were active this week, a great surprise as activity had been constant for a while. However lulls in the action happen every once and a while and in a few weeks we could be back to full strength.

Welcome to the AF chart goes out to nobody, unless you want to count Cyril and Jordan. Then again, karters should just take their example and join from the start, and this section can be gotten rid of and I have less to type. I'll just keep it here for motivation when those few decide to make the leap into the full AF charts.

~~1-10~~
Up in the realm of the untouchable, the Top 10 was very inactive this week, realizing they had a nice cushion behind them. Everyone took a week off that is, except for #10 Mark Schmidt. Once again renewing the rivalry for the German MKWPP crown, Mark hit 3 PRs and cut .6406 AF points, enough to jump Dustin (bumping Enders down to #11) and give him a .35 AF lead on the German Site Title. This battle has been interesting every week, and Dustins next hoard should switch up the standings once more.

~~11-25~~
Slightly more activity here, but proportionately, pretty much the same as only 3 players were active here. #19 Alvin Le had a 1 PR effort for the week, and gained virtually no AF. This helped him distance from Artur Bauer and slowly move towards #18 Ben Hart. #22 Matthieu Mayer is truly becoming an elite player. This week he had 7 PRs, vaulting him up one spot and cutting .6 AF points. If he keeps up this progress he can become the next Jay Batten (who I just realized was silent this week for the first time in a while). Finally #25 Thomas van Deerse held on to his #25 spot with 1 PR. It didnt give him a cut in AF for the week, however he gained less than others. Hopefully activity can return here next week as well.

~~26-50~~
This was one of the more active groups, with a whole 6 players playing, but again thats about the same as last group since both the players active and total players in the group are doubled. #33 Liam Ashcroft kept on karting as hes known to do, setting 3 PRs for a 1.01 AF cut and a one place jump. A little below him is a group of three all committed to karting. #40 Zane Royal, #41 Daniel Raftery and #42 John Brunn all played this week. Zane had 2 PRs that helped him not to lose as much ground, and he didnt gain or lose any spots. The PRs potentially saved him from a drop, as Daniel cut .29 AF points and now sits only .2 behind Zane with his 1 PR. John was the one who made the move. He jumped up one spot to latch on to the train, hitting 5 PRs for a 1.96 AF cut. John passed KC master Joe Sebeny in the process. Closing out the group was the duo of #47 Zack McNell and #48 Matthias Sempels. Zack had 3 PRs that sent him up one spot from #48 with a .56 AF cut. Matthias filled the vacancy, moving from #50 with 3 PRs of his own and a .92 AF cut.

~~51-100~~
Sadly, most of the activity in this group is near the top, which means that in a few weeks, this group could be even less active if those karters keep up their upward movement. Starting at the top position in the group, #51 Tim van Hamhad two PRs that helped him to move slightly towards Franco Gubser. Right below is #52 Marvin Donjes. Before people questioned his skill and claimed he was just good at specific courses, however now that hes nearing the Top 50 its hard to argue that his skill has grown exponentially. This week brought 10 PRs, a 3.5 AF cut, and a jump from last weeks 55th position. Right below him is #55 Yann Deptia, a recent joiner to the charts. Moving all the way from #68 last week, Yann had 21 PRs and a huge 10.1 AF cut. Heres where the drop off happens, and where there are a bunch of inactive players. Down to #76 Sebastian Kovats is where everything picks up again. Sebastian had 3 PRs this week, that brought him up one spot with a .65 AF cut. Slightly lower, #82 Danny Gallenberger found no need to stop playing, and sent in his one PR for the week. He stayed about even on the AF front, which is better than the karters surrounding him. That closes out this group, which is never especially active, however this week was at a new low point. It seems the few that are active make their way out of this group in a month or so and then I have to wait for the next mover to make it out of the Top 100. This is the group of people dropping out of the Top 100.

~~101-381 ~~
This week, the 100+ group will not be forgotten! The same faces were pretty much active as last week. #102 Frederick Hutchington was the highest active that had a three digit place position, trying to move back into the Top 100. His 1 PR didnt bring that much ground, although he did gain about .2 less than the people around him AF wise. #114 Jamal Fluellen was very impressive. He moved up a whole 9 places, with an 11 PR week, which cut him off 6.5 AF points. Hes known to hoard, so hopefully his next set of times moves him closer to the Top 100. #117 Christian Nemetz was also playing, sending in 2 PRs but still dropping one place from Jamals huge move. Showing a testament to the massive amount of movement in MKW, Christian has been fairly active recently, however a couple months ago he was in the Top 100. #122 Dexter Howe had a single PR that didnt stop him from dropping a place on the rankings. Next active player was #147 Christian Wild. He cut a tenth of AF with 1 PR, however Cyril joining above made him lose a place in the rankings. Much farther down, below the active 220s group that was silent this week is one of the great stories of MKW. #376 Jeremy Lee was in the dead last position two weeks ago on the MKWPP, a place he had held for two years. Last week he shocked everyone by handing the reigns to Peter Ferguson and moving up 6 spots. This week he continued his movement, with a full 7 AF points cut off. He moved up 2 positions, and had 4 PRs. With continued activity, he could reach the Top 350 soon. The hardest part about the bottom is that the players are few and far between, large AF gaps separate them. Good luck to Jeremy on his upward battle!

Site Records
Nothing in the SR column this week. Judging by the forum posts I've seen, our mysterious new news updater next week will have some news to cover in this section, however that's it for me this week.

For the awards section, check back this evening when I get home for school. I finished up the movement though, and that's really what you care about. Thanks for reading, and see you in maybe two weeks!

~Web

fields.author: Webinator
fields.title: New Faces
fields.content:
Hey everyone, Web here, I'll be getting around to posting the news tonight. Just wanted to pass on some news to you guys. The new updater for the site has been chosen by me and Nick, and will make their debut on the news this Sunday, May 29th for the 22-28th Update.

My update covers the 15th to the 21st, and I'll put it up tonight. Just figure you'd want that news.

Also, on another note, we're over 50% on the domination page, I think that's the first time I've seen that number. Keep it up and maybe with recruiting we can get 100% by 2020!

The New Players
No new players this week. Not really sure why, but I guess we had a nice streak for a while. Hopefully next week will start back up the trend.

Movement
As with last week's 29 players, this week only brought 27 to the site. Everyone must miss Nick.

Our Welcome to the AF chart goes out to behind #166 Tonny Su, who joined about a month ago on the April 30th update. This update he sneaks in at a decent starting position before the month of June strikes. Other than that, no one else joined the AF charts, but I'm happy with just one joining. With Tonny's entry, 387 players now sit on the charts, nearing the big 400 mark. Let's get on to the real movement.

~~1-10~~
As with last week, the Top 10 wasn't active at all, even less active than last time. The The top 10 decided to play dead relative to their activity the past few weeks. #6 Jay Batten was the only active karter, trying to fight his way into the Top 5 spots on the charts. With 4 solid PRs, Jay cut .7188 AF points and ascended further away from ex-champ Bubbles and closer to Aziz Abdullah. If Doom doesn't return to activity soon another "Jay Batten week" should cause his downfall. Only .4 AF separates Jay from his Top 5 goal. You'll have to see what happens later today.

~~11-25~~
In this group, as with last week, only three players played. The difference was that only one of them was active last week. That shows a glimmer of hope, as different players are playing albeit sparingly. Starting things off, #16 Cole Gilbert came back from the dead to grab a SR (that's all he ever does), however not cutting much AF since he was already close to the top on the chart there. He's stuck in the middle of a group now, so he'll have to make a small effort to try and pass Alex Shoal, although I'm not really sure he's interested in moving up. Regardless, most of us know he could if he wanted to. Next up is #22 Matthieu Mayer, submitting 3 times this week. They overcame the general AF gain to cut Matthieu .29 AF, and send him a little closer to #21 Alvin van Asselt. #25 Thomas van Deerse closes out this group again, still at that bubble position at #25. His 2 PRs cut .09 AF, but more importantly stationed him very close to #24 Alexandre Gilet (only about .2 away). With another week or two, Thomas could be off of the dreaded bubble position in this group.

~~26-50~~
With a small (or big) delay on this news update for whatever reason, let's get back to the news in late May.... :P. This was a very active section as usual, with the bulk of karters playing here. Starting things off, #30 Kevin Mason sent in one PR, however it didn't have much of an impact on his AF score as he gained about the same rate as the players around him. Even so, continued activity is better than nothing! Moving to the first player with an AF cut here we reach #38 Zane Royal, who hit 4 PRs for a sweet .85 AF cut. This normally wouldn't mean much, however the great amount of activity here leaves groups clustered, and Zane ended up passing two players from #40 due to his activity and their lack thereof. #41 John Brunn is a member of the new breed of karters originating in the past year or so that has been making huge strides on the page. He's up another place from last week, 7 PRs bringing in a 3.2 AF cut. John has finally overcome a massive 6 AF graveyard, which is huge for such a high spot on the page. He's now locked on to a nice train that doesn't have AF gaps of more than 1 up until the Top 15, so one of the final major pushes has just been made. #42 Daniel Raftery suffered because of this, even with his one PR that brought on a tenth AF cut, he got jumped by John. Dan is on the verge of breaking this graveyard too, so both can follow each other higher on the charts. Notable place jumpers this week include #45 Franco Gubser, moving from the bubble spot at #50 up a nice 5. His week included 6 PRs and a 2.53 AF cut. This great week overshadows #46 Zack McNell's. Zack had 5 PRs and a 1.1 AF cut, including passing Kyle R and Mike Smith (*cough* inviso *cough*) to move up two spots, but Franco pushed him back one for a net gain of one place. Closing out the Top 50 is a new entry, the player that never seems to stop PRing, ever since he joined in the low 100s. #48 Marvin Donjes ascends from #52 with 13 PRs and a 3.09 AF cut. He never seems to stop getting new times, however this active group combined with its fair share of AF graveyards may prove difficult.

~~51-100~~
Following the most active group is ironically usually the least active group here. They didn't fail to disappoint, as out of 50 possible karters that could have grabbed at least one PR, only four decided to. It's no wonder why people like Donjes and Brunn ascended through this group so quickly, as no one else is around to bring you down. In fact, this group is the treadmill group, as several karters just fly through here as the rest slowly drift down. The most recent graduate was Marvin Donjes, and now that he's out of the picture someone has to take his place. Will it be #53 Yann Deptia? Already a few spots from leaving, Yann only joined a few months ago. This week he shot up two places with 6 PRs and a 1.7 AF cut. Two more weeks like that and he'll be gone, leaving even less activity in this group. Traveling down past a pile of dusty controllers we reach #71 Sebastian Kovats, potential successor #2 to the 51-100 destroyer crown. He moved from #75 to #71 this week, which is promising. He also cut 3.32 AF. Keep up that progress and you'll be out of the group in no time! Two players in the 80s close out this group. #82 Danny Gallenberger is far and away from the 100 zone, and had 1 PR this week that cut just enough AF to take him a little below the baseline for the week, .0625. Finally, #86 Thibaud Bordeau jumped from #93 (yay inactivity!), aided by 12 PRs and a 3.75 cut.

~~101-387 ~~
In the constant quest to get two digits after your ranking on the MKWPP, we reach the band of a couple hundred hopefuls fighting for that goal. Just barely missing out on that classification this week was #101 Frederick Hutchington. With 3 PRs, he jumped up from #102 with a solid .42 AF cut, however standing between him and the Top 100 distinction is a 2.9 AF wall. The climb is worth it (or so I've heard), and Frederick has breathed the fresh air of the Top 100 before, so getting back is even a better feeling. Good luck! #111 Viktor Silivanov had a 5 PR week, that brough a 2.28 AF cut but nothing place wise. #114 Loris Bagnasco fared better here, jumping from #118 with 14 PRs and a 5.43 AF cut. Both could post serious threats for joining the Top 100, because once you're in, you're pretty much in as long as you keep playing. Further down is a trio of karters, #138 Sam Smith, #140 Cyril Fulag, and #142 Tomas Pallaruelo. Sam had 3 PRs for a .4375 AF cut, and no place change. Cyril had 5 PRs for a 1.41 AF cut, and a one place jump. Finally Tomas brought one PR, but gained AF, albeit slightly less than his inactive competitors. Passing Tonny Su's entry at #166, and falling much farther down, we find #218 Eric Shore, with 23 PRs and a 13.1 AF cut. Very nice activity showing great potential there, jumping 9 spots in the rankings. #222 Michael Timpe had an interesting week. He had 4 PRs and a 3.071 AF cut, which was enough to jump two players. However with Eric Shore's jump bumping him back down one and Tonny's joining doing the same, he's back in 222nd again. At least it's a cool numbered position. Closing out the news are #262 Julien Stephens and #286 Andre Riviere. Julien had 4 PRs, a 1.92 AF cut, and a 2 place jump, while Andre had 8 PRs, a 5.48 AF cut, and a 3 place jump. Decent progress from these lower-ranked karters with more ground ahead.

Site Records
Minimal SR activity this week, however better than last week's invisible SRs. Cole took Delfino 3lap away from Sword, shifting the charts a little bit. Sword drops to T-5 with 3 SRs, and Cole jumps to T-9 with 2. On a separate note, I just noticed that we're nearing the sub 69 minute mark for 3lap and flap combined SRs. Down to 69:05.803 from .913 last week, hopefully in the next few months with some SR activity this goal can become a reality.

Cole Gilbert beat the old DS Delfino Square crs time of 2'05"413 with a time of: 2'05"303

That's the news for this week. As for awards, check out the really long titled news update near the top of the page for information on them getting caught up. Thanks for reading!

~Web

fields.author: NStride
fields.title: In Karting Memory
fields.content:
Hello karters, this is NStride: NMeade's successor for news writing. I look forward to this opportunity to bring you all the latest happenings in the kart community, and hopefully I will be able to avoid typos and solid yellow font over half the news from the get-go! :)

This news update covers all of the PRing action from May 22nd to May 28th. So, let's check out all the movement and new players!

The New Players
Three new players joined us this week, although none of them with full time sheets. Hopefully they'll get around to submitting their remaining PRs soon though.

Please welcome:
Ruvies Elie, who joins us with 32 PRs sent.
Kyle Fraser, who joins with 34 submitted PRs.
Violet Breeze, who joins us with 63 PRs and a strong chance to join the AF in the top 100.

Movement
A few more karters were active this week than last, with a total of 32 players submitting records.

Our "Welcome to the AF chart" goes to #254 Bryan Straatman, who, rumor has it, is really good at finding strats. It must run in his family. Hopefully we'll see some more action from him in the coming weeks and a push into the Top 250.

In other news, new name Violet Breeze wins our "Almost-Welcome to the AF chart" award.

~1-10~
Once again, not very much action in the top 10 this week. So, that means #6 Jay Batten gets this entire portion of the news update to himself. He sent in 3 PRs this week with a .1 AF cut, whereas inactive Aziz lost .17 AF this week. Jay is now less than .2 AF points from the elite Top 5.

~11-20~
In this portion, once again one will see just about nothing but zombies. Only one player was actively sending in PRs. The rest were dead, but not really because they are still there. Anyway... that active player is #12 Tyler McNell. McNell only sent in 2 PRs this week, but made over half an AF cut. He has almost covered the AF graveyard between 13th and 11th, and if he keeps this up we may see him in the Top 10.

~21-50~
Welcome to the active zone! This portion of the AF ladder for many was like the security lines at the airport. A lot of jostling and forward progress, but seemingly getting nowhere.

This may have felt the case largely due to #32 Daniel Raftery. This guy apparently took the platinum access or something and skipped 10 players with 10 PRs and a 5.8 AF cut! Will the others be able to catch up to this kind of progress?

#33 Liam Ashcroft might be able to chase Daniel down. He sent in 4 PRs this week, passing inactive Lucas Acek. Also a possible contender for the Top 30 is #35 Paul-Philipp Baehr who sent in 9 PRs this week with a 3.5 AF cut. It was enough to pass 5 players, losing a spot though to Daniel.

#37 Andrew Tran also sent in a PR this week and made a 0.5 AF cut. Despite this, he still loses a place, but not a place on the news update!

#40 Zane Royal sent in a PR as well with an AF cut, but remarkably lost two places! I suppose that's one small step for Zane, one giant leap for Baehr and Raftery.

Not much further down we have #44 Alberto Fiorese. His action was impressive this week with 13 PRs sent and a 3.4 AF cut. He's got a massive AF graveyard to battle though if he wants to enter the Top 40. Will he be able to do it?

Depends, as the competition is fierce behind him with #46 Marvin Donjes, who sent in 10 PRs and made a 1.4 AF cut.

Last to mention in the Top 50 is its new active entrant, #49 Tim van Ham, who made a nice cut this week and is also pressuring active #48 Zack McNell. Congratulations Tim and good luck to you for the future!

~51-100~
In here, the action is a bit quieter and spaced out. Kind of reminds me of walking to the security line; nobody really jostling, many people off to the side drinking their Starbucks, although one will still definitely see a person in a rush, weaving in and out of the commuters in front of him.

#53 Yann Deptia is the closest of these individuals to the security checkpoint. He didn't pass anybody, but his 3 PRs are enough to bring him within 4 AF of the Top 50.

Similarly, #71 Sebastian Kovats turned in quite a few PRs and made a nice cut.

#82 Danny Gallenberger also sent in a PR that passed about 30 players on the course or lap, but he still lost over .5 AF.

~101-Satellite Parking Zone 2 section Z~
Again, a few active players were in this bracket, all of them leisurely taking their time driving up to the airport terminal.

#109 Viktor Silivanov, #113 Loris Bagnasco, and #138 Cyril Fulag all made nice AF cuts and passed a couple players. (Although for Viktor it seems his rDH time is a bit off, so we'll see how things look after that smoke clears.)

Way farther down (much farther than Daily Parking) we find #210 Eric Shore who was active this week, passing a decent amount of players (9). #220 Sean Wilson also finds a parking spot a bit farther back. Lastly, in the satellite parking you will find #335 Stephen De Winter, who is the only active player outside the Top 300 this week.

Site Records
Three new site records this week, all of them fast-laps. I almost said four here by the way, but a 17 second fast lap on DS Desert Hills doesn't seem possible. I'm sure our time updating crew will have this fixed shortly though. :cool:

Yann Deptia beat the old Moo Moo Meadows lap time of 0'23"934 with a time of: 0'23"924
Paul-Philipp Baehr beat the old Wario's Gold Mine lap time of 0'09"393 with a time of: 0'09"386
Paul-Philipp Baehr beat the old GCN DK Mountain lap time of 0'40"450 with a time of: 0'39"902

Well, that covers it all looks like. Well done on the active karting guys and keep up the good work! Until my next update, peace.

~NStride

fields.author: NStride
fields.title: Where are the non-TAS charts?
fields.content:
Hi fellow karters, NStride (obviously) here again. :)

Looks like we have a relatively quiet week to cover today, so anybody who made an AF cut, a movement in the Top 30, or 3 PRs or more will get a mention. (Hey, gotta inspire people to play in anyway I can, right?)

Some quick stats and info before we get started with the movement. This week, which covers May 29th to June 4th, had...
24 active players
0 New Players
1 New Site Record

New Players
As said rather statistically above, I sadly report that no new players joined us this week. Rather odd, considering for some it's the start of summer vacation. Maybe we'll see some new faces next week.

~Movement~
24 Players were active this week, and many players lost some significant AF. Where could all that AF have gone? Let's find out...

~1-10~
One player was active in the Top 10 this week, and he happens to also be #1 Jorge Hernandez. He turned in two PRs this week, including the new Site Record, and cut nearly a tenth an AF point. With the second ranked player retired from AF play, and third place Shaun nearly double the AF of Jorge, could we be looking at a very long-standing champion?

~11-20~
Shockingly, not a single new PR can be found in this entire field of players this week. Will one of these players step up their game and take advantage of the inactivity?

~21-50
Five players were active in this wave, the foremost of which being #21 Matthieu Mayer. Matthieu made superb progress this week, turning in 4 PRs which resulted in a 1.5 AF cut. He is just 1.5 more AF away from the inactive Top 20, so hopefully we'll continue to see him climb the ranks!
Not far behind, we see #24 Thomas van Deerse. He too is close to the Top 20 and could very well be a powerful contender. He turned in 3 PRs this week and made a 0.9 AF cut. Keep it up!
Another skip away is #31 Liam Ashcroft. "LAsh" made a decent 3 PRs this week, enough for a 0.8 AF cut and two places gained.
#39 Oliver Martin's activity, even though it was "just" 1 PR, was enough to hold off active Zane Royal. A little bit farther, and he will hit a tight pack of inactive players, so with these two both active, well, expect some action!
Furthest down in this range of players is #47 Matthias Sempels. He played the game impressively this week, submitting 10 PRs. It was enough for a 2.8 AF cut and a move well into the Top 50! It takes a lot of work nowadays to break this barrier, so congrats to him.

~51-100~
Despite this gap of players in the news update, only two players picked up their controllers and successfully PRed here.
So, props to #69 Sebastian Kovats and #82 Danny Gallenberger for their progress and AF cuts this week. Danny's was rather small, but he is nonetheless making forward progress. Sebastian's wasn't exactly minor though; he submitted 6 PRs and made a 3.3 AF cut, taking him under the 100 AF point line. Congrats to him, and maybe he will soon pass that rotting news updater in 66th. ;)

101-T-Man
Activity! In fact, if my blearing eyes for want of sleep do not mistake me, there are 13 players showing up with PRs in this AF range this week!
We start with what appears to be a very close miss to the Top 100 by #101 Dave Tandy. He landed 10 PRs this week and just about kicks Noah Gordon out of the Top. Should be interesting, especially with our "Welcome to the AF Chart" recipient this week: #104 Violet Breeze. She is only 1 or 2 AF away from this significant Top as well.
Also of note this week is #111 Viktor Silivanov. He will face the only consequence of accidentally submitting one time wrong, or having the updaters mess up, and that is having the news writer have no clue as to how much AF he would have actually cut this week. Keep it up Viktor, and I will (or Web will) be sure to get your proper stats next time!
#132 Cyril Fulag continues to make progress this week with a 4.5 AF cut and 6 players passed. Not bad, not bad at all.
#139 Sam Smith made a little progress this week with a 1.7 AF cut, although it doesn't seem he has passed any players this time. He might need to step up his game a bit, because #146 Christian Wild lifted his fingers off the other MKs and played for maybe 10 minutes this week. Oh, what's that? Oh yeah. He PRed 6 times and made a 4.7 AF cut. C'mon Chris, so close to #1 on the combined (overall) rankings now!
Not too far away is our runner-up for the "Welcome to the AF Chart" award, #151 Victor Pavao, who joins us with 5 PRs sent this week. Not a bad start at all Victor, keep up the good work. :)
Two more people of "major" note this week. They are #168 Tonny Su and #202 Robin Cheah. Tonny made a nice 1 AF cut this week, and Robin is about to break into the Top 200 it seems with a massive 19 AF cut. Make sure to seal that break shut with duct tape once you're done Robin.

Honorable mentions this week go to #40 Zane Royal, #197 Tony Fan, #212 Eric Shore, #219 Sean Wilson, and #222 Michael Timpe.

~Site Records~
One new Site Record was submitted this week. Congratulations to:

Jorge Hernandez who beat the old SNES Ghost Valley 2 crs time of 0'52"518 with a time of: 0'52"415

Well done karting this week, MKWii community. Keeping track and reporting it all has been a blast, and hopefully my news updates have not put you to sleep. Now... has anyone seen those non-TAS charts? :hehe:

~NStride

fields.author: Webinator
fields.title: Summertime Karting
fields.content:
Hey everybody, summer has finally dawned on the karting world. This means everybody in school has a lot more time to PR and enjoy the outside world instead of being crammed inside a non-air conditioned schoolroom. The activity was about average today, but the great surprise was in the new members joining the site. Enough with the spoilers, let's get to it!

This update covers from June 5th to June 11th, 2011.

The New Players
Five new players this week! Shock was wondering where all the players were, but everyone joined a week later than he was expecting. Only thing is, how many joined the main AF charts....
Zachary Tyler sent in all course times before realizing the flaps can only be accessed on the endscreen. Good luck hunting for the rest of them, it's always nice to have another Zack on the AF charts.
Christopher Ramirez had the same 32 times, but was higher on the charts. While Zachary was about 391st with his set, Christopher turned in at around 187th, which is great for only half a timesheet.
Andrew Ahearn saw Jeremy Lee leaving the dead last spot about a month ago, and realized somebody had to fill it eventually. With his initial timeset of all 64 times, Andrew secures the second to last spot ahead of Peter Ferguson. As we all know, anyone can improve from here. Just use Jeremy as your inspiration story Andrew, and you'll be in the Top 300 in no time!
Kevin Reinisch was kind of boring this week, since he joined with 32 times, but was behind Christopher and ahead of Zachary at ~225. Not much else to say about him, so hurry up and finish the timesheet so I can track your movement!
Zach Walker was the second Zachary to join this week, but decided he had to one-up his predecessor. Zach submitted 35 times, either the flaps he's most proud of or the three he could get after noticing that you can't see them anywhere else but the endscreen. Either way, the 35 seems promising for a full AF chart entry, and being at 303 now, there is some potential in Zach's times.

On an unrelated note, I think that's the longest "New Players" section I've ever typed!

Movement
The movement was average, maybe a little lacking as 39 players were active.

Welcome to the AF chart goes out to nobody, only Andrew Ahearn joined the ranks and he was a newbie this week.

~~1-10~~
The top 10 was mostly inactive again, much changed from their previous months were everyone was actively moving. Only three were karting this week. #4 Marc Bas and #5 Aziz Abdullah each sent in one PR. Marc's wasn't enough to stop the gaining of .0781 AF, and Aziz cut just enough AF to stay even for the week. If both want to stay in their current positions however, that's not going to be enough. #6 Jay Batten was on his weekly rampage up the charts, this week with 4 PRs and a .2 AF cut. The cut for the week leaves him about .0185, or one place behind Aziz. This means Jay has to move up two places on one chart, or one spot on two charts next week in order to pass for #5. (Although that's disregarding the AF gain everyone naturally gets, you get the point). Will Jay finally join the Top 5, where he's been searching for a spot in for months? You'll have to arrange a meeting with my co-anchor, NStride to figure out that news next week.

~~11-25~~
Where NStride was searching for any sings of life last week, I found a minor amount of karters PRing in this group, four to be exact. Things start off kind of low, with #18 Alvin Le and 3 PRs. Alvin cut .8906 AF with these great times, and shot up a spot from #19, hurdling Ben Hart. Following closely behind is #20 Matthieu Mayer with 2 PRs of his own. Matthieu didn't cut any AF, but he was so tightly packed with Artur Bauer he managed to pass him by gaining less AF. Closing out the group, #23 Salvatore Bellusci and #24 Thomas van Deerse couldn't overcome the gain of AF with their 3 and 2 PRs, respectively. Salvatore gained .18 AF, and Thomas stayed even, so the two moved slightly closer together this week. With no one else playing around them little efforts are all that is necessary to ascend.

~~26-50~~
Starting things off here was #30 Daniel Raftery, making 8 PRs to jump up three spots, bringing a 1.8 AF cut with him. Trailing closely behind that cut was #32 Liam Ashcroft, although his 1 PR wasn't enough to overcome the general backwards turn of AF points, and he gained some regardless. #35 Paul-Philipp Baehr had a nice 5 PR week that triggered a .45 AF cut, and behind him #36 Oliver Martin had a 3 PR week that brought him up from 39th. Oli has been near the Top 30 at points however recently has been relatively inactive, it's nice to see him returning and still PRing. #41 John Brunn holds his ground and gains a place from #42 with 3 PRs and a .6719 AF cut. #44 Zack McNell is starting to get on a roll now, this week moving up two spots from #46 with his 3 PRs and .4375 AF cut. Only problem now is he's facing a 4 AF gap to #43, and once he reaches that spot he has a 7 AF gap to #42. It's a very steep cliff that will take work to climb, however as the Tyler McNell has shown, success in MKW runs in the name. #46 Marvin Donjes is officially staking his claim in the Top 50 this week after two relatively quiet weeks. Overcoming a minor AF graveyard, this week brought 7 PRs and a .8750 AF cut. He's nearing #45 Alberto Fiorese and #44 McNell, however he too can see the major cliff looming in the distance. "The Donkey" has proven time and time again he can rise to the occasion, and this should be interesting. Finally, #50 Tim van Ham tries to hang on to his bubble spot with a 1 PR effort, however failed to cut any AF, only gain less than others. With people lurking a paragraph below to snatch his spot, Tim may want to start PRing hardcore to maintain his class.

~~51-100~~
Getting back to this group, starting off the movement is #52 Yann Deptia, who has been very active recently on the charts. He's almost clear of this group, leaving them after methodically making his way through the ranks. This week moved him up one spot from #53 with 5 PRs, and a 2.2 AF cut, or 2.75%. Slightly behind is #57 Harp Valentine with a pair of new times. They moved him up one place as well, with a 1.35 AF cut. Another large gap follows before reaching #69 Sebastian Kovats, with 2 PRs of his own. He ended up gaining AF by not jumping enough positions, however did lessen the blow to stay in place. Down to #81 Danny Gallenberger, a 4 PR week is shown. It moved him up one place (seemingly the trend for the group), and cut .21 AF off. Everyone else below was asleep, showing how the trend works: the 50-100 group is for a few select players to use as a springboard to the Top 50, and otherwise is filled with players who just made the Top 100 and are slipping back down, or the past greats slowly falling back into unimportance. Take ex-champ Michael Fried for example, now sitting at #94. Now 93 players are beating one of MK's greats, and a longtime site champ.

~~101-End~~
Starting off this group is #101 Frederick Hutchington, still fighting desperately for that one spot that catapults him into MKW importance. He moved up from #102 this week with 5 PRs, cutting .718 AF and moving within 1.1 AF points of catching Cutz for the Top 100 ranking. Further down is another Top 100 contender, #108 Viktor Silvanov. Viktor had 4 PRs, but moved up three spots from #111th, and only cut .6094. Maximum efficiency is bringing him closer to the elite group, and in later weeks we'll see what happens. #113 Martin Prigent is next in line, bringing to the table 5 PRs which cut him .75 AF. No rank movements, however he's in a graveyard now (2 AF ahead of #114 and 3 AF behind #112). Here's where it gets tough to continue on. Next are #132 Cyril Fulag and #133 Sam Smith, each playing this week and ending up right next door to each other. Sam moved from #139 to catch the next active train with only 1 PR (1.59 AF with 1 PR is very impressive), while Cyril had three that weren't enough to cut back the gain he got from other players. In the distance #143 Tomas Pallaruelo had one PR of his own as he struggled to keep within distance of the two movers. Down in his own little world is #167 Tonny Su. With 6 PRs he jumped up a place from 168 and cut 1.75 AF points. Farther down is #195 Tony Fan with 1 PR that moved him up two spots, and #208 Eric Shore. Eric's goal is to hit the Top 200 in MKW before moving on to other MarioKart games, and with 7 PRs this week bumping him up 4 spots, his weight is relieved by 3.87 AF points. #232 Murray Wright returns to the scene with 52 PRs. They moved him from #288, and cut 71 AF points, most likely hoarded over some time. Closing things off are #262 Julien Stephens, moving from #265 with 14 PRs and a 5.1 AF cut, and #285 Andre Riviere, moving from #289 with 4 PRs and a .56 AF cut. Activity is still in spurts in this group, and new players are joining so it doesn't entirely become a dead zone.

Site Records
SR wise it was pretty quiet, with only three records slipping through the cracks. Paul-Philipp moved into a tie for 3rd on the SR table with his 4th SR, and Hahaae netted his second as Matthieu Mayer joined the ranks with his first. Losers this week were Jorge Hernandez, falling from 9 to 8 but retaining first, Aziz Abdullah dropping from 2 to 1, and Eric Hacksell losing his sole record on DKSC flap to drop off the chart altogether.

Matthieu Mayer beat the old Moo Moo Meadows crs time of 1'15"996 with a time of: 1'15"964
Ethan McCormac beat the old DK's Snowboard Cross lap time of 0'35"410 with a time of: 0'35"377
Paul-Philipp Baehr beat the old Wario's Gold Mine crs time of 0'35"095 with a time of: 0'33"801

Thanks for reading guys. As for awards, look up and you'll see everything up to the 3rd week of June has been caught up. They'll be regular again now that the task of getting them caught up is finished.

~Web

fields.author: Webinator
fields.title: Attention: We Interrupt your Weekly Karting for an Awards Announcement!
fields.content:
Hey guys, just took a look at the awards page and realized it was kind of dusty. As I finish up the news update from yesterday I'll leave this as a placeholder. Tomorrow I'm going to get as much of the awards caught up as I can, since the POM for March hasn't been decided and the POWs date back to late April. On another note, as the second POQ draws to a close, I'm going to hold off on a vote for a POQ, since the last polls have been disastrous, to say the least.
Anyway, just keep on the lookout tomorrow as I get this updated. It's officially my summer vacation now (last final was today! :D), so awards are due.

Also, the May 26th Update is now finished, so check out #'s 26 to the end when you can, there were some interesting moves down in the lower sections. I'm finishing up yesterday's update now so watch for the sections to come pouring through.

~~POWs
April, Week 4 - Cole Gilbert, for a small return to the charts with a 9 PR and 6.14 AF cut week.
May, Week 1 - Kevin Mason, 5 PRs and a 2.4% cut off his AF count led the Top 100.
May, Week 2 - Yann Deptia, 21 PRs and a 10 point AF cut after recently joining the charts. Moved from #68 to #55.
May, Week 3 - John Brunn for 7 PRs that helped him clear an AF graveyard to move up a place. 4.95% of his AF, or 3.29 points were cut in the process.
May, Week 4 - Paul-Philipp Baehr hit 9 PRs and cut 3.54 AF points, leading the Top 50. Moved from #39 to #35 in the ranks.
June, Week 1 - Matthias Sempels brought 10 PRs and jumped from #52 to #47. Cut 2.84 AF points and dropped 3.69% off.
June, Week 2 - Thomas van Deerse ascended from #24 to #22 this week, helped by 8 PRs and a 2.25 AF cut.
June, Week 3 - Matthias Sempels stands out again, moving from #44 to #43 this week. His 4.62% AF cut was the most of the top 50, 6 PRs shaving 3.4 AF points off.

~~POMs
March - Shaun Tanney, for determination with a long AF graveyard in front. 25 PRs prompted a 17% AF cut (2.4 points), and a piece out of the massive AF gap to #2.
April - Jak Russo, for a huge jump from #11 to #8, cutting 26% AF with 21 PRs (amounting to a cut of 9.6 AF points). Honorable Mentions go to Jorge Hernandez, Dustin Enders, and Shaun Tanney
May - Marvin Donjes, for standing out below with minor activity above. 30 PRs gave a 8.06 AF cut (about 10%), and gave a jump in rank from #57 to #47.

Thanks for reading and good luck karting, these awards never stop so there's always a chance to grab one for yourself!

~Web

fields.author: Webinator
fields.title: WR Activity Rebounds as Summer Approaches
fields.content:
Hey guys, Web here. Andy was out of town without internet access, so that's why you're seeing me again and also why it's a little late this time. The awards are finally up to date though, so check if you won a POW!

"Summertime Karting" is now finished, check out the rest of the movement and make sure I didn't miss you!

This update covers June 12th to June 18th, 2011. Thanks for your patience.

The New Players
One new player joined this week, even with summer it appears the new entries are slowing down. Either that, or they all joined last week.

Azim Islam submitted one time. I'm guessing it was Luigi Circuit course, and since I'm too lazy to check I hope I'm right. Other than that, not much to tell on how he'll slot in when or if he finishes his timesheet.

Movement
The movement continued at its average pace, with 40 players playing this week. Hopefully the pickup will happen soon, or MKW might have just started to lose those 50-player weeks for good.

Welcome to the AF chart goes out to #183 Will Eudy, joining back on the May 1st update. Two months later, his timeset is finally finished, and he settles onto the main AF chart in a comfortable 183rd to start. Everyone below lost a spot by default. However everyone below #215 Nicola Torre are really angry because they dropped two spots by default this week. DarkRoy joined in at #215 after being on the site for a few years, and hopefully movement will follow. Closing things off here, a third member joined from the section of incomplete timesets, #349 Peter Lankton. Anyone below #349 dropped three spots, but they probably expected that anyway since that area of the AF tables is filled with a lot of broken controllers and old strats nobody has touched for a while. Very long section here, lets get on to everyone else who already made it onto the charts.

~~1-10~~
The Top 10 has been very quiet in the past months, after the time where 8 or 9 would be active all at once. This week only brought two to the table, and if you've been watching the activity in the past few months, you can probably guess who they were. First off, #3 Shaun Tanney had a 7 PR week, cutting about .32 AF points. The cut brings him under the 10 AF mark and makes him the third MKW player to do so. He's about 1.2 points away from #2 Nick Meade, who has retired AF playing, and with progress like this Shaun should reclaim his peak position on the charts soon. This news update would be empty if I didn't mention #5 Jay Batten, as he's been active for months and months, each week coming with several PRs to work up the charts. Recently, he seems to have reached a stumbling block, which is perfectly understandable for being so high on the charts and only having so many places you can cut. Two PRs this week were the result from Jay, however he did gain .05 AF points and failed to break even. The gap for him is 10 AF points to reach #4 Marc Bas, which is a massive canyon for already being so highly ranked, however it wouldn't suprise me if in a few months Jay is still chipping away at the gap.

~~11-25~~
It appears that in Mario Kart Wii, the new breed of players that are coming through the ranks are hidden one group below the top. The 11-25 section had more activity than usual, five players in total. #12 Tyler McNell led the charge, with 3 PRs and a .25 AF cut. It brought him closer to German #2 Dustin Enders, however I'm guessing Enders has about 10 PRs saved up for a hoard he'll be posting soon. #17 Alvin Le is next in line, with 2 PRs and a 1.26 AF cut. This great jump was enough to propel him past Eric Hacksell and set Cole in his radar. #20 Matthieu Mayer had a nice week, with 2 PRs and a .406 AF cut. He didn't move in the ranks, but any cut of AF is a nice bonus. #23 Thomas van Deerse finally is making his way past the bubble spot in this group, moving up another place from last time. His 5 PRs prompted a 1.85 AF cut, and now he's about a tenth away from catching 2008 POY Alvin van Asselt. #24 Salvatore Bellusci is trying hard to regain his old Top 20 standing. His 4 PRs this week cut .48 AF, but Thomas passed him, setting his goals back another place.

~~26-50~~
Although not the huge influx of activity as usual, this group still had its fair share of players trying to improve their MKW standing. One player who has been mentioned at the top of this group for a while and is looking to make the big jump is #27 Kevin Mason. With 2 PRs, Kevin had a nice .29 AF cut and is moving his way to the Top 25. Hot on his heels is #28 Daniel Raftery, who had 7 PRs last week, enough to move him up two spots from #30. His 2.73 AF cut is also unmatched and a very nice deficit for the week. #31 Liam Ashcroft had an uncharacteristic week by only PRing once and gaining AF, hopefully he'll be back in stride next week. Another player to watch is #38 John Brunn, moving from #41 this week. With only 3 PRs, he cut exactly 2 AF points and continues to make a dent on the standings. Next up is a face we haven't seen in a while, #41 Zane Royal. With 3 PRs, Zane cut .17 AF and moved up one place on the rankings. Closing out the group is a cluster of three active karters. #44 Matthias Sempels had a 4 PR week that cut him 2.2 AF, however he didn't move up in rank. #45 Zack McNell had a 2 PR week that moved him up one place with a .4688 AF cut. The victim was #46 Marvin Donjes, who had 2 PRs, however gained AF and was passed. A weird backwards week for Donjes will most likely be corrected for the next update.

~~51-100~~
It's official. There's no pulse. This group is D-E-A-D. Out of 50 players that could have played, only three, yes THREE actually did. That's a measly 6%. #57 Sebastian Kovats is about as scared as I would be moving through a group of 47 dead karters, so he decided to work overtime this week and grab 12 PRs. Those PRs catapulted him from #65 up 8 spots, with a 4.8 AF cut. One more week of intense karting should let you see some active faces Sebastian, don't give up yet! Next down is #81 Danny Gallenberger, who had 6 PRs for a 2.3 AF cut. It didn't change his ranking any, but he's on the verge of overcoming the AF graveyard he was placed in, fighting past 6 points to stand only 1.6 away from the Top 80. He has all the time he wants though, since nobody is really going to play here. Lastly is #100 Frederick Hutchington, who made the jump into this elite group after beating a graveyard of his own. 2 PRs brought a .89 AF cut, and now he's passed Noah Gordon for the biggest bubble spot on the whole page. Will he last, or will the "disease" that effects so many innocent karters in the group strike him down. Time will tell.

~~101-End~~
Down here was probably the most activity, which is surprising because this is where I though all the dead karters were. Apparently not. Starting things off, a player ready to leave the triple digits is #102 Viktor Silvanov, jumping all the way from #108 last week. He had 10 PRs and a 4.17 AF cut, and next week he should be up there if the pace continues. #108 Virgil Blondel rose from the dead to send in a 39 PR group, jumping from #145 up 37 spots. The 46 point AF cut is a huge accomplishment, but the gate to the Top 100 becomes harder to reach each passing day, so Virgil may have to continue karting hard to reach it. #113 Loris Bagnasco is next, sending in 19 PRs for a 5.68 AF cut and a jump up one position. Right behind is #115 Sam Smith, with 27 PRs, a 24.7 AF cut, and a jump all the way from #133. Apparently this was the week of hoarding in MKW, or just the week of ridiculous playing. #132 Cyril Fulag continues progress sans Sam, and has 7 PRs that brought a 2.782 AF cut. He passed two players, however two passed him in Virgil and Sam, so he sticks right in place. At least the AF came off. #146 Christian Wild seems to be active in every MK game at once at the moment, as he rallies to try and take Michael Fried's combined Mario Kart crown. This week he brought 2 PRs to the table, cutting .89 AF. Also, he gained about .002 combined ranking points, which I think is the first time I've ever cared about those on a news update, but since Chris is so close to the MK Champion crown, every little .001 is important. #161 Tonny Su had 13 PRs for a 5.5 AF cut, moving up four spots on the ranking. #195 Tony Fan had another 2 PRs that cut .7812 and let him pass one player, however he was pushed back to #195 due to Will Eudy's entrance. #201 Eric Shore nears his Top 200 goal with a jump from #203 aided by 7 PRs. #241 Dave Johnston, #263 Julien Stephens, and #287 Andre Riviere were all also active, cutting massive amounts of AF and PRing all the way.

Site Records
Two SRs, and only one that changed hands this update. Danny Gallenberger took his first ever SR this week, depriving Paul-Philipp Baehr of one of his four. Other than that, the SR table stayed pretty solid.

Danny Gallenberger beat the old Mushroom Gorge lap time of 0'09"379 with a time of: 0'09"302
Tony Ruiz beat the old GCN Waluigi Stadium lap time of 0'35"668 with a time of: 0'35"448

For awards, look down to see the great catchup. On another note, the 3rd POQ should be announced very soon, probably in two updates so keep your eyes peeled for the announcement. There it is, a full update at once. I think Shock isn't going to be back for the next update, so I'll have it for you on Sunday. Until then, keep karting!

~Web

fields.author: Webinator
fields.title: Heat Turns Up, Activity Tones Down
fields.content:
Hey guys, Webinator here with an on-time news update, as surprising as that is. This week brought a decreased amount of activity to the MKW world as the heat turned up. Let's get right to it!

This update covers June 19th to 25th, 2011.

The New Players
One n00b enters MKWPP's gates this week.
Jalen Woody sent in 33 times, the one flap he submitted remains a mystery since again, I'm too lazy to check. Hopefully the rest of the sheet fills in in a couple of weeks.

Movement
The activity has steadily fallen in the past weeks, with only 33 players sending in submissions this week. From a news writer's point of view it's easier on the fingers and brain, but my heart aches for the 50 and 60 player weeks again. You might force me to make a comeback or something. Scary stuff.

Welcome to the AF chart is also disappointed this week since nobody from the incomplete timeset world decide to make the jump upwards into full-AF land. There's a few players that have 54 or more times submitted, and only have less than 10 to send in. It's not that difficult and getting mentioned on the news is always a nice bonus.

~~1-10~~
Two updates ago three were active. Last week two played. This week the activity in the top was limited to only one. If any of you had to take a guess, you'd probably hit it right on the head. Yep, the only player was #5 Jay Batten, who had a decent week cutting .23 AF points off. He sent in 5 PRs, which ended up cutting 1% off his AF score. He's 9.6 AF points off of #4 Marc Bas, but if nobody else plays Jay could reach the Final Four quicker than expected.

~~11-25~~
The lucky number for this section is five, as it seems to pop up so frequently as the number of players that pick up their controllers here. Better than most groups in terms of percentage, but when you're so close to the Top 10 a last burst of activity is needed to reach the pinnacle that only the strongest of karters possess. Starting things of was a player close to realizing this goal #13 Tony Ruiz moved up a rank with 7 PRs, shaving off his AF score by 3.4 points. Jamie Disley was the victim of this move, although Tony has 4 points to cut for another spot. Two active karters slightly below that couldn't overcome the backwards treadmill of activity were #16 Cole Gilbert and #17 Alvin Le. Both sent in one PR, with disappointing results. Cole stayed dead even with no loss or gain on AF points, and Alvin gained .12 AF points whereas everyone around him gained .24 points. Slight victories, however much better than the dead weight around them. #22 Thomas van Deerse is continuing his progress, with 2 PRs this week. He gained .14 AF points, however those around him that didn't play, namely ex-champ Alvin van Asselt gained more, and Thomas moved up one spot in the main ranking. Closing out the group is #24 Salvatore Bellusci, who was one of the two that actually cut AF here. He sent in 3 PRs to eliminate .3281 AF points, and close the gap on Asselt to half an AF point. Knocking Alvin out of the top 25 will be a milestone day, marking a further deviation from the 2008 MKW days and looking towards the future, although this group has to step it up for something drastic like that to happen.

~~26-50~~
Seven players were playing down here, moving throughout the group from those about to exit above to those who just checked in from the dead zones of the 51-100 crowd. #26 Kevin Mason moved up one more spot this week, and is now in the prime position of this group. One more week could earn him the key to the second highest group, if he could cut off 1.6 AF points. That small graveyard poses a challenge to Kevin's slow and steady pace, however with no one else playing he should be the next contender to earn a Top 25 spot. #33 Paul-Philipp Baehr's highlight of the week was taking a Site Record at MG flap, however he proved himself in terms of the main chart. With 4 PRs, he cut .53 AF points and moved up two spots on the ranks. #36 John Brunn also moved up two spots with 4 PRs, however his AF cut was different at 1.68 AF points. He's shooting up the ranks in this week and his potential seems limitless, hopefully the upward trend continues. Down near the bottom of the group lie three close karters, #43 Matthias Sempels, #45 Marvin Donjes, and #46 Zack McNell. All three cut AF points, Sempels with 4 PRs losing .82 off his score (and moving up one spot), and Donjes with 8 PRs and a 1.67 AF cut moving from #46 up one spot. This displaced Zack McNell, dropping one spot on the ranks despite his .12 AF cut. His 2 PRs weren't enough, but any form of forward progress is nice. Finally #49 Yann Deptia escapes the harrowing frights of the dead regions, and moves from #52 up three spots this week. His resume was 4 PRs cutting 1.42 AF points this week, and more importantly, a rank promotion.

~~51-100~~
Dead as usual down here. Maybe it's just that I got used to the 50 and 60 weeks too much, but this group never seems to have any signs of life. Six players played down here, and with only 12% of the group active the section is much smaller this time than usual. #56 Sebastian Kovats had 4 PRs that brought him up a spot with a 1.12 AF cut. #58 Harp Valentine was exactly tied with Sebastian last week, however his smaller AF cut at .375 couldn't let him keep pace and pass a player like his ex-tied compatriot. Augustin Berrios is now the man in the middle between this separated pair. Another active pair grouped closely together are #75 Nate Paternost and #77 Danny Gallenberger. Nate cut 4.89 AF points with a 9 PR submission that only brought him up one place. Danny had a similar cut at 4.21 AF with 5 PRs and a jump from #81 up four places. At the bottom of this group are two karters that are clinging on to the edge of the cliff, desperate not to drop off of the Top 100 ledge. #97 Dave Tandy sent in a 25 PR submission, cutting 7.06 AF and moving him up from #103 to grasp the group, determined not to let go this time. #98 Frederick Hutchington moved into the Top 100 for the third time last week, and this week used his momentum to his advantage with a 5 PR, 4.18 AF cut week. Cut loose from the group is #101 Noah Gordon, who will have to fight back into the hallowed gates of double-digit placing.

~~Everyone Else~~
Down here the group ranges from old pros trying to make comebacks into the Top 100 to rising stars ready to reach their potential and make the first big step to MKW greatness. #108 Virgil Blondel had a nice hoard last week, and this week sent in 1 PR. It couldn't stop the gain of AF, but it was near even at only a .04 gain so it looks good for the future. #115 Sam Smith and #116 Martin Prigent traveled together this week, with 3 and 5 PRs, respectively. Sam cut .65 AF and Martin cut 1.53 AF, although neither moved up any spots. #126 Cyril Fulag moved up all the way from #132 this week, the first very promising week that we've seen from him after his entry recently. 7 PRs brought a 4.64 AF cut, and a great prospect for the future. #145 Christian Wild is still fighting to be the best in MarioKart, and this week cut .7812 AF points with 2 PRs. He moved up one spot as well, and gained about .002 combined points, another small step to MK greatness. Farther down is the section where you can still submit huge PR sets in one week and it isn't a hoard. #180 Will Eudy moved up three spots with a 7.15 AF cut and a quarter of his timeset improved. #191 Eric Shore achieved his goal of hitting the top 200. Moving up ten spots from #201 with 16 PRs, he cut 9.9375 AF points, and possibly this great progress will convince him to keep with MKW. #194 Tony Fan had 2 PRs, cutting 1.65 AF points and gained one place. #204 Nicola Torre moved up 11 spots and cut 12.78 AF points with only 2 PRs, very huge PRs as they had to have cut about 384 spots each. The typical suspects were active at the bottom, with #263 Julien Stephens getting 3 PRs but not moving up a spot, and #281 Andre Riviere hitting 6 PRs to cut 7.58 AF points to move from #287. That's it for the week's movement, let's get on to the top of the charts with Site Records.

Site Records
Two SRs were in the works this week, on one course. Mushroom Gorge got its fair share of mountain riding as Salvatore Bellusci furthered his course record, and the flap battle continued as Paul-Philipp Baehr took back his flap from Danny Gallenberger, who snatched it the week before. Only one SR title change meant little movement on the main SR chart, other than Paul moving up to T-3 with 4 SRs and Danny dropping off the list losing his sole SR.

Salvatore Bellusci beat the old Mushroom Gorge crs time of 0'32"425 with a time of: 0'31"747
Paul-Philipp Baehr beat the old Mushroom Gorge lap time of 0'09"302 with a time of: 0'09"236

Awards
Nothing this week since no deadlines passed since last time, however next time tune in for the 4th POW for June, the June POM, and the 2nd POQ for 2011!

Thanks for reading, I'm pretty sure Shock will be here next week, if not then see you next week! Keep karting, get that active players number back into the 40's and 50's.

~Web

fields.author: NStride
fields.title: Coco-Nuts
fields.content:
Hey everyone, I'm back. We have had a crazy karting week, and I look forward to reporting it this fine Independence Day (Good Riddance Day in England).

This update covers the activity from June 26th to July 2nd.

Before we start on the news though, I would like to just put out there what the time updaters would like to see in a submission. We have had some troubles with the updating here and there because some basic guidelines are being ignored. In the future, please submit times in the following generic format:

--------------
John Doe:
LC: 1'10"122
LC flap: 22"193
GV: 21"255

Thanks!
--------------

Time updaters do not care about if you use Wii Wheel all the time, what your YouTube channel is, or any side story that goes with your PRs. Also, please do not use spaces between what you use to separate minutes from seconds from milliseconds. It is a real hassle to parse a submission, then realize you have to go back and backspace every time entry. Also, it hasn't been too much of a problem, but please make sure you use the correct abbreviations. Time updaters prefer abbreviations and NOT fully typed course and lap names. Saves time for you too. Lastly, unless you are a top player that PRs at most about 3 times a day, please don't send in a new submission for every single new record you achieve. Seriously, please do not send in more than 4 submissions a day. It's not fun coming onto the updating page and realizing that you will be there for the next hour, with half the submissions coming from the same person and many times on the same course over and over.

So yeah. Just wanted to take care of that pet peeve I was having. On to the news!

A new glitch
That's right, in case for some reason you didn't know by now, a new glitch has been uncovered on Coconut Lawl... I mean Mall. Although I won't be covering the new glitch in this update since it only covers through the 2nd, I'll just say for now that the World Record is currently around 50 seconds. If you haven't done this glitch yet, do it soon and I'm sure you'll gain some major AF points!

The New Players
A warm welcome to: Daniel Crutcher, Ovila Acolatse,Roronoa Fabrici, and Thomas Ullrich.

Activity
Lots of activity this week. So much so that it would be an eye bleed to even read all the activity of all the active players, so that means unless you did some PR action that was quite worthy of note, you're not probably going to be on this update. (65 players PRed).

~1-20~
Really active this week! 9 players PRed, and since they are all so highly ranked, all will be mentioned. First off is #3 Shaun Tanney. He made 2 PRs this week and further solidified his position as European MKWii King. Not too far behind him is #5 Jay Batten who made 4 PRs this week. Continuing down this list of actives we find former champion #7 David McPartland. He submitted 3 PRs this week. #8 Jak Russo is right behind him though with 2 PRs submitted this week. We could find a bit of jostling around here soon given the new CM glitch.. #10 Dustin Enders finishes off the top 10 with a strong move, a 0.4 AF cut where most others seemed to be losing AF despite their PRing.

#14 Cole Gilbert gets a mention this week, as he passed 2 players with his 7 PRs. Is he getting in position to try to take over the #1 spot on the combined charts with the release of MK3DS coming up? Further down we have some more old names on the active list. #16 Alex Shoal makes an AF cut but loses a place, #17 Alvin Le maintains his exact AF and keeps his spot, and #18 Eric Hacksell also sent in a PR but lost AF.

~~21-50~~
12 players were active in this AF range this week, so pretty active. However, no auto-mention rule applies here, so you will not make the main page this week unless you made an AF cut or submitted 3 PRs or more. Why? I don't know; PM Tom Gaffikin if you have questions on the forum.

#24 Salvatore Bellusci barely met this requirement, with 3 PRs but a loss of AF. He may want to keep up his activity though because only 3 AF behind him is #25 Kevin Mason. Kevin made 3 PRs this week as well, but he did enough for a 1.8 AF cut.
This next player gets a line on the update completely to himself, because not only was he active, but he also passed 3 players with 11 PRs. This is quite impressive for this level of play. I am talking about #27 Fabien Jacques. Congrats on a great week to him!
A bit further down is #31 John Brunn, who had a great week as well and is closing in on the Top 30. He made 5 PRs this week and passed 4 players, so he gets his own line in the news update as well.
#44 Zack McNell also impressed this week by passing 2 players with his 5 PRs. Close behind him though is #45 Marvin Donjes who PRed 6 times and passed a player. Donjes sits only .2 AF behind McNell, so will Coconut Mall end up being the tie breaker? Rounding out the Top 50 is #47 Yann Deptia who made just 2 PRs, yet still progressed 2 AF points and passed 2 players.

~~~51-100~~~
11 active players in this bracket today. :) Again, you will need 3 PRs or an AF cut to get a mention if you play within this range. I am a bit less forgiving than Web, but if you make it on here with me you really earned it!
Starting us off here is #54 Sebastian Kovats who made a slight AF cut and maintained his position. Next mention goes to #64 Ross Coleman. He may have lost some AF this week, but he submitted 5 PRs. Right in front of him is #63 Bob Holden; I mention him because these two are really neck to neck at the moment. Once again, will CM be a major decider as to who comes up on top?
A bit further down and we see #77 Danny Gallenberger. This guy is overcoming quite the AF gap between 78th and 76th. Keep it up man!
This next contender on the charts really let us know that he is out there and moving up! I'm talking about #84 Dave Tandy. He made 29 PRs this week! This was enough for a 13 point AF cut and a blowing away of 12 players. Look out!
Next up is our "Welcome to the AF Chart" award winner. Well, we like to welcome everybody, but the guys who join the highest get this particular ribbon. Say hello to #86 Thomas Ullrich. We'll see if he keeps progressing now or ditches us now that he's on the page. Of course the former is better. :rolleyes:
Three more people to cover here. First of these is #92 Michael Fried. Fried made 5 PRs this week and passed 2 players. The contest for the top position of the combined charts is on!
Next is #97 Virgil Blondel; Blondel passed 9 players this week with a 12 AF cut across 10 PRs! Really moving along... keep it up!
And last to cover in the Top 100 this week is #100 Kevin Borne. He cut .4 AF and barely managed to stay in this barrier, edging out Frederick by .3. Competition is again intense here!

*101-End*
20 more active players here. :D This week, to get a mention in this area you will need a 3 AF cut or more or 5 PRs. Just because.
So, let's start this out with #116 Martin Prigent. Martin had a good week this week as he made a .7 AF cut with 5 PRs. If he hadn't played on the other hand, he would have lost over 1.5 AF. So, well done to him!
Perhaps the mention of the week goes to #118 David Schiering though. Brace yourself for this: 36 PRs, 88 AF cut, and 61 players passed. I would like to call hoarding, but you never know what people are capable of doing in a week...
Quite a bit farther down, and you will see #143 Tomas Pallaruelo. He had a successful week with 10 PRs and a 5 AF cut, as did #150 Victor Pavao, whose 8 PRs boosted him up a spot.
A bit farther down is #181 Will Eudy and #187 Eric Shore. Well done to those two for making small AF cuts with their 6 PRs.
As we head outside the Top 200, we still see a lot of activity. First is #208 Sean Wilson who made an 11 AF cut. Following him is #216 Munim Peerally. Munim did particularly well, with a 27 AF cut and a nice surge to that Top 200. A bit deeper into this pit we find #227 Dave Johnston and #229 Murray Wright both make a move of 12 AF points.
Joining us in the lower ranks is #234 Roronoa Fabrici. Well done on joining the page, now make your climb! Maybe also new to the page #256 Daniel Crutcher can help give you motivation.
Even further still, (yes, people are PRing even way down here!), climbing this ladder (or not really?) to higher ground is the last mention of this update. This goes to #263 Julian Stephens. He made a 6.4 AF cut and had 11 PRs and went absolutely nowhere with it. Tough place to be haha.

And that concludes the movement. Time for...

New Site Records
4 new Site Records this week:
Thomas Ullrich beat the old Grumble Volcano crs time of 0'19"625 with a time of: 0'19"581
Thomas Petraud beat the old GCN Waluigi Stadium crs time of 1'50"446 with a time of: 1'49"659
Nick Meade beat the old GCN Mario Circuit crs time of 1'31"444 with a time of: 1'31"436
Nick Meade beat the old N64 Bowser's Castle crs time of 2'31"763 with a time of: 2'31"752

And oh will there be quite the contention for next week's CM course and flap. Who will be the ones to take it by the next update? I guess we'll wait and see.

Awards
Hey guys, Web here invading the update for a second to put in the awards that have been happening the past couple of days. For more info check the awards page!
~~POW
The 4th POW for June is awarded to Cole Gilbert for shining the most in the top. His 6 PRs brought a 3.12 AF cut from his score, and he jumped from 16th to 14th in the main ranking, showing again he's never truly done with MKW.

~~POM
The June POM goes out to John Brunn for finishing out a fantastic quarter with a great month. He jumped another ten places with the largest cut in the top.

~~POQ
The 2011 2nd POQ goes to John Brunn, for a solid cut across the three months and a great move from #56 to #32, while cutting 25 points of AF (or 30% off his previous total) from his score.

After today is the deadline for the first POW of July, so it will be featured in my Sunday update. Thanks for reading and keep on karting!
~Web (sorry, couldn't resist)

~NStride (The guy Web called Shock last week. lol)

fields.author: Webinator
fields.title: The Separation
fields.content:
Separate Charts Do Exist!
Hey guys, Webinator here with some important news you probably know about already, but with more juicy details! For all of you suffering for years after the discovery of Grumble Rock, Mushroom Mountain, Wario's Green Pipe and Bowser's Trippy Walkthrough Ceiling, MKWPP finally has a solution: separate charts. They do exist right now, and are currently being worked on so upon release the players ranking near the top of the charts on Non-SC aren't just horrible glitchers. (And believe me, I've found a bunch of 1:45 MG glitched times and 1:50's GV glitched times).
