As of right now there are 18 times on the charts, both 3lap and flap for 9 courses (MG, CM, WGM, GV, BC, rGV2, rBC3, rDKJP, and rDKM). They will be separate Non-SC charts for now and most likely for the long run, with the combined or "main" AF chart staying with glitched times, because as you know by now time has gone on too long for the Non-SC times to get the upper hand on the charts, as many players who have since retired would be left with incomplete timesheets.

So just to let you know, we're still working out the kinks, making sure the stats are working fine and trying to get everything in sync so we won't have any glitches upon the release of the charts. Just stay patient a little longer and all of your Non-SC dreams will be fulfilled. In other news.....

Coconut Mall's Invisible Stores of Mystery and Happiness
As most of you know, the 9th glitch was found on a MKW course in the past week, as Coconut Mall fell under fire. The new glitch involves using the railings to bounce out of bounds into a safe zone, and then drive throughout all of Nintendo's great solid walls on the interior of Coconut Mall to trigger glitchy checkpoints and get a time under 50 seconds, and a flap of about 6 seconds. Loads of fun this MKW game is. Anyway, those times aren't on the charts right now because of the fact that we have to sort out the Non-Glitch and Glitch times on CM and make sure that everything is stable before releasing them. The WRs have changed hands many times, and for that you might want to check out Pierrepont's mkwii.co.uk site that lists the record history, but once the separate charts are released we'll take both Non-SC times and the glitched CM times on the site. Hang tight and keep driving through the various stores and cars around CM while the charts are finished.

Oh yeah, and apparently there will also be weekly news here, however I'll type that later tonight. This first section was mainly an alert for those who don't frequent the forums on the current happenings of the site and when resolutions are going to happen.

THE ACTUAL NEWS!!!!
Hey guys, ignoring those two important MKW issues and things going on right now we have an actual news update to bring you all. For some reason people love NStride/Shock/Andy/That Karter with the amazing voice who should release his Sky Garden Song from Fenner's stream to the public's updates more than me, because for some reason all of the big updates happen around him. Either that or I'm strategic with when I update. Regardless, only 37 players played this week, which is good news for them because everyone on the main AF chart will probably get mentioned.

This news covers July 3rd to 9th, 2011.

The New Players
Three new players this week joining just as the Coconut Mall chaos erupts. Maybe it prompted their entry onto the charts, or maybe news of Non-SC charts is beginning to drive players to MKWPP.

Gthree San submitted 32 times, probably the courses. ~235th now, but then again that doesn't mean much.
Brian Smith sent in 38 times. Why 38? Ask Brian, why should I know? Hopefully his timesheet gets finished, as any number above 32 is a step in the right direction towards that goal. Brian is ~374th, so maybe a little more work is needed on the flaps.
Alex Bjorkman was weird and sent in 4 times. Other than that, I don't know much about him other than his last name is pretty cool.

Movement
As mentioned above, 37 players played. Let's just get down to it.

Nobody gets the Welcome to the AF chart greeting, because nobody was tough enough to make the jump from the incomplete timsheet section. Yeah I just called all of you out, now go finish out those timesheets, get on the full AF chart and make the MKW community proud!

~~1-10~~
Two karters were active up here, finding it necessary to press on in their quests for MKW excellence. The Top 10 has really been quiet for the past few months as only a select few have really been active. First off, #5 Jay Batten was obviously active, hitting only 1 PR this week to lessen his gain slightly, although not avoid it entirely. The MKW German crown battle intensified however, as #9 Dustin Enders sent in his periodical hoard of times. The 13 new submissions shot him up a place from #10, and resulted in a cut of 2.64 AF points. Dustin and Mark Schmidt have battled back and forth over their country's crown in the most exciting country battle in all of MKW, as it is unpredictable who will have the better score week to week. Will Mark come back and take it? Time will tell.

~~11-25~~
Five players were active here, which is pretty typical for this group. The usuals were karting, starting off with #11 Mark Schmidt determined not to let his German rival gain too much of an edge. Mark sent in 7 PRs, cutting 2.08 AF points and drawing very near to kicking Jimmy Benson out of the Top 10 for the first time in may months. He's only .2 away from the Top 10 again, and .8 away from Dustin and the German title, so the battle should heat up in the coming weeks. #12 Tyler McNell sent in 1 PR just to keep up his activity streak, however couldn't cut any AF points and stayed firmly in place with a 4 AF cushion ahead and behind him. #16 Alex Shoal made a small return to MKW this week, sending in 3 PRs, two of which were site records, and almost breaking even for the week. It helped him to draw nearer to #15 Jamie Disley who is only .2 AF ahead, however Alex seems to be wavering on retirement/inactivity so we'll see if the move will happen. Closer to the end of this croup is #21 Thomas van Deerse, who moved up one spot this week with 2 PRs and a .15 AF cut. Passing ex-2008 champ Alvin van Asselt he only has more prestigious karters ahead. Finally, newcomer to this group #25 Kevin Mason was at the Wii again, determined to continue playing so as not to drop back into the 26-50 group so soon. His one PR didn't help much, however it did make him gain only half the AF of the players around him, proving any bit of PRing helps out.

~~26-50~~
A quiet week from this section, however that's to be expected from their usual playtime. The top performer was #31 Robert van Zanten. RVZ moved up a place on the charts with 3 PRs and a cut of 1.06 AF points, hurdling #32 John Brunn even though Brunn was active. John also had 3 PRs, but only cut .7344 AF, leaving him about .28 AF separated from RVZ. John has been on a tear and RVZ has been mostly inactive, so signs point to the pass happening soon, however RVZ might have some more PRs to share. Closing out the group are four players all in the 40s scrambling to avoid displacement from this group. #41 Zane Royal hit 1 PR but didn't do much AF wise. #43 Matthias Sempels hit 4 PRs and cut 1.07 AF, but stayed at #43. #44 Zack McNell had a 1 PR, .9219 AF cut week that put him right on the heels of Matthias, and #45 Marvin Donjes was relatively silent with 1 PR that didn't give him enough AF to stay even.

~~51-100~~
You expected activity here? Only 5 players showed up this week, typical stuff. Starting things off is #54 Sebastian Kovats, determined to exit this wasteland and move up into the slightly more active 26-50 group. He had 2 PRs and cut off one point of AF on his quest up the charts. #60 Bob Holden had 3 PRs and moved up three spots, cutting 1.37 AF points in the progress. He seems ready to make the jump as well, sad for this group because it will lose activity. #72 Stacy Needham, one of the only two MK players to be Top 100 in all games brought his talents back to MKW this week. 3 PRs almost brought his AF back to even, however he has 5 games to be focused on otherwise so he can improve more here when he wants. #77 Danny Gallenberger is really making great strides since his suffering on the cusp of the Top 100 months ago. He cut 1.25 AF points and put himself about .6 away from Lewis Benny and his next rank. Closing out the group is the other one of the two karters in the Top 100 on all games, #98 Kevin Borne. Kevin was an ex-site champion in 2008 battling it out with Alvin, and is impressively known for not using any glitches across the entire game. He just strengthened his membership in that group again this week by jumping from #100 with 2.78 AF dropped off his score.

~~101-Obscurity ~~
#101 Sam Smith starts off this sad batch of karters, getting 20 PRs and jumping up 13 spots with a 14.718 AF cut. Right below #105 Viktor Silvanov had 11 PRs and cut 2.03 AF off. Continuing this trend of impressive triple-digit karting, #110 Loris Bagnascohad 12 PRs, moving from #115 with a 4.52 cut. Finally ending this streak of double-digit PR hoards is #119 Michael Schneider, with 13 PRs, a jump from #121, and a 6.51 AF cut. Much farther down is #154 Tonny Su, with a batch of 7 PRs prompting a 4.5 AF cut and bringing him up from #159. #181 Will Eudy was active with 3 PRs and a .58 AF cut, but no place improvements. #202 Munim Peeraly, #217 Dimitri Coueffe, and #218 Murray Wright all had AF cuts over 2 points and great batches of PRs that moved them up the charts. Finally, the "Funky Kong Never Give Up Award" goes to #244 Daniel Crutcher, who hit 17 PRs to prove that the lowest active player on the charts doesn't always have to be the lowest active player on the charts. What did I just say there? I have absolutely no idea.

Honorable mentions to #187 Eric Shore and #368 Quassim Weber, who played but didn't cut any AF.

Site Records
Only 2 SRs this week, and both from an old face come back to assert his WR status once more. Alex Shoal sent in his MC improvements, taking the flap from ROM and tying Sword's course record. That might be the first tie for an SR MKWPP has had in its history, although don't quote me on that because I'm sure that I'm wrong. On the SR table, Shoal made a comeback from off the chart to tied for 10th with 2 SRs, and Romain Smadja (ROM) dropped further away from Jorge by losing one and moving from 7 to 6, now two away from Jorge's 8.

Alex Shoal TIED the Mario Circuit crs time of 1'21"764 with a time of: 1'21"764
Alex Shoal beat the old Mario Circuit lap time of 0'25"337 with a time of: 0'25"325

Awards
I'll update this with the first July POW on the 12th, or tomorrow by the date I'm typing this.

That's it for this week guys! Next week and potentially the week after that I'll be down the beach, so you might see two updates in a row from NStride.

~Web

fields.author: NStride
fields.title: Front Runners
fields.content:
Hi karting community, NStride again. I apologize that I did not get this news up earlier and on time. But hey look, now it's here!

Let's get down to the action right away. This news covers the activity from July 10th to July 16th, and it was not very packed with PRs. However, the top of the charts were very active, so they will be getting a lot of mention in this update.

New Players
No new players this week.

Movement
1-11
Two players were active in the top 10 this week, and there was a battle at the borderline for position! That's always fun to watch.
#5 Jay Batten was the highest ranked PR player this week. He did something I have not seen in a long, long time for this level of play. He PR'ed 19 times and cut over 2 AF. That is crazy, Jay, keep it up. He has sufficiently distanced himself from 6th place, but now has a large gap to face before challenging Marc Bas in 4th.
The highlight of the top 10 battle was between #10 Mark Schmidt and #11 Jimmy Benson. These two sit within .15 AF of each other, and both are about to overtake Dustin Enders and Jak Russo. Will this duel turn into a battle? We'll find out next week!

12-20
I promised that the top players were the most active this week, and I mean it! Four more players were active in this 9 player range. They are all close and fighting for position!
#13 Tony Ruiz did work this week by submitting 3 PRs and solidifying his position on the chart. He's got a bit of a ways to go until 12th, but he may want to watch his back with the battle going on with #15 Alex Shoal, #17 Matthieu Mayer and #18 Alvin Le. All four of these players range under 3 AF points and all were active. Matthieu Mayer though looks to be the one to watch, as he PR'ed 14 times, cut 2 players forward, and made a 4 AF cut: a much larger gain than the other three made.
21-50
#26 Fabien Jacques made good progress this week with 3 PRs. He moved up a place from 27th.
#31 Paul-Philippe Baehr had perhaps the most impressive progress in this range, with 12 PRs and 3 players passed.
#32 John Brunn is now right behind Baehr. He passed Robert van Zanten this week with a PR.
#34 Lucas Acek follows right behind as well. He PR'ed 4 times and passed two players this week. Nice work to him.
And our last active player in the top 50 is #43 Marvin Donjes who made 2 PRs this week and passed just as many players. Nice activity guys!

51-100
And, like I said earlier, the front was clearly the active portion of this news update. Although the 51-100 range makes up half the top 100 (obviously), only 5 players were active in it, and only 1 I would consider made any significant move. Either way, here were the actives!
#54 Bob Holden is the guy with the progress. He made 12 PRs this week and cut in front of 6 players on the ladder. Well done to him!
#76 Danny Gallenberger passed 1 player this week with 2 PRs.
#97 Kevin Borne made 4 PRs this week, and may soon be dueling with our newest top 100 entry #98 Sam Smith. Sam also made 4 PRs this week, but passed 3 players this week compared to Borne's 1. Nice to see activity out at this barrier. :)

101-Timbuktu
#104 Viktor Silivanov is the farthest away from the famous city in Mali, Africa this week in this range of players. He made 6 PRs and cut in front of a player. Good luck to him and his journey of 4-5 AF points left to reach the top 100!
Nothing happens here for a long time as I scroll down the stat sheet... ah.
#152 Tonny Su is the next player active, and what a gap of inactives! Ah well, they must all be near the top now. Keep up your good work Tonny. (He made 9 PRs and passed 2 players this week.)
Our second to last significant active player is #249 Julian Stephens. For some reason, I feel like I mention that name a lot. Maybe I do, maybe I don't. Anyway, he made 4 PRs and cut 7 spots forward this week. Good job on making it into the top 250!
Our last active is way down on the list this week. It is #342 Stephen de Winter. I'm not sure how he did it, but he submitted 22 PRs and only passed 1 player. Maybe it's because it's summer and he plays best in the cold? I don't know. Anyway, congrats on making the news update and making me wonder....

New Site Records
Matthieu Mayer beat the old Moo Moo Meadows crs time of 1'15"964 with a time of: 1'15"863
Paul-Philipp Baehr beat the old Mushroom Gorge lap time of 0'09"236 with a time of: 0'09"174

Awards
Working out with Web right now who's doing awards. They should be up in a day or two though; thanks for the patience.

I guess that wraps it up for now. Good job on the karting, and see you all next week!

fields.author: Webinator
fields.title: A Day Late and a Few Karters Short
fields.content:
Hey guys, sorry for the one day delay but I was busy yesterday. The karter turnout was better than usual (at least for my weeks), with almost 40 players hitting the controllers. There is still a hidden batch of you guys that have decided not to play. Shame on you all. Anyway, let's get down to it.

This news update covers July 17th to July 23rd, 2011.

The New Players
Just one noob this week.
Alexandre Agniel sent in 32 times. I think I might just stop mentioning people who don't send in flaps, and then this site will get a mass submission of every player's flap time. He's 231st right now, so a Top 150 finish may be in store with the rest of those times in (if they ever come in)

Movement
38 people decided to send in their MKW submissions this week, about the average.

Welcome to the AF chart goes out to nobody. I'm done here now. No long rant about those people who haven't submitted their times, because frankly they don't listen well.

~~1-10~~
The Top 10 has been kind of sad recently. Nobody is playing, or at least regularly 7 players aren't playing. That's good for everyone else but kind of depressing for this paragraph. A big shocker is that #5 Jay Batten was playing. He sent in 12 PRs and cut .79 AF points. He's under the 19 AF barrier and is now 4.7 AF points away from #4 Marc Bas. The other guy that was playing decided to continue the most exciting country battle in MKW's history. #8 Mark Schmidt sent in 3 PRs, 2 of them being the CM glitch times, and earned himself the distinction of German MKW Champion again. He cut .9 AF points and jumped from #11 to distance himself 1.5 AF points from Dustin Enders. Dustin should pop up in a week or so with 50 or so new PRs, so Mark has to stay vigilant and at the controller.

~~11-25~~
Five players were active here, which is a nice number for the amount that are in the group. #13 Cole Gilbert, #3 MK Combined was at the helm this week, sending in 7 PRs and moving from #14 up one place. He cut 3.21 AF points and again proved he's never done with this game. Ever. Directly after him is #14 Tony Ruiz, who lost the spot to Cole this week. Sending in 2 new PRs that are both SRs probably makes up for it though, and a 1.18 AF cut can't hurt. Next spot down is #15 Alex Shoal, who had one PR to knock off a little AF, but it was swallowed up by the other players and he gained about .3 this week. #23 Salvatore Bellusci played as well but his activity was minimal, 2 PRs and a gain of AF. Nice thing is he moved up a place since he gained less than #49 Artur Bauer. #25 Fabien Jacques sent in 3 PRs, moved up one spot and cut .96 AF. A nice week for him.

~~26-50~~
#28 John Brunn starts things off in this group. He had a great week as usual, with 6 PRs and a 2.56 AF cut, bringing him up four spots from #32. It wouldn't surprise me if by next week he'll be featured in the Top 25. #34 Liam Ashcroft didn't cut AF as usual this week, but with 3 PRs and moving up a place (he gained less), it can't be viewed as a loss at all. #36 Oliver Martin was back moving up one place with 2 PRs and a 1.02 AF cut. #39 Zane Royal used his epic white rMR pipes to kart his way to 6 PRs and a .39 AF cut. The big highlight was the move from 41st place. #43 Matthias Sempels had a 2.48 AF cut with 3 PRs, and moved up a place himself. #44 Marvin Donjes is quickly proving himself as a force in MKW lore. He had a 4 PR, 1.00 AF week, but dropped a place due to Matthias' superior move. Closing out the group is the pair of #47 Bob Holden and #48 Franco Gubser, although one outshined the other. Bob had 17 PRs, a 9.02 AF cut, and moved all the way from #54. Franco hit 2 PRs to move from #51 with a 3.17 AF cut. Brandon Sansui and Tim van Ham are the victims of the move, as they leave the Top 50 and drop to the depths below.

~~51-100~~
A karter looking to leave this group as he sees fellow competitors drop around him is #52 Sebastian Kovats, who had 5 PRs and a 4.37 AF cut that moved him up three spots. #64 Ross Coleman had a 4 PR week, but gained AF. #70 Danny Gallenberger continued the forward progress by hitting 10 PRs and cutting 6.51 AF points to move from #76 up 6 places. #73 Stacy Needham had a 4 PR, 2.64 AF cut week that drove him up a spot. The biggest mover here is #78 Dave Tandy, who had 22 PRs and moved from #83 with a 12.51 AF cut. He's been very active on the CM glitch discovery but found time to play other courses as well. Nice work! #82 Sofie Wimmer, female #2 cut 5 AF points exactly with 7 PRs, but couldn't change her ranking. She did pass Dan Boettcher but Dave Tandy's move negated that progress. #84 Andre Hoelscher had 13 PRs to jump from #94 with a 7.10 AF cut. Combined MK #2 #88 Michael Fried continued his progress as he PRed 2 times and moved up 4 spots with a 3.71 AF cut. #92 Kevin Borne was playing with 5 PRs and a 2.18 AF cut. He moved from #97 and is securing his spot in the Top 100. Closing out the group is the pair of #97 Viktor Silvanov and #98 Sam Smith, each with different stories. Viktor moved from #104 with 9 PRs and a 7.21 AF cut, and Sam sadly gained AF with 1 PR, although jumped Kevin Letailleur to negate Viktor's move. Dropped from the Top 100 this week is Virgil Blondel, a few weeks after he entered. Such is the harsh backlash of MKW.

~~101-END~~
#106 Fintan Kelly, official MKW hero and bringer of the separate charts had 24 PRs and cut 26.15 AF points, moving all the way from #124. #117 Sophie Steiner had 3 PRs and cut 1.29 AF points off her score, and impressive outing. #125 Cyril Fulag had 5 PRs, a 1.32 AF cut, and moved up 3 spots. #147 Christian Wild, #1 MK Combined and the guy that doesn't know the definition of inactive played with 1 PR, however gained AF. #178 Will Eudy had 2 PRs and cut 6.98 AF points, moving up three spots. #184 Murray Wright had 18 PRs, moved from #218 up a bunch of spots with a 29 point AF cut.

Movement outside the Top 200 was #239 Julien Stephens -12.39 AF and a move from #249.

Site Records
Due to finally allowing the new Coconut Mall glitch times onto the charts, a bunch of people got their times sent in. This resulted in the largest amount of people I've seen breaking a SR in one week, a grand total of 20 people got in on the action with flap and course times. I would list them all here, but I think you can all just check out the charts and see for yourselves. However, the final victor was Tony Ruiz, who grabbed his second and third SRs by taking both CM glitch WRs. By dropping Marc Bas one SR, Marc and Tony are tied for 5th on the charts. The other big loser was Andrew Grieve, who dropped from T-5th to T-10th, down to 2 SRs now.

On a happy note, we subbed both 69 and 68 minutes for total course and flap time! Yay glitches!

Tony Ruiz beat the old Coconut Mall crs time of 1'56"895 with a time of: 0'44"375
Tony Ruiz beat the old Coconut Mall lap time of 0'37"753 with a time of: 0'05"636

Awards
Had some catching up to do here. Here's the first three weeks of July's POWs.

1st July POW - Sure, he hoards but Dustin Enders does make massive leaps and always stays in contention. Awarded for 18 PRs, a 3.54 AF cut, and moving back into the Top 10 and taking the German crown.
2nd July POW - Jay Batten stole the show again with his 19 PRs and 2.5 AF cut. The 11% score reduction helped him start to bridge the huge gap to 4th place.
3rd July POW - No one in the Top 70 had a cut over 3% on their AF, so Danny Gallenberger wins this award. He had 8 PRs and moved from 76th to 72nd with over 3 AF cut and a 3.5% move.

~Web

fields.author: NStride
fields.title: Separate Charts
fields.content:
It is. To those of you who may not know yet, another glitch was found recently on Mario Circuit. Mario Circuit can now be found on the new non-glitch times on our site. Otherwise, you can submit your times to the combined charts to Tree Circuit.

Nah I'm kidding. It's still universally known as Mario Circuit, so keep calling it MC in your submissions. But I'm not kidding about the separate charts! Non-glitch charts have at long last been added to the site. You should see them on the left tabs in red. There is no AF charts with them yet though. But at least the non-glitch times people achieve are being accounted for.

So yeah. That's what's up. On the forums many new WRs have been discussed the past couple of weeks, and one I would like to mention in particular here.



This is the first World Record to sub 1'52 on Wario's Gold Mine by Nick Meade. This is quite the achievement, and the run is equally impressive. Be sure to watch it sometime if you haven't. Congrats to our former Site Champion on this great time! We may see a battle for this WR too in the coming days, as Marco van Turner accomplished a 1'52"041 PR himself, and Shaun Tanney scored a time just barely slower with promising splits.

So great job on the activity these weeks guys! The Mario Kart Wii forum rarely goes longer than 20 minutes without a new post. Lots of new TASes, vids, PRs, MKWii challenges, site issues and work for the separate charts, and more going on, and it's been entertaining to watch.

Now on to the movement and news. This news update covers the activity from July 24th to August 6th.

New Players

4 new players these last two weeks! Please welcome:

Dennis Antonov, Jason Crab, David Berger, and Will Dykstra to the site!

~Movement~

36 players were active the past two weeks in total. The activity was relatively proportionate, and it had its definitely motivated players and not-so-motivated players. I guess some people felt more of an urge than others to survive the coming zombie apocalypse.



This is the structure that #3 Shaun Tanney, #4 Marc Bas, and #5 Jay Batten are defending themselves in, along with the other members of the top 20. They are miles away from the center of the zombie epicenter, and all three are battling to reach the most inward chamber in the fortress, which is currently occupied by Jorge Hernandez. The fortress is armed by their many servants, who wield high powered machine guns and hand grenades, which represent their many strong PRs. The zombies have a long, hard battle to fight if they want to even come close to these three. #13 Tony Ruiz is a bit closer to the outer walls, but he added some weapons to his arsenal this week with his three PRs, and forced Cole Gilbert to trade with him and take his slightly less well-protected position. #15 Alex Shoal got some more ammo this week too with his PR. And facing the gate to the fortress with several hand grenades on hand as well as many 1-up mushrooms is #19 Fabien Jacques. This guy barged in the fortress the other day with a tank of PRs so strong that no one dared deny him access. He moved from #25 this week to this new position. Very impressive on his part.

Well done on being so prepared in that castle guys.



These are the pilgrims of the 21st to 50th position on the AF ladder. They have PRed enough to earn themselves tanks, but some have a much farther journey than others to reach the fortress of the top 20. Let's see who put their tank in gear these weeks and moved further from the encroaching threat.

#27 John Brunn led the way this week, though he barely pressed the accelerator. Still, it was enough to pass a fellow tanker and get closer to the fortress nonetheless.

#34 Liam Ashcroft also moved forward a bit, with his 5 PRs and slight AF cut. He's in good shape still to avoid the zombies, but you can't be too safe these days. Keep moving soldier.

#38 Zane Royal PRed four times, but he must have stopped at a gas station or a fast food restaurant or something, because he still only cut .3 AF. Oh well. He's still considerably far away from the zombies too.

#43 Bob Holden tied with #43 Matthias Sempels for this AF spot. However, it looks as if Holden will in the end Hold the spot , as he made a 6 point AF cut this week. Pretty impressive. Matthias was still active though with his 2 PRs.


This is the group of people who have not upgraded to a tank yet. However, you can tell from that guy in the front that his grin is his looking forward to the reward soon. Most people are found in this infantry; a good 100 in fact. This section will cover the work actions of those in the 51st - 150th positions.

The guy in the front is #53 Sebastian Kovats. He is literally inches from his tank upgrade. He only needs .7 of an AF cut to cover the rest of the gap into the top 50.

Two players a bit farther down decided to do some double time this week, and they passed 4 people and 7 people respectively: #60 Ross Coleman and #62 Danny Gallenberger. Both definitely made nice AF cuts, but they still have about 13 more AF cut to go before passing into the top 50. Keep marching!

#78 Dave Tandy made a 3 point AF cut or so this week too. He's almost caught up to the group of players in front of him now, so although he can see the zombies in the horizon behind him, it looks like maybe he'll pass them and let the zombies take them out first. Not far behind Dave is #84 Sebastian Wimmer, who made 14 PRs this week. With a pair of binoculars, I think Wimmer should be able to make out the first distorted zombie face behind him.

#89 Kevin Borne was also active this week, although it was just 2 PRs from him. However, he cut about 100 people on average for those two PRs, giving him a nice 2.7 AF cut. #95 Sam Smith and #107Noah Gordon also made 2 PRs this week, although they didn't cut as much as Kevin did. *NStride wonders if this is a group that decided to play MC.

#108 David Schiering had an impressive couple weeks with his 6 PRs. Although it was just 6 PRs, he still cut 12 AF and passed 11 players. Not bad at all. Hopefully he didn't hitchhike on the TAS plane to "fame". Pretty unlikely I think, as there are few airports so close to the zombies there, and the planes usually fly farther than 11 spots.

#121 Cyril Fulag was pretty close to the zombies, and he knew it. They were only a few hundred yards away from him in 125th, so he PRed 13 times and cut 7 AF to keep them at bay. Don't give up the fight!

The Zombies



That's in other words, those under 151st place. And that includes your very own news writer, #152 Zack Weber! He is on the verge of being not a zombie, but it will come at the cost of turning another player into one. And of course there will be the usual bloody fight over it too. His 1 PR is not very promising though.

Farther along in the ranks of the zombies are #174 Will Eudy, #178 Murray Wright, and #185 Tony Fan. All three of them made nice cuts this week, but especially Murray did with his 21 point AF cut. They may be zombies, but they're definitely coming after the rest of you!

#197 Sean Wilson made it into the top 200 this update, so congrats to him. His 11 point AF cut was enough to pass some odd 13 players. A bit farther down is our pretty much final mentions for this week. They are #230 Daniel Crutcher (nice last name for a zombie, no?) and #234 Julian Stephens. They are still zombies, and they have a long way to go to find the cure.

Our welcome to the Zombie-Chart award though goes to #386 David Berger. This guy joins the higher ranks of the zombies, because with an entry that low he probably isn't terribly interested in curing himself. We could be proven wrong, but he is not far from the king of the zombies, our last place AF player Peter Ferguson, so he might have connections with him. Oh well, welcome anyway!

New Site Records
As of this update, 2 new Site Records were updated, although I am sure there are quite a few more. Anyway, congrats to those who got updated. Specifically...

Dave Tandy beat the old Coconut Mall lap time of 0'05"636 with a time of: 0'05"624
Zane Royal beat the old N64 Mario Raceway crs time of 1'42"109 with a time of: 1'41"986


And... I think that covers everything! Sorry this news update was long in coming. Hope you were duly entertained though, and peace out. :)

~NStride

fields.author: NStride
fields.title: Non-Glitch Rules
fields.content:
This page might be out of date. Check this thread if you do not see a specific track addressed here. Last update: July 28th, 2018.

This entry covers the non-shortcut rules of the MKWii Player's Page. If you score a time and it seems like it's ranked higher than you would expect, chances are you may have used a shortcut; check the full-size images and descriptions to double check your PR before submitting!

No-Glitch/Non-SC Rules


Here is a list of glitches/shortcuts that are not allowed for times being submitted as "Non-SC/No-Glitch". Certain things that are allowed are also mentioned.

For the images, red is the banned shortcuts. The green lines and curves are allowed shortcuts/paths.

Mushroom Gorge (MG)
Image
- No riding on walls/mountain
- The 'Canyon Gap' that cuts the final turn is allowed, only if you don't ride the wall/mountain, clipping the wall is okay.


Mario Circuit (MC)
Image
- No clipping any trees to land on the track below.
- Using the ramp by the Chain Chomp is allowed.


Coconut Mall (CM)
Image
- No going out of bounds (below the Mall, through the Mall's walls, the car parking lot, etc)
- No using the shroomspot exit to skip the first U-turn


Wario's Gold Mine (WGM)
Image
- No hopping on/off any pipes or beams.
- The right-turn gap after the bat cave is allowed, only if you do not contact any of the beams.
- No using Lakitu to respawn you before the last turn to trigger a lap.


Maple Treeway (MT)
Image
- No going out of bounds/skipping checkpoints of any kind to make the No-Lap-Count SC after the Cannon
- The U-turn gap (after the Wiggler area) is allowed.


Grumble Volcano (GV)
Image
- No riding the rock by the start/finish line
- No jumping on/off any rocks (Yes, this includes the 'Rock-Hop' SC)
- No skipping across the lava next to the Rock Hop SC to force a Lakitu respawn glitch.


Bowser's Castle (BC)
Image
- No using any halfpipes to jump to the upper section of track (right before the triple thwomps)


Rainbow Road (RR)*
Image
- No going inside the fence by start/finish line to jump to the end of the lap, or down below on the wavy area.
- Using the gap right after the Figure-8 area is allowed.
- The 'Moonjump' at the beginning is allowed.


GCN Peach Beach (rPB)
Image
- No clipping of any trees to land onto the beach below.


SNES Ghost Valley 2 (rGV2)
Image
- No clipping of any walls/beams to skip portions of the track.


N64 Sherbet Land (rSL)
Image
- No clipping the start/finish pole to land in the water behind.
- Bouncing off the wall to help aid in the shroomspot is allowed.


GCN Waluigi Stadium (rWS)*
Image
- No bouncing on top of the banner to land before the halfpipe section


DS Desert Hills (rDH)
Image
- No clipping the wall at the beginning to skip the lake.
- Jumping on top of the wall to skip the lake is also considered a glitch.


GBA Bowser's Castle 3 (rBC3)
Image
- No using ANY of the yellow ramps to skip the two straights (Yes, this includes the 'Non-Ultra SC')
- You're still allowed to ride on the walls.


N64 DK's Jungle Parkway (rDKJP)
Image
- No clipping the tree to bounce off the start/finish line to land in the cave below.
- No jumping up through the fence to skip the spiral before the Cannon (known as the 'Spiral SC/Cut')


GCN DK Mountain (rDKM)
Image
- No clipping through any fences to land in any area down below.
- The chasm SC right before the final turn is allowed.


N64 Bowser's Castle (rBC)
- No clipping the wall at the bridge (before the spiral) to fall into the lava to spawn up above.
- Riding the walls is allowed.


***No player has yet to make any glitch on rWS and RR to save time, therefore no seperate Non-SC charts/rankings for these tracks exist. All rWS and RR times are updated in the Combined ranking.

Please note that our main/default ranking is Combined. If you did a time as Non-SC/No-glitch and forget to label it as so in a time submission, it will be updated as a Combined time!

fields.author: Webinator
fields.title: Announcement
fields.content:
Hey guys, Webinator here.

It's been a while, and I'm sorry about that. But if you haven't seen on the forum, life has gotten in the way of kart for me and because of that, I'm going to retire from news updating and moderating. It was a fun year and a few months that I did it, and I thank you all for your support and advice on my entries.

Sorry it has to end.

~thewebinator, aka "the one day late newswriter"

fields.author: MrL1193
fields.title: Catching up with the times
fields.content:
Hello, Mario Kart Wii Players' Page. This is your new writer, MrL1193, here. As you've probably heard, Andy has been extremely busy with school lately, and since Web has finally taken his well-earned retirement, Andy asked me if I could help with the news updates. I'll be flying solo for now, but we'll be trying to find a suitable alternate writer for the future, so expect to see another new face sometime soon.

This update will pick up right where the last one left off, covering activity from August 6th to October 9th. Expect a rather large wall of text, as there's been a lot of activity of late to report.

New Players

19 players joined the site in these past 9 weeks. Please welcome Stephen L, Andrew Catapana, Phillipp Helmers, Andre Morales, Brandon Pata, Abraham Pagan, Alexis Lesieur, Martin Blue, Ryu Yuki, Steven Ly, Matthew Everitt, Mikel Nelson, Zubin J, Florian Truetschel, Stefan Glosby, Adam Frederick, Max Reese, Declan Haines, and Jason Weekes. Of these 19, only 4 joined with full timesheets and will be pointed out later.

Movement

131 players sent in their times during the gap in news updating. Due to the sheer number of active players, I can't possibly mention everyone, so only the highest-ranked players are guaranteed recognition for activity.

~~1-10~~
Starting at the top, Champion Jorge Hernandez submitted 3 PR's these past two months. It wasn't enough to actually lower his AF, but it did fend off a heavy hit from the players taking advantage of the new Mario Circuit and Coconut Mall glitches, which could have pushed his AF into the double digits for the first time in quite a while. #2 Nick Meade defended himself likewise but also added a few PR's on other tracks for a total of 7. It still wasn't enough to overcome the AF deficit, though, and he actually took more of a hit than Jorge. Continuing the trend, #3 Shaun Tanney submitted 9 times including Mario Circuit and Coconut Mall times and also failed to cut AF. He did, however, creep closer to Nick; Shaun has been closing the gap for some time now, so a pass could happen in the future. #4 Jay Batten was the one to break the losing streak; he submitted a whopping 30 PR's to knock more than 2 full points off his AF and pass #5 Marc Bas, who PR'ed twice but still lost a lot of ground on the new glitch tracks. #6 Jak Russo made an impressive 15 PR's and cut more than 4 points of AF, enough to shoot past 3 players--a big move considering he was already in the Top 10. Rounding out the activity in the Top 10 are the German duo #8 Dustin Enders and #9 Mark Schmidt. The two have been dueling for the title of German Champ for many months now, and for the moment, Dustin is on top by a slim .1875 lead. He submitted 17 PR's, 3 more than Mark's 14, and passed both Mark and retired former champion Bubbles. Mark cut a bit of AF, but not nearly as much as Dustin; he surely hasn't given up the fight yet, however.

~~11-25~~
Just outside the Top 10, there was quite a lot of movement going on. #11 Tony Ruiz made his bid for fame and moved up two spots. He sent in 11 PR's, the same number as his new rank. #13 Tyler Mcnell was one of Tony's victims; with 18 PR's, there was no shortage of new times on Tyler's part, but he still lost AF and 1 position. #14 Alex Shoal moved up one rank with 6 PR's and a decent .8 cut. #15 Thomas van Deerse made a particularly big jump with 30 PR's, moving up 7 places and cutting 17.6% off his AF. #16 Cole Gilbert submitted 2 PR's but lost ground and two positions to Alex and Thomas. #17 Alvin Le and #18 Fabien Jacques submitted 8 and 9 PR's respectively and moved in tandem, each cutting AF and passing one player to remain together. A few places down, Irish Champ #21 Daniel Raftery made a big jump with 17 PR's and a cut of more than 7 AF, gaining 8 places. #22 Artur Bauer also had quite a few PR's to send in--12, to be exact. He moved up 3 places with his improvements. Swedish Champ #23 Eric Hacksell submitted just 1 PR; it mitigated his AF backslide by almost 1 AF, so it must have been a pretty good PR. And finishing off this section, #24 John Brunn nabbed a solid 16 PR's and moved up 3 spots with a 2.6 AF cut, while #25 Salvatore Bellusci did what he could with 11 PR's but still lost a position and some ground in AF. Former champion Alvin van Asselt was forced out of this group as a result of all the movement, though he did have some new times to report.

~~26-50~~
To try to limit the length of this update, from this point on, I'll only be mentioning those who made some sort of positive movement, either in AF or in position, or made some supreme effort in getting new PR's.
#29 Liam Ashcroft is the first in this group to meet this requirement; he PR'ed 9 times for a solid 2.5 AF cut, gaining 5 positions. #30 Paul-Philipp Baehr was pushed back by Liam's move, but he forged ahead with 8 PR's and managed a net gain of 2 places. #31 Mickael Smolen submitted 5 PR's and cut a bit of AF. This would have been enough to gain some places, but due to the leaps of the players around him, he stayed right where he was. #34 Lucas Acek made 8 PR's; his AF number still increased, but not as much as his neighbors' did, so he moved up one spot. #36 Zane Royal, currently #6 in 3-Laps, set 15 new times and moved up two places with a small AF cut. With more effort put into his flaps, he could become a serious contender in the overall Top 10. #38 Bob Holden also got 15 PR's, but cut more than 3 AF and gained 5 ranks. Glitchmeister #40 Marvin Donjes has been hard at work on the new Coconut Mall and Mario Circuit glitches ever since they came out; he still found time to muster a total of 13 PR's though, enough to knock off a decent amount of AF and pass 5 players. Next up, we have a newcomer to the full AF rankings, #43 Marvin Steven Eckhardt. He finally got around to filling out his timesheet, submitting 63 PR's and joining at fairly impressive rank, to the annoyance of the 362 players below him. #47 Clement Rouchon had the biggest jump out of the players in this group; he submitted a set of 29 PR's and rocketed up 21 places, latching onto the tail end of the Top 50. Kyle R ends this section, with a strong 19 PR showing that was just enough to gain 5 places and secure a spot in this group, leaving Franco Gubser just barely hanging on to the group with slight activity.

~~51-100~~
Starting off the next group down, we have #51 Alberto Fiorese. His 9 PR's weren't enough to keep him from being knocked out of the group above, but he did cut almost 1 point of AF. The next karter who has something positive to show for his efforts is Wheeler #57 Danny Gallenberger. With his solid 18 PR's, he made a move of 5 places, cutting almost 7 points of AF. Passing over another inactive karter, we come across one of the rare Japanese players on the rankings, #59 Harp Valentine. His 6 PR's were enough to cut 1.8 AF and keep him in place in the rankings. #65 Dave Tandy has been making impressive strides lately. Like Marvin up above, Dave has been hard at work on the new glitch tracks, but he also managed to make a very solid cut, shedding 11.8 AF and moving up 13 places. #69 Nate Paternost was one of the karters Dave passed, but Nate made a solid cut of his own, with 12 PR's and a 7 place move despite initially being set back by Dave. #73 Simone Bertini's 14 PR's were enough to cut a few points of AF and gain one rank. Next up is a karter who's been playing since the release of the game, #78 David Schiering. A former site champion, David apparently decided to start playing again, and has submitted 30 PR's over these past two months, yielding a fantastic 30 place move back into the Top 100 and a 34.0000 AF cut. That's a 23.6831% cut, more than anyone else in this news update. Nice comeback, David! Next we have another player with a freshly filled out timesheet, #86 Sean Owens. His 13 new times were enough to net him a relatively comfortable position in the Top 100, and he seems ready to work his way up further. #88 Sam Smith and #89 Viktor Silivanov made sizable moves toward the newcomer, Sam moving 7 places with 15 PR's and Viktor moving 9 places with 19 PR's. Both of them avoided being narrowly pushed out of the Top 100 with their activity. And finally, #92 Alex Vandegrift did likewise with 28 PR's; however, he only cut about half as much AF and so only moved up 5 spots. It hardly seems fair, but since he's still in the Top 100, he probably isn't too jealous.

~~101-405~~
This section, being the largest, saw a lot of AF cuts from the players as usual, so I'll only be pointing out new guys and the players who actually gained positions. The first of these is #102 Noah Gordon. With his 12 PR's, he climbed 5 places closer to the Top 100, and may very soon actually make it back in. #107 Loris Bagnasco also climbed 5 places, but he demonstrated his superior efficiency by doing so with only 5 PR's and actually cutting more AF than Cutz. #109 Martin Prigent worked his way toward the Top 100 as well, with 11 PR's and 10 places gained. And just a bit lower, #112 Luke Berrill pulled out 23 PR's for a 14 position jump. There's quite a bit of potential outside the Top 100; a lot of these guys have been in the Top 100 before, and I wouldn't be surprised to see them in it again before long. #117 Jamal Fluellen is on his way up as well; with his 16 PR's, he passed 6 more karters on his way to the Top 100. #119 Marco van Turner made a sizable cut as well, with 25 PR's and a 12 place improvement, and #125 David Lee was up 16 places with 13 PR's. #132 Tom Norton found time in between Banana Cup improvements to amass 17 PR's and gain 24 positions. If he ever manages to fully balance his timesheet, he'll be a force to be reckoned with. #135 Tomas Pallaruelo reported 13 PR's, enough for an 8 place cut. Further down, #149 Tonny Su managed 9 PR's and cut 4 places, while #151 Will Eudy sent in a whopping 45 for a 23 rank improvement, leaving Combined Rankings champ Christian Wild sandwiched in between them. #161 Jose Karica, unlike the other guys mentioned here, didn't cut AF. However, his 5 PR's slowed his descent enough for him to pass 2 people, so he gets mentioned as well. #171 Eric Shore sent in an impressive 43 PR's and moved up 18 positions. Hot on his heels is #174 Nicola Torre, the biggest mover this update just going by ranks gained and AF cut; he only needed 20 PR's to cut 43.6 AF and 33 places. #175 Murray Wright gained 3 places with 5 PR's, while #179 Sean Wilson jumped 18 places with 40 PR's. Meanwhile, #200 Daniel Crutcher made the third-largest cut of this update, with 34 PR's, 31.3 AF cut, and a 30 place move. It's not as easy to make big cuts like these in the upper ranges, so enjoy them while you can. #222 Dave Johnston made 23 PR's and improved by 6 positions, while #231 Julian Stephens got 16 PR's and improved by 3 positions. These guys have been diligently working their way up through the ranks for quite a while now; it shouldn't be long now before they break into the Top 200. Continuing down the ranks, we come to a series of newcomers to the AF chart and newcomers to the site as a whole: #233 Luke Allen, #248 Florian Truetschel, #266 Iacopo Sorce, #303 Mikel Nelson, and #349 Max Reese. Hopefully, we'll soon see some activity in the lower ranks from these guys; only time will tell. Down close to the bottom, we now come to the last active non-newbie: #370 David Berger. If nothing else, this guy definitely deserves some sort of recognition for effort, as he improved 62 out of his 64 times in these past two months. He cut just over 30 AF and 16 positions, not as many positions as those guys in the tighter-packed 100's, but still a commendable effort indeed. Keep it up, David! Finally, to end it all, we have newbie #391 Stefan Glosby. He joins quite close to the bottom, but with diligent effort, he could make some big cuts down here.


Site Records
A whole bunch of Site Records fell during the past two months, and there was a flurry of activity on the recently glitched Mario Circuit. Each of the two records was claimed by 20-30 different people at various times before finally coming to rest as detailed below. On the Site Records table, Daniel Raftery gained one to move into a three-way tie for 3rd with 4 records; Marvin Donjes leaped from 0 to 2 records, tied for eighth; and Rhys Ogle, Yu Nakano, and Daniel Crutcher all appeared on the table with 1 each. Tom Norton and Dave Tandy each traded 1 record for another, Sword remaining tied for 6th with 3 and Silver remaining tied for 13th with 1. The losers were Marc Bas, who lost 1 and dropped to tied 8th with 2; Cole Gilbert, Tony Ruiz, and Andrew Grieve, who each lost 1 and dropped to tied 13th with 1; Alex Shoal, who gained 1 but lost 2 and also ended up with just 1; and Aziz Abdullah, who, through the technicalities of updating, lost his only record and dropped off the table.

Dave Tandy beat the old Mario Circuit crs time of 1'21"764 with a time of: 1'05"218
Marvin Donjes beat the old Mario Circuit lap time of 0'25"325 with a time of: 0'09"749
Marvin Donjes beat the old Coconut Mall crs time of 0'44"375 with a time of: 0'44"318
Daniel Crutcher beat the old Coconut Mall lap time of 0'05"624 with a time of: 0'05"607
Ethan McCormac beat the old DK's Snowboard Cross lap time of 0'35"377 with a time of: 0'35"358
Cole Gilbert beat the old GCN Peach Beach crs time of 1'13"114 with a time of: 1'13"097
Zane Royal beat the old N64 Mario Raceway crs time of 1'41"986 with a time of: 1'41"732
Tom Norton beat the old DS Delfino Square crs time of 2'05"303 with a time of: 2'05"167
Yu Nakano beat the old DS Desert Hills crs time of 1'35"317 with a time of: 1'35"269
Daniel Raftery beat the old GBA Bowser's Castle 3 crs time of 1'58"856 with a time of: 1'58"615
Alex Shoal beat the old N64 DK's Jungle Parkway crs time of 2'12"401 with a time of: 2'12"318
Rhys Ogle beat the old GCN DK Mountain crs time of 2'06"862 with a time of: 2'06"858

Unfortunately, I don't currently have access to the non-SC stats, so I can't comment on those. But rest assured, they'll find their way into the updates eventually--at the very least, the Site Records, if nothing else.



Well, I think that covers just about everything. Sorry about the gigantic news update; hopefully, they'll be shorter again once we're back on schedule. And before I finish, I'd like to publicly thank Web for his service as our news writer through busy and stressful times; there's nothing like writing an update yourself to appreciate the effort that goes into it.

That's it for now. See you next update!

~MrL1193/John (aka JJ)

fields.author: MrL1193
fields.title: A return to normalcy and inactivity
fields.content:
Hey guys, MrL1193 here, bringing you your weekly news update. Nothing particularly out of the ordinary happened this week, so I'll just get to the news without delay.

This update covers October 9th to October 16th, which is in fact a period of 7 days and not 8 according to the stats program. Hopefully this will solve the problem of missing days in the updates.

New Players
Three new challengers appeared this week.
Jason Belles joined with the typical 32 times. His course-only timesheet tentatively ranks him at 403rd for now.
Samuel Laryea sent in just 5 times, which is still better than nothing. He would theoretically be ranked just above Jason at 402nd if their other times were all ranked last.
Michael Miller was the most promising of the rookies. His 32 times (which, oddly, consisted of 31 courses and a flap) place him at 264th, which isn't bad for only half a timesheet. Hopefully he'll send in the rest of his times soon.

Movement
A scant 27 players were active this week, which is bad news for Mario Kart Wii but good news for those who did play, as they get more of the spotlight and less of the AF backsliding. Let's see who they were.

~~1-10~~
European champion #3 Shaun Tanney was the highest-ranked active player this week. With his 2 PR's, he cut a little bit of AF and continues inching toward Nick. #8 Mark Schimdt was the only other active player here. He PR'ed 3 times and gained a position, taking his German crown back from Dused. No doubt Dused will show up again a month from now with 16 hoarded PR's, so Mark shouldn't relax just yet.

~~11-25~~
Though there wasn't much movement here, the activity level was somewhat higher in this group than all the rest this week, as one third of the players were active. #14 Alex Shoal was the first of these, chipping away at the roughly 3.5 AF gap in front of him with 2 PR's. Right behind him is Dutch champion #15 Thomas van Deerse, who closed the gap between them this week by PR'ing thrice rather than twice. #18 Fabien Jacques also claimed 2 PR's, but he too has a bit of empty space to climb through before he can rank up. #23 Salvatore Bellusci was the only player in this group to move; he sent in 5 PR's to cut nearly 2.4 AF, leapingfrogging 2 karters. #24 John Brunn would have gained a place with his 4 PR's and a 1.9 AF cut, but because of Dashi, he stayed put.

~~26-50~~
Just outside the Top 25, we come to #26 Paul-Philipp Baehr, whose name always makes me double-check my spelling. With an impressive 12 PR's, he made a strong cut of almost 5 AF and climbed over 4 players. #30 Liam Ashcroft was one of his victims; Lash cut AF with 2 PR's but got stepped on by Paul and fell back a spot. #38 Marvin Steven Eckhardt joined the full AF chart only recently and he shows no signs of slowing; with 11 PR's this week, he jumped 5 places and cut nearly 4 AF. Among the karters he passed were #40 Marvin Donjes and #43 Matthias Sempels; Marvin managed to hold his position with 3 PR's, but Matthias could only manage 1, and lost both a position and some ground in AF.

~~51-100~~
Considering that this section contains twice as many players as the last one, you'd expect to find more active players here. However, only a meager 2 karters were active this week. Those two were #56 Harp Valentine and #58 Danny Gallenberger. Harp made a nice 3 place move with 5 PR's and 4.5 AF cut, and may soon be leaving this rubbish heap to rot as he moves toward the Top 50. Danny's outlook is a little bleaker, as his 1 PR wasn't enough to overcome the AF deficit and he lost a place to Harp. However, Danny has been gaining positions steadily for quite some time, so he'll probably be able to overcome the setback.

~~101+~~
Finally, we come to the last and largest group, which didn't have very many active players either. A few karters here are still struggling upward toward the fabled (yet inactive) Top 100, though; among these is #108 Martin Prigent. With 4 new PR's, he managed to move one place closer to the 100 mark. New Zealander #127 Dexter Howe also gained one place, but he did it with only 2 PR's and a smaller AF cut. A bit further down, we have a player who's only just finished his timesheet; welcome #147 Martin Blue. He starts off at a respectable rank; time and effort could see him in the Top 100 soon. #151 Will Eudy was set back one place by Martin's appearance just above, but he was able to crank out 5 PR's to break even in positions and cut ~1.3 AF. Down in the lower ranks, #213 Dave Johnston made an energetic move of 9 places, cutting over 10 AF with 12 PR's. And to finish it all, we have #275 Andrea Gardina, who PR'ed thrice but cut less than 1 AF and lost a spot because of Martin. Don't give up, Andrea; with some more work, you'll make some progress yet.


Site Records
Only one new Site Record this week, but it's a significant one. With the introduction of a new strategy for the Coconut Mall glitch, we finally subbed 51 minutes in total course time. The record in question didn't change hands, though the holder did have to fend off Harp Valentine, Fabien Jacques, Matthias Sempels, and Danny Gallenberger to retain it.

Marvin Donjes beat the old Coconut Mall crs time of 0'44"318 with a time of: 0'40"515



Well, that's it for this update. See you next week!

~MrL1193

fields.author: MrL1193
fields.title: Short and Sweet
fields.content:
Hello, this is your news writer MrL1193 here again with another thrilling report on Mario Kart Wii activity. It'll be a bit short again due to lack of activity, so hopefully the quality of it will compensate.

This update covers October 16th to October 23rd.

New Players
No new players this week.

Movement
Only 20 players were active this week, even less than last week. Hopefully this downward trend won't continue much longer. The good news is that I'll be mentioning everyone who PR'ed this week.

~~1-10~~
The Top 10 was quiet this week, with only the sounds of #3 Shaun Tanney's controller clicking to break the silence. He made 2 PR's but still suffered a net loss in AF, a common curse of the Top 10. He continues to creep closer to inactive Nick, and is expected to make the pass for #2 before long.

~~11-25~~
Down in the next group, #15 Thomas Van Deerse managed a PR but it wasn't enough to cut AF or positions. #21 Salvatore Bellusci and #22 John Brunn were the winners here, moving in tandem up the ladder. Each gained 2 places with similar AF cuts, Dashi cranking out 6 PR's and JJ nabbing 3.

~~26-50~~
Comparing the number of PR's to the progress made by the players, things seem to be a bit backwards in this group. #32 James Richards overcame the AF treadmill with minimal effort this week, cutting some AF with only 1 PR. And expanding on this theme of efficiency, #40 Matthias Sempels cut more than 3 AF and passed 3 players, also with just 1 PR. He accomplished all this by working on Grumble Volcano this week, which just goes to show you how much a single neglected track can bring down your AF. Remember to keep your timesheets balanced, guys! The other active karters here didn't get quite as much satisfaction out of their work. #41 Marvin Donjes's 3 PR's just barely saved him from AF backsliding but didn't save him from being knocked down a position by Fisico, while #49 Franco Gubser obtained the opposite result with his 3, falling back a bit in AF but gaining a spot to rebound from the brink of the Top 50.

~~51-100~~
Starting off this group, we have everyone's favorite Wheeler #57 Danny Gallenberger. With 3 PR's, he continues to steadily progress toward the Top 50, gaining 1 position and cutting ~1.3 AF. Right in the middle, #75 Stacy Needham turned out 6 PR's and also gained 1 place, though his AF cut was just short of a full point. #82 Andre Hoelscher sent in 10 PR's for an impressive cut of over 10 AF and jumped 8 places--quite an accomplishment, but not the biggest move this week. No, that recognition goes to #91 Martin Blue. After completing his timesheet last week, he sent in 25 more PR's this week for an incredible cut of more than 60 AF, rocketing up 56 places and landing in the Top 100. Assuming it was all done in 1 week, that's some seriously impressive karting work there; just don't forget that sleep is important too, Martin!

~~101+~~
Meanwhile, outside the Top 100, #128 Dexter Howe may be left feeling a bit robbed; his ~2.2 AF cut with only 1 PR is the model of efficiency, but he can do little more than shake his fist at Martin as he drops a position to the maniac. #136 Tomas Pallaruelo likewise fell victim to the speed demon, his respectable 2 PR's and ~1 AF cut proving insufficient to counter the loss. #149 Tonny Su and #153 Victor Pavao, on the other hand, didn't feel these effects as they were already behind Martin at the start of the week. Each of them submitted 4 PR's this week, Tonny gaining 1 place and Victor climbing 2. Just behind them, #158 Fabio Sacco filled out his timesheet and joined at a respectable rank. The last active karters this week felt the effects of his appearance, as #233 Julian Stephens and #372 David Berger each PR'ed and cut a bit of AF but still lost a place to Fabio. Don't get discouraged guys; with more practice and studying videos, you could make the Top 200 in no time!


Site Records
The Site Records front was also quiet this week, with just one new record to report.

Marvin Donjes improved his own Coconut Mall crs time of 0'40"515 and subbed 40 with a time of: 0'39"903


I guess that's it for this update. Barring unforeseen changes, I'll be seeing you again next week, just before Halloween. Until then, keep karting everyone!

~MrL1193

fields.author: MrL1193
fields.title: Happy Halloween
fields.content:
Hello, and Happy Halloween everybody! I hope you're all enjoying your night, whether you're partying, hitting up houses for candy, handing out the candy, or just hiding in bushes waiting to scare the living daylights out of little kids. This update is a bit late because the times updating fell behind this week, but at least it conveniently gives me an excuse to do this on Halloween. I'll be covering the activity from October 23rd - October 31st.

New Players
Just one new player this week: Rob Jon, who joined with a full timesheet.

Movement
33 of our karters played Mario Kart Wii this week--or just got around to sending in their times, I suppose. Let's see who they were.

~~1-10~~
Starting off, we have the Top 10, who I guess could be considered the VIP's of the big Halloween bash. Apparently, most of them decided to come as ghosts, because there's precious little activity to be seen here. Only #2 Shaun Tanney showed signs of life, as he PR'ed 4 times for quite a nice cut of over half a point of AF. With that, he finally passed former long-reigning champion Nick Meade for the #2 spot. Champ Jorge doesn't seem to be afraid, though, as there's still a gulf of 4 points between them.

~~11-25~~
In the next group of players, #15 Thomas van Deerse PR'ed twice but found himself in the same position as before with slightly more AF. #19 John Brunn made progress, however, with 7 PR's yielding a 3 place cut. #22 Salvatore Bellusci was none too pleased about this, as he was knocked down a spot, but he still cut AF with 6 PR's.

~~26-50~~
Several karters were active in this group, but these guys seemed to be having trouble making progress. #32 James Richards and #36 Zane Royal were two of these unfortunates, each one finding his 1 PR insufficient to cut places or keep from backsliding in AF. #39 Marvin Donjes was undaunted, however, as he demonstrated perfect efficiency by cutting 2 places with 2 PR's. #49 Franco Gubser, unfortunately, fell victim to the 1 PR curse and lost ground, but cutting losses is still better than nothing, I suppose.

~~51-100~~
In contrast to the last group, most of the active players here made big cuts. #56 Dave Tandy was the first of these, with 24 PR's earning him a nice 9 place cut. #58 Danny Gallenberger, the lone victim in this group of the 1 PR curse, lost a place as a result, but he still didn't pick up as much AF as he could have. #66 Thomas Ullrich updated his timesheet with 38 new PR's and made a huge cut of exactly 33 AF and 28 places, knocking off nearly a quarter of his old AF. His move outpaced new up-and-comer #75 Martin Blue's, but Martin was undeterred, his 18 PR's and 26 AF cut shooting him up 16 places. #91 Viktor Silivanov got pushed back by the two leapfroggers, but his 5 PR's and 2 AF cut held his position loss to 1 instead of 2, at least. Finally, #99 Frederick Hutchington gave a vivid demonstration of why it's a bad idea for partiers to stand too close to the 100 door, as he charged in with 9 PR's and an 11 place cut. He mauled Carlos Eduardo in the process and left him out on the porch as a warning to other would-be party crashers, leaving Thibaud Bordeau to guard the doorway.

~~101+~~
Meanwhile, out in the front yard, #104 Noah Gordon stared longingly at the door and started moving toward it, but fell victim to the 1 PR curse and was quickly passed by Frederick. #108 Martin Prigent almost managed to get closer with his 1 PR and small AF cut but ended up in the exact same position as before, again due to Nosey's move. #128 Dexter Howe was yet another victim of the 1 PR curse, as he fell back in AF and stayed in place. #141 Blake Germany had better luck, as he moved at double speed with 3 PR's and a 6 position improvement. #149 Tonny Su and #151 Will Eudy made solid cuts in AF with 3 and 2 PR's respectively, but didn't actually move up in places. It's a good thing for Will that he played, though, because #152 Fabio Sacco would have passed him if he hadn't. As it is, Fabio still got himself a nice 15.25 AF cut with 10 PR's and subbed 200 in AF, passing 6 guys in the process. Appearing to fill the vacancy left by Fabio is #158 Michael Miller, a newcomer to the full AF chart. He makes a solid debut, and his recent activity promises further improvements. Next up is #169 Pierre-Emmanuel Medus, who made the biggest raw AF cut of the update. With 24 PR's, he jumped 21 places and knocked off more than 42 points from his AF. #178 Murray Wright felt the effects of those last two players' activity, as he found himself 1 rank lower than before. He still cut almost 3 AF with 11 PR's, though.
Farther afield, newcomer #213 Rob Jon joined the site at a respectable rank; with more work, he could make the Top 200 very soon. #214 Dave Johnston worked hard, earning 7 PR's, but he didn't move in the rankings. #232 Julian Stephens did, though, his 5 PR's bumping him up one spot. And rounding out the Top 300, #274 Andrea Gardina found the time to play Mario Kart Wii as well, it seems, sending in 12 PR's to gain 2 places.
Way out in the graveyard where no one plays, #369 David Berger showed that he's still alive and kicking. He churned out 13 PR's, making his way past the resting places of 3 departed karters. And finally, down very close to the end of the line is #404 Kristopher Lamp. I think this may actually be the first time I've seen someone in the 400's pick up a controller and play. Kristopher hasn't let his position get him down, as he's turned up from time to time to send in new times. This week, he submitted 16, but alas for him, he ended up 1 rank lower due to new arrivals above. I think we could all learn a lesson from him about perseverance, though--you're never too low to improve.



Site Records
There were 3 new Site Records this week. As far as Site Record possession goes, no one was knocked off the table this week. Blake Germany was the only new record holder who didn't have any others before.

Blake Germany beat Ethan McCormac's old DK's Snowboard Cross crs time of 1'49"502 with a time of: 1'49"366
Shaun Tanney beat Marc Bas's old Koopa Cape lap time of 0'44"404 with a time of: 0'44"367
Thomas Ullrich beat his own old Grumble Volcano crs time of 0'19"581 with a time of: 0'19"578


Well, that's it for this update. I hope you'll excuse any incoherencies that may have accumulated as a result of being distracted by trick-or-treaters... :P Anyway, I'll see you next week. Happy karting and Happy Halloween everyone!

~MrL1193

fields.author: MrL1193
fields.title: It's raining, it's pouring, the old man is snoring...
fields.content:
Hello again, MrL1193 here to bring you another boring update on this damp November night. I hope the weather is better wherever you are than it is here in California; I'm posting this update after 1 AM because this is the first chance I'm getting after the thunder and lightning. This update will cover activity from October 31st - November 6th.

New Players
1 new player this week. Welcome Carter Clem, who joined with the usual 32 courses. His half timesheet puts him at a theoretical rank of 230, which is pretty good for a start. Hopefully he'll look up his lap times soon.

Movement
26 players were active these last 6 days, which seems to be about the typical number nowadays. We'll have to wait and see if it holds up once Mario Kart 7 is released.

~~1-10~~
We start things off as usual with the Top 10--which, this week, is not actually the Top 10 but rather the Top 11. 11 was also the number of PR's #4 Jay Batten submitted; with them, he cut more than a full point of AF and nabbed a SR. The only other player active here was #10 Tony Ruiz, who sent in 6 PR's to cut ~1.2 AF and move into an exact tie with ex-champ Bubbles for the end spot in the group--hence why there are 11 players covered in only 10 ranks. No doubt this situation will change by next week, but for now you can just enjoy watching my paragraphs get messed up.

~~12-25~~
Meanwhile, in the newly shortened group just below, #14 Thomas van Deerse decided that he was tired of PR'ing without making any headway and sent in 6 PR's this time, enough to cut 1.75 AF and pass 1 player. The only other activity came from #19 John Brunn, whose 1 PR wasn't enough to make either of those kinds of progress.

~~26-50~~
Activity picks up a bit in the next paragraph as we find more karters active here. The first of them is #32 James Richards. With his lone PR, he exactly halved his AF losses, which still marks some progress relative to the other players. #35 Marvin Donjes, however, wasn't willing to settle for such a small victory and instead made a very efficient cut of 2.5 AF and 4 places with only 3 PR's. #38 Matthias Sempels made a similarly efficient cut with 2 PR's, moving 3 places and cutting ~1.8 AF. And #44 Martin Blue decided on a plan of full-blown massacre, jumping 31 places with 20 PR's. Martin's been moving up the charts in leaps and bounds lately; I wouldn't be surprised if he finds his way into the Top 25 by next week. Finishing this section, #49 Zack McNell cut a bit of AF with 2 PR's but still lost a spot to Martin.

~~51-100~~
With the exit of Martin, the lower half of the Top 100 wasn't left with much activity. There were still a few guys who made some progress, though, such as #56 Danny Gallenberger. With 4 PR's, he made a nice 2.2 AF cut and gained 2 places even as Martin shot past him. Following this, we have a long empty space of Inactivity...and after it,#83 Andre Hoelscher. Andre sent in 7 PR's, enough for a nice 4.4 AF cut and 1 position gained. And closing out the Top 100, we have #91 Viktor Silivanov. His 1 PR wasn't enough to cut AF, but he didn't fall down as much as the guys around him, at least.

~~101+~~
Activity outside the Top 100, like the activity within it, was rather spread out. #104 Noah Gordon managed a PR, but it wasn't quite enough to nullify his AF losses. Almost 50 places lower, however, #151 Will Eudy did manage to cut a full point of AF with 1 PR. He didn't pass anyone this week, but he's in good shape to do so next week. #158 Michael Miller's 2 PR's, on the other hand, were strikingly unhelpful in terms of AF; surprisingly, it seems that he only made a cut of 1 position on the individual times charts between his 2 PR's. Ah well, AF isn't all that matters, I suppose. #164 Jose Karica made a PR this week and cut a bit of AF, but stayed in place as well. #171 Eric Shore was the first to make a move here, with 10 PR's yielding a nice ~5.2 AF, 4 position cut. #193 Munim Peerally made one as well, with 8 PR's earning him a big 17 place move and an almost 17 point AF cut. And the last big mover of this update was #202 Dave Johnston, who skimmed over 13 karters with his 10 PR's and ~11.1 AF cut. We're not done with the small moves yet, though. Recent newcomer #211 Rob Jon cut 2 places with 4 PR's--a good sign, as it shows that he actually has intentions of playing now that he's got a timesheet up. #232 Julian Stephens PR'ed 3 times, but the resultant ~1.2 AF cut wasn't enough for him to pass anyone. #273 Andrea Gardina continued his Mario Kart Wii activity this week with 9 PR's, enough to cut ~5.6 AF and 1 position. And finally, #275 Samuel Laryea completed his timesheet this week and joined the AF chart at the tail end of the Top 300 and this update.


Site Records
There were 4 new Site Records to report this week. Glitch tracks were the most prominently featured, including the newly popularized GCN DK Mountain glitch. On the Site Records rankings, Jay Batten managed to get onto the table by taking one of Paul-Phillip Baehr's 4 SR's, knocking Paul down to T5th with 3, and Tony Ruiz doubled his count to 2 for T8th and knocked Dave Tandy off the table. Danny Gallenberger almost made an appearance, but Jay Batten beat him out before I could acknowledge his SR.

Tony Ruiz beat the old Mario Circuit crs time of 1'05"218 with a time of: 1'04"984
Marvin Donjes beat the old Coconut Mall crs time of 0'39"903 with a time of: 0'39"770
Ethan McCormac beat the old DK's Snowboard Cross lap time of 0'35"358 and achieved the first DKSC God Flap with a time of: 0'35"298
Jay Batten beat the old GCN DK Mountain lap time of 0'39"902 with a time of: 0'39"716


And with that, my job here is done. I bid you all good night--or good morning, or whatever it is for you... :doze:

Zzzzzz...

~MrL1193

fields.author: MrL1193
fields.title: November Cooldown
fields.content:
Hey guys, MrL1193 here again. It's time for the weekly news update, and once again, I've put it off until nighttime. Ah well, better late than never, eh? Fortunately for me, the activity level dropped with the temperature this week, so it didn't take as long as usual. This update covers November 6 - November 13.

New Players
2 new players this week: Josh Miller and Christian Sari. Each of them joined with the usual 32 times, Josh theoretically slotting in somewhere around 334 and Christian at about 253.

Movement
Only 15 players showed up as active this week, though about half of all the players showed up as earning an AF cut due to a player being deleted. I suspect that there should be more karters to mention, but because of the way the timing of the updates worked out, a good chunk of activity will have to wait until next week. Oh well, that just leaves more space in this update for everything, I guess.

~~1-10~~
We start off in the Top 10 with one of the usual suspects, #4 Jay Batten. With 5 PR's, he made a sizable move toward #3 Nick Meade. #8 Aziz Abdullah was active as well with 4 PR's, though his rank didn't change either. And down at the lower border, #10 Tony Ruiz broke his previous week's tie with David McPartland by sending in 4 PR's, 3 of which were SR's--quite the enviable feat. Also, this is the first time in more than two and a half years that Bubbles hasn't been in the Top 10; it's a testament to the strength of his times that it took this long to finally happen, and would have taken even longer without new glitches.

~~11-25~~
In the "Almost Famous" group, we find exactly as many active karters as in the Top 10. They were all quite close together, as it happens. #18 Artur Bauer started off as the lowest-ranked of the three, but he submitted 12 PR's to jump 6 places, finishing above the other two. #20 John Brunn and #21 Salvatore Bellusci were each knocked back a place, but they still played to cut their losses. John made a minor cut with 2 PR's, while Salvatore made a bigger one with 5 and almost overtook John.

~~26-50~~
The lower half of the Top 50 proves to be the third group in a row to contain exactly 3 active karters. #30 Liam Ashcroft cut some AF with 2 PR's, but didn't move. #34 Marvin Donjes did, however, passing one karter with 6 PR's and a pretty big AF cut. And down at the bottom of the group, #50 Franco Gubser managed a PR but couldn't quite push himself any further from the brink. He's been hovering around here for a while now; time will tell whether he'll be able to hang on.

~~51-100~~
The area below the Top 50 marks a sharp dropoff in activity, as the often inactive half of the Top 100 didn't fail to disappoint. Out of 50 karters, only one had anything to report: #92 Sam Smith. He only showed 1 PR, but it was worth a decent cut in AF by itself. There was no movement by anyone here.

~~101-410~~
Not to be outdone, the last group of the update contained 310 players total but only 2 active players. Those two happened to be neighbors, both to start and to finish. #150 Fabio Sacco started the week just below #151 Will Eudy, but proceeded to pass both Will and one other karter with just 2 PR's, cutting several points of AF in the process. Will managed to hold his ground with a lone PR, though, and thus stayed close to Fabio. And with that, we're already done with the movement!


Site Records
The Site Records scene was all Jarv this week, as Tony Ruiz stole 3 SR's to move up to 3rd place with 5 total. Marvin Donjes dropped to tied 11th with just 1 left and Jay Batten and Rhys Ogle were knocked out completely.
On an interesting side note, Aziz Abdullah briefly took the DK Mountain course record with a time of 2'06"265 before Jarv claimed it with the glitch. Doom's time remains the Non-SC World Record, though, and is still a new Non-SC SR. I don't have the means to track all the Non-SC SR's at the moment, but for now, you can enjoy the inclusion of just this one.

Tony Ruiz beat Marvin Donjes's old Coconut Mall crs time of 0'39"770 with a time of: 0'39"645
Tony Ruiz beat Rhys Ogles's old GCN DK Mountain crs time of 2'06"858 with a time of: 2'05"748
Tony Ruiz beat Jay Batten's old GCN DK Mountain lap time of 0'39"716 with a time of: 0'39"385

That concludes my part of the update. Web has been working on awards lately, however, so keep an eye out for a possible update on those. And, regardless of how that goes, I should be seeing you next week. Until then, take care, and happy karting!

~MrL1193

fields.author: MrL1193
fields.title: Early Christmas gifts?
fields.content:
Hey guys, it's been another week. Time for another news update--and also, an announcement. For some time now, the awards section of the site has been rather neglected, but that ends now. All awards up through the second week of November have now been updated, and you can thank your former news writer Zack Weber a.k.a. The Webinator for most of them. Be sure to check them out; you may have won some of your own!

New Players
There were 2 new players this week: Anthony Caiulo and Anton Tamminen, who could well be Mario Kart twins. They each joined with the typical 32 course times and rather similar theoretical AF as well. Anthony currently slots in at 318, while the similarly-named Anton appears at around 322.

Movement
29 players sent in PR's this week--or last week, in some cases. If you thought you made an improvement last week but weren't mentioned, you'll probably find your overdue credit in this update.

~~1-10~~
In the Top 10, only the usual two British players were active: #2 Shaun Tanney and #4 Jay Batten. Shaun only PR'ed once for a slight reduction in AF losses, while Jay PR'ed 4 times to actually make a slight cut. They've both managed to climb up a bit in the ranks recently, and with current and former champions Jorge and Nick inactive, there's plenty of opportunity for each of them, if they can cross the AF gaps ahead of them.

~~11-25~~
As is often the case, the next group down from the Top 10 is the most proportionally active one this week. #13 Tyler McNell sent in 6 PR's for a nice AF cut, though he fell just short of passing Jimmy Benson. #14 Thomas van Deerse managed an AF cut as well with 2 PR's, but even as he moved forward, Tyler was pulling further away from him. #17 Fabien Jacques, however, easily overtook 2 karters with 5 PR's and a big ~3.2 AF cut. His AF improvement was proportionally the largest of the update, at roughly 7%. And closing in on the spot Fabien left is #20 Salvatore Bellusci. With his 5 PR's, he cut just over half a point of AF and passed #21 John Brunn, whose 1 PR couldn't quite neutralize his AF loss.

~~26-50~~
Just outside the Top 25, #26 Paul-Philipp Baehr moved closer to the next group with 7 PR's, knocking more than a whole point of AF off his score to end the week at exactly 52 AF. His rank didn't change this week, but with another nice improvement like that one, he should be able to earn his promotion. Fellow German #33 Marvin Donjes was also active with 6 PR's, managing to beat Paul's cut by exactly a quarter of a point and 1 rank improvement. And down below, #49 Zack McNell beats the AF treadmill for the week with 1 PR. Both he and #50 Franco Gubser have been hanging on by a thread lately; with some new faces knocking on the door of the Top 50, they'll need to step up their pace if they want to stay in it.

~~51-100~~
