Right below the slow-moving guys, we have a veritable three-ring circus, as several karters simultaneously make large strides forward and play musical chairs in their bid for the Top 50. #52 Sebastian Kovats decided to submit 10 PR's this week to cut around 2 and a half points of AF and pass three karters. #55 Danny Gallenberger filled the vacancy he left behind, cutting ~2.2 AF with 3 PR's and passing one karter. And #56 Dave Tandy filled the vacancy he left behind by passing 2 karters with 6 PR's, cutting over 3 points of AF. The only other activity here was down at the lower end of the group, coming from #93 Frederick "5" Hutchington. Frederick sent in 5 PR's, cut ~5.5 AF, and passed 5 karters. Somebody give that guy a high five, 'cause he deserves it.

~~101+~~
As we exit the Top 100, it becomes more difficult to see who really made progress in AF, as there was a player deletion that affected a lot of players. #103 Noah Gordon definitely made progress, though, as he made another attempt to reenter the Top 100. His 3 PR's yielded a 1 place move and ~1.4 AF cut. #126 Dexter Howe made a nice, neat move as well, climbing 2 ranks with 2 PR's. #139 Tonny Su made a big jump, with 11 PR's pushing him forward 10 places. #150 Will Eudy managed to gain a spot with 3 PR's. Meanwhile, #191 Munim Peerally and #198 Dave Johnston jumped on the "pass 1 player per PR" train as well, choosing 2 and 4 respectively as their lucky numbers. #205 Daniel Crutcher and #232 Julian Stephens, on the other hand, missed the train and didn't go anywhere with their 3 and 1 PR's respectively. And finally, we come to #269 Andrea Gardina and #354 Christophe Charignon, who are widely separated in rank, but were seemingly united in their motivation to play--Combined Rankings points. Each of them passed 4 players, Andrea with 7 PR's and Christophe with 15. And that finishes the movement section!


Site Records
There was just 1 new SR this week. The result of it was that Paul-Philipp Baehr and Tony Ruiz have both ended up in a 4-way tie for 3rd place, with 4 SR's each.

Paul-Philipp Baehr beat Tony Ruiz's old GCN DK Mountain lap time of 0'39"385 with a time of: 0'39"037


I'll try to keep the awards updated from now on, and starting next week, I plan to add them to each update. In the meantime, enjoy your Thanksgiving guys! (And if you're not American, I guess you can just take advantage of this week to pass some distracted karters, hehe.) :hehe: See you next update!

~MrL1193

fields.author: MrL1193
fields.title: Rules in review
fields.content:
Hello, MrL1193 here to bring you the weekly news. I hope you guys had a happy Thanksgiving (assuming you're American, that is).


Now, before I get to the actual update, I'd like to take a moment to draw attention to the process of times submissions. It seems that a number of you guys don't quite understand the proper procedure to ensure that times are updated quickly and accurately, so I think a brief review of certain points is in order. Here are some basic guidelines to follow:

Make sure you include your name in your messages. You can put it in either the subject or the message body, but make sure it's there. Otherwise, your times will not be updated. Don't rely on us recognizing you by e-mail address either, as one person can be submitting times for multiple people in some cases. It's a simple policy, really--if we don't know for sure whose times they are, then we don't update them.

Use the official site abbreviations for the courses. You can find the full list of these on the "Joining Info" page. You can also type the full name of the course, but you have to be careful not to make a typo in doing so. The reason this is important is that we updaters use a tool called a parser to extract information from messages, and the parser is not as adaptable as a human being. If a message is formatted incorrectly, it will either make an error or not recognize the score at all. For example, both "Moonview Highway" and "MH" would be acceptable, but "MVH" would not. Similarly, "N64 Bowser's Castle" and "RBC" are fine, but "R Bowser's Castle" is not.
A related problem that occasionally crops up is getting the names and times of certain retro tracks inadvertently mixed together. This can happen quite easily; simply typing, "SNES Mario Circuit 3: 24.500" for your flap will result in the parser picking up the time "3:24.500," which is not what you want. Use some other symbol, such as a dash, to separate them instead of a colon.

Don't put all your PR's on one line. This is also for the sake of the parser; if you put all your PR's on one line, the parser reads them as all being for the same course. Use proper line breaks to make sure that doesn't happen.

Separate your SC and Non-SC times in your message. This makes it much easier to sort and check them. And, of course, if your times are all of one type, don't forget to specify whether they are SC or Non-SC. It makes our job much easier if you eliminate the guesswork.

And finally, don't forget to double-check your submissions to make sure they're free of typos. We can sometimes catch typos for you, but there's no guarantee that we'll know what you intended to type. Save time and make sure you get it right the first time.

Now, let's get on with the news, shall we?


New Players
Two players joined the site this week, the same number as last week. Welcome Michael Rippstein and Kenneth Kang. Michael's only starting time was a Yoshi Falls lap, which was impressively ranked at #3. Kenneth's 32 course times gave a better estimate of his overall ability, putting him at approximately 244th.

Movement
An average 25 players reported new times, though I wouldn't have thought it to look at the full AF chart movement. I guess the guys with incomplete timesheets were busy as well this week, but that concerns us not.

~~1-10~~
As usual, #2 Shaun Tanney was active this week. With 4 PR's, he would have broken even in AF if not for the appearance of newbie Michael and his YF lap. Right behind him, #3 Jay Batten didn't slow his pace for a moment, as he cut another .375 off his AF with 6 PR's--a huge move at such a high rank. He passed former champ Nick Meade and is now barely a tenth of a point away from taking Shaun's title of UK and European champion. Chronic hoarder #6 Dustin Enders showed up this week as well, this time with 12 PR's bringing an enormous ~6.1 AF cut, more than a fifth of his total. Dustin passed three karters, though one, Aziz Abdullah, pulled a magic trick and somehow stayed at the same rank without doing a thing. And #10 Tony Ruiz shows that he's here to stay, as 8 new PR's push him further into the Top 10.

~~11-25~~
There wasn't a whole lot of activity to report outside the Top 10. Slow but steady, #14 Thomas van Deerse sent in another PR this week, but still took a hit in AF. #21 John Brunn fared a bit better, as his 1 PR yielded a slight cut, but he still didn't quite pass anyone.

~~26-50~~
The second quarter of the Top 100 was quiet as well this week. Near the top, #27 Kevin Mason sent in 3 PR's to gain 2 places, and down below, #49 Zack McNell and #50 Franco Gubser submitted 2 PR's each to distance themselves from the pack below. Zack still lost ground in AF, but Franco made good progress, and they're now almost even with each other.

~~51-100~~
Continuing on, we find none of the regulars of this group. Instead, #67 Andre Hoelscher popped up this week with 17 new PR's, cutting almost that many points of AF and 16 places. The only other active karter here was #93 Jon Coppernoll, who gained a spot with 4 PR's.

~~101+~~
Just outside the Top 100, #101 Noah Gordon reported 2 new PR's and passed two players. He's been working on reentering it for a while now, and looks set to do so very soon. #119 Joshua Leutz PR'ed twice as well, but didn't move up or cut AF. A good bit lower, #191 Munim Peerally made a strong cut of ~5.8 AF with only 2 PR's, but also failed to gain positions. #238 Florian Truetschel did, however. 26 PR's catapulted him forward 14 places and took more than 20 points off his AF. #267 Andrea Gardina continued his Mario Kart Wii activity this week with an efficient move of 2 places with 2 PR's. And finally, #348 Christophe Charignon also stayed active, moving 6 places with 16 PR's.


Site Records
There were two more Site Records to report this week. Tony Ruiz broke the tie for third place to claim it for himself with 5 SR's, while Paul-Philipp Baehr lost a SR and dropped to tied 6th with 3.

1'59"945 improved his own Moonview Highway crs time of 1'43"687 with a time of: 1'43"666
Tony Ruiz beat Paul-Philipp Baehr's old GCN DK Mountain lap time of 0'39"037 with a time of: 0'38"896

Awards
The 3rd POW of November goes to Jay Batten. While other karters update their times irregularly, Jay remains constant, climbing ever higher. This week, a solid 4 PR's knocked around 0.74% off his AF and put him within striking distance of third place.


That wraps it up for this update. Happy karting everyone!

~MrL1193

fields.author: MrL1193
fields.title: The late gales of November
fields.content:
Hey guys, it's news time again. I know this update is a couple days late, but I didn't forget about you guys. A couple different problems transpired to cause delays. The first was a surprise windstorm that knocked out the power in my area for a couple days. (I thought we were supposed to have earthquakes in California, not hurricanes... :confused:) Actually, though, that didn't affect the news, since it happened in the middle of the week. The other, more troublesome problem was with the site's updating pages, which kept me from updating times this weekend. I actually could have written up the news if I'd wanted, but since that would have meant an incomplete news update (which no one likes), I decided to wait for the problem to be fixed. So, to compensate, you get to read about the events of a little more than a week this time. This update covers November 27 - December 6.

New Players
5 players joined the site in the time between updates, a bit more than usual. It's a good sign, as the site will want new players to make up for those distracted by the recently-released Mario Kart 7.
Qi Zhu sent in 62 times for a start. His theoretical rank is #158 for the moment--quite solid--so hopefully he'll fill in those last two times soon to join the full ranks.
Kenesu Kuro came up with 31 times in his debut, one less than the usual and exactly half as many as Qi Zhu. With several Top 10 times to his name, Kenesu's theoretical rank for the moment is #194--pretty impressive for having less than half a timesheet, though it still won't garner as much recognition as an actual rank.
Ryan Crawshaw sent in 2 starter times, which doesn't say much about his potential. Theoretically, he would be 412th, but that's hardly an accurate estimate.
The other two newbies, Claire March and Jordon Gabbard, joined with full timesheets and will be mentioned later.

Movement
A good 25 players were active these last 9 days, a nice change from recent weeks.

~~1-10~~
As is often the case, the Top 10 was rather quiet. Only #2 Shaun Tanney reported a new PR, and it wasn't enough to overcome the AF treadmill. He did pull away from Jay Batten a bit, however, slightly strengthening his position as European Champion.

~~11-25~~
The Top 25 area didn't have much more to report on, with only two more players active. #14 Thomas van Deerse played enough to earn 3 PR's, but as in past weeks, he failed to cut AF. #20 John Brunn was a bit more successful, with 2 PR's allowing him to pass a karter to reenter the Top 20.

~~26-50~~
Activity picks up slowly but surely with the Top 50 group, which featured three other active karters. #32 Marvin Donjes sent in 3 PR's and somehow managed to gain a place while moving backwards in AF. #35 Matthias Sempels made a more straightforward move, cutting AF and passing 3 players with 2 PR's, one of which was #38 Zane Royal. He submitted a PR but still lost a place because of Fisico, and he didn't cut AF, either.

~~51-100~~
Following a trend, the fourth group in the update happens to have 4 players active. DKJP master #57 Max Awesome sent in 28 PR's after a long break and jumped 18 places. Just below him, #59 Dylan Imhoff finally filled in his flaps and joined the rankings, demoting a whole bunch of karters below. At the moment, Chouy's flap times are still far weaker than his course times, so he still has plenty of potential for improvement if he feels like it. Lower down, another player returning from a break, #85 Alex Vandegrift, submitted 24 PR's to gain 10 positions. And finally, #94 Frederick Hutchington made a good cut of ~3.3 AF with 4 PR's, but his movement was canceled out by Dylan's and Alex's activity and left him right where he was before.

~~101-415~~
It falls to the last and largest group to provide the bulk of the activity this update. #127 Dexter Howe managed a PR, but lost a place because of Dylan's entry above. #145 Brett Edwards, however, made good progress with 2 PR's. In lieu of a 945 to claim, "Mr. 1'59"945" settled for passing 3 karters to take a numbered position that bears some slight resemblance to his favorite numerals. #151 Will Eudy also made 2 PR's, but lost to the AF treadmill and got bumped down a position, again due to Chouy. #159 Zack Weber slid back in AF as well, but at least his 1 PR anchored him in place on the rankings. A bit lower, #166 Christian Sari made his debut, with the submission of his flap times earning him a respectable starting rank. Former karts-only player #195 Tony Fan returned to submit a PR, but received a double demotion from the new entries above him. Outside the Top 200, #243 Anton Tamminen filled out his timesheet for a decent starting position; he seems interested in the game so far, so hopefully we'll see some more progress from him soon.
To finish this section, we have to go far, far down, to a region that's mostly comprised of players who simply don't care any more. Web's brother #383 Quassim Weber apparently isn't one of these dead players, though. He took a 2 place loss because of new AF entrants, but his 2 PR's were enough to keep it from becoming three. And finally, at the very end, we have our newbies of the update, #407 Jordon Gabbard and #415 Claire March. Jordon's times are of interest mainly because he claims that they were all set with the Shooting Star; it doesn't seem to have helped his ranking, but it's unique. Claire's entry is noteworthy for a different reason--namely, that she(?) has taken from Peter Ferguson the dubious honor of having the highest number next to her name on the full AF rankings. She seems ready to improve, though, so she may shed that distinction before long.


Site Records
None. Nada. Zip. Zilch. Zero. Yep, that's right, there were NO new Site Records this week. It's a pretty safe bet that Neos will have one for us next update, though, so you can look forward to that.


Awards
November 4th POW: Jay Batten - In yet another impressive week, Jay finally overtook Nick for third place with 6 new PR's. He cut nearly .4 AF, more than 3% of his total.
November POM: Dustin Enders - Although Jay reported more PR's, Dustin earned bigger cuts. Yet again reclaming his German crown from Mark Schmidt, Dustin cut ~5.7 AF, almost a fifth of his total, and moved from #9 to #6.


That'll do it for this update. No doubt you guys will be too busy with Mario Kart 7 to play much Mario Kart Wii in coming weeks, but remember: if you get tired of the game, Mario Kart Wii is still here for you! Have fun, and happy karting!

~MrL1193

fields.author: MrL1193
fields.title: And then there were 7
fields.content:
Hey guys, it's time for another quick news update. But before I get to that, I'd just like to mention that the Mario Kart 7 site is up and running now, so be sure to check that out if you haven't already. You can give feedback in the Mario Kart 7 section of the message boards.
Now, as for Mario Kart Wii, since last week's update was delayed and lengthened, this one ended up being shorter than usual to compensate. This update covers December 6 - December 11.

New Players
None since the last update.

Movement
With a mere 5 days to work with, only 12 players came up with new PR's, so this should be a short update, made even shorter by the fact that I can't judge anyone's AF cuts accurately due to a player deletion. Oh well, it's not like you care about all those extra numbers anyway, right? That's my job, not yours.

~~1-10~~
Only the usual suspect, #2 Jay Batten, was active here. With 4 PR's, he passed Shaun Tanney to become European Champion on the site.

~~11-25~~
The Top 25 as a whole didn't seem to be much affected by the shorter updating period, as approximately the usual number of players were active. #14 Thomas van Deerse, one of the regulars of this section, PR'ed twice and drew a good bit closer to #13 Tyler McNell. #20 John Brunn also PR'ed twice with a pair of Non-SC Ghost Valley 2 times, including a short-lived Flap WR. However, former GV2 king #22 Jamie Disley had something to say about that, and returned to reclaim his Flap WR from John in less than a day. His lone PR hardly had any impact on his AF, but he still managed to pass a player with some help from the usual vicissitudes of the AF chart.

~~26-50~~
Though not many got a chance to play this update, #32 Marvin Donjes was active as usual. His lone PR was only a small improvement, but every little bit counts, especially in the higher ranks. Meanwhile, #47 Dave Tandy released a massive 26 PR hoarded submission and jumped 9 places, straight into the Top 50.

~~51-100~~
#55 Danny Gallenberger gets this section all to himself, as the other 49 karters were inactive. Although he was passed by Dave, Danny's 2 PR's kept him from dropping a position and got him another step closer to the Top 50.

~~101+~~
Outside the Top 100, #126 Dexter Howe gained 1 spot with 1 big PR on Shy Guy Beach. #159 Zack Weber was also busy on that track and got a sizeable PR of his own, though his ranking didn't improve. And farther back, #229 Anton Tamminen submitted 9 PR's for a major cut of 14 places.


Site Records
None, unless you count the activity on GV2 Non-SC Flap that I already mentioned. Alas, the Non-SC part of the site still is not tracked by the stats program. Hopefully that will be remedied eventually.


Awards
Hey guys, Web here. John asked me to cover for him on the award since he was one of the top candidates for it, and he turned out to be the winner!

December 1st POW: John Brunn - for non-hoarded players, Brunn stood above the rest. His two PRs netted him a 1.34% AF cut, which was better than the other regularly-active players could do.

I'll go back into my inactivity cave now. ~Web

That's all for now. Happy karting everyone!

~MrL1193

fields.author: MrL1193
fields.title: Making a list and checking it twice
fields.content:
Hello everyone. MrL1193 here again, with your usual news update and an announcement. Recently, it's seemed as if we've had to delete or freeze suspected or proven cheaters on a nearly weekly basis. Well, just recently, suspicion fell upon our #2, Jay Batten. After some commotion, Jay provided all the necessary proof and was cleared of all charges. The result of this was that he was given the first green proof check of the Mario Kart Wii rankings and the community started going through the list of players to see who else has been naughty or nice. If you think you deserve to have a proof check, feel free to apply for one, providing any evidence necessary. For the moment, the qualifications for each check are roughly as follows:

Yellow: This mark simply shows that you're a trustworthy player. If you have a long history of honesty in Mario Kart or you've provided sufficient pictorial and video evidence of your times, you can receive this mark. We'll also likely give you one of these without any application if someone reliable vouches for you.
Green: This mark indicates hard evidence that you're the real deal. Videos and pictures aren't enough for this; you need to actually play while reliable players watch you live to see if your skill matches your times. You don't necessarily have to set up a real-life meeting with someone; streaming over the internet works as well, as long as you let us know about your play session beforehand so we can watch. Just make sure to follow all the proper guidelines while streaming (ask our judges for more info on what these are, either before or during the stream).

And now, let's get on with the news.


New Players
There were 3 newcomers this week.

Leo Petiard, unlike most fresh players, actually completed a timesheet. We'll see how he fared later in the update.
Oliver Luyckx scraped up the usual 32 course times--good enough for approximately 236th but no official rank.
Leon Williams joined with an odd 13 times, hovering around 368th.

Movement
25 karters found time in the midst of Christmas shopping to play--or perhaps just submit their times.

~~1-10~~
Only one karter at the top had anything to report this week. #1 Jorge Hernandez submitted 1 PR this week, a Coconut Mall glitch flap, which took almost a full point off his already-single-digit AF. #2 Jay Batten, who was silent this week, had been creeping up on him, but it now seems unlikely that the crown will be changing hands any time soon.

~~11-25~~
Just outside the Top 10, #12 Ruby Aruba sent in 7 PR's for a nice cut in AF, enough to pass Jimmy Benson. It's a good thing he did, too, because #13 Thomas van Deerse had a strong week as well. He cut about as much AF with only 3 PR's, also passed Jimmy, and would have overtaken Aruba as well if Aruba had stayed inactive. #22 Jamie Disley, recently made a return to Mario Kart Wii, and this week, he made 2 more PR's for a slight cut of AF.

~~26-50~~
#30 Liam Ashcroft was active as well this week. He turned out 2 PR's to cut some AF. And down at the border, #49 Franco Gubser fought his way back into the Top 50 with 3 PR's. He only passed one player, but thanks to a player deletion above him, he gained two spots.

~~51-100~~
#55 Danny Gallenberger managed a PR this week. He didn't quite cut AF, but, like Franco, he gained a free spot on the rankings. Other karters behind new AF entrant #69 Leo Petiard stayed put, though, as Leo's appearance bumped them right back down. Undeterred, #92 Frederick Hutchington decided to pass 2 player with 2 PR's anyway. #95 Loris Bagnasco updated 26 of his times all at once for a 16 place move, jumping straight into the Top 100. And rounding out the group, #100 Noah Gordon also makes it back in after a long struggle just outside it. He followed Frederick's example and also cut 2 places with 2 PR's.

~~101+~~
Meanwhile, out in the less glamorous ranks, #104 Carlos Eduardo had a new time to report. He still fell back a place because of Loris's move, though. #135 Brett Edwards updated 7 of his times, skipping past 10 karters. #150 Will Eudy moved up 1 position, PR'ing 3 times and ending the week with precisely half a point less in AF. #152 Fabio Sacco's lone PR, however, didn't gain him any places, though he cut AF. #158 Zack Weber was quite busy this week, climbing up 1 place with 4 PR's. #166 Eric Shore sent in some PR's as well, earning a nice 7 place cut with 8 PR's.
Beyond this week's subgroup in the Top 200, we find #225 Anton Tamminen. He kept up activity in the game with 11 PR's and rose 4 positions. A little lower, #234 Julian Stephens passed 1 player with 1 PR and stayed dead even in AF. And finally, much farther down, #415 Claire March made an impressive effort of 21 PR's, but still has yet to make any headway in the rankings yet. Don't worry, with persistent effort, you'll improve soon!


Site Records
For the third week in a row, there were none. Hopefully this isn't becoming a habit. Maybe we'll see more once the Non-SC section of the site is finished.


Awards
December 2nd POW: Jay Batten - Another week, another award for Jay. Having dispelled any doubts about his legitimacy, Jay cut more than 2% off his AF total with 4 PR's.

That's all for now. The next news update probably won't be until after Christmas, as I'm not likely to get to write one on the actual day. Merry Christmas, and see you next update!

~MrL1193

fields.author: MrL1193
fields.title: Christmas Karting
fields.content:
Hello everyone! I hope you guys had a merry Christmas this year. The community got several nice Christmas presents in the form of new WR's; rather than deterring karters, the holidays seem to have spurred them on to greater feats, and there's quite a bit to write about. This update covers December 18 - December 26.


New Players
Just one this Christmas: Steve Bernelli. He joined with only 4 times, but one of them was a Site Record. His theoretical rank is #404 for the moment.

Movement
Christmas break brought in a good deal of activity, with 35 players either playing or finally getting their times updated.

~~1-10~~
The chase for the crown continues through Christmas as #1 Jorge Hernandez tries to pull further away from #2 Jay Batten. With 3 PR's to report, Jorge made a pretty big cut for his level, but Jay still managed to close in a bit with his 8 PR's. Interestingly, Jay is one of only 3 players in the Top 10 to have no Site Records, despite being so close to the top; he'll have his work cut out for him if he wants to beat Jorge's impressive total of 8 SR's. And speaking of SR's, #7 Jak Russo and #8 Aziz Abdullah each had one to report. With 10 total PR's, Jak cut almost twice as much AF as Doom, but Doom was the one who moved up a spot, despite having only 2 new times.

~~11-25~~
The 5 different players active in this group all had something in common: Their ranks stayed exactly the same. #12 Ruby Aruba was the only one to cut AF, with his 6 PR's knocking off around 1.5 points. #13 Thomas van Deerse played too, but with only 2 PR's, he couldn't catch up. The other players, #15 Alex Shoal, #20 John Brunn, and #22 Jamie Disley, PR'ed once each but took a net loss in AF.

~~26-50~~
#30 Liam Ashcroft kept busy in the week leading up to Christmas, earning 2 PR's to make a little progress. Meanwhile, #36 Clement Rouchon submitted 12 PR's to cut exactly 12 places. #44 Dave Tandy submitted another batch of times as well--10, to be exact--but only gained 2 places this time, as Clement shot past him. And rounding out the group, #49 Franco Gubser and #50 Zack McNell continued their usual policy of doing the bare minimum necessary to stay in the Top 50, with 2 and 1 PR's respectively.

~~51-100~~
One karter who has an eye on the two easy marks just above is #51 Sebastian Kovats, whose 7 PR's brought him up 1 position to the doorstep of the Top 50. #52 Max Awesome came close as well, with 10 newly submitted times bumping him up 4 spots. #64 Leo Petiard seems to be of the "Minimum Effort, Maximum Gain" school of thought, as he jumped 5 places and cut almost exactly that many points of AF with only 2 PR's. #88 Jon Coppernoll didn't do too badly himself, though, cutting 9 places and ~9.7 AF with 10 PR's. And finishing this group, #98 Noah Gordon set about solidifying his Top 100 status, with 3 PR's bringing him up from #100 to give him a bit of breathing room.

~~101+~~
#117 Joshua Leutz showed himself a candidate for the Mr. Efficiency title as well; with just 1 PR, he gained 3 places, though with a less impressive AF cut than the guys in the last paragraph. #126 Dexter Howe made a decent AF cut as well with 2 PR's, but stayed in place. #134 Tomas Pallaruelo had a solid week as well, with 3 PR's moving him up 4 places. #158 Zack Weber took a net loss despite his 2 PR's, though, but #179 Murray Wright drove one PR more to climb up a spot. #230 Julian Stephens decided that he likes orderly progress, and, in 1 week, cut exactly 2 points of AF with 3 PR's and moved up 4 places.
Meanwhile, down in the quicksand of the lower ranks, #393 Jordon Gabbard improved 59 PR's, almost his whole timesheet, and moved up 14 places into the Top 400. The new #407, Kristopher Lamp, wasn't as lucky, as all the effort he put into earning 40 new PR's only moved him up 2 places. He still fared better than #415 Claire March, though, who PR'ed 15 times but still hasn't been able to move up at all since joining the site. Hopefully they'll all keep trying until they can escape up to less hostile regions.


Site Records
Christmastime brought a mass update of top times, including 8 new Site Records, causing quite a shakeup in SR totals. Aziz Abdullah, Lee Robbins, Sergio Mera Gallardo, Jak Russo, and Steve Bernelli all went from 0 to 1, while Jamie Disley, Max Awesome, and Andrew Grieve each doubled their count to 2. Romain Smadja dropped from 6 to 5 but is still 2nd only to Jorge Hernandez. Tony Ruiz's total fell from 5 to 3 and knocked him down to tied 4th, the same as Nick Meade, who also lost 1 SR. Paul-PhilippBaehr's 1 lost SR dropped him to tied 8th with 2 left, and Alex Shoal, Yu Nakano, and Blake Germany all lost their only SR's and dropped off the table entirely.

Matthieu Mayer improved his own Moo Moo Meadows crs time of 1'15"863 with a time of: 1'15"859
Andrew Grieve improved his own Toad's Factory crs time of 1'51"070 with a time of: 1'50"897
Lee Robbins beat Tony Ruiz's old Coconut Mall crs time of 0'39"645 with a time of: 0'39"599
Andrew Grieve beat Blake Germany's old DK's Snowboard Cross crs time of 1'49"366 with a time of: 1'49"100
Steve Bernelli beat Paul-Philipp Baehr's old Wario's Gold Mine crs time of 0'33"801 with a time of: 0'33"724
Jak Russo beat Nick Meade's old Maple Treeway crs time of 2'17"683 with a time of: 2'17"532
Lee Duggan improved his own Dry Dry Ruins crs time of 1'48"359 with a time of: 1'48"275
Jamie Disley beat Romain Smadja's old Moonview Highway lap time of 0'33"323 by 1 millisecond with a time of: 0'33"322
Aziz Abdullah beat Yu Nakano's old DS Desert Hills crs time of 1'35"269 with a time of: 1'35"114
Max Awesome beat Alex Shoal's old N64 DK's Jungle Parkway crs time of 2'12"318 with a time of: 2'12"175
Andrew Grieve beat Tony Ruiz's old GCN DK Mountain crs time of 2'05"748, but Sergio Mera Gallardo surpassed them both with a time of: 2'02"241


Awards
3rd POW of December: Thomas van Deerse - With a solid 5 PR's, Thomas finally made it past an AF gap and gained another place. He cut ~1.56 AF, just over 4% of his total.

That'll do it for this year's news. Merry Christmas and Happy New Year!


~MrL1193

fields.author: MrL1193
fields.title: New year and new standards
fields.content:
Hey guys, it's time for the first update of 2012! And to start the year off, we have a handy new feature for you all: Proper Non-SC standards! These standards weren't made to be easy, so don't feel discouraged if your times seem to be worse-ranked than your combined times. Just be sure to work on them for a while and you'll soon have them up to par.

And now for the rest of the news. This update covers December 26, 2011 - January 3, 2012.


New Players
3 players joined the Mario Kart Wii populace this week.

Nx Mare joined with the usual 32 times, appearing around 237th.
Mike Johnson also started off with 32 times, slotting in just a little lower at 245th.
Enoch Tsang was the last of the newbies. With only 12 times, his theoretical rank was lower, at 359th, but just filling in missing times should give him a considerable boost.


Movement
A good 35 players weren't lured away by MK7 this week.

~~1-10~~
As usual, #2 Jay Batten was active. 5 PR's brought his AF down another .375, ever closer to champ Jorge. Former champ #4 Nick Meade reported a PR as well and broke even in AF. And rounding out the Top 10, #9 Tony Ros also PR'ed once and passed Mark Schmidt to get off the bubble position.

~~11-25~~
#12 Ruby Aruba has been making a return to MKWii lately. His latest progress included 5 PR's, which brought him very close to former champ Bubbles at 11th. #13 Thomas van Deerse clearly doesn't intend to let Aruba get away, though, as he was also active with 3 PR's and a bigger AF cut to catch up. Meanwhile, #20 Salvatore Bellusci who had been silent for more than a month, came back with 14 PR's to barely edge out #21 John Brunn for the last spot in the Top 20.

~~26-50~~
Like several players above, #28 Liam Ashcroft reported 1 PR this week. He gained 2 places, though, so it must have been a pretty good improvement. Chronic hoarder/lazy updater #40 Dave Tandy was also ready with 9 PR's this week, displacing 4 karters with his usual abruptness. #49 Sebastian Kovats decided to make a jump of his own as well, and sent in 11 PR's to move up 2 places, straight into the Top 50. #50 Franco Gubser was left on the edge as a result, but he was able to cut his losses with 4 PR's.

~~51-100~~
All the players in this group made fairly large cuts to their AF this week, most of them with the help of some hoarding. #51 Max Awesome made a run at the Top 50, but was rebuffed by Sebastian's move. He did, however, cut almost 3 points of AF and pass late #50 Zack McNell like Sebastian before him. #61 Leo Petiard kept up his recent rapid progress with 16 PR's, gaining a quick 3 places with a ~6.78 AF cut. #86 Sean Owens was up 6 places with 11 PR's, cutting just over 9 points. And rounding out the group, #93 Viktor Silivanov cut 2 places and ~1.42 AF with 8 PR's.

~~101+~~
New Zealand's leading player, #125 Dexter Howe opens the post-100 field with 2 PR's and a 1 place move. #150 Will Eudy's progress matched his in those numbers, with a similar small AF cut. #156 Victor Pavao submitted 5 PR's, but they weren't sufficient to keep him from falling back in AF and losing a place. #209 Rob Jon made solid progress with 10 PR's and 4 places gained. #231 Julian Stephens cut about 2.2 AF with 3 PR's, but he was pushed back 1 place. Meanwhile, #279 Josh Miller finally completed his timesheet and joined in the middle ranks. His appearance didn't deter #286 Florian Chollet, who moved up a spot with 2 PR's. #327 Jeff Hensel worked hard to earn 21 PR's and cut ~11.69 AF, but he stayed right where he was in rank. And finally, #417 Claire March kept up her activity with 10 PR's but still remains at the bottom of the ranks. Her persistence is admirable, however, and may yet bring results.


Site Records
None this week. Mario Kart Wii seems to be far from dead, however, so we can still hold out hope for more.


Awards
4th POW of December: Ruby Aruba - Aruba finished the year with a flurry of activity, squeezing in 10 PR's to cut ~5.86% off his AF--and still found time to make considerable contributions to the site.
December POM: Jorge Hernandez - With just 4 PR's, Jorge knocked a massive ~13.85% off his AF and reasserted his position as the reigning champ.
4th POQ, 2011: Dave Tandy - Although hoarding often disqualified Dave for smaller awards, the sum of his efforts far exceeded everyone else's this quarter. He improved 53/64 of his times, climbed from #71 to #40, and cut roughly 34 points and 34% from his AF, more than double what anyone above him managed.


Don't forget, the poll to determine the Player of the Year is currently open. Head on over to the forum message board to cast your vote! Happy karting, and happy 2012 everyone!


~MrL1193

fields.author: MrL1193
fields.title: Winter Warmup
fields.content:
Hey guys, it's been another week, so it's time for another news update, complete with the first award of the year. This update covers January 3 - January 9.


New Players
There were 2 new players this week, both with interesting names.
Melvin Demonfaucon joined with only 8 times. His current theoretical rank is 384th.
Timothee Le Borgne joined with a full timesheet.

Movement
A solid 34 players were active this week. 2012 seems to be off to a good start.

~~1-10~~
We start things off right at the top with #1 Jorge Hernandez. He had 1 new PR to show, which negated most but not all of the usual AF backsliding. #2 Jay Batten still had Jorge's crown in his sights, and used his 3 PR's to close the gap by about 3 more tenths. Meanwhile, #4 Nick Meade reported 2 new PR's, one of which was a reclaiming of the GCN Mario Circuit WR. #10 Mark Schmidt was the last active player in the Top 10, with one small PR. He's fought with #6 Dustin Enders over the German crown in the past, but he has a long way to go if he wants to reclaim it this time.

~~11-25~~
Right behind Mark and looking to reenter the Top 10 is #11 Ruby Aruba. With another strong week, he passed former champ David McPartland (who no longer holds the record for single longest reign) with 5 PR's and a ~1.28 AF cut. #13 Thomas van Deerse had a strong week of his own, with 6 PR's and a ~1.47 AF cut, though he didn't quite manage to pass Bubbles to stick with Aruba in the rankings. Next up is #14 Lee Duggan. Lee has been on the site for quite some time now but only just finished his timesheet with his last few flaps, to the annoyance of 415 karters below him who were demoted. #21 John Brunn managed to avoid the demotion with a PR but still took a hit in AF. #22 Salvatore Bellusci was the unlucky one of the group; he PR'ed 4 times but lost ground in AF and dropped 2 places to boot. That brings us to the biggest mover of the week, #25 Marvin Steven Eckhardt. His big update of 33 PR's catapulted him forward 17 places, and probably further annoyed karters displaced by Lee's appearance with AF losses.

~~26-50~~
The surge of activity slows as we exit the Top 25. #30 Liam Ashcroft submitted 1 PR, but was pushed down 2 places by Lee and Marvin. #37 Dave Tandy was unphased, however, continuing his climb to the top with 5 PR's and 3 places gained.

~~51-100~~
Former Top 50 member #51 Franco Gubser got bumped out by Lee this week after hovering on the edge for some months. He did send in 2 PR's to offset his AF losses to keep within striking distance, though. #58 Joe Sebeny and #62 Leo Petiard also lost 1 place each and some AF, although they had 4 and 1 PR's respectively. #82 Sean Owens made a neat cut of 6% of his AF with 6 PR's and gained 4 positions. #89 Jon Coppernoll couldn't overcome AF losses this week, but he did hold his position with 2 PR's. And rounding out the Top 100, #92 Sebastian Wimmer made a nice comeback to Mario Kart Wii with 8 PR's, moving up 3 places and cutting ~2.78 AF.

~~101+~~
Once again, New Zealand champion #126 Dexter Howe leads off the post-100. Unfortunately for him, his lone PR wasn't enough to keep him from losing a place and some AF. #136 Tomas Pallaruelo couldn't quite keep ahead on the AF treadmill either, but he did at least keep his place in the rankings with 3 PR's. Meanwhile, #186 Munim Peerally wins the Mr. Efficiency award this week by jumping up from #194 with 3 PR's. Taking into account the 1 place offset caused by Lee, that's an average of 3 players passed per PR, something I'm sure every other player wishes he could match. #201 Rob Jon didn't do too badly himself, though, as he also passed 8 karters, though he had 6 PR's to report instead of 3. #279 Josh Miller wasn't so lucky; he submitted a round dozen of PR's and cut ~3.47 AF but stayed right where he was in the rankings. Such is the lot of lower-ranked karters, unfortunately. And finally, newbie #338 Timothee Le Borgne joined at a modest rank in the 300's. Hopefully he'll surprise us with his progress soon.


Site Records
There were 3 new Site Records this week, but only 1 of them changed hands. Lee Duggan took one of Shaun Tanney's to get to tied 3rd with 4 SR's, dropping Shaun down to tied 13th with just 1.

Lee Duggan beat Shaun Tanney's old Koopa Cape lap time of 0'44"367 with a time of: 0'44"304
Nick Meade improved his own GCN Mario Circuit crs time of 1'31"436 with a time of: 1'31"421
Tyler Reyes improved his own SNES Mario Circuit 3 crs time of 1'18"273 with a time of: 1'18"261


Awards
The first POW of 2012 goes to Thomas van Deerse. Thomas got the biggest cut in the Top 20, with 5 PR's knocking almost 5% off his total, or ~1.83 AF.


The Player of the Year award for 2011 has yet to be determined. There's still time to vote, so if you haven't already, check out the poll on the MKWii message board. Take care, and happy karting!

~MrL1193

fields.author: MrL1193
fields.title: 2011's POY and the Hunt for the Crown
fields.content:
Hello, MrL1193 here as usual to bring you your weekly news. There was a good bit to report on this week, including plenty of activity at the top ranks and the results of the poll to determine 2011's Player of the Year. This update covers January 9th - January 17th.


New Players
Just one newbie this week: Krystian Wieczorek. He sent in 28 times to start, which puts him at approximately 416th for now.

Movement
22 players were active this week, most of them in the higher ranks.

~~1-10~~
3 players were active in the Top 10 this week--the past champion, the present champion, and the potential future champion of the site. #1 Jorge Hernandez kept up his defense of his title with 5 PR's, dropping his AF under 7 again. However, #2 Jay Batten relentlessly continued to close in on him. An incredible 11 PR streak narrowed the gap to just over 3 points and earned him admission to the exclusive Sub 10 AF Club, previously the sole territory of Jorge. Amazingly, Jay still doesn't have a single Site Record to his name (a situation which could change very quickly), which just goes to show you how important a balanced timesheet is to your AF. And coming now to the past champion of the trio, #4 Nick Meade got a PR on Maple Treeway which almost regained him the World Record but didn't help his AF much.

~~11-25~~
One player who has his sights set on joining the league of legends is Dutch Champion #11 Thomas van Deerse. With an impressive 8 PR's, he passed 2 players and is now less than half an AF point away from #10 Mark Schmidt. #12 Ruby Aruba made solid progress himself, with 5 PR's, but he still lost a place to Thomas. #16 Alex Shoal didn't move anywhere, but he netted a big cut of ~1.20 AF with only 1 PR by getting himself a proper Coconut Mall glitch flap. Meanwhile, #19 John Brunn PR'ed twice and moved up 2 places through a cluster of tightly-packed karters. It's a good thing that he did, because #22 Salvatore Bellusci PR'ed thrice and almost jumped past John, but was left clutching at thin air instead. The three karters ahead of him are still very close together in AF, though, so he should have little difficulty moving up from here.

~~26-50~~
Just 2 karters were active here, one high and one low. #29 Liam Ashcroft made a straightforward move of 1 place with 1 PR. And at the other end of the group, #47 Max Awesome sent in a batch of 12 PR's, good enough to cut 5 places and gain admission into the Top 50.

~~51-100~~
The heading "51-100" is a bit of a misnomer, because only a set of 3 consecutive karters near the top of the group were active. #52 Franco Gubser came up with 1 PR, but was still pushed down a spot by Max. #53 Reinier de Jonge sent in 4 new times and completed his timesheet, jumping into the middle spot. #54 Leo Petiard completes the set, with a batch of 19 PR's propelling him forward 8 positions to latch onto the last spot.

~~101+~~
As usual, #126 Dexter Howe is the first active player out in Triple Digit Land. He PR'ed twice and was rewarded with the right to remain stationary, though he did fall back slightly in AF. #181 Munim Peerally sent in 7 PR's and jumped forward 5 places, cutting over 13 points of AF. #198 Rob Jon made a large cut of his own of almost 7 points of AF, with 9 PR's. He moved forward 3 places, into the Top 200. #280 Josh Miller submitted 3 PR's and cut just over a point of AF, but lost a place because of Reinier's entry far above him. And finally, everyone's favorite female karter #420 Claire March made a bit more progress with 26 PR's. Slowly but surely, she continues to close the gap to #419 Peter Ferguson, so she may climb the ranks yet.


Site Records
There were 2 new Site Records this week. Thomas Petraud took Jak Russo's only SR to double his own SR count to 2, moving up to tied 8th in total SR's.

Thomas Petraud beat Jak Russo's Maple Treeway crs time of 2'17"532 with a time of: 2'17"331
Max Awesome improved his own N64 DK's Jungle Parkway crs time of 2'12"175 with a time of: 2'11"440


Awards
Congratulations to Jay Batten, 2011's Player of the Year! Jay won the poll by a landslide, becoming the first player to win a MKW POY award without ever having been Site Champion. Jay moved from #29 to #2 throughout 2011, cutting 44.25 AF points--a massive 79.6% of his starting AF. SR's consistently eluded him, but he improved his entire timesheet (all 64 times). Consistently climbing throughout the year, he gained countless POWs and POMs, and also proved his skill beyond any doubt. Nobody else's progress could compare to his in raw numbers.

In other news, Jay also won the second POW of January 2012. Several top players made strong cuts, but Jay crushed all competition with a staggering 13 PR's. He cut ~1.31 points, or ~11.78% from his AF and subbed 10 in AF--a very rare accomplishment indeed. With a total of 11 POW's now, Jay also happens to have more POW's than anyone else. And with 16 awards and 32 points total, he is now Mario Kart Wii's most decorated karter. Congratulations!

That'll do it for this update. Happy karting!


~MrL1193

fields.author: MrL1193
fields.title: keeW etisoppO
fields.content:
Hello everyone, it's time for another news update. It's been a pretty weird week for MKWii; all the activity of recent weeks seems to have disappeared rather suddenly, SR's were given back to previous holders, and inactive players moved forward in the rankings instead of backwards. Let's take a look at all that, shall we?


New Players
One rookie, Tyler Vanderwater, joined the site this week. His 8 times don't project that he beat any of the players with full timesheets, but that's only to be expected with just 1/8 of a timesheet.

Movement
Only 13 players played this week. However, the AF treadmill was on reverse this week due to a player deletion, so every single player on the site got an AF cut. So, to go with this theme, I'll be mentioning everyone in reverse order.

~~101-419~~
We start off with the reigning queen of high numbers, #419 Claire March. Claire pulled off 6 PR's this week and lowered her rank by 1, but still remains on top. And a good bit farther along, #277 Josh Miller moved 3 places with 7 PR's.

~~51-100~~
#80 Sean Owens made an efficient cut of 3 places with 2 PR's, or 1 place per PR taking the default cut into account. Meanwhile, #52 Franco Gubser nabbed another PR this week, though he didn't move anywhere. He's been hovering around the 50 mark for a long time now; maybe he'll break into the 40's again before long.

~~26-50~~
In the only group this week that didn't have exactly 1 pair of karters playing, #35 Reinier de Jonge, having recently completed his timesheet, decided to reverse the digits of his rank from 53 to 35 with 8 PR's. #29 Liam Ashcroft reported 2 PR's but didn't go anywhere at all. #28 Ben Hart did, though, also submitting a pair of PR's to jump past Liam from 32nd.

~~11-25~~
#19 John Brunn submitted 1 PR as usual this week. Since he was past the area of players who got automatic promotions, he didn't move, but he did strengthen his position a bit. #12 Ruby Aruba did likewise but with 4 PR's instead; he's now only 3/4 of a point away from #10 Tony Ros. Perhaps we'll see him in that elite group again sometime soon.

~~1-10~~
Finally, among the last 10 karters, we find #8 Thomas van Deerse. Thomas boldly leapfrogged 3 players with 5 PR's to prove himself worthy of joining the group. And last but not least, #2 Jay Batten used his 2 PR's to inch ever closer to becoming MKWii's #1.


Site Records
No new ones this week, though 4 SR's were reassigned because of that player deletion. Champ Jorge Hernandez now has 10 SR's as a result, twice as many as second-place Romain Smadja. Jazz Ahmed and Dylan Imhoff also put in an appearance with 1 SR apiece.


Awards
3rd POW of January - Thomas van Deerse Thomas took advantage of a quiet week to break into the Top 10 with 6 PR's. ~2.81 points, or ~8.67% of his total AF, were enough to propel him forward 4 places to #8.


See you guys next update!

~MrL1193

fields.author: MrL1193
fields.title: February Frenzy
fields.content:
Update: January 23rd - February 1st

Hey guys, it's time for the first news update of February. It's been a pretty busy week, so there's plenty of activity to cover.

Recently, it came to our attention that standards on the combined charts were being displayed incorrectly for players who only had NonSC times, showing their NonSC standards instead of Combined standards. This problem has been corrected now.


New Players
John Cwusha joined at approximately 221st with 34 times, including a Top 10 time on Mario Circuit glitched.
Mark Frank only had 28 times to start off. His theoretical rank is 398th for now.

Movement
After a brief slump last week, activity rebounded strongly, with 33 players picking up their controllers.

~~1-10~~
As expected, #2 Jay Batten continued his relentless pursuit of champ Jorge. He still hasn't claimed any SR's, but he did crank out 8 PR's for a massive .8906 AF cut, roughly 9.5% of his total. He also became only the second player to reach Myth rank, a rare feat indeed. Just below, #4 Nick Meade got a PR, though it didn't help his AF too much. #8 Thomas van Deerse, who recently joined the Top 10, didn't have much more luck, though he reported 2 PR's. #10 Ruby Aruba on the other hand, made plenty of progress; he cut .8906 points, the same as Jay, and passed two karters to make it in the Top 10, knocking Tony Ros out in the process.

~~11-25~~
Surprisingly, former champion #13 David McPartland apparently got a time updated last week, though I have no idea how old it was. #18 John Brunn put on a turn of speed and pulled off 6 PR's, enough to cut almost a whole AF point and move up another spot. And #20 Alvin Le earned 1 PR, though it wasn't enough to overcome his AF loss.

~~26-50~~
#26 Ben Hart made a nice ~1.78 AF cut with 4 PR's to jump 2 spots and land right on the doorstep of the Top 25. Meanwhile, another former champ, #31 Alvin van Asselt got a flap updated, just like Bubbles in the next group up. It was worth a good bit of AF, but he still didn't quite break even. #32 Reinier de Jonge pulled a magic trick this week, cutting multiple points of AF and 3 places with just 1 PR. In contrast, #37 Dave Tandy made a good cut in AF with 6 PR's but stayed right where he was. #46 Max Anosova, after another name change, pulled off 5 PR's for a 1 place move. And joining the group this week, #48 Leo Petiard climbed 5 places with 8 PR's and a 2.875 AF cut.

~~51-100~~
There's very little to talk about in this group. #53 Franco Gubser earned a PR, but he lost ground in AF and a place in the rankings. Lower down, #84 Carter Clem finally finished his timesheet, and is off to a good start. And...that's it for the Top 100.

~~101+~~
Just below the 2-digit threshhold, #103 Ashley O'Hara got his Luigi Circuit time updated, though he was demoted by Mr. Clem above. #125 Dexter Howe came up with 2 PR's, just barely making a net gain in AF and staying put in the rankings. #126 Tom Norton has been hard at work chasing the N64 Sherbet Land WR for a while now, but he still found time to update 13 of his times this week and jump 11 places. #157 Juanki Vecino Duena did an even bigger update of 35 times, shooting up 58 places and knocking off a whopping 84.625 points of AF. Down in the lower ranks, where active players are few and far between, #201 Daniel Crutcher made a good 9 position move with 7 PR's. #274 Josh Miller made a 3 place improvement with 10 PR's. And finally, way down at the end, #419 Claire March pulled out a 39 PR improvement to cut ~.41 AF and finally moved forward a place to leave Peter Ferguson at the bottom of the ladder again. We'll see if she continues her progress in weeks to come.


Site Records
3 new Site Records this update. N64 Sherbet Land Course was the only one to change hands, increasing Sword's total to 4 for tied 3rd place and lowering Jorge's total to 9.

Thomas Petraud improved his own Maple Treeway crs time of 2'17"331 with a time of: 2'17"317
Tom Norton beat Jorge Hernandez's old N64 Sherbet Land crs time of 2'04"369 with a time of: 2'04"353
Thomas Petraud improved his own GCN Waluigi Stadium crs time of 1'49"659 with a time of: 1'49"353


Awards
4th POW of January: Jay Batten - Active as always, Jay came up with an impressive 8 PR's for a .8906 AF cut, or 9.5159% of his total, and also became Myth D rank.
January POM: Jay Batten - With 24 PR's, Jay edged out Thomas van Deerse for this award. He took off more than a quarter of his total AF with a cut of 2.9062 AF points, subbed 10 in AF, and attained Myth D rank.


That's all for now. See you next update!

~MrL1193

fields.author: MrL1193
fields.title: Business As Usual
fields.content:
Update: February 1st - February 8th

Hey guys, it's been another week. Nothing special happened, so I'll just get straight to the boring facts.


New Players
Two players joined the site this week, each with an SR to contribute to the site.
Luis G's 26 starting times included the SNES Mario Circuit 3 WR--very impressive indeed. His theoretical rank is 289th.
Kunio Oniku had only 23 times but is ranked a bit higher than Luis, at 281st. His claim to fame was an impressive SNES Ghost Valley 2 SC record.

Movement
An average 21 player week this time, nothing special.

~~1-10~~
It was business as usual in the Top 10. #2 Jay Batten blah blah 2 PR's blah less than 1.5 AF from Jorge blah blah...Oh, and #10 Ruby Aruba cut exactly a quarter of a point of AF with 5 PR's. Pretty standard stuff for these guys, with no change in rank.

~~11-25~~
Outside the Top 10, there was some actual movement going on. #17 John Brunn cut the smallest amount of AF possible this week with 2 PR's and passed Fabien Jacques. #19 Salvatore Bellusci moved up 3 places to sandwich Fabien from below, with 5 new PR's. The biggest mover this week was crazy Dutchman #23 Reinier de Jonge, who has been working hard to balance his timesheet. He whipped out 5 PR's for an ~11.1 AF cut that bumped him up 9 places.

~~26-50~~
This group was fairly quiet this week. #38 Matthias Sempels's lone PR didn't do very much for his rank or his AF. #44 Leo Petiard, however, came up with 10 PR's, which earned him a ~3.9 AF cut and pushed him forward 4 places.

~~51-100~~
Moving into the lower half of the Top 100, we find #52 Franco Gubser, who was slightly active, as usual. He moved up 1 spot with 1 PR. Meanwhile, #66 Ross Coleman and #68 Agustin Berrios got a couple (probably old) times updated, though they didn't move anywhere. And rounding out the group is #89 Jon Coppernoll, who turned up with 2 PR's to pass 1 inactive karter.

~~101+~~
Activity was scattered as usual out in no-man's land. #132 Andrew Grieve (who really deserves a higher rank) got 1 time updated, which didn't help his AF much. #159 Victor Pavao actually did manage to overcome the AF treadmill this week with 4 PR's, but he didn't pass anyone in doing so. #200 Daniel Crutcher came up with just 1 PR, but it was apparently a pretty good one--enough to cut AF and 1 place in the rankings. #266 Josh Miller came up with 14 PR's to jump 8 places. And finally, #329 Adam Frederick completed his timesheet with 3 PR's, joining the charts at a modest rank. We'll see if he stays motivated to climb the charts in weeks to come.


Site Records
This week's two newcomers accounted for both the new Site Records this week. The losers were Jorge Hernandez, who now has only 8 SR's but still has the most, and Tyler Reyes, who no longer has any SR's.

Kunio Oniku beat Jorge Hernandez's old SNES Ghost Valley 2 crs time of 0'52"415 with a time of: 0'52"182
Luis G beat Tyler Reyes's old SNES Mario Circuit 3 crs time of 1'18"261 with a time of: 1'18"230


Awards
1st POW of February: Jay Batten - Jay earns his second POW in a row with his constant activity. 2 PR's yielded a .2344 AF, 2.7675% AF cut, the best of the week when hoarding and player level were taken into account.


Have a great Valentine's, everyone, and happy karting!

~MrL1193

fields.author: MrL1193
fields.title: Red Shells are red, Spiny Shells are blue; if you were a Blue, I wouldn't kiss you...
fields.content:
Update: February 8th - February 15th


New Players
Stan D joined with 27 times to his name. I'm guessing he likes to use karts, because his Rainbow Road times far outshine all his others, and include a Myth D rank 3-Lap. His theoretical rank is 283rd.
James Mekealian came up with 32 starter times, probably all course times. He's guaranteed at least 394th place with this half of his sheet.
Avery Mojica started off slow with just 1 time--not really enough to judge his possible rank. Hopefully, he'll fill in the rest in time.


Movement
24 players were busy this week, which is about the usual number. However, a fairly high-ranked player was deleted this week, so most of the field outside the Top 20 gained ground in AF without doing anything at all.

~~1-10~~
#2 Jay Batten doesn't particularly care what day or occasion it is--he's going to keep right on karting until he reaches the top. He kept the accelerator in the red zone with 4 PR's, cutting exactly a quarter of a point of AF and subbing 8 AF. #4 Nick Meade was active as well with 1 PR, which was just enough to break even in AF. #8 Thomas Van Deerse kept up his constant progress with 2 PR's, cutting just over a quarter of a point. And it's a good thing he did, because breathing down his neck is #9 Ruby Aruba, who also PR'ed twice but cut ~0.66 AF instead. They both subbed 30 in AF this week and are now separated by less than 0.2, so the battle could go either way in weeks to come.

~~11-25~~
#14 Artur Bauer was this week's big mover. He decided to update 30 of his times all at once to jump up 8 places. #18 John Brunn was one of several karters who fell victim to this move, but he still cut some AF with 2 PR's. #23 Reinier de Jonge also nabbed 2 PR's and cut AF this week, making good progress toward the new #22, Alvin Le. It's pretty clear that Rein hasn't reached his full potential yet, so he should have little difficulty continuing to progress through the ranks.

~~26-50~~
#35 Dave Tandy submitted 4 PR's this week, enough to pass 2 karters. #37 Leo Petiard moved at a faster clip, sending in 8 PR's to jump 7 places. And rounding out the group, #43 Max Anosova climbed 4 places with 8 PR's.

~~51-100~~
The oft-inactive lower half of the Top 100 had a few karters stirring this Valentine's Day. #65 Ross Coleman seems to be making a return to this game lately, and continued his progress this week with 1 PR. He gained a place for free, as did most players below him, all thanks to the disappearance of one karter from the charts. #84 Carter Clem also had a PR to report, but he didn't move anywhere. And finishing the Top 100, we have #89 Frederick Hutchington. He updated 9 of his times and cut around 9.9 AF, gaining 8 places.

~~101+~~
Not too much was going on out in no-man's land this week. #126 Tom Norton got a PR that didn't move him anywhere. #197 Rob Jon was up 2 places with 4 PR's, and #262 Josh Miller got the same number to rise 4 places. And that's pretty much it.


Site Records
None this week.


Awards
2nd POW of February: Jay Batten - Jay kept up his rapid pace this week with 4 PR's, cutting exactly a quarter of a point to bring his AF under 8.


See you next update!


~MrL1193

fields.author: MrL1193
fields.title: It's quiet...Too quiet...
fields.content:
Update: February 15th - February 22nd


New Players
One newbie arrived this week: Sam Fairless. He only started with 5 times, but one of them was a new Site Record on Mushroom Gorge. His theoretical rank for the moment is 400th, which isn't half bad for such an incomplete sheet.

Movement
Well, there sure wasn't much movement this week. Only 11 players spent any time on Mario Kart Wii. At least there was a good bit of action at the top, keeping things mildly interesting.

~~1-10~~
In a slight departure from the usual routine, Jay wasn't the highest-ranked active player. #1 Jorge Hernandez noticed the threat from #2 Jay Batten, it seems. Jay made a small AF cut with 5 PR's, but Jorge updated 7 times to knock off almost a full point and pull his AF under 6. On a side note, he's also pushed his Mario Kart Wii score on the Combined Rankings past the 2 point mark, which means that his AF is currently less than one hundredth the score of the lowest ranked karter, Claire March. Meanwhile, down at the other end of the group, #8 Thomas van Deerse and #9 Ruby Aruba also played as a pair. Each of them scored 2 PR's, but Thomas cut .1406 AF, as opposed to Aruba's .0625, which allowed Thomas to pull away a bit. They're still separated by less than .1, and neither of them shows signs of slowing yet. This group bears further watching in weeks to come; changes could be in store.

~~11-50~~
And now for the rest of the week's activity! #18 Reinier de Jonge was the fastest-moving by far, cutting more than 4 AF with just 4 PR's and charging past 5 rival karters. #19 John Brunn kept up his steady progress with 2 PR's, including a Top 10 time, but it wasn't enough to avoid being pushed down a spot by Rein. No doubt more karters will fall victim to the crazy Dutchman in weeks to come. And finally, out in the vast sea of inactivity, #48 Franco Gubser finally triumphed this week in his struggle to rejoin the Top 50. He only came up with 1 PR, but it was enough to cut more than half a point of AF and jump 3 places, making him the only player other than Rein to gain places this week. Good work, Franco!

All those other guys...
...didn't play this week. Yes, I'm serious--there were no signs of life anywhere outside the Top 50. I guess everyone's too busy playing Mario Kart 7 these days. Oh well, such is the cycle of game life, I suppose.




Site Records
Newcomer Sam brought a new Site Record to the table this week, stealing Salvatore Bellusci's place among 25 other 1-record wonders at tied 13th.

Sam Fairless beat Salvatore Bellusci's old Mushroom Gorge crs time of 0'31"747 with a time of: 0'30"769


Awards
3rd POW of February: Reinier de Jonge - In a week of overwhelming inactivity, Rein stood head and shoulders above the rest. With 4 PR's, he shaved off 4.375 AF, roughly ~9.18% of his total, and leaped from #23 to #18.


That's all for this week. Happy karting!

~MrL1193

fields.author: MrL1193
fields.title: Playing Leapfrog on Leap Day
fields.content:
Update: February 22nd - March 1st


New Players
Three fresh faces joined the site this week.

Nathan Diedrick joined with 32 course times, around 260th in AF. He seems to have an affinity for glitch tracks.
Wheel master Tylor McCallumore joined with a stronger set of 34 times, good enough for 200th in theory. His times included silver medals on Mushroom Gorge course and lap, the former of which would have been an SR if Sam Fairless hadn't joined last week.
Christian W (not to be confused with Christian Wild) was the only one of the trio to send in a full set of 64. With his solid, balanced timesheet, he earned a starting rank of 114th on the full AF charts. The Top 100 beckons.

Movement
A grand total of 15 players hit the tracks this week, and, as before, most of them were high-ranked.

~~1-10~~
If you can't guess who the first active player was, you probably haven't been following the news updates around here lately. #2 Jay Batten only managed 1 PR this week, but it was still enough to propel him forward another ~.1 in AF. The other active player here was #8 Ruby Aruba, who came up with 2 PR's to knock a big ~1.5 off his AF and pass Dutch Champion Thomas van Deerse. We'll have to wait to see if Thomas returns the favor next week.

~~11-25~~
Meanwhile, #12 Artur Bauer, who has apparently taken over Dused's role of German hoarding king, submitted 12 PR's this week. He climbed over two other karters, including fellow German Mark Schmidt, to become #2 in Germany. The remaining active players in the Top 20 weren't so lucky this week; #18 Reinier de Jonge and #19 John Brunn grabbed 1 and 2 PR's respectively but lost ground in AF.

~~26-50~~
#32 Leo Petiard was busy as usual this week. He netted himself 7 PR's, enough to leapfrog 5 karters. #38 Robert van Zanten, however, is the unofficial winner of this week's Mr. Efficiency award, as he jumped 3 places with exactly that many PR's.

~~51-100~~
The rest of the Top 100 didn't have any surprises in store this week. #77 Simone Bertini and #99 Sam Smith each had 1 PR to report but didn't gain ground in AF.

~~101+~~
The post-100 field was looking pretty dead this week as well with only a pair of active karters. #158 Victor Pavao came up with 3 PR's, but due to the appearance of newcomer Chris above him, he took a net loss in AF and didn't move up in rank (though he did pass Christian Wild). The other guy who played was #198 Rob Jon, who worked to get 7 PR's and cut ~5.5 AF, but since he was caught in an AF graveyard, he still got a rank demotion because of Chris. He still has more than 6 points ahead of him to the next karter, but if he keeps on working at it, he'll make it.


Site Records
None this week.


Awards
4th POW of February: Ruby Aruba - With almost no competition, Aruba easily wins this award, moving from #9 - #8 with 2 PR's. He cut ~1.5 points, or about ~5.1% off of his AF.
February POM: Jorge Hernandez - Jorge defended his crown well this month, staying a step ahead of Jay and subbing 6 in AF. His 7 PR's took off about ~.77 points of AF, which is impressive at such a high level.


Have a great week everybody!

~MrL1193

fields.author: MrL1193
fields.title: March of the Mass Updaters
fields.content:
Update: March 1st - March 8th


New Players
Pierre Coste came up with a full set of times, which earned him a rank of 320th. He's already quite well-ranked in Super Mario Kart; we'll see if he can manage a matching Mario Kart Wii performance.
Russell Horwood has only sent in 39 times so far, leaving out his Koopa Cape lap and the entire Special, Shell, and Banana Cups. He would be ranked just below Pierre at 332nd if every one of his missing times were ranked dead last, though it's safe to say that he can do better than that.

Movement
The active players this week numbered 20 in all.

~~1-10~~
Starting things off, #1 Jorge Hernandez got a new PR on DK Mountain this week. He got within .644 of the WR with only 2/3 glitch SC's, which earned him a small AF cut. German Champion #6 Dustin Enders did likewise, but his PR was an actual Flap WR. He beat #5 Marc Bas to achieve it, but he's still a long way off from the French Champ in terms of AF.

~~11-25~~
The rest of the Top 25 didn't show much activity. #19 John Brunn had the field to himself this week; he knocked off just over 1% of his AF with 2 PR's, and got quite close to #18 Reinier de Jonge.

~~26-50~~
Just the usual suspects were busy in this group. #32 Leo Petiard made a solid 5 PR effort, which got him about halfway through the AF graveyard he was facing at the start of the week. And just behind him, #33 Dave Tandy made a queer-looking move of 3 places with 3 PR's. He moved up right next to Leo on the rankings, but since he only cut .5 AF, he fell further behind Leo in AF. I'm not sure whether you'd count that as being closer or farther away, but regardless, it's progress!

~~51-100~~
In a shocking turn of events, the lower half of the Top 100 wasn't dead this week! #67 Andre Hoelscher and #86 Frederick Hutchington both returned to update some of their times. Andre submitted 4, which bumped him up 1 spot and cut almost 2 points of AF, while Frederick jumped up 3 places with 5 PR's and cut over 4 points.

~~101+~~
Just knocking at the door of the Top 100 is #103 Christian W. He must have been super busy this week, because he pocketed no fewer than 17 PR's, enough to shoot forward 11 places. He wasn't the only Chris playing for Germany this week, as #135 Christian Nemetz returned as well, moving forward 1 place with 5 new times. The largest move resulting from a mass update of times, though, belongs to #144 Aubrey Clissold. He rocketed up 39 places with 20 PR's, though it seems that none of them were on Koopa Cape. Meanwhile, #172 Eric Shore contented himself with climbing 2 places with 3 PR's, despite being passed by Aubrey. #186 Daniel Crutcher was the last of the players making massive updates this week, with his 27 new times catapulting him forward 14 places. Just below where Daniel moved from, right outside the Top 200, #201 Tony Fan demonstrated his superior prowess with karts with 2 new PR's on DK Summit, though they didn't keep him from backsliding in AF. And finally, out past the 400 marker, #413 Krystian Wieczorek made his humble debut on the AF charts this week. He plays a number of other Mario Kart games as well, so it remains to be seen if he'll find time for Mario Kart Wii in the future.


Site Records
This week, Dused stole Marco's only remaining SR to take his place among the 25 other 1-record wonders.

Dustin Enders beat Marc Bas's old Toad's Factory lap time of 0'35"163 with a time of: 0'35"160


Awards
1st POW of March: Leo Petiard - With a solid 5 PR's, Leo subbed 60 in AF and cut ~1.77 points of AF, almost half the gap to the karter ahead of him.


That's it for this update. Happy karting everyone!

~MrL1193

fields.author: MrL1193
fields.title: Happy St. Patrick's Day :)
fields.content:
Update: March 8th - March 15th


New Players
Michael Vogt submitted 64/64 times to earn a starting rank of 408th. Perhaps he'll break into the Top 400 soon.
Alex Jascol sent in only 5 times. He's tentatively ranked 420th for now, though that will change if he gets a full timesheet.

Movement
18 players picked up their controllers this week, which seems to be about average these days.

~~1-10~~
The Top 10 was quite quiet this week. Only #8 Ruby Aruba played, earning 3 PR's to close the distance to lucky #7 Jak Russo to exactly 2 AF points.

~~11-25~~
The usual suspects were active in this group. #17 Reinier de Jonge and #18 John Brunn both made good AF cuts this week. John cut 1.125 points with 3 PR's and would have ended the week 2 places higher than before, but Reinier came storming back with 2 PR's and a ~1.45 point cut to fend him off. They each passed Alex Shoal to gain 1 place.

~~26-50~~
This is where most of the week's activity was concentrated. #29 Liam Ashcroft played this week and earned a PR, though he took a net loss in AF. #32 Leo Petiard blazed through the AF graveyard he was in with 10 PR's; he's now less than .4 away from former champ Alvin van Asselt and easier rank acquisition. #38 Robert van Zanten earned a nice PR on Mario Raceway lap, with which he almost beat fellow Dutchman Reinier's WR. He also cut ~.2 AF, though he didn't move up. #41 Max Anosova did, however, climbing 2 places with 2 PR's. And rounding out the group, #48 Franco Gubser PR'ed twice as well and made good progress toward #47 Marvin Rekovsky.

~~51-100~~
As usual, activity drops off sharply here. #63 Andre Hoelscher used his 4 PR's to motor forward past 4 karters in the wasteland of inactivity. And a bit farther back, #79 Dilan Arse finally completed his timesheet after several years on the site, earning his place in the Top 100.

~~101+~~
Right on the border of the wasteland is #101 Christian W. He PR'ed 9 times to pass 2 players and just toe the line in the sand, glaring at #100 Sam Smith. #169 Daniel Crutcher sprouted wings and flew up 17 places with 14 PR's. The luck o' the Irish must have been with him, because this comes right after another large set of new PR's last week. He cut ~18.7 points of AF, too, more than anyone else this week. #260 Russell Horwood is another newcomer to the AF chart; after joining last week with some cups missing from his timesheet, he filled out the rest to earn a rank of Intermediate A. He doesn't have far to go to join the Experts now. And finally, #425 Claire March noticed that she'd slipped back down to the bottom position on the chart and decided to fix that with 11 PR's. Her numbered position and AF still took a hit from the new arrivals, of course, but she did manage to pass Peter Ferguson once again. Maybe this time she'll continue on to beat Andrew Ahearn as well, or even sub 600 in AF.


Site Records
We got a pair of new SR's this week, including a new sub on Maple Treeway. Neither of them changed hands, though, so the SR tallies remain the same.

Lee Robbins improved his own Coconut Mall crs time of 0'39"599 with a time of: 0'39"515
Thomas Petraud improved his own Maple Treeway crs time of 2'17"317 and subbed with a time of: 2'16"884


Awards
2nd POW of March: Reinier de Jonge - Rein hit 2 big PR's this week to simultaneously move up a spot and fend off John Brunn. His AF cut was ~1.45 points, ~3.32% of his total.


Have a great week!

~MrL1193

fields.author: MrL1193
fields.title: Official start of spring, no groundhogs in sight.
fields.content:
Update: March 15th - March 22nd


New Players
The only newcomer this week was Axel San. He joined with the typical 32 course times, albeit at a higher theoretical rank than most--201st. He also holds both the SC and NonSC WR's for SNES Ghost Valley 2, which just happen to be the only current 52 and 53 second subs, respectively.

Movement
An average 19 players managed to come up with new times.

~~1-10~~
The rivalry at the top between Jorge and Jay seems to have cooled off a bit, as Jay hasn't submitted any new PR's in several weeks. However, competition for the German crown has heated up suddenly, as #8 Artur Bauer rapidly closes in on #6 Dustin Enders. Dustin took the European Record on Toad's Factory this week, but it didn't save him from falling back a bit in AF. Artur, on the other hand, returned after several weeks of silence to update a quarter of his timesheet, or 16 PR's. He leaped straight into the Top 10 from #12 and is now less than 2 AF away from his fellow German. Dustin had better pick up the pace if he wants to keep his title.

~~11-25~~
Meanwhile, #17 John Brunn and #18 Reinier de Jonge kept up their progress. This week, John pulled slightly ahead, with 4 PR's as opposed to Rein's 1. Rein has made sudden improvements before, though, so he could turn the tables very quickly.

~~26-50~~
#31 Leo Petiard was active as usual. He made a small AF cut and passed Alvin van Asselt with 1 PR. #47 Franco Gubser passed 1 player as well, thanks to 2 PR's. And right behind him, #49 Sebastian Kovats noticed that he'd fallen out of the Top 50 since his last visit and decided to fix that. Armed with 8 new times, he passed 3 karters and broke back into the Top 50.

~~51-100~~
In contrast to all that movement we just covered, #66 Ross Coleman hardly moved at all. With his 1 PR, he reduced his AF backslide to a miniscule amount, which is better than doing nothing at all. #84 Frederick Hutchington got a pair of PR's on N64 Bowser's Castle to the tune of ~3.3 AF cut and 3 places gained. #85 Carter Clem almost lost a place because of this, but with 1 PR of his own, he was able to cut AF and hold his position.

~~101+~~
#101 Christian W is probably a tad irritated right now. He PR'ed no fewer than 11 times and cut just over 3 points of AF, but he still wasn't able to enter the Top 100. He's less than half a point away, though, so he doesn't have far to go now. #112 Martin Prigent sent in 5 new times, enough to pass 2 players and cut almost 2 AF. #167 Daniel Crutcher also moved up 2 spots, though he did it with 4 PR's. Much farther down, #396 Michael Vogt made a nice move of 12 places with 12 PR's to break into the Top 400. And finally, #403 Taylor Fankhauser came up with a whopping 41 PR's, which bumped him up 10 places.


Site Records
Only 1 new Site Record this week, the aforementioned GV2 record by Axel.

Axel San beat Kunio Oniku's old SNES Ghost Valley 2 crs time of 0'52"182 with a time of: 0'51"984


Awards
Web here with the late edition of the 3rd March POW.

Drumroll please.......
John Brunn had the best non-hoarded week of all at the top. With 3 PRs, a .34 AF cut, and a one place improvement, he kept playing when others went silent. Activity is slowing a little, so keep karting hard and you may get a POW of your own soon!

See you next update!

~MrL1193

fields.author: MrL1193
fields.title: Double Feature
fields.content:
Update: March 22nd - April 8th


New Players
A total of 3 players joined during these past couple weeks, though none of them had full timesheets.
Umbre R.B. joined with just 2 times, which doesn't say much about his overall skill. Nevertheless, they guarantee him at least 423rd.
Adam Maynard sent in 16 assorted course times as his starter set, which earned him a theoretical rank of 393rd.
Jimmey Schickoll had the highest theoretical rank of the three rookies, at 365th. His 15 times were not very well balanced but showed good potential on some tracks.

Movement
A good 29 players were active during the delay between news updates. If it's a lengthy update you want, look no further.

~~1-10~~
At the top, #2 Jay Batten returned to continue his pursuit of the crown. 5 PR's were enough to cut the gap down to less than 1.5 AF. And a few places down, #6 Artur Bauer overtook #7 Dustin Enders for the title of German Champion. Dustin eked out 1 PR, but it proved insufficient in the face of Artur's 6, which earned him a cut of exactly two and a quarter points of AF. Dustin has been known to hoard times in the past, though, so don't be too surprised if he comes storming back next week with a dozen PR's.

~~11-25~~
Meanwhile, #16 Reinier de Jonge was up to his usual tricks. This time, he passed 2 karters with 2 PR's, both on Peach Beach. #18 John Brunn was active as well, with 4 PR's, but though he cut AF, he couldn't keep Rein from passing him. And coming up behind them is #20 Salvatore Bellusci. He had been quiet for a while, but came back with 6 PR's to pass Fabien Jacques for a Top 20 position. And just below, #24 Leo Petiard submitted no fewer than 16 PR's, which catapulted him past 7 karters, right into the Top 25.

~~26-50~~
#30 Liam Ashcroft came up with a new PR for the first time in quite a while. It didn't allow him to cut AF, but it did lessen his loss--a good thing for him, because #31 Dave Tandy sent in a batch of 16 PR's and is now breathing down Liam's neck. Dave only passed two karters, but he did cut ~5.6 AF. And #38 Robert van Zanten reported a new Mario Circuit Lap Site Record, which helped him cut his AF losses a bit as well.

~~51-100~~
The lower half of the Top 100 saw a good bit of activity--a pleasant change from the usual graveyard scene. #62 Andre Hoelscher asserted his place among the living with a solid 6 PR's, enough to cut ~3.6 AF and move forward a place. #66 Ross Coleman looked like he wanted to make a run for it, but tripped and fell flat on his face after just 1 PR, becoming the only active player in the group to lose ground in AF. #68 Dilan Arse, however, sprinted past a dozen fallen karters with 16 PR's. #79 Carter Clem came up with 6 PR's, enough to pass exactly that many players. #83 Frederick Hutchington reported 2 PR's, earning the right to shuffle forward 1 place. And rounding out the group, we have a new face in the Top 100, #99 Christian W. He sent in 8 PR's to pass 2 players and finally break free from the largely ignored triple-digit ranks.

~~101+~~
#101 Sam Smith was the unlucky victim of Mr. W's move. Sam's luck in breaking into the Top 50 of MK7 apparently didn't carry over to MKWii and the Top 100, as he tried to hold his ground with 2 PR's but was pushed out anyway.
