I may sound like a broken record here, but again #3 Thomas van Deerse kept up his PRing pace, setting three times this week, including PRs on DKJP and rSGB. He cut just over half an AF point and is getting ever closer to snatching the second spot on the rankings from Meade. Its less than 2 AF points now, and if things continue the way they have been, it shouldnt be long before Thomas claims it. Finally, John Brunn submitted a PR, but it wasnt enough for him to overcome the AF treadmill. The good news is Leo Petiard didnt submit, so John could squeeze out the gap a little from Leos charging pace.

~~11-25 ~~
The next group had two players active, starting with #13 Salvatore Bellusci He had an impressive week, with 5 PRs and a 2% AF cut. His move allowed him to pass both Lee Duggan and Alex Shoal. Ahead stands the top 10 barrier, a mere 3.4 AF points away. #24 Liam Ashcroft was the last active in this group, sending in 4 times for a 1.2 point AF cut. Hes pulling away from 25th and getting pretty close to the next slew of players in the 47-48 AF range.

~~26-50~~
#48 Daniel Crutcher breaks into this group with style, saving it from inactivity and leaving a lot of inactive players in front of Daniel for him to pass. This week brought 7 PRs for an almost two point AF cut. MKW Legend Brendan Payne sits in front of Daniel as his next victim, maybe well see that pass next week.

~~51-100~~
Three players were active in this section, starting off with Heres where the real activity of this week began. #64 Christian W. Christian W only had 1 PR to submit, knocking off a tenth of a point from his score. Further down a battle is emerging between . #80 Jon Coppernoll and . #81 Qi Zhu. Jon had the greater week, with 2 PRs and a whole AF point lost from his old score, but Qi still submitted a PR, unwilling to let Jon go so easily. Jon does have the edge here, with a point and a half of space, so maybe Chaos is a better target for him at 79th.

~~101-Obscurity~~
Two players sent in times here, with #146 Rob Jon submitting 19 PRs for an 8.1 point AF cut. With that ridiculous week he moves from 154th up 8 spots, and 5 more players await in the next three AF points. Finally, last active for the week was #246 Josh Miller, who had a 3 PR submission for a 2.25 point AF cut. He managed to pass one player on the charts too, which Im sure gives him a little motivation boost.

Site Records
Two site records were conquered this week. Daniel Crutcher took down his own Coconut Mall flap while Salvatore Bellusci snatched the Rainbow Road flap record from Marvin Donjes. This doesnt move much around on the table, but it does bump up Salvatore to a tie for 5th with 2 SRs, and take Marvin Donjes off of the list entirely.
Daniel Crutcher beat his own old Coconut Mall lap time of0'04"351 with a time of: 0'04"335
Salvatore Bellusci beat Marvin Donjess old Rainbow Road lap time of0'48"092 with a time of: 0'48"068

Awards
In a week with little activity, recognition can be given to Daniel Crutcher, who earns the 3rd POW of November. Knocking out four PRs to move up a from 50th to 49th position and cutting 2% off of his AF score, he clearly outperformed everyone this week. On top of that, he improved his own SR on Coconut Mall. Dont worry; were still catching up on the past awards still left unclaimed after the cheaters were evicted. Theyll be back up in no time.

Thats the news for this week. Keep karting everyone!
~Web

fields.author: MrL1193
fields.title: Hibernation
fields.content:
Update: November 22nd - December 1st


New Players
No one new stepped into the ring this week.

Movement
A modest 24 players made time for karting this week. A number of them were ones with incomplete timesheets, as is often the case, but none of them managed to finish filling in the rest of their times, unfortunately.

~~1-10~~
As usual, #3 Thomas van Deerse leads the charge this week. With 5 new PR's, he cut almost a full point of AF, almost halving the gap to #2 Nick Meade. And down at the lower end of the group, #8 Leo Petiard also submitted 5 new times, though he only cut a small amount of AF. The dynamic duo seem to have a monopoly on Top 10 activity at the moment, so expect to see them continue on to even greater heights.

~~11-25~~
#12 Salvatore Bellusci looks like he could be joining Thomas and Leo before long. With 3 PR's, he cut enough AF to pass Mark Schmidt and take his title of German Champion. #15 Alex Shoal barely cut any AF, but he did make a nice improvement to his GCN Mario Circuit time. And #21 Liam Ashcroft sent in 7 new times, cutting over 3 AF and leapfrogging 3 players.

~~26-50~~
Not much happened in the rest of the groups this week. #47 Daniel Crutcher passed famed MKW player Brendan Payne with 5 PR's, but not a creature was stirring throughout the rest of the Top 50.

~~51-100~~
Next up, it's #64 Christian W's turn to get a section all to himself. He only improved one time--which, coincidentally, was N64 Bowser's Castle lap--not quite succeeding in cutting AF, but at least mitigating his losses.

~~101+~~
And finally, not too far out in No Man's Land, #132 Rob Jon and #140 James Leare made some nice cuts with large numbers of PR's. James earned a solid 9, cutting ~5.7 AF and passing 3 players, but his improvement paled in comparison to Rob's, who jumped forward 14 places with the same number of PR's, cutting almost 22 points of AF. Rob's accomplishment was made even more impressive by the fact that he apparently didn't hoard any of his times, meaning he must have really been playing hard all week. Great job, Rob; keep up this pace and you'll make the Top 100 in no time!


Site Records
The Site Records front was quite quiet this week, with no transfers of titles going on and only one record being improved at all.

Steve Bernelli improved his own Maple Treeway lap time of 0'26"406 with a time of: 0'25"975


Awards
4th POW of November: Rob Jon - Rob made an incredible amount of progress for just one week's time, PR'ing 14 times and moving from 146th to 132nd. He slashed almost 22 points, or ~11.1%, from his total AF, much more than anyone in the Top 100.
November POM: Rob Jon - Constantly active throughout the month, Rob accumulated a terrific AF cut of ~38.9 points, approximately 18.1% of his total. He raced ahead 27 places, from #159 to #132, and improved 33 of his times along the way.

It's not often that a player can win awards while still ranked outside the Top 100, but Rob did--and if he did, then so can you! So what are you waiting for? Get out there and start karting; with enough effort, anyone can be honored here. Happy karting!

~MrL1193

fields.author: Webinator
fields.title: The Calm Before the Storm
fields.content:
Hey guys, Web here for another edition of your weekly MKW news. Were looking for a few times updaters to help keep the site updated, so if youre interested, apply in the forums!

This news update covers December 2nd to 8th, 2012.

The New Players
Nobody new joined this week, but my investigatory skills tell me next week that someone may be joining the site. Stay tuned!

Movement
Only 19 players picked up their controllers this week, a smaller number than usual (may be attributed to me forgetting to update a few days before today, sorry about that). For once, the second half of this paragraph has meaning. From the weathered and tortured Land of the Unfinished Timesheets, #164 Steven Reinhold burst into the scene. He finished up his timesheet with 8 new submissions. 164th is a very respectable spot to join in on the charts, and with the lack of activity above it shouldnt be hard to push further upwards.

~~The Top 10~~
Big news in the Top 10 this week. #2 Thomas van Deerse submitted 5 PRs including GV2 and DDR improvements to jump ex-champion Nick Meade and pass for the vice crown position on the charts. Champion Tanney has slept for a long time, and now only 79 position improvements separate Thomas from capturing it for himself. Those positions are hard to come by, but they can only seem sweeter as each brings him closer to the title. Also active as always was #7 John Brunn, who had one PR that cut his AF score by two tenths. Hes in a bit of a gap right now, but Leo Petiard has been active recently so any improvements can help hold his ground.

~~11-25 ~~
Two players picked up their controllers in the 11-25 zone this week. #12 Salvatore Bellusci karted his way to a 1:52.180 on Toads Factory, cutting .15 AF off of his total and moving closer to the Top 10. Tony Ros is only two tenths away, but after that a 2 point chasm awaits. The only way to power through is constant activity, so good luck! Next up was #21 Liam Ashcroft, who had a PR of his own, a nice near-29 second sub on rMC flap. It kept him above the red and pushed him closer to the Top 20, though a 1.5 point gap is still sitting in front of him.

~~26-50~~
Two is the magic number this week, with another two karters being active in this group. #26 Sebastian Kovats had an impressive 5 PRs to cut 1.3 AF points. The gaps are crazy at this level, so it didnt net him any place improvements, but hes only .7 away from making this paragraph 50% less active. Finally, #46 Daniel Crutcher has been tearing up the charts recently, this time sending a solid RR flap and a near rDKJP sub that would make any karter shed a tear; 2:16.001. On the positive side, he did pass Marvin Rekovsky and Daniel Anderson isnt far ahead.

~~51-100~~
Only one player, #64 Christian W was active here, breaking the trend but not really surprising anyone in this section of ex-karters and lost PRs. Christian sent in 2 PRs to cut .4 points of AF and almost catching Nate Paternost to move up another spot in the rankings. It cant be that hard when nobody around him is playing though.

~~101-Obscurity~~
To close out the small activity for the week, POM winner #119 Rob Jon had a monster week. He sent in 13 PRs for an 11 point AF cut and an improvement from 132nd position up almost 15 spots. The Top 100 seems in reach at this point with the progress hes making, and its making up for the total lack of activity in the rest of the section.

Site Records
No records changed hands, but three were broken by their old holders. Daniel Crutcher pushed down his CM flap almost half of a tenth, and Blake Germany knocked down both of the DKSC records to try and solidify his hold on the title. Being that no records changed hands, the records table stayed motionless for a week.
Daniel Crutcher beat the old Coconut Mall lap time of0'04"335 with a time of: 0'04"289
Blake Germany beat the old DK's Snowboard Cross crs time of 1'47"987 with a time of: 1'47"533
Blake Germany beat the old DK's Snowboard Cross lap time of 0'34"543 with a time of: 0'34"518

Awards
The first week of the holiday month goes to someone who has been earning his workload over the past few weeks. Rob Jon, wins the 1st POW of December for a ridiculous week of 13 PRs for an 11.6 point AF cut and a 13 spot improvement in the rankings.

Thats the news for this week. Keep karting everyone!
~Web

fields.author: MrL1193
fields.title: Better Late than Never
fields.content:
Update: December 8th - December 15th

Hello everyone, John here with the late edition of your weekly news. I apologize for the delay; rest assured, however, that I didn't forget you. So straightaway, let's get to giving credit where it's due.

New Players
After a dry spell of a few weeks, the site finally saw a couple more newbies decide to take the plunge and join up. This may herald coming holiday activity, and I expect that more will join by next week.

Nathan Chintagavongse (boy I'm glad I don't have to say that out loud) was first up this week. He sent in 32 times...guess which ones? It was a fairly solid set overall, though, highlighted by a 1:51.6 on Toad's Factory. With them, he's guaranteed to at least be better than 265th should he ever send in his lap times.
Sora Hoshi only sent in 8 course times, saying he hadn't done the other courses yet. He seemed to have an affinity for Coconut Mall NonSC, his 1:58.6 hinting that he probably could do much better than the 393rd place his current times rank him at.

Movement
In all, 26 players were active this week, though it seems that not many of them had full timesheets. And, for that matter, no one who had a partial timesheet completed it, so there's no one for me to congratulate here either. Oh well.

~~1-10~~
For once, #2 Thomas van Deerse apparently took a week off, leaving #5 Ruby Aruba to kick off this section. Aruba returned after a lengthy break with PR's on GCN Waluigi Stadium and N64 Bowser's Castle; he still took a net loss in AF, but only the smallest amount possible. #7 John Brunn's AF was also fairly static this week, as he cut the second-smallest amount possible; he only got 1 PR, on DS Delfino Square, but it was enough to hold his ground.

~~11-25~~
The next group didn't show many signs of progress either, despite some degree of activity. #12 Salvatore Bellusci played non-glitch retro DK tracks and came up with 2 PR's, thus taking only the third-smallest net loss possible in AF. And #21 Liam Ashcroft's lone PR barely did anything to mitigate his AF loss at all, but considering the fact that it was a new SR (mentioned below), he probably isn't complaining.

~~26-50~~
Meanwhile, #45 Daniel Crutcher was busy as usual, this week directing his attention to Bowser's Castle and GBA Bowser Castle 3. Those 2 PR's earned him a ~0.6 AF cut, which was good enough for him to pass retired Sherbet Land great Daniel Anderson and claim this paragraph for himself.

~~51-100~~
#62 Christian W also gets his own paragraph this update--for the third week in a row, in fact. He blitzed past Nate Paternost and Dilan Arse with no fewer than 8 PR's, cutting around 2.3 AF. The rest of the Top 100 merely slept the week away, as usual.

~~101+~~
The active players in the post-100 field were surprisingly few and far between this week--no two of them were in the same 100's range, in fact. As a result, #160 Steven Reinhold, who completed his timesheet only last week, took center stage this week, helped by an absurd number of PR's--14 in all. With them, he cut ~6.4 AF and shot past 4 players, including my fellow news writer Zack Weber. Down in the 200's, #245 Josh Miller cut almost one and a half points of AF with 4 PR's, moving up 2 spots. And finally, #360 Christophe Charignon sent in 3 PR's, possibly looking for some Combined Rankings points. He improved 3 places, an average of 1 place per PR, and has a nice cluster of 5 karters ahead of him to look forward to passing should he continue to play.


Site Records
There was a healthy amount of SR activity this week, with four being improved, three of them finding new owners. The most significant change to the rankings resulted from Liam Ashcroft smashing one of Romain Smadja's old flap records, dropping him to 3 SR's and out of his tie with Lee Duggan for most SR's and leaving him in a 3-way tie for second. Liam himself joined the horde of one-record wonders tied for 17th, as did Nafumo Chan, who seized Andrew Grieve's last remaining SR. And finally, Luis G knocked Alvin van Asselt back down into the aforementioned horde by claming one of Alvin's Daisy Circuit records for his own. With it, Luis rose to tied 5th at 2 SR's.

Nafumo Chan beat Andrew Grieve's old Toad's Factory crs time of 1'50"897 with a time of: 1'50"864
Luis G beat Alvin van Asselt's Daisy Circuit crs time of 1'29"518 with a time of: 1'29"428
Axel San improved his own Bowser's Castle crs time of 2'10"917 with a time of: 2'10"532
Liam Ashcroft beat Romain Smadja's old DS Desert Hills lap time of 0'29"568 by over a tenth with a time of: 0'29"432


Awards
2nd POW of December: Christian W - A slow week in the Top 100 gave ever-active Christian a chance to shine. With an impressive 8 PR's, he cut ~2.3 points, or ~2.4% of his total AF, and improved from 64th to 62nd.

That'll do it for this update. Assuming the world hasn't ended by next week, Web should be here to deliver the news then. Until then, happy karting everyone!

~MrL1193

fields.author: Webinator
fields.title: Merry Apocalypse
fields.content:
Hello? If anyone out there still has an internet connection and is safe, somehow untouched by the devastating events that happened a mere nine days ago, Im speaking to you. When I took this job back I knew it would take dedication, so Im writing the news, despite the apocalyptic dystopian society that now lies before us. Heres the last week of news I may ever be able to deliver.

This news update covers December 16nd to 29th, 2012.

The New Players
As the day of our demise drew nearer, several players decided it was necessary to cross one more objective off of their bucket list and join the MKWPP before it was reduced to ashes. The final three new players included:
John Western sent in his prized 8 records he managed to frantically kart with shaking hands. He slots in at 427th.
Tim Driebergen submitted 31 PRs to put him at a theoretical 370th. What was the one course time he forgot to write down? Its too late to go back and check now, but if only he had his Mushroom Gorge PR on hand his 3lap timesheet would have been completed before the worlds demise.
Niral Patel was luckier than Tim, in that he managed to submit all of his course times before the tidal wave washed over his home. He placed in at 335th, but probably will have to spend the week bailing out water.

Movement
In an effort to send in those long-hoarded final PRs, 36 players were active over the last two weeks. However no one from the land of unfinished timesheets was active and attempting to join the full AF chart, cementing their position in that dubious group for eternity.

~~The Top 10~~
The Top 10 was quite active this week, perhaps attempting to put their final stakes in their MKW legacy before the rankings became final. One karter was determined to reach the top spot before the apocalypse destroyed the Earth, and accomplished that. New #1 Thomas van Deerse had 8 PRs ovr the last week, cutting 1.1 points of AF and hurdling Shaun Tanney mere weeks after passing Nick Meade for #2. His climb to the top has been long and hard, but its finally rewarded with the champions crown. And with the impending apocalypse, nobody will really be alive to challenge him, so congrats! The rest of the Top 10 was the usual players. #7 Leo Petiard had an impressive 8 PR streak, setting his final time right before the meteors started to hit. Cutting .7812 points of AF, he distanced himself further from #8 John Brunn, who continued to play and set one PR. It wasnt enough to cut any AF, but John will be faithfully back at the news desk next week despite the craters and carnage around.

~~11-25 ~~
#11 Salvatore Bellusci was desperate to reach the Top 10 before the end of the world, but couldnt quite reach that position. He sent in three new improvements to cut .15 AF points, but with #10 Aziz Abdullah still 1.5 points away, that goal will now never be realized. The final active member here was #20 Liam Ashcroft, who had one last PR to submit, not really gaining any ground on Cole for #19, but every little bit of AF counts when the massive power outages start to happen.

~~26-50~~
Nobody played in this group. Either the end of the world selectively hit at each of these 25 players homes early, or they just didnt feel like spending their last days trying to PR. I can admire the latter, but its probably just them not playing as usual again.

~~51-100~~
The bulk of the activity was in this group, where four karters across the range of the group attempted to break those final PRs before it all ended. First up was #57 Frederick Hutchington, who sent in three PRs, moved from #59 to #57, and accepted the new times updater job, which now that I think about it means he doesnt really have to update anymore now that the world has ended. Thanks for volunteering anyway though! #61 Christian W had eight new times of his own, moving up one spot on the charts and cutting 1.4 AF points. He was one of the always-active members, so its sad we wont see any more times submissions from him. #75 Stacy Needham was probably running around to all seven of the games trying to pad out his combined rank as the power lines started to fall down. He managed to move up a spot with two PRs, and a .35 AF cut. Finally, #81 Qi Zhu had a three PR streak, but couldnt gain any ground.

~~101-Obscurity~~
Showing the true severity of the situation, six players were active down here, where only one or two ever manage to PR regularly. #127 Tom Norton logged on to submit a new SR improvement on rDS, but it didnt cut any points since he already had the record. The resident Auto expert of the MKW community #132 Brett Edwards was also back, sending in six times (two of which were SRs), to cut three points of AF and move up a spot. Maybe Brett has taken refuge in Peach Gardens while the catastrophe took place, its flammable but its probably far enough away from Earth to be safe. #156 Steven Reinhold had seven PRs this week for an almost 7 AF cut, quite impressive for his rank. Next up was a player who really had some MKW playing to do before the end of the world. #196 Andrew Ahearn, previously ranked 424th, sent in an entirely new timesheet, (thats right, all 64 times), to cut 347 AF points and move up several hundred places. Quite an impressive move, as no one wants to be remembered as third to last on the MKW charts as the world ends. #348 Stephen De Winter sent in one time, but due to Andrews massive submission he dropped a spot on the charts. Finally, #399 Stefan Glosby pulls off a milestone of his own, setting 21 PRs for a 9 point AF cut, and jumping 10 spots up to 399th. Reaching the Top 400 on your last week Is pretty impressive, especially slotting in one spot above the cutoff.

Site Records
Four new records were set, with three changing hands and one being an impressive improvement. Mr. 1:59 Brett Edwards was back wreaking havoc on rPG, breaking the tie with Reiner on the 3lap and reclaiming the flap from ROM. Sword improved his own rDS to push it achingly close to the sub, while Thomas Petraud pushed glitch rPB down another few tenths away from Alex Shoal. On the site record table, this meant longtime greats Alex and Reiner were pushed off completely, while Brett and Thomas improved from two to three SRs and moved to a tie for 3rd on that chart. Sword still sits high with Lee Duggan with 4 SRs at the top of the table.

Thomas Petraud beat the old GCN Peach Beach crs time of 1'07"804 with a time of: 1'07"342
Tom Norton beat the old DS Delfino Square crs time of2'05"062 with a time of: 2'05"034
Brett Edwards beat the old DS Peach Gardens crs time of1'59"8241'59"824 with a time of: 1'59"653
Brett Edwards beat the old DS Peach Gardens lap time of0'38"507 with a time of: 0'38"469

Awards
The third POW of December, goes to Leo Petiard, for 4 PRs and a 1.4 AF cut, moving past John Brunn on the charts and further into the Top 10.

Keep posted for the end of the year awards coming soon, including 4th POW December, POM December, 4th POQ 2012, and the POY.

Hope everyone had a happy holidays, sorry for the news being a week late but the stats werent updated for last week so only six people would have been mentioned. Also, welcome to Frederick Hutchington as a new times updater, hopefully hell help keep us on task with times updating. We might be getting a new updater next week too, so stay tuned and thanks for volunteering.

~Web

fields.author: MrL1193
fields.title: Strong Start
fields.content:
Update: December 29th, 2012 - January 5th, 2013

Hello, John here to deliver the first news update of 2013. We've managed to clean up most of the debris from two weeks ago, and we're ready to make a fresh start in the new year. Let's take a look at the year's first new times.

New Players
The new year brought several new players to the site--three in all. And in a shocking twist of events, two of them joined with full timesheets, no New Year's Resolutions needed. If only all newbies were so thorough!

Geoffrey Ewbank was one of these newbies, his thoroughness possibly stemming from his SMK background. He starts off at the humble rank of 409th, but he'll probably improve quickly once he starts learning how to use bikes.
Sack Zero was the other player who joined with a full set. His times earned him a solid starting rank of 112th, and included an impressive Mushroom Gorge Course NonSC time.
Fra Lenoob boasted an even stronger MG NonSC time than Zero--2nd on the NonSC charts, in fact--but at the cost of only having 20 course times to submit. He's guaranteed a minimum rank of 319th or so for now, which will probably improve greatly if he ever adds his lap times.

Movement
The coming of a new year prompted a bigger turnout than usual this week, with a total of 33 players working to overcome the AF treadmill even as people around the world hopped on their treadmills to get started on their New Year's Resolutions. Even the laggards in the Land of Unfinished Timesheets caught the spirit of new beginnings, it seems; #283 Tim Driebergen finally filled in his last few times to join the main pack this week. Hopefully this newfound life among the players will last into the year to come.

~~1-10~~
Leading the charge, and, indeed, the whole field this week, new champion #1 Thomas van Deerse set about distancing himself from the field with new, improved WGM and rDKM laps. He only barely cut AF, but since the inactive players behind him suffered significant backsliding, Thomas pulled away a fair bit, to a distance of a quarter of a point. #5 Ruby Aruba was active as well, coming up with a new N64 Bowser's Castle course time, but it wasn't enough to overcome the AF treadmill. #7 Leo Petiard was a bit more successful, inching closer to #6 Jak Russo with 2 new PR's on DKSC couse and MT lap. #8 John Brunn closed out the Top 10's activity with a small improvement to his rYF course time, which just barely helped mitigate his losses to the AF treadmill.

~~11-25~~
Meanwhile, #11 Salvatore Bellusci has been hard at work on his New Year's resolution to break into the Top 10. He worked off another ~.3 AF with 5 PR's, but there's still just over a full point separating him from #10 Aziz Abdullah. #19 Cole Gilbert's lone rYF course PR did little to help his AF, but that's pretty common when you're already close to the top on a particular course. #22 Paul-Philipp Baehr made the biggest cut in the group, shedding ~2.9 AF with 7 PR's and passing Fabien Jacques and Alvin Le as he went.

~~26-50~~
The lower half of the Top 50 was the odd group out, as it was far quieter than the rest. Only #26 Sebastian Kovats came out to play, cutting the very smallest amount of AF possible with his 3 PR's. He's now less than .3 AF away from #25 Jamie Disley, so just holding his ground again next week could be enough to push him into the Top 25.

~~51-100~~
Almost 30 places down from Sebastian, #55 Tim van Ham made a return to MKW for the new year, improving both his LC times and cutting a bit of AF to end the week at an even 84 points. #57 Christian W decided that he wanted to kick off 2013 by submitting 13 PR's, dropping ~5.5 AF and passing 4 players. #69 Luke Berrill only improved 6 of his times, and cut less AF than Christian, but he still managed to pass 1 player more than Mr. W due to how closely his rivals were clustered. #79 Jon Coppernoll proceeded at a more sedate pace, cutting exactly 2 AF and passing 1 player with 3 PR's, one of which was a new American Record on rYF. This helped Jon to keep his distance from #81 Qi Zhu, the last active player in the Top 100. Qi, unfortunately, fell victim to the AF treadmill despite improvements to his MMM course PR and his already highly-ranked DKSC lap. He's still not too far behind Jon, though, so he may catch up again soon.

~~101+~~
Not too many players were active outside the Top 100, but they made up for their low attendance with an abundance of PR's. #121 Murray Wright sent in a whopping 25 improved times, knocking off ~19.1 AF and flying past 15 rival karters. #149 Steven Reinhold didn't do too badly himself, cutting ~6.5 AF and jumping forward 7 places with 13 PR's. #400 Stefan Glosby was the only unlucky player of the bunch; due to the 2 new arrivals jumping into the ranks ahead of him, the AF treadmill was turned up to the max for him, and he actually lost a place this week, as well as falling back in AF. His 4 PR's did help lessen the damage, however, and with continued effort, he should start making progress again before long.


Site Records
The first Site Records of the year were both brought to us by Steve Bernelli, who was also in possession of them at the end of last year. It's a good thing he did improve them, since he would have lost the 3-Lap to Thomas Petraud if he hadn't. For now, they both remain tied with Brett Edwards for third on the SR table, with 3 SR's each--one less than co-leaders Tom Norton and Lee Duggan.

Steve Bernelli improved his own Maple Treeway crs time from 2'01"741 to 2'01"186
Steve Bernelli also improved his Maple Treeway lap time from 0'25"509 to 0'25"443


Awards
4th POW of December: Thomas van Deerse - With one last strong push, Thomas finally passed Shaun Tanney to become the new site champion. 6 PR's and an impressive ~.8 AF cut helped prove that his lack of SR's didn't mean that he hadn't earned his crown.
December POM: Thomas van Deerse - Thomas completed his meteoric rise to the top in spectacular fashion, improving 14 different times and cutting ~1.9 AF. Despite never claiming any SR's, he was still able to pass Shaun Tanney and Nick Meade to affirm his status as MKW's best all-around player.

Stay tuned for 2012's 4th POQ, and keep an eye out on the message board for the 2012 POY poll. We'll announce the winners here once they've been determined. Until next update, happy new year and happy karting!

~MrL1193

fields.author: MrL1193
fields.title: Playing Catch-up
fields.content:
Update: January 5th - January 29th


New Players
Two new players found their way to the site this month: Carlo Scarian and Daniel Berti. I guess they heard my wish last update that more newbies would submit full timesheets, because they both did so, joining the rankings quite close together--Carlo at 277th and Daniel at 266th.

Movement
With 43 players submitting new times, there's a fair amount of activity to cover this update. And not least among them was #187 Anthony Caiulo, who completed his timesheet and jumped in above the 200 mark. Hopefully he'll keep up the good work, now that he's eligible for further mentions in the activity report.

~~1-10~~
All the usual suspects were active among the players with single-digit ranks. #1 Thomas van Deerse managed to keep busy with 2 PR's, shaving a bit more off his AF and securing his position at the top. #5 Ruby Aruba didn't quite manage to fully offset his natural AF backsliding, but he came close with 3 PR's. #7 Leo Petiard made a good bit of progress with 4 PR's, inching ever closer to #6 Jak Russo. And #8 John Brunn stayed alive by improving his DS Yoshi Falls time several times. He still lost some ground in AF, but he did claim the SR, if only temporarily.

~~11-25~~
John wasn't the only one playing DS Yoshi Falls, as #19 Cole Gilbert showed his strength on the course as well, emerging on top for the moment. He didn't improve any of his other times, but he still mitigated his AF drift by a bit. Cole may soon be under pressure to defend his GCN Peach Beach record, however, as #20 Liam Ashcroft started closing in on the 1:13 sub there, posing a twofold threat to Cole as he also crept closer in AF. In total, Liam improved 4 of his times, cutting roughly ~0.6 AF.

~~26-50~~
#39 Franco Gubser popped in this month with a new Coconut Mall 3-Lap time, which helped keep his AF backsliding to a minimum. #45 Daniel Crutcher was active as well, turning in 2 new times to the tune of ~0.5 AF off his total. And just joining the Top 50 is #50 Tim van Ham. Tim has been keeping busy since he picked up the game again during winter break, and he becomes the first player this update to move up in the ranks. He submitted 6 new times, cutting ~4.1 AF and passing 5 players to just barely make it into the Top 50.

~~51-100~~
The lower half of the Top 100 was easily the most active group this update. #51 Christian W was a major contributor, though he probably wishes he weren't. With a commendable 15 PR's to report, he would have broken into the Top 50 if Tim hadn't edged him out. As it is, though, he still managed to move up 6 places, cutting ~6.2 AF. #54 Danny Gallenberger had the misfortune of being passed by both Tim and Chris, meaning that instead of moving up 2 spots, he stayed right at the same rank, even though he cut ~1.1 AF with his new DK Summit PR's. #58 Frederick Hutchington also remained at the same rank, though this is because he was just behind Tim and Chris to begin with. With both of them gone, he's suddenly faced with a bit of an AF gap to cross in order to pass his next rival. Fortunately, he did chip away at it with 3 PR's, reducing it to just over 2 points. #68 Luke Berrill found himself falling back in AF rather than moving forward, but he did his best to offset the loss with a new GCN DK Mountain lap time. It was enough for him to pass former Daisy Circuit king Agustin Berrios, so I guess it could be considered a victory. Meanwhile, #75 Stacy Needham popped in with his first 2 PR's of the year, cutting exactly an eighth of a point of AF. #81 Qi Zhu also submitted 2 PR's, both on DKSC, though they only barely offset his AF drift. #94 Sam Smith sent in half a dozen PR's, making solid progress by passing 3 players and cutting ~1.6 AF. #95 Sack Zero was the biggest mover of the group, however, charging in all the way from 112th, improving 18 times and cutting ~22.2 AF along the way. #99 Blake Germany rounds out the Top 100 this month. He got knocked down a spot by Zero, but he still managed to improve both his DK Summit SR's and cut ~1.3 AF with 2 other PR's, so he's probably still content with his month's work.

~~101+~~
Out in the Land of Triple Digit Ranks, #119 Rob Jon sent in a lone PR, a sub 1:46 on Moonview Highway, which counteracted the natural AF backsliding he suffered at least a bit. #138 Steven Reinhold had a strong run of 20 PR's, which pushed him forward 11 places and knocked almost 16 points off his AF. #210 Stan Barmentloo followed suit with his own score of PR's, rocketing past 14 players and cutting almost as much AF as Steven. #352 Stephen de Winter was a bit unlucky, getting hit hard by the entry of the new players because of his lower rank. His new Grumble Volcano times would have been enough to gain a spot, but instead, they only limited his loss to 2 places instead of 3. However, #378 Stefan Glosby didn't let the new players keep him down. He managed to improve 14 of his times, trying out several glitches for the first time, and cut ~34.3 AF, shooting forward 32 places. Keep it up, Stefan!


Site Records
The only change to the Site Record table this week was that DS Yoshi Falls specialist Clement Blizzard lost his only SR, which had stood for almost 3 years straight. Both Cole Gilbert and John Brunn managed to beat Clement's old time, with Cole holding the lead for now. With it, Cole doubles his SR count to 2, moving up to tied 6th in the rankings.

Blake Germany improved his own DK's Snowboard Cross crs time of 1'47"533 to a time of: 1'46"980
Blake Germany also improved his own DK's Snowboard Cross lap time of 0'34"518 to a time of: 0'34"382
Cole Gilbert beat Clement Blizzard's (very) old DS Yoshi Falls crs time of 0'59"207 with a time of: 0'59"137


Awards
The community has made their decision: 2012's Player of the Year, by a landslide, is none other than Thomas van Deerse! Thomas continues the Players' Page tradition by becoming the 5th champion to win the Player of the Year award. He started out at 13th in 2012, almost 25 AF away from 1st, but played consistently throughout the year, steadily working his way up. He finally overtook Shaun Tanney for the title with just a week left in the year, having improved 60/64 of his times and cut ~23.6 AF, or ~63.4% of his total AF. Congratulations!

The first award of the new year, the first POW of January, also goes to Thomas van Deerse. Even though the other players were quite quiet this week, Thomas kept playing after taking the crown to secure his position, earning 2 more PR's and cutting another ~0.14 points, or ~1.03% from his AF.

2nd POW of January: Christian W - A terrific string of a dozen PR's earned Christian this award. He cut ~3.2 points / ~3.7% from his AF and moved up one place to 56th.
3rd POW of January: Tim van Ham - In a particularly quiet week, Tim's solid ~2.2 point / ~2.7% AF cut stood out. He moved up 2 places to 50th with only 3 PR's.


That's all for this update. See you next time, and happy karting!

~MrL1193

fields.author: blahperson15
fields.title: Yes, we are still alive
fields.content:
Hi, I've stepped in to help out with the updates. I don't really have much to say about myself, so I'll get straight into this well-needed emergency catch-up update. It might not be that interesting, since I'm trying to get it done fast for you, but I hope it fulfills your karting news needs.

Update: January 29th - March 15th

New Players
A fair number of players joined the site in the past 6 weeks. Here's who they are:
Michele Gallastri, who submitted 31 out of 64 times. Were his timesheet complete, he would be theoretically placed 246th.
Mamadou Kane, who also joined with an incomplete timesheet, submitting 32 times. Mamadou's theoretical placing is 334th.
Simone Serra, who submitted 31 times, theoretically placing 344th. Noticing a pattern here?
Gabe Mastare, who submitted only 5 times and thus gains a theoretical rank of 418th.
Ray Parsons, who beat Gabe in the least-times-sent rankings by sending only two times in. Ray's theoretical rank is 430th.
And, last but most certainly not least, Andrew Knight, the only new player to submit a full sheet of 64 times! Anyone who hasn't is encouraged to follow by his example! He joins the charts and slots in at 305th.

Movement
Despite the long timespan, only 50 players were active during this time. Let's see what happened:

1~10
Starting off the activity over these past 6 weeks is non other than Site Champion #1 Thomas van Deerse. He made two PRs, however it wasn't quite enough to stop his AF from slipping slightly due to the all-too-well-known treadmill effect. Next up, #5 Ruby Aruba made a single PR, also slipping a little further down. #7 Leo Petiard played hard, however, making a large 12 PRs and cutting half the distance between him and #6 Jak Russo.

10~25
#11 Salvatore Bellusci starts off this section this time, with 2 PRs that helped to negate his natural AF loss, although he still slipped a little. #19 Cole Gilbert and #20 Liam Ashcroft made one and two PRs repectively, both joining the trend of making improvements but still slipping. Finally in this bracket, #25 Sebastian Kovats, who made 7 PRs during this time which was enough to jump #25 Jamie Disley for his spot in the top 25.

26~50
#26 Jamie Disley leads this group today. Despite making 3 PRs, it wasn't enough to stop Sebastian from barely passing him for his spot, pushing him down one place to 26th. #39 Franco Gubser and #46 Daniel Anderson each made a single PR, hanging in there but nevertheless slipping a little. #47 Christian Wild, however, was very eager to make a move, making 6 PRs, and with it, a big leap from 51st.

51~100
#68 Luke Berrill played during this time, making 6 PRs and cutting AF but staying firmly rooted to the spot. Right behind him, #69 Qi Zhu made a massive leap from 81st to his current position on the charts, with 10 PRs and cutting over 10 points of AF. #76 Stacy Needham made 2 PRs, enough to almost fully counterbalance the slide that affected so many people. #80 Jon Coppernoll made 3 PRs, but conversely he fell more than Stacy, closing off the activity for this group.

101~436
Many large leaps happened in this area of the charts. First off is #116 Murray Wright, who made 13 PRs, which certainly didn't net him any bad luck as he jumped up 5 places from #121. Not far behind him is #120 Fra Lenoob, who completed their timesheet and hence landed in this group full of activity. Not far behind him again is #123 Steven Reinhold, who made an impressive 23 PRs which was rewarded with a huge jump from 138th.

Further down the chart, #166 Anthony Caiulo also made a massive effort, making 16 PRs and moving 21 places up the charts. #197 Florian Truetschel joined in on the activity making 13 PRs and jumping up 5 places too. However, right behind him, #198 Daniel Berti will give Florian something to worry about. Daniel went on a massive PR spree, improving 37 of his times and cutting almost a hundred AF points, giving him a huge 68 place leap up the charts. As mentioned earlier, #305 Andrew Knight joined the charts this week with a full timesheet. I'm sure he'll keep rising soon since he's made the effort to join with a full set of times. And last but not least, we have #362 Stefan Glosby, who improved 43 of his times, leaving 16 players in the dust behind him.

Site Records
5 site records have changed over the past 6 weeks, although only two changed hands, showing the determination of these players to push their own times to the absolute limit. Sebastian Kovats gained his first SR this week, dropping Salvatore Bellusci's total to one. Alexandre Agniel gained a second SR, knocking Dylan Imhoff off the SR table completely.

Sam Fairless improved his own Mushroom Gorge lap time of 0'07"289 with a time of: 0'07"023
Joshua Bernelli improved his own Maple Treeway lap time of 0'25"443 with a time of: 0'24"845
Sebastian Kovats beat the old Bowser's Castle lap time of 0'42"563 with a time of: 0'42"368
Salvatore Bellusci improved his own Rainbow Road lap time of 0'48"068 with a time of: 0'48"048
Alexandre Agniel beat the old GBA Bowser's Castle 3 crs time of 1'58"805 with a time of: 1'58"566


Well, that's all from me! Happy karting, everyone!

~blahperson15

fields.author: blahperson15
fields.title: Rebirth
fields.content:
The last twelve days saw a massive surge in activity, including Cole taking the oldest WR in the game - gaining the first ever sub-59 time on DS Yoshi Falls and ending Omega's time that lasted just short of 3 years.
So, without further ado, let's see what happened!

Update: March 15th - March 27th

New Players
Two new players have joined since the last update, and they are:
Ryan Hower, who submitted a completed timesheet, slotting in at 429th;
Sam Lyoko, who submitted only two times.

Movement
This week saw 51 players take on the world.

1~10
Once again, Site Champion #1 Thomas van Deerse starts of the activity, making dual rWS PRs to scare off anyone who Deerse to come near him, increasing the gap between himself and Shaun. #6 Leo Petiard also continues to move up through the top Zoan of the charts, making another 4 PRs and bringing him ever closer to Aruba after passing Jak. Right behind him, #7 Jak Russo improved his DDR 3lap, however he gained no places despite his efforts. It's possible that he is using this as a Ruse to scare Lee into improving his SR, but perhaps we will see a new person holding this SR soon. #10 Aziz Abdullah also played this week, submitting 4 PRs to maintain his position in the top 10.

11~25
#11 Salvatore Bellusci continues to drag Aziz to his Doom as he continues his efforts to get into the top 10, Dashing to make 3 PRs including the RR flap SR. Old time Site Champion #16 David McPartland Bubbled back into life this week, making a surprise PR on rYF, most likely inspired by the recent activity there. Past the big AF gap in his shadow, #17 Liam Ashcroft sLAshed 5 of his times to make a large AF cut, passing 3 players and narrowing the gap between himself and David. #20 Cole Gilbert didn't gain any places this week but improved his rYF SRs, taking down Omega's aforementioned prestigious WR in the process, which everyone thought was really Cole (Sorry, I couldn't come up with anything better). #25 Sebastian Kovats closes off the Top 25 this time, making an impressive DKSC flap, achieving the Kovated God time.

26~50
#38 Andre Hoelscher made 6 PRs this week, jumping 5 players to make a big move, punching a big Hoel in front of him. Despite falling victim to Andre, #39 Franco Gubser managed to move himself into a tie for 39th with Robert van Zanten with a single PR. He also almost left me unable to make any lame puns, which quite Francoly is disappointing. #48 Alexandre Agniel decided to complete his timesheet, after the giant Rave when he took the rBC3 WR.

51~100
#58 Kyle R, who has the shortest last name I have ever seen, submitted a strong GV2 PR, but fell a place due to Alexandre completing his timesheet. #66 Luke Berrill made a Berrilliant 13 PRs, moving up two places. #70 Qi Zhu continued to Zhoom along this week with another 5 PRs. #74 Thomas Ullrich improved his GV 3lap this week, pulling him Ulltimately close to the SR. #77 Stacy Needham decided that he Needed Ham this week, so headed down to the Delfino Square Butchery, accidentally completing a lap in his fastest time yet.

101~436
#101 Evan Simmons Summoned another 2 PRs to his collection, getting closer to breaking into the top 100. #114 Fra Lenoob and #115 Steven Reinhold were in close rivalry this week, making 10 and 8 PRs and gaining 6 and 8 places respectively. Despite Steven Holding tightly onto his Reins as he sped along, Fra proved he wasn't actually Le Noob by staying just ahead. #158 Anthony Caiulo made an impressive 20 PRs this week, saying Cia(ul)o to the 8 people he passed as a result. Joining the charts this week is #168 Nathan Chintagavongse (it's pronounced Chintagavongse), who filled out the remaining holes in his timesheet. #252 Russell Horwood decided to Russell his leaves, making a single PR on LC flap. #354 Stefan Glosby kept up his fast pace of PRs this week, beating another 15 of his times and moving up 8 places, in the process proving to #356 Stephen De Winter that his name is spelt in a superior way. #387 Dave Castaneda Cast his Net and went fishing for records too, catching 13 of them and moving up a place. Finally, aforementioned new member #429 Ryan Hower submitted his timesheet, bringing the Movement section to a close.

Site Records
Since the last news there has been massive Site Record activity, with 9 records broken!

Fra Lenoob beat the old Toad's Factory crs time of 1'50"864 with a time of: 1'50"806
Michael Penninck smashed his own Mario Circuit crs time of 1'04"278 with a time of: 1'01"820
Joshua Bernelli improved his ownMaple Treeway crs time of 2'01"186 with a time of: 2'00"383
Salvatore Bellusci improved his own Rainbow Road lap time of 0'48"048 with a time of: 0'47"880
Cole Gilbert improved his own DS Yoshi Falls crs time of 0'59"137 with the first ever sub-59 time of: 0'58"970
Thomas Petraud beat the old N64 Sherbet Land lap time of 0'39"962 with a time of: 0'39"842
Thomas Petraud improved his own GCN Waluigi Stadium crs time of 1'49"140 with a time of: 1'48"979
Thomas Petraud beat the old GCN Waluigi Stadium lap time of 0'35"448 with a time of: 0'35"229
Tyler Reyes beat the old SNES Mario Circuit 3 crs time of 1'18"192 by the skin of his teeth with a time of: 1'18"188

Well, that's all from me again! Happy karting, everyone!

~blahperson15

fields.author: blahperson15
fields.title: Important notice: DKSC Glitch
fields.content:
As some of you may already be aware, a glitch was discovered overnight on DKSC. Please refrain from posting DKSC glitch times to the Yahoo group until such a time when a seperate chart has been created, and the current entries backed up to the non-glitch charts.

For an explanation of the glitch, try here.

Sorry for the inconvenience.

fields.author: blahperson15
fields.title: Redeath
fields.content:
Hi. I know I definitely owe you all an apology for being slack with updates, especially considering I've only just started doing them recently. As a university student I can't always dedicate time to updating, and I am sorry that you have had to suffer as a result.

Anyway, I'll carry on now without any more soppy life stories. Over the last while some people played kart and moved up. Some people didn't play kart and moved down. Some people did play kart but moved down anyway.

So, let's see what exactly happened!

Update: March 27th - April 22nd

New Players
Six new players have joined us, so allow me to introduce them:
Jay Carr joins the charts with a full timesheet in 113th place, which is surprisingly high for a new player.
Cornelius Jacobson also joined with a full timesheet. He enters with a placing of 256th.
Nikash Gill submitted 32 times with a theoretical ranking of 368th.
Conor Gilbertson submitted 33 times with a theoretical ranking of 382nd.
David Delzenne submitted 32 times with a theoretical ranking of 391st.
Elias Malave submitted 32 times with a theoretical ranking of 437th.

Of course, these last four players still have times to submit in order to join the AF rankings, so we can expect them to rise as (if) they complete their timesheets.

Movement
46 people have played since the last update, or rather, 46 people managed to make PRs.

1~10
This is how the Top 10 looked recently:


#1 Thomas van Deerse leads the pack this time once again, and he's made another 8 PRs and cut almost 0.6 AF. #2 Shaun Tanney was in pursuit with 10 PRs of his own and cut a tiny bit less than Thomas did. #6 Leo Petiard continued his never-ending progress with yet another 4 PRs which was plenty enough to compensate for any backsliding and edge him ever closer to Aruba's 5th place spot, which is now less than half an AF point away. And last but most certainly not least is #8 Salvatore Bellusci, who made 10 PRs which catapulted him into the top 10 by a considerable margin, cutting over 3 full AF points.

By the way, whoever drew that picture sucks.

11~25
The top portion of this group was completely inactive, however there was plenty of competition to be had a little further down. The first of these is #17 Liam Ashcroft who, despite making 2 PRs, slipped a little, although a little is a lot less than the AF of the people above him suffered. Behind him is #18 Paul-Philipp Baehr who made a big cut, cutting just shy of 10% of his total AF and vaulting over four other players. And then, right behind him, we have #19 Cole Gilbert, who jumped up into a tie with Reinier for 19th place with 1 PR. The competition continued in this section, and, not wanting to be left out, #23 Alvin Le made 6 PRs to make a healthy cut. And finally, #25 Sebastian Kovats made 10 PRs too, since, you know, making a ton of PRs has been such a fad over the last while, cutting of most of the large void that was between him and his next rival.

26~50
Most of this group have been hibernating lately. Thankfully, a few realised that it isn't actually winter and did play. #26 Jamie Disley was one of those people. He made only a single PR, but that PR was also a new Site Record. #35 Franco Gubser made an impressive cut, jumping up 4 places with his 5 PRs, keeping up his recent activity. #45 Christian W also gained a place with his 4 PRs. #49 Danny Gallenberger jumps into the top 50 from 55th, making 10 PRs, which is as many as the rest of this bracket combined.

51~100
This group also saw only 4 people play, although some large cuts were made by those who did play. First off is #59 Luke Berrill, who improved a quarter of his timesheet to make a 7 place cut. Knocking on his doorstep is #61 Qi Zhu, who made 17 PRs and made an even bigger 9 place cut from 70th. New to the top 100 we have #83 Cyril Fulag, who improved a full half of his times to get all the way here from just outside the top 100. #96 Sam Smith also played, but his 1 PR wasn't enough to stop him from dropping a place in Cyril's wake.

101~438
At the top of this group we have a large number of players all vying for a spot in the top 100. First in the queue is #102 Evan Simmons, who made 5 PRs and cut ~3.7AF points, but surprisingly dropped a spot as Cyril flew past. However, the gap between him and the top 100 is now very small indeed. The next person in the queue is #103 Fra Lenoob, who looks like he might plan to jump the queue after gaining 11 places with his 6 PRs. #106 Murray Wright also joined in the fun moving up 13 places with 14 PRs. And at the back of the queue is #107 Ashley O'Hara, who made 4 PRs and gets one place closer to the top 100.

New player #113 Jay Carr joins us close to the top of this bracket. #146 Anthony Caiulo beat 19 of his times and was rewarded with a 12 place cut for his efforts. Further down, our other new player on the AF charts, #256 Cornelius Jacobson also joins. And finally, #346 Stefan Glosby continues his endless activity, gaining another 6 places with his 21 PRs.

Site Records
There are 6 new Site Records, and also one that changed hands because of a certain frozen player having their account rightly deleted, and I will mention those too.

Shaun Tanney beat Fra Lenoob's old Toad's Factory crs time of 1'50"806 with a time of: 1'50"792
After a SR battle with Qi Zhu, Shaun Tanney came out on top and beat Marc Bas' old Toad's Factory lap time of 0'35"163 with a time of: 0'35"135
Paul-Philipp Baehr beat the old illegitimate Coconut Mall crs time of 0'34"642 with a time of: 0'34"347
Joshua Bernelli continued to improve his own Maple Treeway crs time of 2'00"383 with a time of: 2'00"100
Joshua Bernelli continued to improve his own Maple Treeway lap time of 0'24"845 with a time of: 0'24"483
Jamie Disley beat Romain Smadja's old DS Yoshi Falls lap time of 0'18"451 by a single millisecond with a time of: 0'18"450
Andrew Grieve inherited the GCN DK Mountain crs SR with a time of: 2'04"214

Until next time!
~blahperson15

fields.author: Silver
fields.title: Catching up yet again
fields.content:
Hi, blahpy's caught up in university issues again so I decided to help out with news updating. For future reference, the name's Dave Tandy, though you may know me from other sites as Suprsilver or just Silver. I don't know what else to put here so let's just get started with the news update, shall we?

Update: April 22nd - June 4

New Players
7 new players decided to join the PP since the last news update.
Ray Gredon joins us with a full timesheet and a ranking of 120th.
Patrick Fjordbak joined with 6 times and a theoretical ranking of 418th, assuming all his other times are last place.
Alessandro Orsenigo joined with 30 times and a theoretical ranking of 335th.
David Batke joined with 40 times and a theoretical ranking of 262nd.
Jeff Holtgen joined with 2 times and a theoretical ranking of 440th.
Justin Coulston joined with 32 times and a theoretical ranking of 258th.
Stavros Ferentinos joined with 32 times and a theoretical ranking of 281st.

Movement
70 people submitted PRs since the last news update.

1 - 10
#1 Thomas van Deerse continues to secure his gold medal, submitting 7 PRs and cutting .4 AF. #2 Shaun Tanney submitted 6 PRs but gained .25 AF. #4 Marc Bas submitted just one PR, and wasn't able to cut any AF. #5 Leo Petiard made 5 PRs, moving him up one spot but gaining AF as well. Next, we have #7 Salvatore Bellusci, who submitted 14 PRs, cut 2.6 AF, moved up one spot, and continues his climb up the AF ladder. Rounding up the top 10 for this update, #9 Dave Tandy made 3 PRs but doesn't move up in the rankings or cut AF.

11 - 25
#11 Aziz Abdullah kicks off this section by making 4 PRs and cutting just under 1 AF. #16 Paul-Philipp Baehr submitted 5 PRs, moved up 2 spots, and cut 2.5 AF. Lastly, #23 Alvin Le made 2 PRs but didn't lose AF or gain a spot.

26 - 50
#28 Andre Hoelscher submitted 10 PRs, moving him up 11 places. #34 Franco Gubser also played, submitting 3 PRs and moving up one place. #41 Christian W cut 4 places by submitting 23 PRs. Arriving at the bottom of the group, we see a surge in activity. In fact, #44 through #50 all played with the exception of #47. Shame on you, Oliver Martin. Anyway, #44 Daniel Crutcher made 6 PRs and moved up two spots. #45 Qi Zhu submitted 20 PRs and moves up 16 whole places. If that wasn't impressive enough for you, #46 Cyril Fulag submitted 35 PRs and catapults himself from #83, moving up 37 places and cutting 43 whole AF points. To be fair, though, he probably just released a hoard. #48 Danny Gallenberger submitted 5 PRs and moves himself up one place. #49 Luke Berrill moves up from #59 and submitted 18 PRs. Rounding up the group, #50 Alexandre Agniel submitted two PRs but lost two spots due to the activity above him.

51 - 100
The top half of this group was relatively inactive. #66 Dilan Arse made one PR but it didn't affect his ranking. #69 Simone Bertini was quite active, making 19 PRs and moving up 9 spots. #89 Evan Simmons, #90 Tom Norton, and #91 Fra Lenoob were all active, submitting 5, 29, and 15 times and cutting 13, 43 (!), and 12 places, respectively. #93 Darragh Williamson completes his timesheet and joins us at #93, making a total of 27 PRs. Finally, #98 Steven Reinhold submitted 18 PRs and moves up 19 spots.

101+
"Blake's Summit" expert #102 Blake Germany makes 2 PRs, but falls down 2 spots. #107 Jay Carr moves up 6 spots and submits 8 times, bringing him closer to the top 100. #109 Murray Wright makes one PR, but dropped 3 places nonetheless. #118 Anthony Caiulo submits 39 times, likely hoarded, and moves up 28 spots. New player #120 Ray Gredon joins us here, just two places below Anthony. Further down, #169 Jacob Fitzgibbon made 11 PRs and moves up 2 places, switching places with #171 Nathan Chintagavongse, who made 3 PRs but lost 2 places. #208 Sam Fairless finally completes his timesheet with 23 new PRs and joins us right after the 200 mark. #210 Cornelius Jacobson made 57 PRs, probably hoarded (though it's hard to tell at this rank), and moved up 46 places. #304 Nikash Gill, one of the new players from the last update, joins us here by completing his timesheet. #322 Conor Evans-Gilbertson also completes his timesheet. #330 Pierre Coste moves up one spot and submitted 5 PRs. #332 David Delzenne completed his timesheet as well. Last, but not least, #350 Stefan Glosby made 6 PRs but fell 4 spots in the AF ladder, probably due to all the people completing their timesheets.

Site Records
6 site records were improved this time around.

Qi Zhu beat Shaun Tanney's old Toad's Factory crs time of 1'50"792 with a new time of 1'50"577.
Qi Zhu also beat Shaun Tanney's old Toad's Factory lap time of 0'35"135 with a new time of 0'35"078. It's worth mentioning that Cyril Fulag first took the TF flap SR before Qi Zhu improved his time.
Blake Germany beat his own DK's Snowboard Cross lap time of 0'34"382 with a new time of 0'34"283. (No surprise here!)
Thomas van Deerse beat Shaun Tanney's old SNES Ghost Valley 2 lap time of 0'14"983 with a new time of 0'14"968.
Luis G beat Tyler Reyes' old SNES Mario Circuit 3 crs time of 1'18"188 with a new time of 1'18"170.
Thomas van Deerse beat Andrew Grieve's old GCN DK Mountain crs time of 2'04"214 with a new time of 2'03"525.

Expect news updates to be much more consistent from now on. As we always say, happy karting, everyone :)

~Silver

fields.author: Silver
fields.title: Summer Karting
fields.content:
Hello, all. Schools and universities are letting students out for summer vacation again so many people have had more time to go Mario Karting. Apologies for the late update, the database was not working properly for some time and we added and deleted an illegitimate player that would have messed up some other peoples' rankings. Anyway, without further ado, let's get started with the update :)

Update: June 4th - June 20th

New Players
Six new players decided to join us over the past two weeks.

Fox Martin joins us with 35 times, including some SRs (which will be mentioned later) and a theoretical ranking of 227th.
Andrew Schmidt joined with 9 times and a theoretical ranking of 407th.
William Luo joined with 2 times and a theoretical ranking of 442nd.
Marko Mihelic joined with 14 times and a theoretical ranking of 405th.
Yuiazu Mirage joined with 5 times and a theoretical ranking of 424th.
Alexander Gross joined with... wow, a full timesheet, actually. He joins us at 357th place.

Movement
57 players were active since the last update.

1 - 10
Yet again, #1 Thomas van Deerse leads the pack in this update, making 3 PRs and cutting a bit of AF. #5 Leo Petiard made one PR, but did not cut any AF or move up any places. Determined to keep up his activity, #6 Salvatore Bellusci sent in 3 PRs and moved up one place, despite not cutting AF. Next up, #9 Dave Tandy sent in 7 times and cut just under an AF point. And breaking into the top 10 this update, we have #10 Aziz Abdullah, who made 3 new times and moved up from 11th place, kicking John Brunn out of the elite group, though he did not cut AF.

11 - 25
Despite school ending for many of these players, this section was quite inactive, and no one cut AF. #18 Liam Ashcroft and #19 Cole Gilbert did play, though, sending in two PRs each. #23 Alvin Le also played a little and sent in a PR.

26 - 50
Here's when we start seeing a good amount of players actually cutting AF x). #33 Daniel Crutcher continues his rapid climb up the AF mountain, making 15 PRs and moving up 11 places. #35 Franco Gubser made one PR, but lost a spot due to Daniel Crutcher. #37 Christian W made 12 PRs and moved up four spots. Right below him, #38 Cyril Fulag submitted 10 times and moved up from 46th place. Taking his old spot, #46 Danny Gallenberger sent in 4 times and moved up two spots. Unfortunately, Danny and Cyril's move up caused #47 Qi Zhu to drop down two places, despite sending in 2 times and cutting AF. Rounding off this section, #48 Luke Berrill sent in 5 times and moved up a spot.

51 - 100
This section was relatively inactive as well. #54 Tim van Ham leads this group off, making one time. However, it must have been a pretty big improvement, as he moved up two spots from that alone. Amidst more inactivity, another player makes a huge cut. That player is #64 Fra Lenoob, who made 22 times and moved up from 91st place - quite a big cut. He also cut over 37.6 AF points. There was some more activity near the bottom of this section, with #92 Darragh Williamson making 6 new times and moving up one spot. #94 Steven Reinhold submitted some times as well, moving up four spots with two PRs.

100+
To start off this section, #111 Ray Gredon submitted 16 PRs, moved up 9 places, and cut over 6.5 AF. #114 Anthony Caiulo also played, making 9 new times and moving up 4 places (although it would have been five if it weren't for Ray). #127 Rob Jon sent in 7 new times and cut AF but didn't move up a place. A bit further down, #165 Jacob Fitzgibbon submitted 19 times and moved up four places. Further down still, #207 Sam Fairless made 2 PRs and #209 Cornelius Jacobson submitted 14 times, each of them moving up one spot. Next up, active player #288 Conor Evans-Gilbertson submitted 52 new times - nearly an entire timesheet - and moved from from #322. #328 David Delzenne made 10 times and moved up four places, as well. And new player #357 Alexander Gross ends the movement section of this update by submitting a full timesheet and causing everyone below him to fall one spot.

Site Records
Five SRs were demolished and replaced this week.

Fox Martin beat Qi Zhu's old Toad's Factory crs time of 1'50"577 with a time of: 1'50"175.
Fox Martin beat Qi Zhu's old Toad's Factory lap time of 0'35"078 with a time of: 0'35"052, after a bit of competition from Cyril Fulag.
Aziz Abdullah beat Alexandre Agniel's old GBA Bowser's Castle 3 crs time of 1'58"566 with a time of: 1'58"438.
Tyler Reyes beat Jamie Disley's old SNES Mario Circuit 3 lap time of 0'23"952 with a time of: 0'23"945.
Edvard Tsymbala beat Zane Royal's old N64 Bowser's Castle crs time of 2'31"649 with a time of: 2'31"554.

From now on, you can expect a news update every Sunday starting on the 30th. Enjoy your summer vacation/holidays and happy karting ^-^

~Silver

fields.author: Silver
fields.title: Players' Page YouTube Channel
fields.content:
Hey guys, just wanted to inform you all that we have created a YouTube channel with videos of time trials, tutorials, and possibly new strat ideas and updates on the PP. It's run by members of the MKW PP, of course. You can find the channel at http://www.youtube.com/user/mkwpptts. Feel free to view our videos and use them as guides for improving your time or simply for your viewing enjoyment.

Also, just wanted to clarify something for times submissions. When you submit a time on a course that has a glitch/glitches on it, please note whether the time uses the glitch or not. It makes our job a whole lot easier. Thanks :)

fields.author: Silver
fields.title: Reign of the Thomas'
fields.content:
Yo, Silver here again delivering yet another news update. First off, I'd like to draw your attention to the MKWii TT rules and policies, made by Zack McNell, which can be found here: http://98.156.6.103/tt/rules.html. The PP goes by these rules to a tee. Also, don't forget about our YouTube channel at http://www.youtube.com/user/mkwpptts. Anyway, let's see what happened since the last news update.

Update: June 20th - July 1st

New Players
Three players decided to join the PP.

Leone Castar, better known from MKDD and MKDS, joins us with a full timesheet and a ranking of 389th.
Roy Dafuq joined with 56 times and a theoretical ranking of 144th, which is a pretty good start.
James Ramirez joined with 23 times and a theoretical ranking of 307th - also not bad considering the amount of times he has sent in.

Movement
49 players went MKW'ing since the last update.

#1
A huge congratulations to our new site champion, #1 Thomas Petraud! He managed to fill out his timesheet and enter the main charts at first place, clocking in at under 5.5 AF points - quite an impressive feat indeed. Totom, I feel like you deserve this:



(Credit for the picture goes to the very humble #2 Thomas van Deerse)

2 - 20
#6 Salvatore Bellusci sent in 10 PRs and maintained his rank instead of losing a spot due to Totom. #7 Dave Tandy sent in 11 times and managed to move up two places. #11 Aziz Abdullah sent in three times and cut AF, though he still moved down a place. Last off, but not least, for this section, #17 Paul-Philipp Baehr and #20 Cole Gilbert both sent in two times but didn't cut AF and moved down a spot each (again, due to Totom making everyone drop one place).

21 - 50
#32 Daniel Crutcher continues his upward ascent with 6 PRs, moving up one spot. He better watch out, though, because another Dan, specifically #33 Danny Gallenberger, stormed through with 16 new time submissions, moved up 13 spots, cut over 9 AF points, and is very close to passing Mr. Crutcher. #35 Cyril Fulag also makes a notable cut, moving up 3 places and making 9 PRs. #40 Christian W played as well, making 4 PRs, but still lost three spots due to Totom, Danny, and Cyril. #48 Qi Zhu sent in three new times, but didn't cut any AF and moved down a spot. #49 Luke Berrill played as well and cut three quarters of an AF point, though he still moved down a spot despite his 4 PRs. (I blame Totom again :L)

51 - 100
#51 Alexandre Agniel sent in one new time, which was a SR improvement. He didn't negate any AF gains, but it's still something, right? #55 Fra Lenoob is right at the doorstep of the top 50, as he made 15 new times, cut 11 AF points, and moved up nine spots. #61 Frederick Hutchington had six new PRs sent in and maintained his rank. #63 Kyle R had one small time updated, likely an old one, and didn't cut any of his losses. After skipping a decent-sized chunk of players, we reach #94 Steven Reinhold, who sent in two times and maintained his position despite still gaining AF. Finally, #96 Anthony Caiulo barges into the top 100 with 23 PRs.

100+
#108 Ray Gredon continues to even out his timesheet, making 24 new times and moving up three places. #127 Rob Jon sent in two PRs and maintained his position. #140 Alex B filled out the last few remaining times of his timesheet, dropping in at the mid 100 ranks. #163 Jacob Fitzgibbon steadily marches up the ranks, sending in eleven times and moving up two places. Next, #209 Matt Danner maintained his rank by making in 11 PRs. Farther below, #283 Conor Hornsey continues to persevere and moves up five spots with 12 new times. #325 David Delzenne made 13 times of his own and moved up three places. #354 Alexander Gross also moved up three places by making 19 new PRs. And finally, new player #389 Leone Castar joins us at this rank; good on him for actually joining with a full timesheet x)

Site Records
Five new SRs were set this time around.

Ethan McCormac beat Alvin van Asselt's old Daisy Circuit lap time of 0'28"418 with a time of: 0'28"305. Thomas Petraud had this SR for a short time, as well.
Thomas Petraud improved his own old Koopa Cape crs time of 2'20"361 with a time of: 2'20"100.
Thomas Petraud (yet again) beat Lee Duggan's old Koopa Cape lap time of 0'44"304 with a time of: 0'44"267.
Alexandre Agniel improved his own old GBA Bowser's Castle 3 lap time of 0'37"960 with a time of: 0'37"859. Aziz Abdullah did temporarily hold the SR, though.
Tyler Reyes beat Luis G's old SNES Mario Circuit 3 crs time of 1'18"170 with a time of: 1'18"166.

That's all for this update. See you all next time, everyone!
~Silver

fields.author: Silver
fields.title: K
fields.content:
Welcome again to your weekly news update. There's not much to say here this week, so let's jump straight into the karting action :)

Update: July 1st - July 8th

New Players
Two new players joined our site this past week, both with full timesheets.

Matt Striker slips in at 62nd place with his times.
Mike Maize joins us at 155th with his PRs.

Movement
45 players were active this week.

1 - 10
Starting off today's update, former champion #2 Thomas van Deerse returns from his short break and continues to play, making two new times and cutting a small bit of AF. Y'know, it would be interesting to see the two Thomas' battle for the site champion, though Mr. van Deerse still has a long way to go before catching up to Totom. Moving on, we see a cluster of three active players. #6 Dave Tandy made 12 PRs and cut about two and a half AF points, passing our next active player, #7 Salvatore Bellusci, who submitted four times and cut a small bit of AF. #8 Leo Petiard also played, submitting 12 PRs and cutting just under one AF point.

11 - 25
#13 Olivier Luyckx starts the section off off this time. He completed his timesheet and managed to make everyone below him lose a spot. Luckily, #15 Paul-Philipp Baehr still managed to move up two spots thanks to his 4 new times. #20 Liam Ashcroft and #21 Cole Gilbert made four and one new time(s), respectfully, which negated their AF losses a bit but still moved down a spot.

26 - 50
Another cluster of three is found in the low 30s ranks. #30 Andre Hoelscher made two PRs but still lost a spot. #31 Danny Gallenberger, on the other hand, sent in 5 times and moved up two spots. And #32 Daniel Crutcher improved four times to maintain his rank rather than dropping two spots due to Danny and Olivier. A bit further down, #41 Christian W sent in three times and cut his AF losses a bit, though he still lost a spot. Last, but not least, for this section of players, #47 Fra Lenoob makes a fairly large cut with his 12 PRs, moving up 8 spots and cutting over 8 AF points.

51 - 100
New player #61 Matt Striker slips in right here, and combined with Olivier from farther up, causes #62 Frederick Hutchington to drop one spot rather than gain a spot with his 4 PRs. As we reach the 80s, we find a lot more active players eager to climb up the ranks. #81 Stacy Needham played, making 3 PRs and dropping one place rather than two. #87 Ray Gredon made a massive cut from 108th by submitting 31 PRs, and is progressing very quickly. Perhaps we'll see him in the top 50 in just two weeks or so. Yet another player, #90 Roy Dafuq, completed his timesheet. #92 Anthony Caiulo also sent in some times, moving up 4 places with his 15 PRs. Finally, #96 Darragh Williamson and #98 Evan Simmons both made small cuts with 4 and 3 PRs, respectively. Unfortunately, Darragh still dropped three places, and Evan dropped 6. Too much activity and too many players filling out their timesheets, I assume...

100+
The activity from the 80s and 90s ranks continues near the top of this section. #101 Sam Smith nearly breaks into the top 100 with 10 PRs, passing 3 people along the way. #105 Martin Prigent picks up his controller again, making 2 PRs but still dropping 5 places. #112 Murray Wright moved up a spot by sending in 11 PRs. Right below him, #113 Jay Carr negated his AF losses a bit with 3 new times but still lost 3 spots. The activity stops here, that is, until we reach new player #155 Mike Maize, who starts off in the mid 100s but seems eager to move up. #161 Jacob Fitzgibbon also played, moving up 2 spots with 14 PRs. #212 Matt Danner tries to stop getting pushed down too much by making 2 PRs, but still dropped 3 places. And finally, #272 Conor Hornsey continues to move up the ranks, submitting 30 new times. I must say, I admire his perseverence.

Site Records
Three combined SRs were improved this week.

Joshua Bernelli beat his own old Maple Treeway crs time of 2'00"100 with a time of: 1'59"810
Tom Norton beat his own old N64 Sherbet Land crs time of 2'04"353 with a time of: 2'04"335
Tyler Reyes beat his own old SNES Mario Circuit 3 crs time of 1'18"166 with a time of: 1'18"165

I'll also mention all the improved non glitch SRs since April 22nd (where my first news update goes back to). The stats program does not list new non glitch SRs, but I feel like they should still be mentioned. (Note that there may be some inaccuracies.)

Fox Martin improved Beat Pika's old Mushroom Gorge no glitch crs time of 1'42"346 with a new time of 1'42"066.
Cole Gilbert beat Tom Norton and Alex Shoal's old tied Mario Circuit no glitch crs time of 1'21"764 with a new time of 1'21"759.
Joshua Bernelli beat Thomas Petraud's old Maple Treeway no glitch crs time of 2'16"884 with a new time of 2'16"754.
Fox Martin beat Andrew Grieve's old Grumble Volcano no glitch crs time of 1'53"126 with a new time of 1'52"959.
Fox Martin beat Shaun Tanney's old Grumble Volcano no glitch lap time of 0'36"114 with a new time of 0'36"037.
After a battle with Tom Norton, Jak Russo beat Shaun Tanney's old GBA Bowser Castle 3 no glitch crs time of 2'17"773 with a new time of 2'17"274.

That's it for this week. Happy karting and keep them PRs rollin' :L
~Silver

fields.author: Silver
fields.title: Just ignore the fact that this is a week late.
fields.content:
'Sup guys, welcome to yet another boring news update. (Man, I really need to come up with clever themes for news updates. If only Shock never came up with the zombie apocalypse...)

Update: July 8th - July 21st

New Players
7 new players joined our site since the last update.

Famed wheeler Keiichi Nagai decides to joins us with a full timesheet and a ranking of 21st. It's made even more impressive by the fact that his GV glitch time only utilizes the rock hop.
Austin Setzer also joins us with a full timesheet and a ranking of 449th.
Jerome Stoffel joined with 32 times (the course times) and a theoretical ranking of 433rd.
Rudy Weitze joined with 36 times and a theoretical ranking of 417th.
David Miller joined with 6 times and a theoretical ranking of 433rd.
Ihsan Emre joined with just 3 times and a theoretical ranking of 449th.
Mensur Al-Sharami joined with 4 times and a theoretical ranking of 453rd, or last.

Come on, guys, we need more people joining with a full timesheet, or at least the 32 course times D:

Movement

1 - 10
#2 Thomas van Deerse starts us off today, making 5 PRs and cutting a small bit of AF. Next up, we have the trio of the three active players just as before - #6 Dave Tandy, #7 Leo Petiard, and #8 Salvatore Bellusci all played. Dave maintained his position with 6 PRs, cutting a bit of AF along the way. Meanwhile, Leo made 14 new times, and passed Salvatore, who only made 2 PRs this time around.

11 - 25
#11 Aziz Abdullah kicks off this section. He only made one small PR, and didn't cut AF, but it still warrants a mention in this update. #19 Liam Ashcroft plays, too, and moved up one spot with his 6 times. #21 Keiichi Nagai, as stated before, joins us as the highest ranked wheeler, even without a proper Grumble Volcano glitch time. Lastly, #22 Cole Gilbert makes 2 PRs but still gets knocked down a spot.

26 - 50
Eager to move up the ranks, and perhaps to take back his spot as #1 wheeler, #29 Danny Gallenberger submitted 7 new times and moves up two places. #36 Christian W and #37 Fra Lenoob also continue their upward ascent, making 9 and 10 PRs and cutting 5 and 10 spots, respectively. #49 Qi Zhu also played and made 4 new times, moving up one spot. And taking up Qi's/Kezer's former spot, #50 Matt Striker submitted 19 new PRs and moved up 11 places.

51 - 100
The first active player here was #53 Luke Berrill. He made 2 PRs but still got knocked down two places. #54 Gary Marcoz, on the other hand, moved up 10 spots with his 17 new times. #63 Frederick Hutchington made 2 small PRs and got moved down a spot, which is easily outshined by #74 Roy D, who moved up 16 places with 21 PRs. Sucks to suck, Nosey. Activity in the latter part of this section continues with #78 Stacy Needham, who moved up 3 spots with 7 PRs. Active player #81 Ray Gredon set 14 new times and moved up 6 places. With his activity, he'll get up to the top 50 in no time. We also have #91 Anthony Caiulo, who set 6 personal records and moved up one spot. And rounding off this section, #99 Martin Prigent continues his activity from the last update and re-enters the top 100 with his 8 times.

100+
#102 Sam Smith slowed his activity down considerably from the last update, making just one PR this time around. He moved down a spot, as well. On the other hand, we have #110 Mike Maize, who sent in a whopping 50 new times to our site, moving up 45 places and cutting over 64 AF points. Slow down there, Mr. Corn. #115 Jay Carr played, too, sending in 9 new times. However, he dropped two places due to getting passed by Mike and by Keiichi causing everyone below him to drop a spot, as well as the fact that there's a considerably large AF gap where he is. #145 Alex B sent in one sole time and got knocked down two places as well, thanks again to Mike and Keiichi. #151 Tomas Pallaruelo returns to the karting scene and submitted 7 new times, maintaining his position. #154 Jacob Fitzgibbon continues karting as well with 20 PRs. This time around, he moved up 7 places. A bit further down, #207 Matt Danner also continues his PRing. With 11 PRs, he cut 5 places. #271 Conor Hornsey, still eager to move up, made 3 new times and moved up a place. #317 Andre Riviere sent in one time and maintained his position. #324 David Delzenne moved up 5 spots with 8 PRs. And of course, we can't forget about new player #449 Austin Setzer.

Site Records
Only one combined SR was improved.

Edvard Tsymbala beat Nick Meade's old N64 Bowser's Castle lap time of 0'48"720 with a time of: 0'48"710

As for the no glitch SRs, we've got two of those this time.

Axel San beat his own old SNES Ghost Valley 2 no glitch crs time of 0'52"994 with a new time of 0'52"987.
Keiichi Nagai beat Jamie Disley's old SNES Ghost Valley 2 no glitch lap time of 0'16"534 with a new time of 0'16"519.

That's, uh, pretty much it for now. See you all later :L
~Silver

fields.author: Silver
fields.content:
