I don't know what to put here due to lack of inspiration, lol. Let's just skip this awkward intro and jump straight into the update :L

Update: July 21st --> July 28th

New Players
2 people have joined our glorious empire.

Hunter Gregan joined with 12 times and a theoretical ranking of 392nd, if all his other times were dead last.
Basti X joined with just one time and a theoretical ranking of 454th, or last place.

Movement
There were 42 active players this week, mostly consisting of those who were active during the past few weeks.

1 - 10
Former king of the hill #2 Thomas van Deerse leads us this week. He managed to cut a bit of AF with just one PR. The only other active player in this section this week was #8 Salvatore Bellusci, who sent in 4 new times and cut about 1/3 of an AF point.

11 - 25
#15 Paul-Philipp Baehr negates a bit of his AF gains with 2 new times. #19 Liam Ashcroft also made 2 personal records, and cut just over an AF point. And #22 Cole Gilbert improved a single time, although it didn't help much for his AF.

26 - 50
Active wheeler #28 Danny Gallenberger continues to move up the ranks. This time, with 7 PRs, he moves up one spot. #31 Cyril Fulag also continues his journey upward with 9 PRs and an 8 spot improvement. #35 Christian W moved up a spot, too, submitting 4 new times. And a bit further down, #49 Qi Zhu secures his spot in the top 50 with one new PR.

51 - 100
#53 Luke Berrill makes a minor PR that didn't help him very much. (Speaking of Luke, someone needs to give him a pink proof tick, btw.) #60 Frederick Hutchington played as well, making 3 new PRs and coincidentally moving up 3 spots. Consistently active player #78 Ray Gredon made 13 PRs this time around, moving up 3 spots. #90 Anthony Caiulo moved up one spot with 9 new times. And finally, #94 Martin Prigent moved up from 99th with 7 times. Interestingly, this leaves a tie for the 98th spot.

100+
Knocking at the door of the top 100, #101 Mike Maize moved up 9 spots with 12 PRs. Just below him, #102 Sam Smith, otherwise known as the guy with the most generic American name ever, made 1 PR and maintained his position. #115 Jay Carr made 2 new PRs and has almost bridged the AF gap between 114th and 116th. A bit further down, #145 Alex B made 2 PRs and cut a very small bit of AF. Below him, we have #150 Jacob Fitzgibbon, who made 13 new times and cut 4 places. #172 Michael Miller, the most active player of the past week, made 19 PRs and moved up 8 places. And of course, we always have someone completing their timesheet. That person this week is #177 Michael Penninck. Locked in a tie at #205, Matt Danner submitted 3 times and moved up two places. #217 Stan Barmentloo sent in 29 times and moved up 7 spots. Stan, please remember to stop, drop, and roll, 'cuz you're on fire! (Huehuehuehuehue... bad joke, I know.) We also have #270 Conor Hornsey, who moved up another spot with 6 PRs. And finally, #325 David Delzenne made 4 PRs but dropped a spot.


Site Records
3 combined SRs were improved this week, along with 1 no glitch SR.

Cyril Fulag beat Fox Martin's old Toad's Factory lap time of 0'35"052 with a new time of 0'35"050.
Tyler Reyes improved his own old SNES Mario Circuit 3 crs time of 1'18"165 with a new time of 1'18"120.
Edvard Tsymbala improved his own old N64 Bowser's Castle crs time of 2'31"554 with a new time of 2'31"507.
Cole Gilbert beat his own old Mario Circuit no glitch crs time of 1'21"759 with a new time of 1'21"716.

Happy Karting, everyone, and see you all next week.
~Silver

fields.author: Silver
fields.title: August Activity
fields.content:
Hello, fellow MKWii players. It's time for yet another news update, so let's see what happened over the previous week.

Update: July 28th --> August 5th

New Players
4 new players have joined our site since the past update.

Felix H joins us with a 5 times and a theoretical ranking of 444th.
Jeffi Zipfel joined with 11 times and a theoretical ranking of 416th.
Dennis Rund joined with 10 times and a theoretical ranking of 418th.
Juno Pohnanen joined with 32 times and a theoretical ranking of 278th.

Movement
There were 42 active players over the past week.

1 - 10
Top doge Thomas Petraud did not submit any times over the past week, so #2 Thomas van Deerse leads us this time again. Having sweg like Spodermen, cut a bit of AF with his 2 PRs this week. #6 Dave Tandy also cut some AF this week, making 5 PRs. #8 Salvatore Bellusci, like Thomas, also sent in two times, negating some of his AF loss. Lastly, #10 Jak Russo (JaK is BaK, everyone) submitted one new PR.

11 - 25
Like Jak, #11 Aziz Abdullah made one small PR this past week (which admittedly didn't really help his AF). Continuing the 1 PR trend is #19 Liam Ashcroft, who managed to obtain his first 3lap WR. #20 Keiichi Nagai had 2 times updated, which cut a small amount of AF. And #22 Cole Gilbert made 3 PRs this time around.

26 - 50
#28 Danny Gallenberger was active as always, though he only set one new PR this time around. Next up, #30 Cyril Fulag made 3 PRs, which didn't affect his AF at all or negate any AF losses. Interestingly, he still passed #31 Ben Hart, presumably because less people beat his existing times. As we finally reach movement in the AF rankings, #36 Fra Lenoob made 6 new times and moved up 3 places. #40 Matt Striker played too, jumping up 10 places thanks to his 14 PRs. #45 Matthias Sempels moved up 7 places with his 7 PRs - looks like 7's his lucky number. And #49 Zane Royal played and made 1 new time, but dropped a spot anyway. At least he's back and ready to attack (like JaK).

51 - 100
With his awesome chain wheelie strats, #51 Qi Zhu made two new times this week. Unfortunately, though, he still dropped two places. A bit further down, #69 Roy D makes 2 new times and cuts a bit of AF. Of course, we can't forget about #75 Ray Gredon and his unwavering activity. This time around, he made 11 new times and moved up 3 places. The last active person in this section this time around is #90 Anthony Caiulo who cut about 2 AF points with his 7 new times.

100+
#101 Mike Maize makes 1 PR as well this week, but he managed to negate some of his AF losses. He'll hop into the top 100 soon enough, for sure. #113 Jay Carr finally managed to bridge across the AF gap and move up two places, this time with 4 PRs. #141 Alex B played too, making 6 new times and moving up 4 places. #149 Jacob Fitzgibbon moves up a spot with his 3 PRs. Next, we have #175 Michael Penninck, who submitted 7 new times and cut 2 places. #202 Matt Danner also played, making 6 PRs and moving up 3 spots. And last, but certainly not least, we have #350 Alexander Gross, who sent in a whopping 30 PRs and moved up 9 places, cutting over 20 AF points.

The Uncharted
Players without 64/64 times who cut theoretical AF points (including new players, and listed in order of theoretical ranking) are Carter Clem, Stavros Ferentinos, Juho Pohnanen, Sora Hoshi, Alex Jascol, Jeffi Zipfel, Dennis Rund, Basti X, and Felix H.

Site Records
5 SRs in total were improved.

Cole Gilbert improved his own old Luigi Circuit crs time of 1'09"254 with a time of: 1'09"228
Joshua Bernelli improved his own old Maple Treeway lap time of 0'24"483 with a time of: 0'24"187
Edvard Tsymbala improved his own old N64 Bowser's Castle crs time of 2'31"507 with a time of: 2'31"402
Alexandre Agniel beat Tom Norton's old Wario's Gold Mine no glitch crs time of 1'51"792 with a new time of 1'51"649. (Tom actually improved his time before Alexandre beat it, though.)
Liam Ashcroft beat Cole Gilbert's old GCN Peach Beach no glitch crs time of 1'12"992 with a new time of 1'12"929.

That's it for now, and I'll see you all again next week.
~Silver

fields.author: Silver
fields.title: [Insert news update title here]
fields.content:
Hey, everyone. It's time for another news update, so let's get started right away.

Update: August 5th --> August 18th

New Players
4 new players joined us since the past update this time around.

Alberto Barba joined with 31 times and a theoretical ranking of 261st.
Mikko Jaakkola joined with 32 times and a theoretical ranking of 306th.
Nf Ace joined with just 4 times and a theoretical ranking of 455th.
And Lachlan Young joined with 10 times and a theoretical ranking of 397th.

Movement
Since the past update, 50 players have been active.

1 - 10
There was a lot of activity near the top over the past two weeks. The dynamic ThomTAS duo #1 Thomas Petraud and #2 Thomas van Deerse start us off this time, submitting 2 and 3 PRs, respectively. In addition, they both cut the same amount of AF: .0312 AF points, which may not seem like a lot at first, but is actually quite impressive at their high level. After skipping 3 players, we reach three more active players in a row - #6 Dave Tandy, #7 Leo Petiard, and #8 Salvatore Bellusci all played since the last update. Dave made 7 new PRs, Leo made 10, and Salvatore made 5. They each cut a small amount of AF, as well. And #10 Jak Russo made one new time as well since the past update.

11 - 25
Just like last update, #11 Aziz Abdullah made one new PR which didn't help his AF much, but at least it's something. Moving on, #13 Olivier Luyckx made 2 new PRs and cut just over a full AF point. The first person to move places this time around is #17 Liam Ashcroft, who made 3 new times and two places moved up the AF ladder. #22 Cole Gilbert also made 3 new times, with 2 of them being WRs.

26 - 50
Wheeler #28 Danny Gallenberger leads this section, making one small PR. Our next active player is #30 Cyril Fulag, who made 11 new PRs and bridges the AF gap between 29th and 31st. #33 Christian W continues his climb up the AF ladder as well. He made 5 PRs, causing him to move up 2 places. #36 Fra Lenoob also played a bit, making one new time. And #46 Qi Zhu sent in 3 new times to the PP over the past two weeks. While he cut less than 3/4ths of an AF point, he still managed to move up 5 places.

51 - 100
#52 Luke Berrill submitted 3 new times and moved up one place, inching closer to reentering the top 50. #56 Alexandre Agniel made a small, single PR. Below him, #67 Roy D cut two places with his 11 PRs. Meanwhile, the most active player since the last update, #70 Ray Gredon, made 27 new times, causing him to move up 5 places. The activity continues with #81 Anthony Caiulo, who made 12 PRs and moved up 9 places. #93 Sack Zero also decides to send in a slew of 15 PRs, mostly hoarded, and moved up 15 places as a result. And #95 Martin Prigent submitted one PR that negated a bit of his AF losses, though it didn't stop him from moving down a place due to Zero's hoard.

100+
Unlike most of the time, there weren't any active players in the early 100s ranks, so we jump straight to #139 Alex B. Alex made 2 PRs and moved up 2 spots, though he didn't cut any AF points. #149 Jacob Fitzgibbon played too, cutting a bit of AF with his 4 PRs. #171 Michael Penninck made 8 new PRs and cut 4 places, which affected fellow Michael #173 Michael Miller, who made a new time but still dropped a place. #179 Zack Weber, otherwise known as Webinator (you may remember him for typing up some of the older news updates) decided to pick up the game again and made a new time. #202 Matt Danner made one small PR for this update. Below him, #209 Dennis Rund finally completed his timesheet after working on it for some time. And wrapping up our ranked players, #322 David Delzenne made 6 PRs and moved up 3 spots with them.

The Uncharted
Unranked players who cut theoretical AF points over the past two weeks are James Ramirez, Sora Hoshi, Jeffi Zipfel, Rudy Weitze, Felix H, Basti X, and David Roldan.

Site Records
8 site records were improved over the course of the past two weeks, most of them being from players who improved their own times.

Cole Gilbert improved his own old Luigi Circuit crs time of 1'09"228 with a time of: 1'09"143.
Cole Gilbert beat Romain Smadja's old Luigi Circuit lap time of 0'21"782 with a time of: 0'21"768.
Fox Martin improved his own old Toad's Factory crs time of 1'50"175 with a time of: 1'50"032.
Cyril Fulag improved his old Toad's Factory lap time of 0'35"050 with a time of: 0'35"015.
Joshua Bernelli improved his own old Maple Treeway crs time of 1'59"810 with a time of: 1'59"549.
Thomas Petraud improved his own old GCN Waluigi Stadium crs time of 1'48"979 with a time of: 1'48"861.
Fox Martin improved his own old Mushroom Gorge no glitch crs time of 1'42"066 with a time of: 1'41"986.
Tom Norton beat Alexandre Agniel's old Wario's Gold Mine no glitch crs time of 1'51"649 with a time of: 1'51"627.

Awards may be started up again soon; I'll let you all know if that happens. That's all for this update, and happy karting.
~Silver

fields.author: Silver
fields.title: Not a typo.
fields.content:
Welcome to another boring news update. I'd like to remind you all again of the set of TT rules which our site follows, found here: http://98.156.6.103/tt/rules.html. Now that that's out of the way, let's get started with our activity report of the last two weeks :)

Update: August 18 --> August 30th

New Players
2 MKWii players have decided to join our site since the last update.

Racer Festus joined with 14 times and a theoretical ranking of 390th.
Mario Pika joined with just one time and a theoretical ranking of 455th.

Movement
32 people were active since the last update, noticeably lower than the past few weeks.

1 - 10
The activity this time around was clearly not top-heavy, as the first player to submit a PR was #7 Leo Petiard. He made 3 new times and cut a little bit of AF. The only other active player in the section was #10 Jak Russo, who cut an even smaller amount of AF with one PR.

11 - 25
Mirroring the past section, there were two players in this section submitted PRs. #17 Laim Ashcroft submitted one PR, but it was a site record, which you'll see later. #22 Cole Gilbert also set 2 new times, one of which was a SR as well, and cut a miniscule amount of AF.

26 - 50
Yet again, there were only 2 active players here. #35 Fra Lenoob made 5 new times and passed one person along the way, being the first person to move up a spot in this update. And #45 Qi Zhu (aka KezER the teachER) follows in Fra's footsteps, cutting one spot with 6 PRs.

51 - 100
We finally hit a (somewhat) more active section here, with #52 Luke Berrill paving the way. He made 2 new times (in addition to his other countless custom track PRs, but they don't count :L) and a bit of AF. Next, we have #65 Roy D, who moved up 2 places with 3 PRs. #69 Ray Gredon is active as usual, making 10 new times and moving up a spot on the AF charts. The last active player here was #79 Anthony Caiulo, who sent in 7 new times and cut 2 places, obtaining his first SR in the process.

100+
Yet again, the first active player here is #135 Alex B, who submitted 4 times and in turn cut 4 places. #149 Jacob Fitzgibbon played as well, cutting a bit of AF with 2 times. #170 Michael Penninck cut a spot with a single time, while #201 Matt Danner had to send in 11 times to cut a spot. Finally, #320 David Delzenne PRed 7 times and cut 2 spots this time around.

The Uncharted
Players without 64/64 times who sent in new times include Fox Martin, Axel San, James Ramirez, David Batke, Sora Hoshi, Joshua Bernelli, and Jeffi Zipfel.

Laim Ashcroft improved his own old GCN Peach Beach no glitch crs time of 1'12"929 with a time of: 1'12"895, being the first player with a no glitch "God" standard on this track.
Anthony Caiulo beat Top Lel's old GCN Peach Beach lap time of 0'16"744 with a time of: 0'16"555. (acually wus dave tandy's old siet rekurd)

That's all for now, happy karting.
~Silver

fields.author: Silver
fields.title: School of MKWii
fields.content:
Welcome to your news update. I have to confess that this one's late because of my laziness (though I was going to finish it up yesterday had certain circumstances not interfered), but in any case, better late than never, right? Anyway, the majority of us are back in school or university (unless you've already graduated or are from the southern hemisphere), and thus have less time for karting. For the rest of you dedicated players, though, I'd like to welcome you back to the school of MKWii.

Update: August 30 --> September 23

New Players
11 players have recently enrolled in our school.

Colin Raptor joins us with a full timesheet and a ranking of 97th, recieving an A for actually bothering to send in all his times.
Alexandre Bussard joined with 5 times and a theoretical ranking of 437th, holding a few top 10s.
Jordie Bee joined with 32 times and a theoretical ranking of 449th.
Timmy Bee joined with 2 times and a theoretical ranking of 455th.
Kyon Gulliksen joined with 5 times and a theoretical ranking of 437th, following Alexandre's example.
Feysal Temptation joined with 4 times and a theoretical ranking of 447th.
Dane M joined with 31 times (including a strong GV2 time) and a theoretical ranking of 277th.
Georg Chad joined with 33 times and a theoretical ranking of 309th.
Alexis Royal joined with 2 times and a theoretical ranking of 451st.
Elisha Thompson joined with 55 times (often sent in the wrong format, please reread how to properly send in your times) and a theoretical ranking of 372nd.
Andrew Brownlie joined with 32 times and a theoretical ranking of 420th.

Movement
64 players have been active since the last update.

1 - 10 ~ The School Staff
Our principal/head teacher #1 Thomas Petraud maintains a bit of activity by sending in one new time, setting a good example to those under him. #2 Thomas van Deerse, our vice principal/assitant principal, also remains active, sending in two new times to negate his AF losses. Teacher #6 Dave Tandy improved 2 of his times (not including his many no-glitch improvements), cutting a small bit of AF. #7 Salvatore Bellusci made 4 PRs and passed Leo Petiard, gaining more respect with his coworkers (while Zoon just continues star cheting his way to victory on Wifi). Veteran teacher #9 Ruby Aruba returns after a lengthy break to make one PR. And lastly, #10 Jak Russo made one new time as well.

11 - 25 ~ Alumni
These recent graduates have grown up and progressed so quickly :^) 2 must be our lucky number today, as all our active players in this section made 2 PRs (or at least had 2 times updated). They are #15 Paul-Philipp Baehr, #17 Liam Ashcroft, #20 Keiichi Nagai, and #22 Cole Gilbert. Keep up your work ethic, guys!

26 - 50 ~ High Honors Students
These students are well on their way to graduating, and have proven themselves to be worthy of respect in our MKWii school. #28 Cyril Fulag moved up 2 places in his class rank by submitting 4 new PRs. #33 Fra Lenoob made 2 times and coincidentally moved up two spots. (Wannabe) teacher #45 Qi Zhu made 5 times and cut some AF points. And #47 Zane Royal returns back to the MKWii TTing scene, making 4 times and moving up 2 spots.

51 - 100 ~ Honors Students
These students, while not as prestigious as our high honors students, have still earned the respect of many people with their MKWii skillz. #52 Luke Berrill made a single new PR, negating a bit of his AF losses. Next, #57 Roy D continues to make progress. A very diligent student, he made 20 new PRs and moved up 8 spots. Another hardworking person is #68 Ray Gredon, who moved up one spot with 11 new times. #75 Anthony Caiulo also submitted 11 new times, moving up 4 places in his class rank. Not wanting to be outdone, #80 Steven Reinhold barges into the top 100, moving up 24 full spots with 22 PRs, and was the most active top 100 player this time around. Another active player is #89 Jon Coppernol, who, despite sending in 1 new time, drops a spot in our rankings. And of course, new student #97 Colin Raptor joins us within the top 100.

100+ ~ Our other hardworking students
Progress is progress, and these active students have earned a mention in this news update. #105 Jay Carr moved up 8 places with 10 PRs. #110 Blake Germany falls 2 spots in the AF ranking despite making two PRs, but it was a valiant effort nonetheless. We also have #135 Alex B, who cut a bit of AF with his 4 PRs. #150 Jacob Fitzgibbon makes an effort to stay active, but loses a spot despite his one new time. #170 Michael Penninck cut a bit of AF as well, submitting 4 PRs. #198 Matt Danner continues climbing up the ranks, cutting 3 places with his 24 times. #212 Sam Fairless improved 7 of his times and moved up 5 places. #260 Josh Miller also stayed on top of his work, improving 9 times and moving up 2 places. #315 David Delzenne cut 5 places with 9 PRs. And finally, #361 Stephen De Winter made 4 PRs yet moved up 11 places, so they must have been pretty significant improvements.

The Uncharted
These people have enrolled in just a few courses, but it's still important to see them progressing through the curriculum. Players without 64/64 times who improved some of their courses include Michele Gallastri, Ethan McCormac, Martin Fox, Enoch Tsang, Axel San, Sergio Avopei, Justin Coulston, David Batke, Sora H, Alex Jascol, Jeffi Zipfel, Racer Festus, Beat Pika, Basti X, and Jeff Holtgen.

Site Records
A whopping 11 SRs were improved since the past update.

Blake Germany improved his own old DK's Snowboard Cross crs time of 1'46"980 with a time of: 1'46"960

fields.author: Silver
fields.title: wow such update
fields.content:
Hello everyone and welcome to another "ebicly laet nus updaet" :^) Yeah, sorry for the delay again (at least it still beats blahpy's updates, though, right???). Anyway, let's see what happened over the past month.

Update: September 24 --> October 24

New Players
6 new faces have joined us since the last news update.

Martin Haberl joins us with a full timesheet and a ranking of 203rd.
Juan Pablo Bravo joined with 21 times and a theoretical ranking of 338th.
Speed Troppelmann joined with 8 times and a theoretical ranking of 427th.
Fabian Knoll joined with 3 times and a theoretical ranking of 453rd.
Abdul Oguz joined with 32 times (the course times) and a theoretical ranking of 307th.
Kyle Fitzgerald joined with 32 times (again, all the courses) and a theoretical ranking of 365th.

Movement
54 players have been active since the last update. In addition, one player (David Batke) was removed due to being caught cheating, which might have shuffled things up a bit. He's been a bad doge indeed :^)

1 - 10 aka the Top Doges of MKWii



#1 Thomas Petraud played just a little bit with 1 small PR in order to maintain his solid position as the leader of the pack. The "other Thomas," (who allegedly likes to do interesting things with his teddy bears) #2 Thomas van Deerse was slightly more active, setting 2 new times and cutting a tiny amount of AF. #5 Dave Tandy managed to move up a spot with his 4 PRs (among other no glitch improvements), and is now one step away from becoming the #1 American on the PP. #7 Leo Petiard, the most active player in the top 10, also moved up a spot with his 10 improvements. And #9 Ruby Aruba found a bit more time to pick up the game and set another PR.

11 - 25
#12 Olivier Luyckx continues the trend of passing one person in the race to the top of the AF ladder, this time setting 6 new times. Next up, #15 Paul-Philipp Baehr (perhaps Thomas van Deerse's teddy "baehr") set his eyes upon a certain WR and nearly grabbed it, although that was the only course he improved. If you're looking for the person who ruined his would-be WR, his name is #22 Cole Gilbert, who improved 2 times this time around.

26 - 50
#31 Velo Lepro (or was it Fra Lenoob?) moved up two spots and continues his constant activity with his 10 PRs. Next, #45 Qi Zhu made 3 PRs, though it didn't really do that much for his AF. #46 Luke Berrill also made 3 PRs, but they were evidently bigger improvements, since he managed to crawl up 6 spots and rest comfortably in the top 50.

51 - 100
Kicking off this relatively active section is #56 Roy D, who improved five of his times and moved up a spot. #58 Ray Gredon, who never fails to impress with his constant activity, made 30 new times and moved up 10 spots. #68 Kyle R had a time updated (likely an old one, since he doesn't play anymore) but still lost a spot due to Ray. #73 Anthony Caiulo set 8 new PRs and moved up two spots. Active players #82 Colin Raptor and #84 Darragh Williamson improved 24 and 23 times, respectively, and moved up 15 and 18 spots on the AF rankings, respectively. #94 Michele Gallastri enters the AF charts by completing his timesheet, and sits nicely in the top 100. And last off on this active section, #100 Jay Carr moved up 5 spots with his 7 PRs.

100+
In stark contrast to the above section, people here were very inactive. Normally, we see some 101st- to 130th-ranked players improving their times, but the first active player this time around is #136 Alex B. He improved a single time yet still lost a spot. #171 Michael Penninck also improved one time and fell a spot. New player #203 Martin Haberl joins us at this spot. The only player to actually move up a spot in this section was #311 David Delzenne, who improved 8 times. Good on you, David. And the last active player this time was #363 Stephen De Winter, who moved down 2 spots despite making 2 PRs.

The Uncharted
People not on the AF charts who played include Martin Fox (if you're wondering what the Fox says, he says "tastastastastas"), Axel San, Stavros Ferentinos, Scooter S, Sergio Avopei, Dane M, Sora H, Joshua Bernelli, Alex Jascol, Racer Festus, Elisha Thompson, Lachlan Young, Kyon Gulliksen, Daniel B, Andrew Schmidt, and Jeff Holtgen.

Site Records
6 SRs were improved since last update.

Cole Gilbert beat Brett Edwards' old Moonview Highway crs time of 1'43"666 with a time of: 1'43"648
Fra Lenoob beat Salvatore Bellusci's old Bowser's Castle lap time of 0'42"563 with a time of: 0'42"533
Dane M beat Axel San's old SNES Ghost Valley 2 crs time of 0'51"984 with a time of: 0'51"963
Tom Norton improved his own old Wario's Gold Mine no glitch crs time of 1'51"304 with a time of: 1'51"213, though Martin Fox had the SR for 6 days as well.
Martin Fox beat Marco van Turner's old Wario's Gold Mine no glitch lap time of 0'35"731 with a time of: 0'35"655.
Liam Ashcroft beat his own old GCN Peach Beach no glitch crs time of 1'12"895 with a time of: 1'12"891.

That's all for now, happy karting :)
~Silver

fields.author: Silver
fields.title: Holiday Karting
fields.content:
Hello, fellow karters, and Merry (slightly late) Christmas!

First of all, I'd like to mention that the Yahoogroups system is fixed, so there's no need to worry about that anymore. All times are up to date and thus this update should be accurate.

Also, we have started a Wiki on MKW Time Trials, found here http://mkwii-tts.wikia.com/wiki/Mario_Kart_Wii_Time_Trials_Wiki Feel free to contribute to it! (Just use a neutral point of view and leave out personal comments like "I think.")

Anyway, let's hop straight into the action of the past, uh, two months.

Update: October 24 --> December 25

New Players
6 new players have joined over the past 2 months.

Jamie Skepper joins us with a full timesheet and a ranking of 106th.
Esteban Bonilla Elizondo also joins us with 64/64 times and a ranking of 434th.
Jordan Artz joined with 29 times and a theoretical ranking of 253rd.
Jakeb Deaner joined with 32 times and a theoretical ranking of 355th.
Julian OfTime joined with 4 times and a theoretical ranking of 454th.
Mackenzie Fuller joined with 49 times and a theoretical ranking of 288th.

Movement
There were 67 active players over the past two months. Unfortunately, a player asked to be removed, but rest assured, your beloved (and, admittedly, irresponsible) news updater has it under control :) This update's AF movements will not include the extra spot earned due to the removed player.

1 - 10 aka gold tier lels
We begin with #1 Thomas Petraud. With 3 PRs, he continues to solidify his position as our reigning champion. Not that it's really needed, of course, since #2 Thomas van Deerse, who managed to set 4 new times, still isn't even close to Totom. #5 Dave Tandy also played, setting 2 new combined PRs and a few other no glitch times. Breaking into the top 10 with 13 improvements on his PRs, #9 Olivier Luyckx was the most active top 10 player. Of course, that comes at the expense of #10 Ruby Aruba, who made 3 PRs (one of them being a no glitch WR) but still got knocked down a spot.

11 - 25 aka top top lels
Determined to move up the ranks, #14 Paul-Philipp Baehr set 17 new times, moving up one spot on the AF ladder. #16 Liam Ashcroft also moved up one spot, although it only took 2 PRs from him. And, of course, #21 Cole Gilbert continues to improve one of his WRs, although it doesn't benefit his AF scores.

26 - 50 aka top lels
This section in particular seemed to have seen a surge in activity, with some players improving over half their timesheets. Blazing the path here is #26 Matt Striker, who sent in 31 new times - nearly half his timesheet! He moved up 13 places (14, really, but the removed player skewed the placements a bit, so we're not counting that for this update). #27 Fra Lenoob was overcome by Matt, but still managed to move up 3 places with his 18 PRs. (C'mon, Velo, are you really going to put up with Mr. Striker? What a wimp.) As a result of those two players, #29 Cyril Fulag, #30 Danny Gallenberger, and #31 Jamie Disley all moved down 2 spots, despite sending in 3, 2, and 1 PRs, respectively. It's a good thing they stayed active, though, because #33 Roy D is still closing in on them. Like a steamroller crushing everything beneath it, Roy managed to improve 41 times and move up 22 places in the AF ranking. Poor #38 Kevin Mason obviously was unaware (either that, or his morale was flattened... get it? Flattened? Like a steam roller? Ah, never mind.), and his sole PR didn't stop him from moving down a spot. Next up, we have another trio of active players, namely #41 Luke Berrill, #42 Qi Zhu, and #43 Ray Gredon. Luke and Qi managed to put up a good fight, moving up 4 and 2 spots, respectively, with their 8 and 4 PRs. Ray, of course, didn't want to be outdone, so he set 35 PRs and moved up 14 spots. What a show-off. Rounding up this section, Mr. "Inzane" #49 Zane Royal sets a single new personal record, though still was knocked down two places.

51 - 100 aka middle lels
This section's activity seemed to be somewhat bottom-heavy, as the first active player here was #70 Anthony Caiulo. He set 7 PRs and moved up 2 spots. #75 Colin Raptor played, too, somehow managing to move up 6 spots with just 2 new times. He managed to evade the movement of #79 Michele Gallastri, who moved up 14 places with 22 times. #84 Darragh Williamson set 9 new times as well, though he got knocked down one spot due to Michele. #89 Andrew Grieve gets a short mention here, as he had one time (likely an old one) updated. #91 Jon Coppernoll gets a better mention, since he actually played. He set 3 PRs, although still got knocked down a spot. Closing off this section, #99 Jay Carr set 2 PRs, which did not affect his position.

100+ aka, uh, okay lels
First off here, we have penguin enthusiast and Toad lover #102 Tom Norton, who improved one of his WRs. #106 Jamie Skepper joined the ranks at this spot - not a bad showing for a new player. #111 Blake Germany set a sole new time as well, though moved down a spot thanks to Jamie. #130 Alex B, though, moved up 5 spots with his 9 new times. Good on you, Alex. Next up, we have #171 Michael Penninck set 3 new times but moved down a spot. In an impressive showing, our next player #180 Matt Danner set 63 new PRs - that's his whole timesheet minus one! He moved up a well deserved 18 places. #205 Sam Fairless improved 19 times and moved up 8 places. "The Decimator" #214 Andrew Ahearn set 9 PRs and moved up 4 places. #223 Tony Fan set a single PR. The determined and persistent #269 Conor Hornsey improved 19 times and moved up 3 places. #295 Kyle Fitzgerald joins us at this rank. #309 David Delzenne set 9 new times and moved up a spot. #339 Alexander Gross set 26 PRs and moved up 13 spots. And of course, we can't forget about new player #434 Esteban Bonilla Elizondo who joins us at this rank.

The Uncharted
Axel San, Ethan McCormac, Martin Fox, Troy Howard, Stavros Ferentinos, Sergio Avopei, Lachlan Young, Alex Jascol, Joshua Bernelli, Racer Festus, Prant San, Speed Troppelmann, Andrew Schmidt, Jeff Holtgen, and Timmy Bee all cut theoretical AF points.

Site Records
19 new SRs (!!!) were set over the past 2 months, most of which were set in December.

Cole Gilbert improved his own old Luigi Circuit crs time of 1'09"102 with a time of: 1'09"034
Sam Fairless improved his own old Mushroom Gorge crs time of 0'27"979 with a time of: 0'27"485
Michael Penninck improved his own old Mario Circuit crs time of 1'01"820 with a time of: 0'59"422
Martin Fox beat Paul Philipp-Baehr's old Coconut Mall crs time of 0'34"347 with a time of: 0'34"251
Thomas Petraud improved his own old Koopa Cape crs time of 2'20"100 with a time of: 2'19"840
Joshua Bernelli improved his own old Maple Treeway crs time of 1'59"594 with a time of: 1'58"833
Cyril Fulag improved his own old Moonview Highway lap time of 0'33"195 with a time of: 0'33"187
Martin Fox beat Thomas Petraud's old GCN Peach Beach crs time of 1'07"342 with a time of: 1'07"167
Anthony Caiulo improved his own old GCN Peach Beach lap time of 0'16"555 with a time of: 0'16"537
Axel San beat Dane M's old SNES Ghost Valley 2 crs time of 0'51"963 with a time of: 0'51"898
Tom Norton improved his own old DS Delfino Square crs time of 2'05"034 with a time of: 2'04"978
Tyler Reyes improved his own old SNES Mario Circuit 3 crs time of 1'18"120 with a time of: 1'18"107
Martin Fox improved his own old Mushroom Gorge no glitch crs time of 1'41"986 with a time of: 1'41"653.
Martin Fox beat Salvatore Bellusci's old Mushroom Gorge no glitch lap time of 0'31"565 with a time of: 0'31"396.
Martin Fox beat Tom Norton's old Wario's Gold Mine no glitch crs time of 1'51"213 with a time of: 1'51"137.
Martin Fox improved his own old Wario's Gold Mine no glitch lap time of 0'35"655 with a time of: 0'35"654.
Axel San improved his own old SNES Ghost Valley 2 no glitch crs time of 0'52"987 with a time of: 0'52"962.
Jamie Disley beat Keiichi Nagai's old SNES Ghost Valley 2 no glitch lap time of 0'16"519 with a time of: 0'16"496.
Ruby Aruba improved his own old N64 DK's Jungle Parkway time of 2'12"506 with a time of: 2'12"258.

Make sure to keep an eye out on the forum for the 2013 POY award poll. Have a happy new year, everyone :)
~Silver

fields.author: Silver
fields.title: Yahoogroups Troubles v2.0
fields.content:
Well, it looks like the new version of Yahoogroups isn't working well for news updaters anymore, and it looks like the change is permanent at this point :/ so unfortunately, times updating messages sent via email will not be received.

For now, it would be better if you posted new times either here or here. Please follow this specific format when submitting new times:

"Date: Mon Sep 2, 2013 12:56am
From: Your name
List of times (preferably track name before the time); each time goes on a new line."

The date must be issued in day-month-date-year format. The day and month has to be the first three letters, start with a capital letter and be in English. For example, submitting a time on the 10th of October would be "Thu Oct 10, 2013". The comma must be issued after the date.

The clock is also 12 hour so am or pm should be included, without a space between that and the time.

If you have me, Thomas, or some other times updater added on Skype, we may be able to update your times without having to follow this tedious process, although note that we might be slow in doing so ;)

Sorry for the inconvenience, guys.

fields.author: Silver
fields.title: New Update!!!11
fields.content:
Wow, a news update??? Well, I know you've been waiting a long time for this. I have to apologize for not being consistent with the news updates. So without further ado, let's delve right into the action.

Update: December 26, 2013 --> March 22, 2014

New Players
8 new players have joined us since the last update, along with someone who rejoined the site.

Tatsuya joins us with a full timesheet and a ranking of 159th.
Keiichi Nagai rejoins us with a full timesheet with a ranking of 22nd.
Gabriel Le Blanc joined with 43 times and a theoretical ranking of 448th.
Wantyu San joined with 22 times and a theoretical ranking of 338th.
Matthew Piper joined with 36 times and a theoretical ranking of 333rd.
Vinnie Colace joined with 44 times and a theoretical ranking of 408th.
Nancy joined with 4 times and a theoretical ranking of 452nd.
Nocky joined with 18 times and a theoretical ranking of 345th.
Suiryu joined with 8 times and a theoretical ranking of 417th.

Remember, theoretical rankings are what your rank would be if all your other times are dead last.

It's great that we're getting more Japanese players, as they've been vastly underrepresented on the PP.

Movement
There were 88 active players since last update - quite a lot even for the long time span.

1 - 10
#1 Thomas Petraud starts us off today. With 8 PRs, he continues to solidify his position as the reigning champion. Likewise, #2 Thomas van Deerse made improvements to 5 of his times, and continues to distance himself from the players below. #7 Salvatore Bellusci and #8 Leo Petiard played as well, setting 9 and 6 PRs, respectively. Meanwhile, #9 Martin Fox joined the full charts at a very high (like Snoop Dogg) rank by submitting 24 new times. And breaking into the top 10 is #10 Paul Philipp-Baehr, who set 18 new times, including a WR.

11 - 25
Unfortunately, Fox and Paul's movements caused #11 Olivier Luyckx to drop two spots despite his 3 PRs. The same thing happened to #13 Jak Russo and #14 Aziz Abdullah, who sent in 1 and 2 new times (respectively) yet both dropped two rungs on the AF ladder. Breaking this trend is #16 Cyril Fulag, who managed to move up 13 spots with his 26 new times. Due to him and Fox, though, #18 Liam Ashcroft was affected as well, as he dropped - you guessed it - 2 spots with his 2 PRs. #22 Keiichi Nagai rejoined the Player's Page at this rank, but this didn't affect #23 Fra Lenoob that much, who managed to move up 4 spots with 31 PRs. Somehow, #24 Roy D managed to top even that feat, moving up 9 places with 37 submissions.

26 - 50
Unfortunately for him, all the movement above took a toll on #26 Cole Gilbert, who made 2 PRs yet moved down 5 full places. On a better note, "blatant cheater" #33 Luke Berrill set 22 PRs and moved up 8 spots. Poor #34 Danny Gallenberger and #35 Jamie Disley were stuck with moving down 4 spots each though with 3 and 2 new times, respectively. #43 Qi Zhu made 5 new PRs and moved down a spot - better than the two he would have lost if he hadn't played. #45 Alex Jascol finally completed his timesheet and slides in comfortably in the top 50, good on you :^). And #46 Anthony Caiulo dives into an AF tie with Max Anosova, moving up 24 spots thanks to his package of 39 PRs.

51 - 100
#52 Gary Marcos had no problem overcoming the movement above him, setting 13 new personal records and moving up 3 spots. #53 Zane Royal, unfortunately, was caught in the midst of this and dropped 4 places even with his 2 submissions. #60 Alexandre Agniel faced a similar problem, making 2 PRs as well but "only" moving down 3 places. Successfully responding to the need of PRs in order to move up the ranks are #70 Ace Firestone, #73 Jamie Skepper, and #75 Steven Reinhold. Ace and Steven set 21 new personal bests each, cutting 5 and 7 spots (respectively), while Jamie had the biggest cut of the three, moving up 26 spots with 38 PRs. Next up, we add yet another player who filled out their timesheet, #80 Lachlan Young, who made 6 PRs to get on the charts. #82 Michele Gallastri played as well, setting 9 PRs, but still moved down 2 places on the AF ladder. He didn't have it as bad as #88 Stacy Needham and #89 Darragh Williamson, though. Michele set only one new time and moved down 5 spots, while Darragh moved down 4 with his 6 PRs. #97 Jon Coppernoll was also affected, getting placed down 5 spots with 6 PRs.

101 - 200
Managing to maintain his spot, #101 Jay Carr played and set 4 new times since the last update. #112 Sam Smith submitted one new time but (not surprisingly) was moved down 4 spots. #126 Alex B fared better, moving up 5 spots with 11 submissions. #138 Rob Jon moved down 2 spots instead of 4 with his 3 PRs - better than nothing, at least. #147 Brett Edwards moved up 3 spots with 10 PRs, as well. The introduction of #159 Tatsuya into the charts wasn't enough to prevent the PR spree of #166 Julian Stephens, who was the most active player this time around with 53 new PRs. He moved up a whopping 88 places, in fact. #167 Matt Danner takes the hint from Julian and played quite a bit as well, moving up 14 places with 37 new times. All this activity fazed #177 Michael Penninck, who set 3 new times yet moved down 5 places. #187 Sam Fairless accomplishes a feat of his own, moving up 19 places with 34 PRs. #190 Zack Weber was quite possibly hit hardest with all this activity, and thus moved down 7 places despite a minor return to the game by making 2 new times.

200+
However, the introduction of #213 Hunter Wells (who set 14 new PRs) to the charts also caused #222 Andrew Ahearn to lose 7 places, though he only submitted 1 new time. The Julian Stephens of the 200s was evidently #232 Kyle Fitzgerald, who set 51 new times and climbed 57 spots up on the AF ladder. #263 Conor Hornsey played quite a bit as well and moved up 7 spots with 29 PRs. #316 David Delzenne set a PR yet moved down 6 spots, and the same thing happened with #371 Stephen De Winter. Filling out his timesheet is #387 Rudy Weitze, who only needed one PR to do so. And rounding up the movement for this update is #438 Esteban Bonilla Elizondo, who set 9 new personal bests, only to move down 3 places.

The Uncharted
Players without a full timesheet that made progress include Axel San, Ethan McCormac, Troy Howard, Jordan Artz, James Ramirez, Stavros Ferentinos, Tylor McCallumore, Dane M, Harley Gordon, Kevin Kuo, Joshua Bernelli, Dante Dhillon, Sora H, Bob Brannen, Juan Pablo Bravo, Racer Festus, Josh Frahn, Speed Troppelmann, Kyon Gulliksen, Feysal Temptation, Umbre R.B., and Julian OfTime.

Site Records
Lots of new site records this time around. I honestly cannot do the no glitch records due to all this activity, though I promise I'll get to it next time around.

fields.author: Shadow
fields.title: What the hell happened to this place?
fields.content:
I was passing by this site when I noticed that there hadn't been a news update since March. Like...what...do people even play this game anymore?
So hello. It's me. I'm back, for one update only. The original news writer for the site from 2008-2010 before there was some sort of coup and other people took over. It's crazy to think that 4 years later, people are still following my general updating outline... Except for this horrible red color. Who decided red was a good idea? My eyes..the goggles do nothing. :crazy:

So what's been happening for the last few months I hear you ask me? Are people even playing the game anymore?
Yes!

76 active players.
13 new players.
11 new site records.
1 partridge in a pear tree.

So let's start with the 13 new players.

"Time" Atek Drew
Jeffrey "MK64" Gutierrez
Matt "Whatchoo talkin' about" Willis
Mark "Mastercard" Vizza
ZJ "I can't believe they allow names like this on this site" Insanity
"Lois" Layne Stephens
Nick "Colonel Ace" Colace
Caleb "Doctor" House
Jacob "Willie" Nelson
Shawn "Chuck" Berry
Michael "Dan" Harmon
and someone called "Vanish" Seriously, you guys?

Site Records
Next up are the site records, because why not.
Martin Fox beat Wu Tang Clan's Moo Moo Meadows crs time of 1'15"844 with a time of: 1'15"840.
Great Scott!
Cyril Fulag beat his own Toad's Factory lap time of 0'34"981 with a time of: 0'34"953, because that's how he rolls
Caleb House beat the old Mario Circuit crs time of 0'59"422 with a time of: 0'55"646
Caleb House beat the old Mario Circuit lap time of 0'09"731 with a time of: 0'09"223
Caleb joined with these times which destroy the previous times. What's up with that.
Blake Germany beat the old DK's Snowboard Cross crs time of 1'46"960 with a time of: 1'46"542
Blake Germany beat the old DK's Snowboard Cross lap time of 0'34"202 with a time of: 0'33"989
Germany (if that *is* your real name), enjoys some time in the snow. Dominant now.
Cole Gilbert beat the old Moonview Highway crs time of 1'43"648 with a time of: 1'43"526
Cole doesn't like ties. He doesn't wear them either.
Cyril Fulag beat the old GCN Peach Beach lap time of 0'16"473 with a time of: 0'15"878
Cyril beat this with 4 other guys. It sounds like a new strat. 6 tenths is huge here.
Cyril Fulag beat the old SNES Ghost Valley 2 lap time of 0'14"968 with a time of: 0'14"908
6 hundreths. That's more like it Cyril. None of this silly tenths business.
Martin Fox beat the old GBA Shy Guy Beach crs time of 1'21"924 with a time of: 1'21"904
Martin steals this away from Tom. Woah, this is heavy.
Thomas van Deerse beat the old N64 DK's Jungle Parkway crs time of 2'11"440 with a time of: 2'10"623
Thomas kills it on this course. Great improvement.
Joshua Bernelli beat the old GCN Mario Circuit crs time of 1'31"119 with a time of: 1'31"064
Martin has most of the main site records now, but loses this one to Joshua
Brett Edwards beats his own DS Peach Gardens lap time of 0'38"430 with a time of: 0'38"385
Take that Brett!
Martin Fox beat the old GCN DK Mountain crs time of 2'03"525 with a time of: 2'01"202
Martin took this to another level. If you put your mind to it, you can accomplish anything!


Now to everyone's favorite part of the update.
Movement

Did I say favorite? I meant most pointless. Some guy in some position got a few PRs and is now at an even better position. I'm kidding. I'm kidding. Most of the time, nobody gains any places at all.

#1 Thomas Petraud lost ground to the chasing pack, but still PR'd 3 times and is still a million miles ahead of #2. If we use the metric system, we discover that a million miles converts roughly to 6.6AF points. Feel free to verify this at your local metric system store.
#2 Thomas van Deerse maintained the Thomas double-team dominance, with 7 PRs and inched closer to #1. At this rate of gaining, Thomas #2 should pass Thomas #1 some time in early 2018. (This is when I hear the next news update is due)
#3 Martin J Fox made fantastic progress with 25 PRs, moving him up from 9th to 3rd, halving his AF. If he keeps halving his AF every 3 months, there's no limit to where he can reach.
#6 Leo Petiard went from 8th to 6th, passing Tandy, Bas and Bellusci. Yes, yes..in this update 8-3=6. It's in revelations people!
#10 Paul-Phillipp Baehr, the man with two names PR'd 8 times and stayed within the top 10. #11 Olivier Luyckx and #12 Ruby Aruba (haha, really) both PR'd a little and maintained station.
#13 Fra Lenoob took the piss with his name, but PR'd an impressive 26 times and moved up 10 places to #13. If these really are your real names guys, I apologise. Hilarious though.
#17 Cyril Fulag, PR'd 11 times, improved his AF, and lost a place, because mariokart wii hates him.
#18 Roy D (for danger) PR'd 19 times and rose 6 places.
#19 Liam Ashcroft rounds out the top 20, because 19 rounds to 20, with 4 PRs, and a loss of a place.

Outside the top 20
#27 Alex Jascol is making a case for being inside the top 20. His 29 PRs netted him a very nice 18 places. The top 20 is still quite a bit away, but he has momentum.
#30 Luke Berrill has a little momentum too. 9 PRs. 3 AF points. 3 spots. That sort of consistent pace is what it takes to steadily rise up the chart.
#32 Alvin Le, #33 Matt Striker, #35 Danny Gallenberger, and #36 Jamie Disley are also making steady progress. They all PR'd exactly once in this three month period, and all made steady progress backwards. Guys..you're going the wrong way..you're on a treadmill..be careful.
#37 Anthony Caiulo made 16 PRs, and gained 9 spots. He's now just behind the treadmill gang, but he's running.
The last active player in the top 50 was #44 Qi Zhu. He made a magic 7 PRs, but it wasn't enough to stop him dropping a spot.

50-100
#55 Jamie Skepper realises that nobody really cares about people outside the top 50, so he's doing his best to move on up. 29 PRs in the last few months has cut a chunk of his AF, and gained him 18 places.
#62 Ace Firestone took a break from his magic career in vegas to PR 19 times. 8 spots was his reward. And yes, that was the card I was thinking of.
#77 Lachlan Young moved up from #80 with his 9 PRs, passing Cupid himself, Harp Valentine.
#91 ZJ Insanity is the highest joiner on the list. All the other guys did pretty well, but ZJ impressively cracked the top 100.
#95 Kevin Borne is the last player in the top 100, and shot up from #129 with only 13 PRs. He probably submitted some times for the newer glitches, or the stat program is broken. Either of these.

100+
Literally nobody reads down this far, except for people who are ranked lower than 100. Admittedly, that's most of us, but I'm only going to mention the big hitters here.
#138 Jacob Fitzgibbon PR'd 35 times and moved up 18 places. Good job Jacob.
#150 Hunter Wells hunted 42 times well, and moved up a staggering 63 places.
#154 Matt Danner PR'd an immense 45 times, gaining him 13 places, and moving him closer to the top 150. Keep going Matt. Remember, 100 is where people start caring.
#158 Julian Stephens made a nice haul of 19 PRs, to gain him 8 spots, to keep him ticking along nicely.

Honorable mentions to #182 Sam Fairless, #231 Kyle Fitzgerald, #236 Matthew Piper, #317 David Delzenne If you're new, and you've been PRing like crazy, it won't show up, because you didn't exist in the database file it's comparing things to. But great work to all those people who joined in this period.

21 players PR'd without a full set of times, but I don't want to talk about them. 556 players currently do not have a full set of times. That's just ridiculous. I blame the glitches. Also, the stat program doesn't keep track of non-glitch times, so good work with all those impressive non-glitch amazements that will fade into news history, cruelly forgotten. :(

Keep karting everyone, and keep joining with ridiculous names. I probably won't do a drive-by news update again.
S.

fields.author: JCop
fields.title: Let's Get This Thing Back on Track
fields.content:
This train has been stuck in the rail yard a little too long for my liking, so I'm gonna do us all a favor and get the ol' engine running again. Think of me as the conductor. The conductor calls the shots because he basically owns the train, so I'm gonna do the news exactly how I see fit with absolutely no consideration for how you guys want me to do it. Sound fair? Good.

Stuff has happened since the last news update. Stuff like 52 people sending in times, 2 newbies joining the site, and 11 site records being broken. Also, a new glitch was exploited. Really, it wouldn't be MKW without another glitch.

First, a shout-out to our 2 new passengers: Bastien Antoniazzi and Alex Matteson. Welcome aboard, gentlemen. This won't be as magical as the Polar Express, but it's pretty dang close.

Activity

Everything you're about to read happened anywhere between July 3rd and right now.

1-20: First Class

#1 Thomas Petraud sent in 12 prs to push his af below 6.
#2 Thomas Van Deerse and #3 Martin Fox each sent in 3 prs and held their positions at 2 and 3.
#5 Nick Meade sent in 1 pr, enough for a former champion to get his name mentioned in the news.
#6 Dave Tandy moved up one spot with 5 prs and is within 2 points of being the US champ, so that's interesting.
#10 Paul-Philipp Baehr is pretty good at this game. He stayed at #10 with the help of 2 prs.
#11 Fra Lenoob sent in 28 prs to move from 13th to 11, one prime number to another.
#15 Roy D moved up 3 spots with 19 prs.
#19 Liam Ashcroft is British. Also, he set 4 more prs.

20-100: Riding Coach

#22 Matt Striker jumped up 11 spots thanks to his 41 new prs.
#24 Lee Duggan dropped off one new time.
Everyone's favorite Canadian #26 Cole Gilbert lowered his af with 5 new times.
#28 Luke Berrill jumped over 2 people with 17 prs.
#37 Qi Zhu passed (lucky number) 7 people with (unlucky number) 13 prs.
#62 Ace Firestone has a badass (and probably fake) name. He passed one person.
#76 Lachlan Young passed one person with 2 prs.
#78 Kevin Borne passed 16 people with 28 prs.
#90 Darragh Williamson fell down one spot, but he sent in 2 prs, so that's nice.
#91 Jay Carr sent in a dozen prs to jump into the top 100.
#99 Jon Coppernoll sent in one pr. Why is his name in purple, you ask? Because he's me, and I like the color purple. As the conductor of this train, I stand by my right to make my name a different color than everyone else's. Deal with it.

100+: These are the people who couldn't afford train tickets so they hold on to the side of the train and pray to whatever god they believe in that they don't fall off. I hope they have good grip strength.

#116 Dane M finished his time sheet by sending in his last 19 prs.
#124 Jacob Fitzgibben passed 12 people with 24 prs. That's half a person per pr (hopefully the bottom half)
#135 Hunter Wells passed 15 people with 16 prs.
#146 Matt Danner used 15 prs to beat 8 people.
#152 Marco van Turner passed one person with one pr, a small effort that actually payed off.
#171 Sam Fairless passed 11 people.
#177 Michael Penninck passed 3 people with 2 prs.
#197 Kyle Fitzgerald passed a whopping 34 people with 33 prs.
That Bastien guy I mentioned earlier joined at #235.
#267 Matt Wills is up 15 spots.
#307 David Delzenne moved 10 seats closer to still not being anywhere near first class.
That new Alex guy that I mentioned above joined us at #332, the equivalent of Ryan Braun's batting average in 2011.
#334 Jacob Nelson passed 6 players.
#384 Vinnie Colace passed 4 players with 9 prs.
#459 Mark Vizza did something unusual. He sent in 20 prs but still managed to move down one spot.

Ok, so that was a lot of activity and probably only 3 of you will bother to read it. Next stop: site records.

Site Records

There are 11 new ones. Read them:

Caleb House beat the old Mario Circuit lap time of 0'09"223 with a time of: 0'09"140
Thomas Petraud beat the old Coconut Mall crs time of 0'34"251 with a time of: 0'33"531
Blake Germany beat the old DK's Snowboard Cross crs time of 1'46"542 with a time of: 1'46"306
Liam Ashcroft beat the old Moonview Highway crs time of 1'43"526 with a time of: 1'43"507
Thomas Petraud beat the old Moonview Highway lap time of 0'33"166 with a time of: 0'33"155
Caleb House beat the old GCN Peach Beach crs time of 1'07"167 with a time of: 1'04"237
Caleb House beat the old GCN Peach Beach lap time of 0'15"878 with a time of: 0'15"765
Dane M beat the old SNES Ghost Valley 2 lap time of 0'14"908 with a time of: 0'14"875
Thomas van Deerse beat the old DS Desert Hills crs time of 1'35"028 with a time of: 1'34"010
Thomas Petraud beat the old DS Desert Hills lap time of 0'29"432 with a time of: 0'27"973
Darragh Williamson beat the old DS Peach Gardens crs time of 1'59"653 with a time of: 1'59"541

Let's make a promise to one another to keep this train moving from now on. If you guys keep playing, then I'll do my best to give you the news as consistently as I can. Deal?

fields.author: JCop
fields.title: Spirit Tracks
fields.content:
Let's start this update with a shout-out. Two weeks ago, a discussion was started on the forum about keeping times updated, something that hadn't been done consistently for quite some time. It didn't take long before a handful of players volunteered their time to keep this thing up to speed, so I'd like to say thanks to Thomas, Sam, Dane, Luke, and Caleb for helping out.

Ok, enough about them, let's talk about the everyone else for a while. We had 33 active players, 3 new passengers, and 3 new site records. The new passengers are Jacob Desmond-Hooper, Jason Teague, and Marc Atar. Welcome aboard, gentlemen!

Activity

As always, we'll start from the top and work our way down. It's easier for me that way because I don't have to go against gravity.

Fist Class:

#1 Thomas Petraud still sits at the tippy top, and he helped his own cause be sending in 2 prs.
#6 Dave Tandy still sits 5 spots below the tippy top. He also sent in 2 prs.
#11 Fra Lenoob sent in 14 prs and is now within .1 af points of the top 10. He also recently became the non-glitch champion, so that's something to be excited about.
#18 Cyril Fulag popped out 3 prs.
#19 Luke Berrill passed 9 players with 15 prs. Good stuff, Luke!
#20 Liam Ashcroft is still British. He's also the highest ranked MKW player who I'm friends with on Facebook. He sent in one pr.

Coach:

#29 Alex Jascol sent in one pr to cut half a point in af.
#38 Anthony Caiulo almost has every vowel in his last name. He also sent in one pr.
#71 Dane M sent in 20 prs to cut 54 af points and pass 45 players. That's a lot of prs, a lot of af points, and a lot of players. Well done, Dane!
#77 Lachlan Young cut more than a full point from his af with 3 prs and somehow moved down one spot.
#91 Darragh Williamson had similar results to Lachlan, setting 5 prs to cut .6 af but moving down one spot.

The ticketless:

#126 Jacob Fitzgibbon hooked himself one new pr.
#162 Sam Fairless jumped up 9 spots with 19 prs. Keep up the activity, Sam, you're making our updating team look good :)
#197 Kyle Fitzgerald sent in a couple prs.
#231 Bastien Antoniazzi moved up 4 spots after joining us at #235 two weeks ago.
#236 Mackenzie Fuller sent in 32 times to finish her time sheet.
#253 Matt Wills cranked out 14 prs to pass 14 players. That's one pr per person per day.
#307 David Delzenne didn't move up, but he did cut some af with 2 prs.
#458 Mark Vizza did something unusual again. His af went up despite sending in 4 prs, but he passed one player despite his increasing af. This is 2 weeks after he moved down a spot despite sending in 20 prs. I don't know how you do it, Mark.

Site Records

You guys set 3 new records this time around, and one of them came from one of our time updaters.

Dave Tandy beat the old Moonview Highway crs time of 1'43"507 with a time of: 1'43"502
Caleb House beat the old GCN Peach Beach crs time of 1'04"237 with a time of: 1'02"291
Thomas Petraud beat the old DS Delfino Square lap time of 0'38"954 with a time of: 0'38"941

This was a good week for our new time updaters. Between the 4 of them, they passed 63 players and set a new site record. I always encourage you guys to go to the forum and tell me how much you love me, but be sure to share some love with those guys as well.

-Jon

fields.author: Silver
fields.title: Holla for Ebolla
fields.content:
Wow, Silver's actually making a news update??? Well, it would appear that JCop's too fearful of the ebola epidemic that has been going on - one particular strain being called the MKWii-bola, as it only affects Mario Kart Wii players. Thus, I have decided to be brave and write the news update this time around. (just kidding, I'm actually immune, as you'll see later)

Oh yeah, it's my birthday tomorrow (or today if you live in Europe/Asia/Oceania). Of course it has to fall on the day after election day, when I have to go back to school...

Update: October 22nd --> November 4th

New Players

One solitary new player joined us (and unfortunately made himself susceptible to MKWii-bola). Welcome, Benjamin Zenon!

Movement

One person mysteriously disappeared from the charts, presumably due to the illness... well that's karma for cheating, II guess. As for the remaining people, 31 players were active since the last update.

1 - 20: The Immune - Somehow these people have found a cure... lucky them. However, the cure only works for as long as they stay in the top 20 for whatever reason... mysterious, right?

#1 Thomas Petraud set 2 new PRs and continues to separate himself from his inferiors. :(
#6 Dave Tandy (aka meeeeee ^-^) improved one time, namely, his existing WR. Everyone should love him, just saying.
#10 Fra Lenoob improved one of his times, which was enough for him to move up one spot.
#19 Luke Berrill, on the other hand, set 7 new PRs but did not move up a spot.

21 - 100: The Healthy - These people have not yet been infected with ebola and are scrambling for the cure.

#35 Danny Gallenberger sent in one single new time and maintains his position.
#46 Dane M sent in 13 PRs and moved up all the way from #71, mysteriously being healed of the illness along the way.
#62 Ace Firestone set 4 PRs yet still moved down a spot thanks to Dane.
#84 Jon Coppernoll moved up 16 places with 4 PRs.
#92 Darragh Williamson set one new PR but moved down a spot as well, this time due to Jon.

101 - 200: The Infected - Unfortunately, these people have not been able to avoid the epidemic. Let's hope they make a full recovery. (not really lol, noobs)

#104 Murray Wright continues to show symptomatic improvement, setting 21 PRs and coincidentally moving up 21 spots.
#126 Jacob Fitzgibbon sent in one PR and maintained his position.
#127 Hunter Wells moved up 8 spots, comfortably settling himself close to Jacob with 11 PRs.
#162 Sam Fairless sent in 5 improvements and cut some AF.
#197 Kyle Fitzgerald sent in 1 PR and cut a small amount of AF.

201 - Infinity and Beyond: The (un)dead - And finally, these people... *sigh* unfortunately, these people have passed away. RIP... wait, what? They're rising from the dead??? Thank God I'm immune... Anyway,

#218 Matthew Piper set 5 new times and solidified his position.
#228 Bastien Antoniazzi moved up 3 places with 3 PRs.
#303 David Delzenne sent 4 new times and moved up 5 spots (one of them due to the removal of the cheater).

The Uncharted - These people are mystical beings watching down upon us and our MKWii-bola-filled madness. I hope you're having fun, you sick freaks.

Shawn Berry, Caleb House, Yuiazu Mirage, and Jacob Desmond-Hooper all set new PRs since the last update.

Site Records

2 site records were set since the last update.

Dave Tandy improved his own old Moonview Highway course time of 1'43"502 with a time of 1'43"387
Darragh Williamson beat Martin Fox's GBA Shy Guy Beach course time of 1'21"904 with a time of 1'21"879

One last thing - Jon's started up the awards again - props to him (although this admittedly leaves a huge gap since the last awards). In any case, check back weekly and stay healthy! ;)
~Silver

fields.author: JCop
fields.title: Polar Express
fields.content:
I'm a few weeks late on this one. Oops. Odds are I'll be a tiny bit late on the next one as well as the Thursday two weeks from now is Christmas and I'm not giving up my holiday for this. Since I won't be doing this on Christmas, I'll use this one as my extra special Christmas update! There won't really be anything special about it, it'll just have more Christmasy stuff in it.

Since the last update, we've had 33 active players, 6 site records, and one new passenger. The new passenger is Gautier Estaloy.

~*~*~
Activity
~*~*~

First Class:

#1 Thomas Petraud stayed at the top of the nice list with 4 new PRs.
#2 Thomas van Deerse sent in two PRs, one for each turtle dove.
#3 Martin Fox owns 7 ugly Christmas sweaters. He improved his AF with 4 PRs.
#6 Dave Tandy sits at the #6 spot, just like Cupid does in the reindeer song. He sent in 4 PRs.

~*~*~*~*~
Site Records
~*~*~*~*~

As I said before, we had 6 new records since the last update. Reading them will help power Santa's sleigh this year, so get to reading:

Caleb House beat the old Mario Circuit lap time of 0'09"140 with a time of: 0'08"985

That does it for this update. If you don't like that I'm doing a Christmas update so early, head to the forum and send me a message detailing how terrible of a job you think I'm doing. That will give me a chance to completely ignore you.

-Jon

fields.author: JCop
fields.title: Reading Railroad
fields.content:

A lot of people make resolutions, and as the MKW news writer, I wanted to make a resolution that would improve the quality of my news updates. However, after some head scratching I realized that my updates are perfect and don't need changing. In other words, it will be business as usual in 2015.

We had 34 active players, 1 new passenger, and 8 new site records since the last update. Our new passenger is Benjamin Pryzbocki. Welcome aboard, Benjamin!

fields.author: JCop
fields.title: Drops of Jupiter
fields.content:
If you've payed close attention, you may have noticed that all the titles I've used on this site have had something to do with trains. We have a special announcement this week regarding the Player of the Year award, and "Drops of Jupiter" is a song by the band Train that won them some awards a dozen years ago. This title was very clever of me because it incorporates trains and awards in a way that I'm sure none of you would have thought of. No offense :)

If you visit the forum (which you do), then you already know who the winner is. Let's all give a big round of applause for Luke Berrill, 2014's Player of the Year as voted by you, the karters. Luke set 50 PRs in 2014, enough to cut more than 40% of his AF and land in the top 20. I'd tip my cap if I was wearing one.

I'm sure you'd all like to party and celebrate Luke's accomplishment a little longer, but I need to move on to the rest of the news. Since our last update, we've had 28 active players, 6 new site records, and zero new passengers. Welcome aboard, no one!

Activity

First Class:

#2 Martin Fox sent in 4 PRs and passed Thomas Van Deerse to take hold of the #2 hole.
#3 Thomas Van Deerse didn't go down quietly, sending in 2 PRs of his own.
#5 Dave Tandy passed two players with just one PR and is the new American champion of MKW. Congrats, Dave!
#13 Roy D moved up into the #13 slot with 4 PRs. I hope he's not superstitious, otherwise he'd be totally freaking out about his rank right now.
#16 Luke Berrill celebrated his big award with one PR.
#18 Cyril Fulag moved up one spot with 2 PRs.

Coach:

#35 Danny Gallenberger sent in one PR again.
#38 Anthony Caiulo improved his AF a tiny bit with one new time.
#93 ZJ Insanity was the only other active player in this grouping. He moved up one spot with 2 PRs.

The Ticketless:

#101 Hunter Wells is pushing himself closer and closer to the top 100. He passed 6 people with 8 PRs.
#111 Tom Norton sent in just one PR, but it was a good one. Read the site record section below to see what it is.
#128 Julian Stephens sent in a nice batch of 24 PRs, moving him up 32 spots.
#147 Sam Fairless bumped himself up one spot with 6 PRs.
#167 Kyle Fitzgerald is up 2 spots with 9 PRs.
#298 David Delzenne moved up one spot with 2 PRs.
#365 Andrew Buchan finished his time sheet on the 7th with his first PRs in almost 7 years. Longest comeback ever?
#386 Rudy Weitze passed 6 players with 6 PRs, a perfect 1:1 ratio.
#446 Mark Vizza passed 9 players with an impressive 34 PRs.

Site Records

We had 6 new records this time around, including a new Sherbet Land world record that Sword worked for 3 years to achieve.

Cole Gilbert beat the old Luigi Circuit crs time of 1'08"998 with a time of: 1'08"994
Cole Gilbert beat the old Luigi Circuit lap time of 0'21"741 with a time of: 0'21"725
Martin Fox beat the old Daisy Circuit crs time of 1'29"177 with a time of: 1'28"962
Martin Fox beat the old Daisy Circuit lap time of 0'28"305 with a time of: 0'28"294
Danny Gallenberger beat the old Moonview Highway lap time of 0'33"1340'33"134 with a time of: 0'33"102
Tom Norton beat the old N64 Sherbet Land crs time of 2'04"304 with a time of: 2'04"253

That does it for this update. I'd like to say congrats once again to Luke for winning POY, as well as the other players who put up big numbers last year that were also considered for the award!

-Jon

fields.author: JCop
fields.title: Old King Coal
fields.content:
I'm a little bit late with this update. 20 days late, to be exact. You can blame school for that. Or you can blame me, I don't really care.

fields.author: JCop
fields.title: Lightspeed Rescue
fields.content:
Ok, time to shake the rust off of this site and get things moving again. It's been almost 3 months since the last update, so I guess you could say I've been slacking. I'd say I'm sorry, but I'm not.

Let's get to the business. Since our last update, we've had 45 active players, 13 site records, 1 new site champion, and 5 new passengers. The new passengers are Muhammed Jin Tazir, Chris Dunstan, Kilton Webb, Quindarious Gooch, and "Mo No". Welcome aboard, fellas!

Activity

First Class:

#1 Martin Fox cut more than a third of his AF with 17 PRs to take the champion spot and earn himself a purple name. Congrats, Martin!
#2 Thomas Petraud didn't give up the top spot without a fight, setting 5 new PRs.
#3 Thomas van Deerse also cut some AF with 5 PRs.
#11 Luke Berrill is closing in on the top 10. He passed 4 players with 18 PRs.
#17 Cyril Fulag dropped off one PR.
#19 Liam Ashcroft also dropped off one PR.
#20 Alex Rue joined the top 20 by passing 4 players with 6 PRs.

Coach:

#33 Alvin Le didn't go anywhere, but he set 2 new PRs.

#39 Ace Firestone passed even more players with even more PRs. Nine and thirteen, to be specific.
#73 Hunter Wells passed an impressive 21 players with the help of 23 PRs.
#74 Lachlan Young stayed put with 3 PRs. It's ok, Lachlan, not everyone can pass 21 players.
#77 Colin Raptor achieved the perfect 1:1 ratio, passing 9 players with 9 PRs.
#83 ZJ Insanity took 2 steps forward.
#92 Darragh Williamson sent in 4 PRs, including a world record on that one flowery track. More about that later.
#93 Caleb House made his way into the top 100, putting 3 Wisconsin players in the top 100. Represent.

The Ticketless:

#473 Nick Colace is the last player in this update. He set 3 new PRs since our last update.

fields.author: Silver
fields.title: Summer PR Spree
fields.content:
Yo, it's ya boiiii Silver again, bringing another fresh dope news update y'all!!! (it really hurt to type this)

First of all, I'd like to bring up our new MKW Records YouTube channel. Yes, we have had collab channels fail in the past, but this one seems to be going along pretty well. It is a place where the most recent World Records and Regional Records are uploaded. Here is the link to the channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCVLnt1f20C77OzOBbJNeN0A. It is mainly managed by our #1 champ, Martin Faxe, but there are other occasional uploaders as well.

Additionally, the charts for the worldwide and regional top 10s, can be found here: mkwtops.weebly.com.

Anyway, without further ado, let's get started with this update.

Update: May 19 --> June 26

New Players

Two new players joined us this time around. Their names are Ben Bart and Feysal A.

Movement

One player has been removed from the PP on request, which may have skewed the charts a little bit. I'd like to make it clear that this is heavily discouraged and players who join the PP should not ask to leave the site. Movement places will not count the removed player, and I'll try to make this update accurate.

1 - 20

#1 Martin Fox aka Faxe sent in a time to the no glitch charts, so I feel like he deserves a mention.
#3 Thomas van Deerse sent in two times and negated some AF loss.

101+

The Uncharted
Jordan Artz, Gautier Estaloy, Suiryu, Angel Vargas, and Jason Teague all sent in new times and cut theoretical AF since the previous update.

Site Records

fields.author: Webinator
fields.title: A Dusty Reunion
fields.content:
Hey everyone, not sure exactly what happened here but theres quite a thick layer of dust covering the official news typewriter that I had to blow off. So either J-Cop forgot to do his weekly cleaning duties or there hasnt been a news update since August, and it looks like the latter. If you dont remember me, I used to update here a few years ago when things were less dusty, but I decided to step in and shake off the rust from the page. Lets get to the news.

This news update covers August 31st 2015 to March 18th, 2016.

The New Players
While the newsroom slept, 19 new players joined the page. The players to make the jump to the main AF table included Stavros Ferentinos at #44, LeoMK at #206, Ben Bart at #325, Leyla Hasso at #448 and Maia Hasso at #484.
The rest of the players to join the page were Josh Andre,Nath.P, Paul Machala, Sam Hashimoto, Justin Hitchcock, ADAM-XL, NAVSA, Scr 7, Max Perkins, Quinten De Neve, Hollend78, Rda 4Vex , MKWiiManu, Bradon, and FlygonMaster.

A few of these players names sound like they may secretly be androids or aliens, but we at the MKWPP pride ourselves on diversity and inclusiveness and heartily welcome them to the fold.

Movement
82 players were active despite the presses staying inactive, lets cover the movement in the main AF table.

~~The Top 10~~
No one new joined the Top 10 since last update, which may have led some of the players to get complacent. Only 4 of the 10 top karters submitted PRs. #1 Martin Fox submitted 9 PRs, among them five new SRs. Despite this, he couldnt fight off the rest of the field, losing a few tenths. Similar stories play out with #3 Thomas van Deerse and #4 Dave Tandy, both sending in a pair of PRs as Thomas stuck to DDR and TF while Dave gravitated towards rDS and rMC3. Both lost some AF but inched closer to their next opponents, staring across some impressive AF graveyards. Finally, #8 Luke Berrill logs the first AF cut of the update, with 12 PRs earning exactly 1 point in cuts. Hes getting close to the pair of Nick and Leo, and another six month stretch like the one he had should net him those spots.

~~11-25 ~~
There was decent activity in the second best group of the page, with #12 Olivier Luyckx keeping guard over his esteemed position with 3 PRs. #13 Ruby Aruba makes the first positive position change of the update, sending in some solid Top 20 times at rSGB and rSL to vault over Roy D. #16 Cyril Fulag moved towards #15 Jak with 3 PRs. He has to watch out for #17 Liam Ashcroft, who improved a quarter of his timesheet with three impressive SRs at rDS and MH, jumping four spots from #21. #20 Alex Rue hit an impressive 9 PRs to cut 1.2 AF, and has to watch out for further improvements from Danny in the future. Finally #22 Dane M hit 6 PRs including a Top 5 3lap on rDS, but was a victim to the rise of the two players above.

~~26-50~~
#36 Qi Zhu hit 5 PRs, holding off #37 Roymund Firestone who sent in 5 of his own to move within 2 points of Zhus place. The two might want to focus on their rearview mirrors, as #38 Bob Holden sent in 26 records to cut 10 positions and finish right behind the competing pair. Holdens Top 10 time on rBC3 flap has helped his move, but hes grabbed many Top 100s throughout this streak, leaving only 18 left on his sheet to match that milestone. #39 Hunter Wells came from even farther behind, with a jump from #63 as the reward for his 25 PRs. He cut 20 AF, and looks ready to climb to higher ranks over the dusty timesheets of the retired. Lastly, #43 Christian W sent in 6 PRs to hold his ground against the aforementioned competitors, only losing one place as his quiet contemporaries fell 3-5 spots.

~~51-100~~
Not always an active section of the table, the 51-100 group defied expectation and brought forth many eager karters. #58 Zed R made the first move, with 23 PRs dragging him from #76 to just outside the Top 50. Included in his submissions were some solid glitch times as well as a nice Top 40 MH flap. #66 Caleb House decided it was time to move, and purchased a nice property 11 spots higher by bribing his realtor with 13 PRs. #74 Lachlan Young hit 3 PRs to fend off the competition, but dropped three spots. #75 Michele Gallastri made sure to turn up the pressure with 28 PRs and a 10 position move. Right below and looking to get into the shuffle is active karter and part-time wrestler #78 ZJ Insanity, who grabbed 23 PRs to move up four slots. His solid times at MG and CM aided in the big move, but hes also submitted some decent cuts at DKSC and TF. #81 Benjamin Zenon hit 31 PRs and slid into the Top 100, with a massive 36 point AF cut. His impressive Top 20 times at rMR, TF, and rDKJP were the highlights of a solid period of karting. #87 Jon Coppernoll didnt write any news, only hit 2 PRs, and is still unfortunately a Green Bay Packers fan. Hopefully he can improve on all of those in the future. #91 Mo No grabbed 48 PRs, becoming the second new Top 100 face, with a huge 52 point AF cut, the largest of this update. Finally, #93 Darragh J, #95 Augustin Berrios, and #96 Stacy Needham sent in a few PRs each, enough to maintain their positions in the Top 100 and step over a few inactive karters in the process.

~~Everyone Else~~
Many players were active below the Top 100 cutoff, but Ill mention those who managed to cut their AF score in these tumultuous times. #102 Kyle Fitzgerald sent in 25 PRs to jump 20 spots. He was probably hoping that I had waited another month or two to write this so he could be included in the paragraph above. #105 Murray Wright hit 8 PRs, improving the lower ranked times in his sheet in an effort to grab more consistency. #109 Jacob Fitzgibbon ascended 10 slots with 19 PRs. Hes quite close to a packed group of karters in the 140s AF range, so hopefully his progress continues. #132 Sam Fairless glitched his way up 8 positions with 11 PRs, cutting nearly a point of AF. His activity included exploring the rSL and rDKJP glitches, as well as improving on his non-glitched LC and rMR. #147 Michael Penninck saw the field of inactive karters as an opportunity, and cut 17AF with 29 PRs, moving from #163 to his present position. Of note is a #4 MR time, as well as a Top 10 rDH flap. Pennincks focus on the glitched tracks is really helping his position so far, will he turn to some of the non-glitched times to move even higher? Finally,#188 Matt Piper sent in 9 PRs to move up three positions and secured his place in the Top 200. (speaking of which, I might have to get around to securing mine soon).

Site Records
In the absence of news, a new DKJP glitch was found that annihilated the old times, with Sam Fairless, Hunter Wells, Gautier Estaloy, and Rda 4Vex all holding the course or flap records at some point before Danny Gallenberger stepped in and snatched both. Also shoutout to Martin Fox, who held the KC, MH, and rDS 3lap records at some point in the news gap but was beaten by the players listed below.

Martin Fox beat the old Moo Moo Meadows crs time of 1'15"840 with a time of: 1'15"772
Martin Fox beat the old Toad's Factory crs time of 1'49"667 with a time of: 1'49"537
Justin Hitchcock beat the old Coconut Mall lap time of 0'04"269 with a time of: 0'04"251

Martin Fox beat the old Dry Dry Ruins lap time of 0'33"051 with a time of: 0'33"024
Liam Ashcroft beat the old Moonview Highway crs time of 1'43"333 with a time of: 1'43"316
Quindarious Gooch beat the old Rainbow Road crs time of 2'25"529 with a time of: 2'25"084
Quindarious Gooch beat the old Rainbow Road lap time of 0'47"129 with a time of: 0'47"124
Sam Hashimoto beat the old SNES Ghost Valley 2 crs time of 0'51"898 with a time of: 0'51"319
Caleb House beat the old N64 Sherbet Land lap time of 0'17"158 with a time of: 0'17"064
Liam Ashcroft beat the old DS Delfino Square crs time of 2'04"965 with a time of: 2'04"753
